ad.title: DSHS IT Software Tester - State of Washington Dept. of Social and Health Services - Olympia, WA
ad.content: $60,636 - $79,548 a yearDescription DSHS Information Technology Specialist 4Join the Juvenile Rehabilitation Administration and work alongside knowledgeable programmers, report designers, requirement specialists, and testers in an Agile development environment. We have an opportunity for a talented IT Software Tester who takes pride in the work they do to maintain and enhance our Automated Client Tracking System. This system is a multi-faceted application which processes and manages all client case management, medical, dental, mental health, screening, treatment, physical location, and sentencing information for our clients. The 1000+ user community consists of our staff and many agencies throughout Washington State. This is a great opportunity to be part of high profile initiatives within our agency.Some of what you'll do: Design, develop, test and provide problem resolution for the Automated Client Tracking System application using the Microsoft .NET framework, C#, ADO.NET, and Microsoft SQL Server Work on a cross-disciplinary Scrum Team Participate in code reviews facilitated by the lead developer or scrum-master Participate in the requirement gathering and analysis process, partnering with other team members and end-users Work with a facilitator to resolve identified issues Who should apply?Professionals with at least 4 years of IT experience such as consulting, analyzing, designing, programming, installing, or maintaining computer software applications, hardware, telecommunications, or network infrastructure equipment; directing IT projects, providing customer or technical support in IT; or administering or supervising staff who performed work in any of these IT disciplines.Desired: College degree or course work in Information Technology including one .NET programming language Experience developing applications using an object-oriented programming language Demonstrated use of Microsoft Visual Studio, C#, and Microsoft Team Foundation ServerIf you have questions regarding the application process, contact Anthony Distefano at distear@dshs.wa.gov or call 360-725-5825.04526 Supplemental Information Prior to a new hire, a background check including criminal record history may be conducted. Information from the background check will not necessarily preclude employment but will be considered in determining the applicant's suitability and competence to perform in the job. This announcement may be used to fill multiple vacancies. Employees driving on state business must have a valid driver's license. Employees driving a privately owned vehicle on state business must have liability insurance on the privately owned vehicle.Washington State Department of Social & Health Services is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in any area of employment, its programs or services on the basis of age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity/expression, marital status, race, creed, color, national origin, religion or beliefs, political affiliation, military status, honorably discharged veteran, Vietnam Era, recently separated or other protected veteran status, the presence of any sensory, mental, physical disability or the use of a trained dog guide or service animal by a person with a disability, equal pay or genetic information. Persons requiring accommodation in the application process or this job announcement in an alternative format may contact the Recruiter at (360) 725-5810. Applicants who are deaf or hard of hearing may call through Washington Relay Service by dialing 7-1-1 or 1-800-833-6384.E-Verify® is a registered trademark of the U.S. Department of Homeland Security

ad.title: Software Developer Intern (Front End) - Health Catalyst - Remote
ad.content: InternshipOur mission is to be the catalyst for massive, measurable, data-informed healthcare improvement through: Data: integrate data in a flexible, open & scalable platform to power healthcare’s digital transformation Analytics: deliver analytic applications & services that generate insight on how to measurably improve Expertise: provide clinical, financial & operational experts who enable & accelerate improvement Engagement: attract, develop and retain world-class team members by being a best place to work Job Summary Health Catalyst is currently looking for (May 2019 - Aug 2019) intern candidates with the Catalyst software development team. This position will contribute to the development of innovative software tools to support Catalyst’s mission to improve the cost and quality of healthcare. The software team builds and supports Catalyst’s data warehousing, clinical content, and deployment system products and is key to scaling Catalyst’s evidenced based approach to healthcare improvement. The team uses agile and test-driven development practices for new development as well as refactoring and enhancing existing software. All work is done in a team setting with a focus on team accountability and success. Understanding the technical and business “why” behind team solutions is an important attribute of a Catalyst Software Developer. Highly Desirable Technical Skills .NET (C#) (or other object oriented programming language) Angular (or other front end framework) HTML/CSS/JavaScript SQL Server Agile development techniques Test Driven Development Team Foundation Server Database principles, processes, technologies, and tools (data modeling, design) Required Functional Skills Effective written and verbal communication and presentation skills High comfort level interacting with colleagues Ability to adapt to change and learn new technologies quickly Duties and Responsibilities Participate as a team member in planning sprints, software design, and developing and testing features Provide feedback to colleagues through code reviews and pair programming Actively solicit and incorporate feedback from clients and internal stakeholders on new software features and designs. Research and present new technologies to the software development team Education & Relevant Experience Completed at least 2nd year of coursework for a BS/BA in Computer science, information systems, or other technology/science degree. The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed in this job function. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, and indeed additional responsibilities may be assigned by Health Catalyst. ad.title: Intern, Software Development Open Source EHR - Health Catalyst - Salt Lake City, UT
ad.content: InternshipOur mission is to be the catalyst for massive, measurable, data-informed healthcare improvement through: Data: integrate data in a flexible, open & scalable platform to power healthcare’s digital transformation Analytics: deliver analytic applications & services that generate insight on how to measurably improve Expertise: provide clinical, financial & operational experts who enable & accelerate improvement Engagement: attract, develop and retain world-class team members by being a best place to work Health Catalyst is currently looking for (May 2019 - Aug 2019) intern candidates with the Catalyst Clinical Informatics software development team. This software team builds and supports Catalyst’s data warehousing, clinical content, and deployment system products and is key to scaling Catalyst’s evidence-based approach to healthcare improvement. Currently most Health Catalyst employees do not have a clinical background and lack the context for Electronic Health Record workflows. The intern will help evaluate, select, setup, and train others on one of the open source EHRs (e.g. OpenEMR, OpenMRS, etc.) for use as an educational tool, product development tool and customer demonstration environment. Highly Desirable Technical Skills Any major software development language NET (C#), Java, PHP, Python, etc. GitHub or related tools. Software build processes from open source repositories Database principles, processes, technologies, and tools (data modeling, design) Clinical/Biomedical/Medication/Health Informatics domain knowledge/experience Required Functional Skills Effective written and verbal communication and presentation skills High comfort level interacting with colleagues Ability to adapt to change and learn new technologies quickly Detail oriented and organized Duties and Responsibilities Evaluate multiple open source EHR options available and select a suitable solution based upon Health Catalyst needs and desired use cases. Assume primary responsibility to setup the EHR solution on internal/cloud-based hardware provided, this may require significant technical expertise which will vary depending on the solution identified (See this example: https://www.open-emr.org/wiki/index.php/OpenEMR_Downloads ) Teach and train other user teams on the EHR solution. Additional features including support for HL7 FHIR ( https://www.hl7.org/fhir/ ) will be explored if time permits. Education & Relevant Experience Significant technical expertise is likely to be required either through education or related work experience. Candidates with healthcare and informatics knowledge, experience, education is also desirable. The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed in this job function. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, and indeed additional responsibilities may be assigned by Health Catalyst . At Health Catalyst, we appreciate the opportunity to benefit from the diverse backgrounds and experiences of others. Because of our deep commitment to respect every individual, Health Catalyst is an equal opportunity employer.

ad.title: Fashion Stylist ( On-Call/ Part -Time) - HSN - Saint Petersburg, FL
ad.content: The Fashion Stylist department is responsible for providing fashion advice, and coordinating outfits and accessories for models and on air talent. Job Description Details About “On –Call” @ HSN HSN employs “on call” staff to cover projects, vacation, and periods of high volume. “On call” means that you are scheduled “as needed”, and you could work a varied schedule from week to week based on our needs and your availability. You may know your schedule a few weeks in advance however, shifts can be short notice as well. Day in the Life Select the most appropriate pieces from collections and ranges for the live show - helps to create the concept of product lines, and execute the vision for our partners and vendors Style wardrobe looks and design attractive outfits for multiple departments within HSN; primarily supporting the live show Preps clothing and accessories as needed, such as ironing and steaming, etc Develop specific goals and plans to prioritize, organize, and accomplish your work Communicates with producers, reviews flow sheets prior to airtime, and suggests changes based on presentation Communicate effectively and clearly to directs models during the live show Maintain a neat and organized wardrobe area Report recaps of shows on a daily basis Keep up to date with emerging fashion trends, styles, and designs; stay current on contemporary styles Attend meeting on behalf of the team and department Works with hosts and on air guests to ensure their best on air look Develops professional, constructive, and cooperative working relationships with vendors, business partners, and on air guests, and maintaining them over time Must Haves Degree in Fashion Design or related degree with experience in runway coordination, visual merchandising or fashion styling 2 years of styling experience of recent and directly related Styling experience required Flexible scheduling – days, nights, overnights, and weekends to support the 24/7 live show environment Valid driver’s license Basic computer skills and knowledge of MS Word, Excel, Power Point and Outlook Ability to differentiate between colors and textures. Must be able to comprehend instruction both written and oral Ability to lift, push, or pull up to 40lbs “Candidates will be considered in totality of their skills and experience versus strict interpretation of “must haves”. Nice to Haves Detail-oriented Positive attitude and be excited to learn and grow continually Excellent communication skills, both oral and written Works well individually and as part of a team Ability to react quickly to critical situations that occur in a live broadcast & production environment Ability to work in an ever-changing “live show” atmosphere, under pressure while keeping a professional composure About HSN, Inc. HSN, Inc., is a leading interactive entertainment and lifestyle retailer, offering a curated assortment of exclusive products and top brand names to its customers. HSN incorporates entertainment, inspiration, personalities and industry experts to provide an entirely unique shopping experience. At HSN, customers find exceptional selections in Health & Beauty, Jewelry, Home/Lifestyle, Fashion/Accessories, and Electronics. HSN broadcasts reach approximately 90 million households (with live programming 364 days per year) and its website — HSN.com features more than 50,000 product videos. Mobile applications include HSN apps for iPad, iPhone and Android. Visit corporate.hsn.com to learn more. HSN, Inc., founded 40 years ago as the first shopping network, is a wholly owned subsidiary of Qurate Retail, Inc. (NASDAQ: QRTEA, QRTEB), which includes QVC, HSN, zulily and the Cornerstone brands (collectively, “Qurate Retail Group”), as well as other minority investments. Qurate Retail Group believes in a third way to shop - beyond transactional ecommerce or traditional brick-and-mortar stores - and is #1 in video commerce, #3 in ecommerce in North America and #3 in mobile commerce in the U.S. (according to Internet Retailer). For more information, visit www.qurateretailgroup.com. For more information, please visit corporate.hsn.com, or follow @HSN on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. EEO As an equal opportunity employer, Qurate Retail Group is committed to a diverse workforce and is also committed to a barrier-free employment process. In order to ensure reasonable accommodations for individuals pursuant to applicable law, individuals that require accommodation in the job application process for a posted position may contact us at CareersUS@QVC.com for assistance. Click Apply and log in with your existing account or create an account. This will allow you to check the status of your application at any time and receive the most up to date communications from our Talent Acquisition team.

ad.title: Software Engineer, Sr. - Care Management - Health Catalyst - Salt Lake City, UT
ad.content: Our mission is to be the catalyst for massive, measurable, data-informed healthcare improvement through: Data: integrate data in a flexible, open & scalable platform to power healthcare’s digital transformation Analytics: deliver analytic applications & services that generate insight on how to measurably improve Expertise: provide clinical, financial & operational experts who enable & accelerate improvement Engagement: attract, develop and retain world-class team members by being a best place to work Job Summary Work on a team of smart, experienced software engineers solving one of our generation’s most important problems, using cutting edge tools and modern technologies. This position will provide you the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment creating new and exciting applications that support Health Catalyst’s Care Management Suite of applications. The Care Management Suite of applications is a comprehensive suite used to support healthcare organizations in providing care management services to their patients. All work is done in a team setting with a focus on team accountability and success. You will provide feedback to colleagues through code reviews and pair programming where high standards, passion and the drive to deliver exceptional products are second nature. Collaboration, mentoring and helping others are just part of who you are. Duties & Responsibilities Collaborate with product and UX teams to architect and build web applications Work with fellow engineers and QA team to define and maintain quality standards Write well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices Participate in user story requirements gathering activities, technical discovery/solutions meetings, and team development sprints Ensure expected requirements are met according to organizational standards and principles Perform varied analyses to support organization and client improvement Perform data validation tests to ensure quality Recommended Skills Extensive experience with C#/.NET C# 7 Async/Await Tasks Generics Dependency Injection Extensive experience with database design and development (MS SQL Server highly preferred) Experience with RESTful APIs Experience with Unit and Integration testing Experience designing and writing functional and E2E tests Experience with HTML5, Angular, and Typescript Experience with version control systems (Git, TFS, Subversion, etc.) Experience with cross-browser development Experience working in Agile software development environments Effective written and verbal communication and presentation skills Interact and communicate with all levels of employees and clients Strong sense of customer service to consistently and effectively address client needs Self-motivated; comfortable working independently under general direction Be willing to take ownership of projects and to present your proposed solutions to the wider teamDesired Skills Healthcare domain knowledge Azure and/or AWS experience Data warehousing experience Application SecurityEducation & Relevant Experience BS/BA in Computer science, information systems, or other technology/science degree or equivalent work experience. ad.title: PPR Analyst - Citi - Tampa, FL
ad.content:
Primary Location: United States,Florida,Tampa Education: Bachelor's Degree Job Function: Risk Management Schedule: Full-time Shift: Day Job Employee Status: Regular Travel Time: No Job ID: 19021604 Description About Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients. Citi’s Mission and Value Propositionexplains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities. Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all. Brief Description of the Organization CBNA is the primary legal entity for Citi, providing products and services to consumers, financial institutions and corporate clients around the world. In the past, Citi has provided most of its internal reporting on a business by business basis. With the changes in the regulatory environment, strong legal entity reporting and governance has become essential. This team is responsible for ensuring that CBNA has the appropriate governance and control infrastructure to meet the demand for legal entity planning, execution, information management and the ever-evolving regulatory environment. Description of the PositionThis position will involve the review of client profiles to ensure compliance with Citi Private Bank policy and regulatory mandates. The Pre-Periodic Review Analyst will act as a front line KYC quality control gate keeper and process desk top due diligence verification, ensuring there are no deficiencies in profile data or documentation.The Pre-Periodic Review Analyst will review and access client profiles and supporting documentation for adherence to CPB policy and quality requirements. This position requires the ability to work independently and apply knowledge of policy and procedures to determine that all aspects of the client’s profile are acceptable. With experience, specialist will act as a subject matter expert in relation to any policy or process inquiries and system enhancement requests.Other more specific tasks will involve the following: Review of profiles presented via CPB system making comparison of the information (Narrative) entered into the Client Profile with information present in documents. An assessment of the Client’s net worth, for example: In relation to the scale and profitability of the client’s business(es)/investments, and in the context of the country and time period in question: Is the net worth supported by the source of wealth information presented and does the totality of the information make sense when taken altogether? Ensure that the correct level of corroboration and supporting documents have been provided. Ensure that the correct level of approvals have been given depending upon the determined risk of the clients Identify documentary and KYC issues and follow-up with the Banker to clear shortcomings as appropriate, prior to quality acceptance. Ensure adherence to other associated CPB Policies.
Qualifications3-5 Years KYC or AML Compliance skills, ideally gained from working in a similar roleStrong communication skills, both written and oralGood interpersonal skillsAbility to work both independently and within a teamAbility to work accurately with strong attention to detailWell organizedAble to work with deadlinesStrong PC skills

ad.title: Business Analyst, Enterprise & Industry Verticals Business Development - Amazon Web Services, Inc. - Seattle, WA
ad.content: Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, or related field5-7+ years of industry experience in data analysis. Proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases3+ years experience in SQL and manipulating large data sets in a database5+ years advanced proficiency in Excel (including VBA, Pivot Tables, array functions, Power Pivots, etc) Are you excited about the cloud computing industry and leveraging cutting edge data analytics technologies and methodologies? Are you interested in driving business decisions through data analysis, reporting, and KPIs? Do you want to work on a team of Business Analysts, Business Intelligence Engineers, and Data Engineers to solve AWS’s most complex business problems through data?The AWS Business Development (BD) Analytics team is looking for a passionate, results-oriented Business Analyst to own defining, building, and scaling metrics and analytical insights that will measure the success and drive the day-to-day behavior for the AWS BD team. In this role, you will work closely with members of the BD team to ensure we are capturing and surfacing the best data and information to make optimal business decisions. As a Business Analyst on the BD Analytics team, you’ll collaborate with engineers to build self-service reports and establish automated processes for large scale data analyses. Successful candidates will be analytical with business acumen, and detail driven with excellent problem solving skills.The ideal candidate will have worked in depth in data analysis, including experience extracting and manipulating data using SQL, leveraging advanced Excel features for data analysis, and producing digestible business intelligence and actionable information. The candidate should also have strong communication and project management skills, enabling them to work with key business stakeholders to understand requirements and shape analytical deliverables. He/she should also have a demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically about business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to work cross-organizationally. A keen sense of ownership, drive, and scrappiness is a must. Advanced proficiency in SQL, ETL, data modeling, and working with “Big Data”Computer programming experience in Python, Ruby, or JavaExperience using AWS analytical services (e.g., Redshift, Data Pipeline, EMR, Machine Learning, Kinesis)Experience with web technologies (e.g., Ruby on Rails, Django, JavaScript) and the model-view-controller architectural patternExcellent problem-solving skillsExcited to learn new technologies and analytical methodologies relating to business intelligence and data analysisStrong communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills to translate ambiguous business requirements into complex analyses and actionable insightsThis position must be located at one of our U.S. AWS Corp. offices with a preference for Seattle.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.Amazon.com is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation/ Age.

ad.title: Lease Analyst - Amazon.com Services, Inc. - Seattle, WA
ad.content: Contract3+ years experience in one or more of the following areas: Real estate, legal, contract management, asset management, and/or lease administrationExperience utilizing commercial real estate software platformsExperience in drafting legal real estate notices and letters Amazon Web Service (AWS) is a comprehensive, evolving, and growing business unit within Amazon.com which provides cloud services. Since early 2006, AWS has provided a highly reliable, scalable, low-cost infrastructure platform that powers hundreds of thousands of businesses in 190 countries around the world. If you are interested in a career working in a high growth, fast paced and Customer focused work environment then AWS may be the right fit for you.The AWS Global Real Estate Team is looking for a talented, experienced Lease Analyst based in our Seattle corporate office campus. In this role, you will be a key member of the Real Estate Team and will be responsible for creating and maintaining all lease reviews and analysis to support the existing and expanding Data Center portfolio throughout the globe. The role will manage tracking critical dates and contracts, performing lease reviews and audits, and drafting all lease notices and letters. The ideal candidate will possess a high level of competence in interpreting complex lease language and legal reviews.The person needs to be detailed oriented and a strong communicator that can work independently in a fast paced, ambiguous environment.Key Responsibilities include:Read and interpret complex industrial lease language and related documentsPerform lease reviews, audits and legal analysis to ensure lease complianceProvide support and expertise researching, resolving and responding to day-to-day lease inquiries from internal partnersManage document flow, legal tracking, and legal document intake Responsible for drafting lease notices and letters; Estoppels, SNDA’s, landlord consent letter requests, renewal notices, etc.Prepare lease assessments and recommendations to asset manager to assist in real estate negotiationsPartnership in real estate strategic planning and portfolio managementAssist in ad hoc lease reporting and analysis 5 + years of demonstrated experience in one or more of the following areas: Real estate, legal, contract management, asset management, and/or lease administrationCommercial real estate attorney or paralegal experienceExperience working with lease administration softwareAbility to review, interpret, understand and analyze complex leases and real estate contractsAbility to work independently and prioritize effectively in a complex, ambiguous and fast-paced environmentMeets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this roleMeets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this roleAmazon is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age

ad.title: Business Analyst - Community Trust - Amazon.com Services, Inc. - Seattle, WA
ad.content: Bachelor’s degree in Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Finance, related technical field, or equivalent work experience.1+ years professional experience1+ years of years of relevant work experience in analytics, business intelligence, finance or related fieldExpertise with MS Excel, Access and SQL/SAS in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasetsProven track record of successful communication of analytical outcomes through written communication, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teamsExperience gathering business requirements, using industry standard business intelligence tool(s) to extract data, formulate analysis and build reports Community Trust is responsible for building customer trust and reducing abuse on Amazon’s Community features, including Customer Reviews, Questions and Answers, Lists, Spark and Customer Profiles. By driving customer trust in user generated content, we increase long term customer engagement on Amazon. Upholding customer trust is multifaceted but impactful for Amazon. Our team is passionate about human motivation and behavior and uses business intelligence, machine learning, classification algorithms and scalable platform services to have a cross-org impact every day. We are inherently scrappy and innovative, experimenting with data about millions of contributions worldwide to identify new genuine and malicious content and contribution patterns. We evaluate user research, customer experience knowledge, data, and cross-Amazon abuse expertise to ensure other teams think about customer trust.The role requires customer focus, creativity, a data-first orientation and experience with performance and scale. You will have the opportunity to make a difference in a fast paced, dynamic environment where your ability to deep dive, communicate, collaborate and drive changes will be a key. You will play a very important role in ensuring a great customer experience improving customer trust in our user generated content features with an eye on automation to help developing scalable and robust solutions.A successful candidate knows and loves working with analytic tools, is comfortable accessing and working with data from multiple sources, and can partner with internal stakeholders to help drive the business.Responsibilities:Interface with business customers, gathering requirements and delivering business analysis.Build customer trust data analysis projects to better understand how shoppers, contributors and sellers engage with Community content.Produce written recommendations and insights for key stakeholders that will help shape effective strategies.Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisionsSimplify and automate reporting, audits, and other data activities; build solutions to have maximum scale and self-service ability by stakeholders.Continually improve ongoing reporting and analysis processes, automating or simplifying self-service support for customers. Both technically deep and business savvy enough to interface with all levels and disciplines within the organizationKnowledge of Advanced SQL and a programming languageAmazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation

ad.title: Senior Program Manager - Corporate FP&A Enterprise Finance Transformation - Amazon.com Services, Inc. - Seattle, WA
ad.content: Bachelor's degree or equivalent experienceSeasoned project manager with 6 years’ experience managing accounting / finance process improvement and/or technology projects with aggressive schedulesExperience using Six Sigma, Lean or other process improvement methodology to streamline business processes Amazon is seeking a Senior Program Manager to join the Corporate Financial Planning and Analysis (FP&A) Enterprise Finance Transformation team. We are embarking on a complex and visible multiyear enterprise wide program to re-implement and re-design our corporate FP&A systems and processes. This senior leader will drive the execution of a finance work stream. Successful candidates will have deep experience in the following three disciplines – Finance, Program Management and Finance Systems. This individual will develop and lead the execution of the work stream project plan. This position involves regular communication with senior management on status, risks and change control. Cross-team coordination, project management and executive presentation skills are essential.In this role, the candidate will be part of a team that collaborates with business finance and technical teams to deliver world class solutions that are highly scalable, secure, and flexible. This person will have operated successfully in a fast-paced, global, results-oriented environment. Strong oral and written communication skills are crucial, as well as ability to think clearly, analyze quantitatively, problem-solve, scope business requirements and prioritize.Responsibilities include:Develop an in-depth understanding of Amazon’s Corporate Finance planning and reporting requirements for each of our unique Businesses to include Allocations, Hierarchy management, Restatement, FX, Guidance, Annual and 3 year Planning, Headcount planning and reporting.Manage complex work stream as part of a large overall program.Coordinate with multiple work streams within program simultaneously from initiation through delivery.Drive effective teamwork, communication, collaboration, and commitment across multiple groups with competing priorities.Collaborate with other PMs on team and across Amazon to identify and implement best practices.Interact with Project Sponsors, Project Stakeholders and multiple business and technical teams to define and deliver complex features.Anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make trade offs, and balance the business needs versus technical constraints.Communicate project issues and status in a concise, accurate, and professional manner.Remain flexible to changing priorities, open to new ideas and have Amazon's success firmly in your focus. Master’s degree or Accounting/Finance certification (Certified Financial Analyst (CFA), Certified Management Accountant (CMA) or Certified Public Accountant (CPA))PMP Certification or Master’s Certificate in Project ManagementDelivery focused leader who can work independently and collaboratively with global teamsExperience supporting finance customers to set and effectively manage expectations, project deliverables, and drive resolution when conflicts or issues ariseExperience in Business Intelligence (BI) or Corporate Performance Management (CPM) software, ideally with exposure to Cognos 10.x BI and/or TM1 software (Report Studio, Analysis Studio, Workspace Advanced, Framework Manager, TM1 Architect/Perspectives), or similar technology (OBIEE, Hyperion, MicroStrategy, Business Objects, Tableau)Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate conceptual requirements from business owners into detailed business and functional requirements with an emphasis toward scalable and efficient global solutionsProven interpersonal and communications skills with the ability to write and speak effectively and persuasively to all levels within an organization.Combination of strategic thinking capacity, proactive problem solving capabilities and the ability to execute complex initiatives.Proven record of innovation and thought leadershipExperience effectively presenting to all levels within the enterprise and to work with both technical and non-technical individualsAmazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation

ad.title: Business Analyst - Amazon US Services LLC - Seattle, WA
ad.content: § BA/BS in Business, Computer Science, Finance or related field§ 3+ years of relevant work experience in a role requiring application of analytic skills to integrate in a business analyst, data analyst or statistical analysis role§ 2-3 years skills in Excel as well as any data visualization tools like Tableau or similar BI tools (familiarity with Tableau preferred).§ Advanced ability to draw insights from data and clearly communicate them to the stakeholders and senior management as required.§ Be self-driven, and show ability to deliver on ambiguous projects with incomplete data.§ An ability and interest in working in a fast-paced, ambiguous and rapidly-changing environment Are you passionate about solving business problems on behalf of Customers and Small Businesses? Amazon Handmade is looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join our team and help unlock insights which take the business to the next level. The ideal candidate will be excited about using data to understand and improve the customer experience for Handmade and the category selection. She/he will be curious and comfortable digging deep into data to understand consumption of content and products, identifying insights that will enable us to expand the impact of our business. They will be able to retrieve, integrate, visualize and present critical data in a format that is immediately useful to improve the business decision-making process. This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities as well as an outstanding business acumen. The ideal candidate knows and loves working with business intelligence tools, and can partner with business leaders to answer key business questions.Responsibilities:§ Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards on the key drivers of our business§ Partner with operations/business teams to consult, develop and implement KPI’s, automated reporting/process solutions and data infrastructure improvements to meet business needs§ Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format§ Prepare and deliver business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocks§ Analyze historical and customer segmentation data to identify trends and insights§ Participate in strategic and tactical planning discussions§ Design, develop and maintain scaled, automated, user-friendly systems, reports, dashboards, etc. that will support our business needs.§ Strong verbal/written communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams. 5+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst, data analyst or statistical analysis roleAdvanced technical or business degree (MS or MBA)5+ years Experience in developing requirements and formulating business metrics for reporting, familiarity with data visualization tools, e.g. Tableau

ad.title: Senior Business Analyst - Amazon.com Services, Inc. - Seattle, WA
ad.content: BA/BS degree in finance, accounting, business, economics, or engineering6+ years of relevant financial/business analysis in a fast paced environmentAdvanced Excel skillsAdvanced analytics, financial modeling and reporting skillsKnowledge of SQL or ETL.Excellent written and verbal communication and data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams Amazon Advertising operates at the intersection of ecommerce and advertising, offering a rich array of digital advertising solutions with the goal of helping our customers find and discover anything they want to buy. Advertising Sales Ops team partners with world-wide sales and marketing teams to uncover new opportunities for acquiring, growing and retaining advertisers. In order to accomplish this we leverage the wealth of Amazon’s information on advertiser base, vendors, marketplace sellers, ad agencies, sales activities from CRM systems and other signals. We are a growing and diverse team with high levels of autonomy and executive visibility. We are looking for a talented senior business analyst for Sales Operations. He/shewill own a variety of activities related to sales operations functions, such as data analysis and reporting, analysis of sales inputs and outputs, creation of dashboards, supporting monthly and quarterly business reviews, and analytics support for new business management initiatives. He/she will be a critical member of the Sales Management team collaborating with Advertising Sales leaders, Tech and Data Engineering team, Product Management, Agency Sales and Finance teams. The successful candidate will have strong data analysis skills, superior Excel skills, knowledge of SQL, strong creative and problem-solving skills, and project management and collaborative abilities. The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, and an ability to work in a fast-paced environment.Responsibilities include:Engage with executive level stakeholders to provide business insights to drive sales. Be a thought leader in identifying and structuring problems to drive sales strategies.Organize data and generate deep insights in campaigns, orders, opportunities, ad delivery and ad operations in order to enhance sales force productivity and effectiveness.Create comprehensive dashboards and automated metrics reports for sales and performance metrics, sales productivity, attach rates by categories, revenue forecasts/visibility, variance to delivered from contracted, etc.Provide data, analyses, modeling, and reporting to support sales force monthly and quarterly business reviews. Analyze revenue trends and variances to goals, and communicate to sales managers.Detect emerging customer or market trends and help determine how the business can meet those opportunities and challenges to drive greater sales success.Partner with the Product, Finance, and Sales to drive direction and strategic initiatives through quantitative and qualitative analysis.Analyze historical data to identify trends and insights (such as advertiser spend analysis, business input metrics) and benchmark against the broader industry.Partner with sales managers, product and operations teams, Consumer teams on a periodic basis to develop new KPIs to measure performance, drive Salesforce hygiene and drive attach/ad spend penetration by categories.Supports ad-hoc data analysis requests Masters degree in business or quantitative disciplinesExperience in online advertisingExperience supporting sales operations Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual OrientationAmazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation#adsto

ad.title: Business Analyst - Term Limited - State of Colorado Job Opportunities - Denver, CO
ad.content:
$5,218 - $6,000 a monthPart-timeDepartment InformationThe Colorado Department of Labor and Employment is a values-driven organization, committed to teamwork, collaboration, accountability, adaptability, excellence, integrity and respect.We believe in outstanding customer service, an inclusive culture, continued process improvement, and in our role as a trusted and strategic partner. Recognizing that making our employees successful also drives our success, we are eager to invest in dedicated individuals who exhibit our shared values and our passion for quality and excellence in all we do.The work we do is rewarding and, through a variety of divisions and programs. The Colorado Department of Labor and Employment connects job seekers with great jobs, provides an up-to-date and accurate picture of the economy to help decision making, assists workers who have been injured on the job, ensures fair labor practices, helps those who have lost their jobs by providing temporary wage replacement through unemployment benefits, and protects the workplace - and Colorado communities - with a variety of consumer protection and safety programs.In addition to rewarding and meaningful work, we offer a variety of benefits that you simply will not find at other employers: Strong, secure, yet flexible retirement benefits including a PERA Defined Benefit Plan or PERA Defined Contribution Plan plus 401K and 457 plans Medical and dental health plans Employer supplemented Health Savings Account Paid life insurance Short- and long-term disability coverage 10 paid holidays per year plus vacation and sick leave Discounted RTD EcoPass (Denver Metro locations) BenefitHub state employee discount program CafeWell employee wellness program Excellent work-life programs, such as flexible schedules, training and more Our agency website: Colorado Department of Labor and Employment The State of Colorado is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building work environments that are inclusive and reflect our communities and the diverse talents of all people. We strongly encourage candidates from all backgrounds and abilities to apply.
Description of Job THIS POSITION IS OPEN TO CURRENT RESIDENTS OF COLORADO ONLY.This is a Project funded position. This project is from June 2019 through December 2020 or completion of this project. This project may be extended up to but no more than 1 year (December 2021). The individual hired for this position will be required to sign a waiver of retention rights. The purpose of this work unit is to provide support to the Oil and Public Safety programs including finance and budget; the Petroleum Storage Tank Fund (PSTF); the Petroleum Cleanup and Redevelopment Fund PCRF); state-lead cleanups of petroleum contaminated sites utilizing Federal Funds and PSTF funds; Amusement Rides and Devices, Explosives, Conveyance and Boiler Programs; internal and external communication including CORA requests; enforcement of statues and regulations across all programs; and the technology team including data management.This position exists to review and evaluate business process workflows practices, and functions in order to collaborate with project stakeholders in the Division of Oil Public Safety and its external stakeholders to document and support business needs and communicate and support those needs throughout each phase of an IT project. This includes gathering and organizing data, identifying problem areas and issues, interviewing stakeholders, eliciting, analyzing, specifying and validating various types of requirements, and communicating the requirements to solution and development teams through the software lifecycle, and writing test cases to properly test that the provided solution meets business needs. The Business Analyst will apply proven communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to help support the solution design and development process, and to ensure that project deliverables are met according to specifications. The Business Analyst will play a pivotal role in ensuring IT understand of requirements and services as liaison between business and technology staff, identifying and resolving any gaps in understanding. This position must manage complicated data sets, workflows and interdependencies between programs and stakeholders, evaluate the relevance of these components and be prepared to mae decisions/use judgements in a variety of circumstances. It is critical that this person have an understanding of IT best practices and trends (Agile, Scrum, etc.) and be able to drive to the basic business needs in order to translate between the business and technical teams. Minimum Qualifications, Substitutions, Conditions of Employment & Appeal Rights Minimum QualificationsBachelor's degree from an accredited institution in a field of study related to the work assignment.Three years of professional experience writing business system requirements.SubstitutionsAdditional appropriate experience will substitute for the degree requirement on a year-for-year basis. Additional appropriate education will substitute for the required experience on a year-for-year basis.Preferred Qualifications Minimum of one year of Sales Force experience Change Management experience Understanding of complex business models Understanding of environmental rules and regulations Conditions of Employment Must be a Colorado resident at time of application. As a condition of employment, you must successfully pass a background check (both criminal and unemployment insurance benefit overpayments). APPEAL RIGHTS: If you receive notice that you have been eliminated from consideration for the position, you may protest the action by filing an appeal with the State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director within 10 days from the date you receive notice of the elimination.Also, if you wish to challenge the selection and comparative analysis process, you may file an appeal with the State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director within 10 days from the receipt of notice or knowledge of the action you are challenging.Refer to Chapters 4 and 8 of the State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures, 4 CCR 801, for more information about the appeals process. The State Personnel Board Rules and Personnel Director's Administrative Procedures are available at www.colorado.gov/spb.A standard appeal form is available at: www.colorado.gov/spb. If you appeal, your appeal must be submitted in writing on the official appeal form, signed by you or your representative, and received at the following address within 10 days of your receipt of notice or knowledge of the action: Colorado State Personnel Board/State Personnel Director, Attn: Appeals Processing, 1525 Sherman Street, 4th Floor, Denver, CO 80203. Fax: 303-866-5038. Phone: 303-866-3300. The ten-day deadline and these appeal procedures also apply to all charges of discrimination.Supplemental Information Minimum Qualification ScreeningA Human Resources Analyst will only review the work experience/job duties sections of the online job application to determine whether you meet the minimum qualifications for the position for which you are applying. Cover letters and resumes WILL NOT be accepted in lieu of the official State of Colorado online application, but may be attached. Part-time work experience will be prorated.Applicants must meet the minimum qualifications to continue in the selection process for this position. Work experience and qualifications must be specifically documented on your online application. Do not use "see resume" or "see attached" statements on your application. Resumes WILL NOT be reviewed for minimum qualification screening.Supplemental QuestionsAnswer the supplemental questions on the application completely and thoughtfully. Your answers may be rated based on your writing ability (spelling, grammar, and clarity of your writing) as well as the content of your answer.Comparative Analysis Process ? TestingAfter minimum qualification screening, the comparative analysis process for this position may involve computer skills testing such as MS Word 2013, MS Excel 2013, MS Access 2013 and/or basic computer skills.SAVE THE DATE: Testing will be scheduled for March 26, 2019 and March 27, 2019.NOTE: To ensure receipt of notifications regarding this job posting, please add the following email address to your contacts or safe senders list: info@governmentjobs.comADAAA Accommodations: Any person with a disability as defined by the ADA Amendments Act of 2008 (ADAAA) may be provided a reasonable accommodation upon request to enable the person to complete an employment assessment. To request an accommodation, please contact by phone or email at least five business days before the assessment date to allow us to evaluate your request and prepare for the accommodation. You may be asked to provide additional information, including medical documentation, regarding functional limitations and type of accommodation needed. Please ensure that you have this information available well in advance of the assessment date.

ad.title: Manager, IT Project Services - Fiserv - Stafford, TX
ad.content: What does an extraordinary Manager, IT Project Services do? You will play a vital role in Fiserv’s Output Solutions (FOS) group that significantly contributes to its overall business success. You are responsible for all aspects of new client implementations, changes into existing business as well as training all levels of the Fiserv Output Solutions organization and external clients on successful implementation processes. Additionally, you will play a key role in ensuring that FOS implementation and release strategy is successful, followed and improved when and where necessary – bettering our processes, tools, methods and resources is a key effort. If you are a whiz at process improvements, bring your skill set here where you’ll be appreciated for your creativity and can-do attitude. You will have end-to-end authority and accountability over the deployment of the project management methodology once a project is accepted into the FOS organization. You will manage multiple projects and project resources to ensure that the quality and success of our projects are consistent, and repeatable. You will spend time through constant involvement in new technology developing methods to contribute to our organization and the services we provide to our clients Essential Job Responsibilities: Responsible for the installation of Fiserv products and systems and the conversion of Client data and systems to complete functionality. Plans, organizes, assigns, directs and evaluates the work of project teams engaged in solution delivery. Acts as liaison with Clients and other departments, divisions, and organizations. Ensures that the design, scope and project estimates for client solutions are appropriate and strategic. Provide to Sales initial design and scope document and high-level estimates Attend Technical Steering Committee to present new solution designs. Provide overall leadership, direction and advice to the project teams. Determine project deliverables, changes to project scope, schedule, and staffing hours. Ensure program is staffed appropriately to deliver expected results and to meet client SLAs. Accept responsibility for problems raised from the team members. Report on activities of the program, via various documents and program review meetings. Ensure timely reporting and correct billing is in place. Basic qualification for consideration: High School Diploma or GED required. Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Information Technology or equivalent discipline preferred or equivalent work experience. Minimum of 5 plus years of experience working in Project Management, Business Analyst or Program Manager role with software implementations. Minimum of 2 years of management experience. Previous experience in Financial Services industry highly preferred. Uses strong analytic skills to solve problems and make decisions based on limited precedents or guidelines. Previous experience with crafting repeatable processes for better efficiency. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to translate highly technical explanations into a non-technical audience Proven successful management experience, particularly in a groundbreaking, fast-growing environment Proven experience in effectively prioritizing and executing tasks in a high-pressure environment Travel required: Less than 10% Learn more about us. In a world moving faster than ever before, Fiserv helps clients deliver solutions in step with the way people live and work today – financial services at the speed of life. With 24,000 associates, we help more than 12,000 clients worldwide create and deliver solutions to enable today's consumer to move and manage money with ease, speed and convenience. Our Aspiration is to move money and information in a way that moves the world. As a FORTUNE™ 500 company and one of FORTUNE Magazine World’s Most Admired Companies for the sixth consecutive year, we are committed to excellence and purposeful innovation. In this role, you will be aligned with our Output Solutions products and services. Fiserv delivers turnkey business critical customer communications accurately, on time and with relevant information essential for customer satisfaction and retention. Fiserv supports financial services, healthcare, billing, retail, utilities, travel and entertainment and other companies. Customer communications and payment solutions include transnational document production and delivery, secure and non-secure card manufacturing and personalization, direct marketing services and digital channel delivery. As a trusted outsourcing partner, we help our clients streamline operations to contain costs, while building customer loyalty and generating incremental revenue. We welcome and encourage diversity in our workforce. We are an equal opportunity employer/disability/vet. Explore the possibilities of a career with Fiserv and Find Your Forward with us.

ad.title: Implementation Analyst - Verity - HealthStream - San Diego, CA
ad.content: Position Summary The Implementation Analyst role serves as the tactical resource independently designing and deciding on the content and automation model that delivers efficiency gains and provider satisfaction improvements. ESSENTIAL DUTIES OR RESPONSIBILITIES – (The below listed duties are not all inclusive. This position must also perform other duties as assigned.): Supervises and manages the implementation of the automation engine to deliver best practice solutions for provider credentialing, expirables management, provider appointment, case review and OPPE. Analyzes client business processes and formulates expert advice to clients on how to best implement our automation engine and content library to reduce inefficiencies and streamline credentialing and review processes. Has the authority to negotiate with clients on behalf of clients and on the scope, design, implementation plan, and long-term optimization plan for the use of the Verity automation engine. Exercises discretion and independent judgment in evaluating client feedback to drive integral changes within our product, automation engine, and content library that allow our solutions to continually better represent and fulfill client needs. Formulates deployment plans and timelines to maximize efficient use of our available best-practice content while ensuring client business needs are all met at the time of go-live. Acts as the primary architect for module-only project plans, independently deciding on timelines, coordinating resources, and escalating client issues to the appropriate internal teams. Job Specifications 1. KNOWLEDGE/EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: A Bachelor's Degree in related discipline. 2+ years software implementation or senior level technical support; healthcare experience highly desirable. Demonstrated proficiency working in a Windows software environment. A working knowledge of SQL and relational databases is a plus. Have a demonstrated affinity for technology. 2. SKILLS REQUIRED (manual, verbal or mental manipulation of data or things): Excellent oral and written communication skills. Excellent organizational skills. Excellent project management skills. Have strong interpersonal and relationship management skills with the ability to influence others to achieve desired results. 3. ABILITIES REQUIRED (work characteristics, behaviors, leadership abilities, etc.): The ability to manage multiple client relationships simultaneously. Be able to work effectively with teams with different backgrounds. Have professional poise and comfort with leading discussions with client decision-makers, end-users and IT professionals. Ability to travel up to 30% of the time. HealthStream is an equal opportunity employer. HealthStream prohibits employment practices that discriminate against individual employees or groups of employees on the basis of age, color, disability, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, veteran or military status, genetic information or any other category deemed protected by state and/or federal law

ad.title: L&I Fiscal Analyst 3 - State of Washington Dept. of Labor & Industries - Tumwater, WA
ad.content: $3,758 - $4,929 a monthDescriptionAre you interested in working on a collaborative team with the opportunity to develop your payroll accounting skills and advance your career goals?This position is the primary Fiscal Analyst supporting Healthcare Reconciliations, Shared Leave and Paid Family Medical Leave Reconciliations. It assists the Payroll & Benefits Manager in coordinating quality assurance review on all healthcare entries, payroll support and serving as a back-up for overpayments and garnishments for the unit. Duties Some of what you will do:General ledger reconciliations for Healthcare and Paid Family Medical Leave. Review, approve and track Shared Leave donations, and coordinate the transfer of funds using journal vouchers. Run payroll cutoff reports and send to all Payroll and Benefits Specialists. Back-up to overpayment tracking and employee garnishments. Other duties as assigned in support of agency or division business goals or employee development.Who Should Apply?We seek professionals experienced in preparing, reconciling, and analyzing the 5181 Healthcare general ledger with the ability to interpret and apply state and federal rules and regulations and demonstrates familiarity with State of Washington civil service rules and collective bargaining agreement provisions.Qualifications Required Qualifications:20 semesters or 30 quarter hours of college-level accounting or 2 years of relevant professional experience in accounting, auditing, budgeting or payroll. As well as excellent customer service with employee, confidentiality and the ability to provide guidance and advice.Desired Qualifications: A critical and analytical thinker that has demonstrated experience analyzing and interpreting financial data, reports, and processes. An excellent communicator (both written and oral) with an eye for details, strong analytical skills, numbers-oriented, and good proofreading skills. A quick learner with the ability to work with minimal oversight, identify what needs to be done, and proactively take appropriate action. Commitment to use critical thinking and technical skills to increase the agency efficiency and effectiveness of accounting procedures and services. Can work effectively on a highly collaborative team that works toward common goals while being respectful and courteous to other team members, even when there are differences of opinion. Resilient and professional under pressure. Engage others in open, constructive and candid discussion and build good working relationships with multiple stakeholders who may hold different points of view. Accepts responsibility, can receive constructive feedback, and react in a positive, confident and respectful manner. Skilled in the use of Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word, computerized fiscal data, and other relevant financial reporting systems. Application process requires you include: Resume Cover letter describing your knowledge and experience regarding the attributes listed in the "Who should apply" and "What we're looking for" sections of this posting. Copy of your unofficial transcripts. If you have any questions regarding this announcement, position, agency or difficulty attaching your documents, please contact: April Elias at 360-902-4510 or email at: Elib235@lni.wa.gov. Supplemental Information This job announcement may be used to fill multiple vacancies. Application review starts immediately and the hiring authority reserves the right to offer the job at any time. It's to your advantage to apply quickly.Employees driving on state business must have a valid driver's license. Employees driving a privately owned vehicle on state business must have liability insurance on the privately owned vehicle.Prior to any new hire into L&I, a background check, including criminal record history, will be conducted. Information from the background check will not necessarily preclude employment but will be considered in determining the applicant's suitability and competence to perform in the position.To apply, follow the "Apply" link aboveJobs advertised as Open Continuous will be closed without notice. Apply quickly!We're looking for evidence that you have what we're looking for. Your application materials will be used for deciding who'll be selected for interview.For more information about the Department of Labor & Industries visit: http://www.lni.wa.gov/ORContact us at: Jobs@Lni.wa.govL&I strives to attract and retain a high-performing and diverse workforce in which our differences are respected and valued to better meet the needs of the diverse customers we serve. L&I fosters an inclusive environment that promotes safety, collaboration, flexibility and fairness so that all employees can participate and contribute to their full potential.This position is represented by the Washington Federation of State Employees (WFSE).Persons with a disability, who need assistance in the application process, or those needing this announcement in an alternative format, may call (360) 902-5700. Applicants that are deaf or hard of hearing may call through the Washington Relay Service at 7-1-1.The State of Washington is an Equal Opportunity Employer
ad.company: State of Washington Dept. of Labor & Industries

ad.title: Tech Support Analyst - OneMain Financial - Evansville, IN
ad.content: Part-timeOneMain Financial is seeking candidates for an open Tech Support Analyst role in the End User Computing department. The successful candidate will be providing support to internal customers through analysis of complex operational and technical issues. This role will: Research and analyze technical problems to determine root cause Create and update technical documentation Provide recommendations to improve system efficiency, effectiveness, and usability Provide training and guidance to less experience teams members or other support groups Compile and review departmental statistics Analyze results and make improvement recommendations to management Communicate with internal customers to ensure problem resolution is achieved Requirements: Outstanding customer service Solid understanding of Windows operating systems (OSX knowledge helpful) Ability to adapt to new technologies Understanding of VDI or published application is a plus High School Diploma or GED required (college or technical training preferred) 2 to 5 years’ experience with technical problem solving or technical customer services OneMain Financial holds a strong commitment to our customers, communities and team members. This approach to lending has helped us provide customers with loan options for over 100 years and grow to over 1,600 branches in 44 states. We know that success starts from within, which is why we place emphasis on creating a team of talented and dedicated individuals. If you’re looking for a place to work collaboratively and build your career from the ground up, think OneMain. At OneMain, we know that in order for our team members to be their best, they need the right opportunities and benefits. Our comprehensive benefits package for full-time and some part-time employees includes: health and well-being options for team members and dependents, up to 4% matching 401(k), tuition reimbursement, continuing education, incentive pay, paid time off, paid volunteer time and more.

ad.title: Markets – Global Spread Products – High Yield Credit Sector Specialist – VP - Citi - New York, NY
ad.content: Primary Location: United States,New York,New York Education: Bachelor's Degree Job Function: Trading Schedule: Full-time Shift: Day Job Employee Status: Regular Travel Time: No Job ID: 19021768 Description About CitiCiti, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all. Position Objective:Objective is formulate and disseminate sector/issuer trade ideas (internally and externally) and assist desk is risk positioning and trade facilitation.Key Responsibilities:Desk analyst on the High Yield Trading desk, covering HY/Crossover cash and CDS issuersSector coverage to be determined, and will span a few different sectors, but experience in Energy and other industrialEvaluate and opine on market trends and technical backdrop within sectorsGenerate, position and disseminate trade ideas to drive PnLProactively assist in desk positioning to facilitate trading in a variety of market environments.Anticipate client demand in respective product/market and foster mindshare with accountsWork closely with sales and trading to analyze trends and risk, while building client franchiseLeverage publishing research teams to layer in long-term fundamental views on certain sectors/issuers as well as overall macro theme Qualifications Knowledge/Experience:Minimum 5+ years of experience in the underlying productsSkills:Exceptional analytical competencyStrong financial modelling and forecasting skillsStrong interpersonal skills that can develop and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholdersAbility to analyze and pitch situations and determine suitable counterpartiesKnowledge of Bloomberg, other risk analysis tools Competencies:Strong verbal communication skillsAbility to multi-taskAbility to manage stressTeam playerHighly motivatedSelf-starterQualifications:Appropriate licensesBachelor’s degree required

ad.title: Senior Executive Assistant - Citi - New York, NY
ad.content: Part-timePrimary Location: United States,New York,New York Education: High School Diploma/GED Job Function: Business Management and Admin Schedule: Part-time Shift: Day Job Employee Status: Regular Travel Time: No Job ID: 19021866 Description About Citi:Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all.Business Overview:Citi's Institutional Clients Group is committed to advancing our client goals. Our diverse and talented staff in approximately 100 countries advises companies, governments and institutions on the best ways to realize their strategic objectives. We've been in many countries for 100 years and have helped to shape, develop and grow the economies and infrastructures in many of the locations where we have a presence.We create solutions for and provide the broadest possible capital market access to thousands of issuers and investor clients. And no institution better executes the increasingly complex payment and cash management solutions required in today's global economy.To provide our clients with best-in-class products, services and execution, our businesses are organized into six groups: Banking, Capital Markets and Advisory, Citi Alternative Investments, Citi Private Bank, Citi Investment Research & Analysis and Citi Transaction Services. This structure enables us to leverage our product breadth and geographic scope, and effectively align our resources with our clients' needs. Summary:This position will provide coverage based on assignment to various Banking, Capital Markets and Advisory franchises as needed and will include supporting various levels of bankers from senior management to associates/analysts. The duties are complex and confidential requiring the highest level of discretion and independent judgment. Employees within this role will have continuous contact/communication with high levels of internal management as well as senior management with external firms. The ideal candidate must be adaptable and able to work with minimal supervision and take ownership of a position while covering.Responsibilities:Provide administrative support to a senior-level executives and team bankers when assigned to cover a vacation, medical leave or open position. Assignments can change daily, weekly and monthly depending on coverage needs throughout the Division.Handle incoming calls, respond to inquiries, clarify company policies and proceduresMaintain frequently changing calendars through Outlook and update contactsCoordinate all aspects of executive level appointments, meetings and conference callsPrepare and review materials and correspondence for meetings and mailingsCoordinate extensive and frequent travel – both international and domesticPrepare, reconcile, and track expense reports through CTE systemOrganize and secure highly confidential company and employee informationAssist with ad-hoc reports and special projects as neededInput call reports in ICG Toolbox – Outlook Client Call Reporting Tool.Serve as back-up support for other managers and administrative staff when required Qualifications Technical Skills –Highly proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint)Ability to gain a strong command of new systems (P2P, Citi Travel & Expense, Outlook Client Call Reporting) Non-Technical Skills –Prior experience in the Investment Banking industry preferred 3+ yearsCollege degree preferredExpertise in multi-tasking, organizing, and prioritizing a mustExtensive calendar management and travel arrangingStrong written and verbal communication skills. Detail oriented with ability to work independently and prioritize workloadDemonstrates a high level of integrity and professionalismEnergetic, responsive team player with the interest to take initiative and work in a fast-paced environment3 days per week – Days to be determined.Ability to work 8:30 a.m.-5:30 p.m. and be flexible for overtime as needed

ad.title: Sr Business Analyst - Citi - Irving, TX
ad.content: Primary Location: United States,Texas,Irving Education: Bachelor's Degree Job Function: Technology Schedule: Full-time Shift: Day Job Employee Status: Regular Travel Time: No Job ID: 19019506 Description CitiRisk Commercial is an end-to-end credit lending and risk management platform to manage underwriting and credit functions. It supports classifiably managed portfolios and provides a unified operating model across Business and Risk for all markets in Citi Commercial Bank.CitiRisk Commercial is looking for Functional SME, who has good exposure to commercial banking. The Incumbents will act as a SME and provide inputs to the team on any queries related to functional requirement. The Incumbents as to work closely with the onsite/offshore business analyst, also provide necessary guidance to offshore development team on any questions arises.Proficient in requirement gathering and analysis, preparation of requirement documentation (preparing BRD, functional specification document, use case, change request, process flow diagrams), use case analysis, gap analysis and User trainingWorking with solution architect and client subject matter experts, the candidate is responsible for documenting the current state of the business and technical architectureInteracting with Global business users and assisting them in understanding the business issue with process/data;
