ad.title: Manager, Software Engineering - Carbon Black - Waltham, MA
ad.content: Carbon Black Protection is an industry-leading application control product, used to lock down and protect critical systems from cyber-attacks, prevent unwanted changes, and ensure continuous compliance with regulatory mandates. Carbon Black needs a leader to work across the organization to ensure our customers’ assets are safe and to grow a high-performing team in a competitive market.What You’ll Do The CB Protection product team is looking for a dynamic engineering manager to lead, coach, and inspire one or more scrum teams. You will be responsible for successfully delivering products to meet the business objectives of the product team while inspiring team members to work hard; leading by example and keeping enthusiasm high. What You’ll Bring Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operational health Experience coaching and mentoring developers at all stages of their careers Ability to lead software engineers in establishing career goals and plans Experience collaborating with other technical teams, product owners, and customers Project management experience with Agile methodologies Collaborative and technical skills to help eliminate team blockers Ability to refine requirements and instill quality practices in the development process Ability to attract top talent and incorporate them into a highly functional and fun team Expertise with C++Bonus Points: B.S./M.S. in Computer Science or related degree Background and interest in Security Experience with kernel development for Linux and MacWhy you should join us Carbon Black is a leading provider of next-generation endpoint security, leveraging breakthrough prevention technology to instantly see and stop cyberattacks before they execute. With more than 14 million endpoints under management, and more than 4,600 customers—including one-third of the Fortune 100—the opportunities are massive and exciting. With 1,200+ employees, offices across the world, and the best-of-the-best tools for collaboration from anywhere, now is an ideal time to become part of the CB Team. See where you fit best at Lifeatcb.carbonblack.com.Carbon Black, Inc. is an EEO/AA employer. Carbon Black is an inclusive employer that believes in workplace equality, supports diversity, creates Why you should join us Carbon Black is a leader in endpoint security dedicated to keeping the world safe from cyberattacks. With more than 5,000 customers—including 34 of the Fortune 100—the opportunities here are massive and exciting. With 1,200+ employees, offices across the world, and the best-of-the-best tools for collaboration from anywhere, now is an ideal time to become part of the CB Team. See where you fit best at Lifeatcb.carbonblack.com. Carbon Black, Inc. is an EEO/AA employer. Carbon Black is an inclusive employer that believes in workplace equality, supports diversity, creates a welcoming environment, and respects the unique qualities each individual brings to the company.

ad.title: VP - Underwriting Leader - Transactional Liability - QBE - New York, NY
ad.content: Lead profitable underwriting operations for assigned line/s of business by developing and communicating a strategic vision for department growth, setting team priorities and guiding adherence to quality metrics to ensure department risk selection aligns with organizational profitability objectives. Line/s of business may include Aviation, Healthcare, Inland Marine, Management Liability & Professional Lines (MLPL), Privacy Network Security Liability (Cyber), Programs, and Technology & Life Sciences. Primary Responsibilities Lead and manage the underwriting team for assigned line(s) of business in Specialty and Commercial by overseeing and evaluating new and renewal business to ensure risk quality and proper insurance to value Drive standardization of underwriting across assigned business line(s) by defining risk assessment parameters, setting quality service standards and developing and leading self-audit initiatives to foster consistent and profitable risk selection Foster a collaborative approach to growing the business by communicating with peers, identifying profit and loss trends, developing strategic portfolio growth initiatives and informing team on changing underwriting guidelines to drive achievement of department profitability objectives Capitalize on opportunities for continuous improvement by reviewing reports on loss ratios, conducting research on market trends and best practices and leading the implementation of innovative underwriting strategies to enhance management liability portfolio and ensure organization is competitive in the marketplace Build, foster and maintain internal and external relationships by leading the delivery of training, utilizing individual credibility to inform on risk exposure decision-making processes and leading team to efficiently underwrite prospective business to meet service expectations and enhance organizational reputation Develop sustainable underwriting operations for business line(s) by analyzing, refining and enhancing current practices to ensure future planning aligns with long-range business growth objectives Manage budgeted resources by anticipating expenditures, accurately forecasting resource needs/costs and properly accounting for expenses to meet requirements and achieve fiscal responsibility Required Qualifications Education: Bachelor's Degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience Experience: 10+ years relevant experience Preferred Qualifications Experience: Extensive underwriting experience is required; specific experience required will vary based on assigned line/s of business; experience managing or leading others; increasing levels of responsibility. Participation in industry events that support continuous education and superior technical proficiency and underwriting competence Licenses/Certifications: Depending on assigned line/s of business, specific participation and memberships are preferred and may include one or more of the following: Professional Liability Underwriting Society, Surety & Fidelity Association of America, American Bankers Association and Professional Liability Underwriting Society, or RIMS Preferred Knowledge Advanced working knowledge of products and insurance operations, underwriting processes and procedures Advanced working knowledge of laws and regulations related to area of responsibility Advanced working knowledge of terminology, concepts and principles related to strategic planning Advanced working knowledge of market trends and current organizational strategies Preferred Competencies/Skills Build and capitalize on beneficial internal and external relationships Collaborate at different levels within the organization to accomplish a common goal Understand the potential intended and unintended consequences of a given decision, both small-scale and on the organization as a whole Utilize effective research and investigative techniques Provide vision and think creatively and innovatively; implement strategies to improve efficiency Analyze risks, benefits and opportunities to ensure organizational competitiveness and satisfaction of established long-range objectives Foster and promote collaboration and teamwork Adjust plans, goals, actions or priorities to meet changing situations; guide others through change Prioritize interests of the company and community during decision-making Leverage business and financial expertise Establish a high degree of trust and credibility with others Show empathy and sensitivity to the experience of others; act fairly, ethically and with integrity when decision-making, managing or working with a team and corresponding with customers Inform team about organizational change and integrations through a variety of means Motivational, inspirational and enthusiastic approach to team leading and management QBE Cultural DNA Everything we do at QBE is underpinned by our DNA (which interlinks seven cultural elements) – because we know it's not just what we do that matters, it's how we do it that makes the difference. We expect all employees to role model and inspire the right behaviors that link to our cultural elements: We are customer-centered We are technical experts We are diverse We are fast-paced We are courageous We are accountable We are a team All employees are expected to adhere to QBE’s Code of Ethics and Conduct and apply sound risk management practices Work environment Travel frequency: Frequent (approximately 10+ trips annually) Physical demands: General office jobs: Work is generally performed in an office environment in which there is not substantial exposure to adverse environmental conditions. Must have the ability to remain in a stationary position for extended periods of time. Must be able to operate basic office equipment including telephone, headset and computer. Incumbent must be able to lift basic office equipment up to 20 lbs. To successfully perform this job, the individual must be able to perform each essential job responsibility satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable an individual with disabilities to perform the essential job responsibilities. Number of Openings: 1 How to Apply: To submit your application, click "Apply" and follow the step by step process. Equal Employment Opportunity: QBE is an equal opportunity employer and is required to comply with equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction it operates.

ad.title: Security and Compliance Technical Program Manager - Amazon.com Services, Inc. - Seattle, WA
ad.content: Experience conducting in-depth architecture analysis and technical risk assessment for a cloud providerExperience in information security, application security, cyber security or equivalent.Exposure to service architecture analysis and/or software development.BA or BS degree. The Security and Compliance TPM is an experienced security professional who will drive the security and compliance elements of a new initiative. You will work alongside product managers, software developers, bizdev, and legal teams to ensure that our services are in compliance with security and privacy requirements. Core responsibilities include:Evaluating service architecture completeness and readiness.Conducting security reviews to verify compliance, including adherence to regulation for new devices.Triggering remediation action when necessary.Training security certifiers to perform security reviews.Verifying that product roadmap items meet regulatory expectations .Driving optimal path to compliance for new services and feature.Translating compliance language to actionable guidance for the engineering teams.Monitoring organization wide compliance with controls, and lead remediation efforts when appropriate.Updating security assessment and documentation after significant architectural changes.Driving policy definition, updates, and policy violation measures.Monitoring relevant federal and state regulations, and modifying the compliance program to accommodate any changes.Acting as a consultative resource for regulatory matters. Hands on experience using cloud technology in professional or personal projectsExperience performing IT security risk assessments and gap analysis on new technology productsHold at least one certification such as CISSP, CISM, CISA, QSA, GIAC, MC.Excellent communication and presentation skills.Amazon is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation

ad.title: Cyber Engineer II - Foreground Security - Arlington, VA
ad.content: We take our work and our fun seriously. We refuse any work that isn’t hard and engaging. We make sure our engineers have the tools they need to do their jobs, and focus on recognizing results. Our research and development projects cover the spectrum of security technologies for Computer Network Operations. If it runs code, somebody in our office has looked at it.Key areas of focus include:Reverse EngineeringVulnerability ResearchWireless and Network CommunicationsConstraint SolvingExploit mitigation techniquesCandidates must be able to play both sides of the fence, both defeating and developing new and advanced security techniques. Projects will be undertaken in small teams with close coordination with customers to quickly enhance capabilities or resolve issues in existing tools.Information security continues to be a growth industry and we are constantly looking to find the right candidates who can do this challenging work.Requirements:Proficient in one or more assembly languages (x86, ARM, etc…)Expertise in one or more scripting languages (e.g., Python or Ruby)Software development experience in C/C++Detailed understanding of and experience in Vulnerability Research (VR) / Reverse Engineering (RE)Proficiency with disassemblers / debuggers – (e.g., IDA Pro, GDB, Windbg)Highly Desirable:Familiarity with PE/ELF file formats, linkers, and compilersExperience solving Capture-the-Flag (CTF) challengesExperience developing and/or reversing Software Protection / Obfuscation techniquesEmbedded development/reverse engineering experienceStrong understanding of and experience with cryptographic protocolsU.S. citizenship is required. All qualified applicants will be subject to a security investigation and must meet minimum qualifications for access to classified information.Education:Degrees are not required for our positions, but they can be helpful. Certifications are neither helpful nor required.CSIALLCSIVR139473 Business Unit ProfileRaytheon Intelligence, Information and Services delivers innovative technology to make the world a safer place. Our expertise in cyber, analytics and automation allow us to reach beyond what others think is possible to underpin national security and give our global customers unique solutions to solve the most pressing modern challenges - from the cyber domain to automated operations, and from intelligent transportation and training solutions to creating clear insight from large volumes of data. IIS operates at nearly 550 sites in 80 countries, and is headquartered in Dulles, Virginia. The business area generated $6.2 billion in 2018 revenues. As a global business, our leaders must have the ability to understand, embrace and operate in a multicultural world - in the marketplace and the workplace. We strive to hire people who reflect our communities and embrace diversity and inclusion to advance our culture, develop our employees, and grow our business. Relocation EligibleYes Clearance TypeNone / Not Required ExpertiseComputer ScienceCyber Jobs

ad.title: State Risk Insurance Claims Adjuster - State of Utah - Salt Lake County, UT
ad.content: $23.88 - $41.67 an hourAre you a motivated insurance claims professional interested in serving state insureds in a variety of unique and interesting claims? Join our team as a State Risk Insurance Claims Adjuster!Principal DutiesAs a State Risk Insurance Claims Adjuster, you will: Adjust property claims related to: fire, flood, lightning, wind, theft, earth movement, vandalism, embezzlement, business interruption, cyber theft, and auto property. Adjust liability claims related to: civil rights, employment, professional malpractice, cyber security, premises liability, bodily injury, death, third-party property damage, and construction defects. Apply insurance coverage under the Risk Management Insurance Policy. Consult with and provide policy coverage training to insureds' management and staff consistent with applicable state and federal laws, policies and procedures. Apply principles of the Governmental Immunity Act and the Unfair Claims Practices Act. Coordinate coverage with all excess insurance policies. RequirementsTo be considered for this position you must: Be licensed to drive in the state of Utah. The Best Qualified CandidateThe best qualified candidate for this position will have: At least 5 years of property/casualty insurance claims adjusting experience. A bachelor's degree or higher in Business Management. Additional PreferencesAdditional points may be awarded to applicants with multi-line claims adjusting experience or a Property/Casualty Insurance Adjuster license.If the chosen applicant does not have an Insurance Adjuster license, the Division will assist the employee to earn one. It is expected that the employee will earn the license within their first year of employment to pass probation.Why You Should Join Our TeamIn addition to the state's comprehensive and competitive benefits package, and healthy work/life balance, working for the Division of Risk Management is rewarding! We strive to approach loss control and claims management in a proactive and collaborative way in partnership with our clients. Our work keeps us on our toes! No two claims are the same, so we have to be flexible and innovative in our claims adjusting services.The Agency/DivisionThe Division of Risk Management provides property, liability, and auto insurance coverage, claims administration, and loss control services to the participating insureds of the Risk Management Fund. Among those insureds are all state agencies, all public school districts, all public institutions of higher education, and many of the public charter schools.Supplemental Information: Physical Requirements Work requires physical exertion such as long periods of standing, walking over rough terrain or rocky surfaces; recurring bending, crouching, stooping, stretching, reaching, lifting moderately heavy items (up to 50 lbs.) or similar activities. Working Conditions Risks which require the use of special safety precautions and/or equipment, e.g. conducting investigations on rooftops, busy roadways, structurally unsound buildings. May require wearing a hard hat or other protective equipment. DHRM rules apply for promotions/transfers.

ad.title: Marketing Consultant - R.R. Donnelley & Sons Company - Westlake, OH
ad.content: The Marketing Consultant is a senior marketing strategist dedicated to delivering consultative guidance and recommendations to clients and prospects. The role is a hybrid marketing and business consultant, and demands experience and expertise in three key areas: (1) marketing best practices, (2) business strategy, and (3) the data and technology infrastructure that supports the business and its marketing programs. The Marketing Consultant is responsible for understanding clients’ marketing goals and providing thoughtful, experience-based recommendations for fulfilling these goals, ideally leveraging the range of Precision Dialogue’s products and services offering. A successful Marketing Consultant bridges the gap between the aspirational and the technical; he or she will successfully help clients define marketing objectives as well as provide guidance on the tactical steps, with consideration to the available data and platforms. The Marketing Consultant supports both the Account Management team in enhancing existing client relationships as well as the Business Development team in providing consultation when required during the sales cycle (for example, within RFP responses and sales presentations). RRD is an EEO/AA including Vets and Disabled Employer Required Skills Primary Responsibilities Provide either ongoing/retainer or project-based strategic consulting in areas such as (but not limited to): Marketing program ROI/conversion optimization List growth/acquisition Campaign ideation Cross-channel strategy Testing strategy Competitive analysis Reengagement strategy & list hygiene Deliverability optimization and remediation Campaign KPI/ROI analysis Marketing platform optimization/migration Attend regular client status calls, quarterly or annual business reviews, and strategic planning sessions as needed (travel up to 25%) Partner with Sales and Account Management resources to scope projects based on recommendations Participate in relevant sales presentations or RFP responses Fulfill the role of Subject Matter Expert (SME) as it relates to platform optimization (Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Adobe Marketing Cloud, and/or other relevant ESPs/tools as required) Support brand positioning as a leader in the customer insights space with expert knowledge of: Business and services overview Value proposition Key differentiators Secondary Responsibilities Help develop sales material to aid the business development process Continuous improvement via explicit enablement path including RRD services and technology platforms Provide guidance to RRD executive management regarding positioning and marketing the RRD brand RRD is an EEO/AA including Vets and Disabled Employer Required Experience Qualifications Prefer at least ten years’ experience in a marketing strategy, business development, and/or account management capacity focused on the 1:1 marketing space Ability to present and discuss how marketing solutions can meet the 1:1 communications needs of Fortune 1000 CMO’s or VP’s of Marketing Experience in relevant marketing disciplines which may include: direct marketing, digital marketing (email, social, mobile, display), database marketing, CRM marketing, business intelligence Experience in relevant platforms which may include: marketing clouds (Salesforce, Adobe), business intelligence (Tableau, Power BI), ESPs, web analytics, ecommerce Undergraduate business degree required (ideally in Marketing) - Master’s degree preferred Possess excellent interpersonal, presentation, and written communication skills Experience-based understanding of marketing best practices and tactics

ad.title: NWI Network Engineer - LANAIR Group - Indiana
ad.content:
Who We Are:LANAIR Group, LLC is a premier IT Services Consultant firm that has grown rapidly since 2006, with offices serving greater Los Angeles, Santa Barbara, Northwest Indiana/Chicago and Dallas. Our experienced team of engineers specializes in: IT Services, Security Services, Unified Communications, Server Virtualization, Desktop Virtualization, Managed Services, Hosting Services both in and out of the “Cloud”. LANAIR integrates the industry's best technologies and practices for each customer's specific needs. We serve as an extension of our customers' IT departments, enabling them to focus on their core business.What We Want:We are seeking a Network Engineer to work out of our Valparaiso, Indiana, office.General Summary:A Network Engineer is a key element within the LANAIR support infrastructure and is expected to provide a high level of technical support to our customers. The Engineer must be able to apply creative problem-solving techniques to identify the source of issues; while at the same time keeping the customer aware of every step along the way. The Engineer is expected to use initiative and advise on potential pitfalls that a customer may experience, using existing or planned methods, and suggest alternatives that may better serve the stability and security of the customer’s solution.Essential Duties and Responsibilities Build, configure & troubleshoot: Complex Routing & Switching Environments LAN/WAN Networks Firewalls Wireless Access Points & Controllers Servers Virtualization Technologies Configure and troubleshoot remote access solution support: Site to site VPN’s SSL VPN’s MPLS Citrix/Vmware VDI Administration and maintenance of the remote monitoring and management system. Follow change management and document processes for all computer systems and network infrastructure. Handle administrative duties to maintain good client and vendor relations. Participate in the On-Call Technician rotation. Stay current on industry trends and technology and complete vendor certifications as identified as critical to support existing and emerging technologies.
Knowledge, Skills, and/or Abilities Required:To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Approximately 3+ years’ experience working in a networking or systems engineering position. Ability to handle multiple tasks and prioritize work in order to maintain required productivity levels. Must be detailed in documenting information and practice good follow through techniques. General problem solving abilities, coupled with a desire to take on responsibility. General knowledge of DNS and networking fundamentals including diagnostics with Windows/Linux tools, and CLI familiarity across major networking platforms. Possess a valid driver’s license and a vehicle for transportation to and from LANAIR Group’s office and remote sites as required. Work time may include some evenings and weekends. Submit to a background check prior to hiring. Desire to work in-office at LANAIR’s Valparaiso, IN location. Assist ITS Support Services Team with issue resolution. Perform other tasks as assigned by the IT Services Manager.
The most competitive candidate will have the following: Bachelor’s degree in computer science or engineering related field or equivalent work experience. Technical certifications: Fortigate NSE 4-8, CCNA-RS, CCNP-RS, CCNA-Security, CCNP-Security, and SonicWALL Advanced Certifications are a plus. Experience and Certifications with Fortinet, SonicWALL and Dell Networking Switches.
The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this classification. It is not designed to contain or to be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of the employee assigned to this job.What’s so great about LANAIR? We are an I.T. Services Company founded in 2006 run entrepreneurially by I.T. Service Engineers, so we understand the job and what it takes. As a fast growing organization with aggressive growth targets we offer the following: An organization where you will be immersed in an IT Consulting Practice, where you will gain valuable “breadth” and “depth” experience. Upside growth and opportunities – a place to be recognized and rewarded for your contributions. Above Average Compensation Plan. Above Average Benefit Program including 401K.

ad.title: NWI Senior Systems Engineer - LANAIR Group - Indiana
ad.content:
Who We Are:LANAIR Group, LLC is a Premier IT Services Consultant firm. We deliver enterprise-level managed services to businesses of all sizes. LANAIR integrates the industry's best technologies and practices for each customer's specific need and delivers it as a service via the company's commitment of client service. We serve as an extension of our customers' IT departments, enabling them to focus on their core business. LANAIR has grown rapidly, since 2006.What We Want:We are seeking a Senior Systems Engineer to work out of our Valparaiso, Indiana, office. Senior Systems Engineers are a key element within the LANAIR support infrastructure and are expected to provide a high level of technical support to our customers – remotely and on occasion onsite via a comprehensive CRM system. Senior Systems Engineers are an integral part of a sophisticated customer support system. These engineers apply creative problem-solving techniques to identify the source of problems and assist in their eventual resolution. Senior Systems Engineers are expected to use initiative, advise and consult, using existing “best practice” methods. Engineers are expected to proactively provide alternatives that may better serve the stability and security of the customer’s issue.Responsibilities:Build, configure & troubleshoot Citrix Virtual servers, desktops, and applications. Install, configure & troubleshoot server operating systems and applications. Install, configure & troubleshoot Window 2008/2012/2016, and Linux servers to meet customer requirements. Perform network administration tasks at client sites. Perform system and administrative tasks as outlined by LANAIR Group standard procedures for client visits. Handle administrative duties to maintain good client and vendor relations. Stay current on industry trends and technology, which may affect operations or customer expectations. Follow policies and standard operating procedures for the ITS department. Focused client service to maintain excellent client relationships. Participate in the On-Call Technician rotation. Work with IT Services Manager to develop and follow an education/certification program to increase/maintain level of technical expertise. Projects, tasks, and responsibilities are completed accurately and professionally with minimum un-billable time. Maintains successful attitude, professional presentation, and productive communication style. Maintains satisfactory relationships with peers. Complete vendor online certifications that are required for partner competency/product familiarity. Expert familiarity with LANAIR Core Infrastructure Management Services including: Complex Routing & Switching Environments Connectwise service board management ControlPoint Management (Kaseya) Remote Administration ControlPoint Monitor (Netmon) Analysis and Reporting Citrix XenDesktop, XenApp, VMware View image management Advanced Level Hyper-V Cluster Management and Deployment Advanced Level vCenter Virtual Machine and Data Store Management basics Storage Area Networking: Install configure and manage LANAIR supported storage technologies (Equallogic, Compellent, Dell MD Units) Dell Server Deployment Expertise Advanced Microsoft Exchange Install, Configure and Troubleshooting Advanced Active Directory concepts and troubleshooting Intermediate to advanced Dell, HP, Cisco Switch management is a requirement Intermediate to advanced Fortinet, Cisco and Sonicwall firewall management is a requirement Dell Chassis Deployment and Management expertise is a requirement Dell Equallogic, Compellent and DAS storage systems expertise is a requirement
Desired Skills & Certifications: Desirable candidates should have a thorough understanding of the concepts below: Mailflow Troubleshooting Exchange Configuration, Management, and Migration Office 365 Fundamentals Competency with Powershell Core troubleshooting fundamentals for Citrix, VMWare, and Hyper-V hypervisors Internal/External DNS Troubleshooting Desirable candidates should have Microsoft, Citrix or VMware certifications. A guideline is listed below: MCSE: Server Infrastructure Desktop Infrastructure Private Cloud Messaging Communication Citrix: CCEE CCIA VMware: View Datacenter Virtualization vCloud
Candidates must have the communication skills of a highly seasoned IT Consultant. This may require tactful handling of client communications; confidently believing, expressing and implementing LANAIR vendor best practice and service standards. Candidates are expected to self-train, motivate and lead others, assist with development and automation of managed service platform and project services. Candidates constantly seek to improve one-self as well as those around and is comfortably familiar with LANAIR service agreements and client platform management style. Candidates should plan for higher certification levels, attend webinars, seminars and other form of educational offerings from vendors as needed. Candidates work well in team and on their own, seeks out to help others and is able work as a team member as well as a leader. Candidates may occasionally be required to work after hours or on weekends depending on emergency or scheduled maintenance and project demands. The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by staff members in this classification. It is not designed to contain or to be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of the employee assigned to this job.What’s so great about LANAIR? We are an I.T. Services Company – run entrepreneurially by I.T. Service Engineers, so we understand the job and what it takes. As a fast growing organization with aggressive growth targets we offer the following: An organization where you will be immersed in an IT Consulting Practice, where you will gain valuable “breadth” and “depth” experience. Upside growth and opportunities – a place to be recognized and rewarded for your contributions. Above Average Compensation Plan. Above Average Benefit Program including 401K.

ad.title: Senior Virtualization Engineer - LANAIR Group - Glendale, CA
ad.content:
Who We Are:LANAIR Group, LLC is a premier IT and Unified Communications Services Consultant firm that has grown rapidly since 2006, with offices serving greater Los Angeles, Santa Barbara, Northwest Indiana/Chicago and Dallas. Our experienced team of engineers specializes in: IT Services, Security Services, Unified Communications, Server Virtualization, Desktop Virtualization, Managed Services, Hosting Services and Education Services for 21st Century learners. LANAIR integrates the industry's best technologies and practices for each customer's specific needs. We serve as an extension of our customers' IT departments, enabling them to focus on their core business.What We Want:A Senior Virtualization Engineer is a key element within the LANAIR team infrastructure and is expected to provide an advanced level of technical expertise with the implementation of virtualization and other leading IT solutions.General Summary:Primary Responsibilities: The Senior Virtualization Engineer will primarily be responsible for the installation, configuration, migration, maintenance, and troubleshooting of the following solutions: VMware vSphere and vSAN Dell Storage and PowerEdge Servers Windows Servers Dell EMC Avamar, Data Domain, and VxRAIL Microsoft Hyper-V Virtual and Physical Server Migrations
Initial Requirements: Must live within 30 miles of the Glendale location due to working out of this office daily (LANAIR Group, LLC. 330 N. Brand Blvd Suite 600, Glendale CA 91203). Must have the ability to quickly become familiar with and to communicate our solutions to engineers and client resources. Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills. This position requires extensive communications internally and externally through email, phone calls, and face to face meetings.
Experience Desired: 5+ years of experience with VMware platform. Experience with Windows Server platforms. Experience with Dell PowerEdge Servers and Dell Storage. Experience with migrating various virtual and physical servers to Hyper V and vSphere environments. Advanced knowledge of clustering services, load balancing and replication services. Demonstrated experience in creating documentation of designs and solution. Exposure to various facets of data center and branch office build-out including planning, designing and implementation of Microsoft systems. Ability to effectively communicate complex enterprise solutions to internal staff and client.
Additional Responsibilities: Provide senior level leadership to all engineering staff. Resolves escalated issues inside and outside of expertise. Provides training to peers and promotes teamwork. Works well with all department members, and company personnel. Keeps communication clear, concise and consistent. Utilizes all company resources including cell, laptop, IM and email effectively. Provides superior client communication skills. Works on multiple projects or tasks well with a sense of urgency and completing tasks on schedule. Able to quickly assess situations that require escalation to vendor support. Contributes and maintain knowledge base as it pertains to client hardware, network information, internal and general knowledge technical publications. The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this classification. It is not designed to contain or to be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of the employee assigned to this job.Technical Skills Required: Computer Science/Engineering Degree or equivalent experience is a minimum. Certifications desired: VMware VCP-DCA Microsoft MCSE (Server and/or Messaging) Dell Compellent Certified Installer EMC Certifications Analytical and critical thinking skills.
What’s So Great About LANAIR? We are an IT Services Company – run entrepreneurially by IT Service Engineers, so we understand the job and what it takes. As a fast growing organization with aggressive growth targets we offer the following: An organization that will immerse you into an IT Consulting Practice, where you will gain valuable “breadth” and “depth” experience. ad.title: Sr. Associate, Business Control & Risk Management - Santander Bank - Dorchester, MA
ad.content: Sr. Associate, Business Control & Risk Management-1902601 Description [POSITION SUMMARY] The Sr. Associate, Business Control & Risk Management operates within the First Line of Defense to execute the Enterprise Risk Framework - ensuring compliance with Regulations, Heightened Standards, and Corporate Policy. The Sr. Associate will help champion the Business Control mandate acting as a critical partner guiding stakeholders to embed risk management practices in the 1st line. The Sr. Associate serves as a subject matter expert by advising and guiding enterprise wide initiative such as risk assessments, KPI development, remediation of issues. Evaluations require collaboration with various stakeholders while influencing parties towards strategic goals. May manage a small team in these efforts.[RESPONSIBILITY STATEMENTS]Acts as a liaison with Risk and Compliance or second line of defense- to develop and implement new policy requests/revisions, to complete all line of business related risk assessments, risk mandates, continuity plans, resolution plans and execution.,Analyzes, evaluates and provides strategic guidance and direction for programs, policies and procedures to ensure alignment with regulatory requirements and acceptable risk mitigation practices.,Develops and implements appropriate controls and procedures reflecting the standards set forth in the policies and Regulations while accounting for risks inherent in the.products, services, types of customers, locations of customers, and functions of the Business Unit.,Develops, implements and monitors compliance program and controls for the assigned area. Identifies gaps in controls, proposes solutions, and implements corrective actions.,Drives projects to implement the necessary changes to policy, procedures and processes in order to align the Business Unit(s) to the organization's OCC's practice standards.,Effectively partners with line of business to solicit information and to mitigate risk.,Manages complex process evaluations across single or varied line of business.,Provides advisory support for regulatory examinations and audits by defining the how and why for all implemented decisions; ensures all requested documentation is provided.,Recognized as a subject matter expert by advising and guiding enterprise wide initiative such as risk assessments, KPI development, remediation of issues.,Reports to management on regulatory developments and risks/issues identified within assigned Compliance area. Regularly provides reports to Retail Risk and Compliance Director on progress., Supports Business Unit team members in the resolution of Risk related issues. Qualifications [EDUCATION] Bachelor's Degree; Accounting, Business, Statistics, Risk Management, Information Systems, Finance, Economics or equivalent field.,Master's Degree; Accounting, Business, Statistics, Risk Management, Information Systems, Finance, Economics or equivalent field.,or equivalent work experience; [WORK EXPERIENCE] 5-9 years; 5-10 years experience in the Business Unit.,9-12 years; Risk Management, Internal Controls, Auditing, Credit Management, relevant line of business experience and/or legal or regulatory experience. [LICENSE/CERTIFICATION] Risk Certification [SKILLS AND ABILITIES] Ability to anticipate the impact of regulatory and other environmental factors and proactively take action to ensure the team/function/enterprise is prepared.,Ability to build credibility with, collaborate with, and influence line of business executives.,Ability to build internal and external networks of information resources within the risk management ecosystem.,Ability to collaborate with internal and external service providers to establish resource requirements, scheduling, assignments and service levels.,Ability to constructively work both independently and in collaborative environments involving all levels of management and employees,Ability to work with limited oversight from manager.,Advanced knowledge of the financial services sector, particularly with the competitive dynamics and products in retail banking and risk management.,Advanced understanding of the regulatory environment and how the risks of the products and services the bank offers are viewed by the Second Line of Defense and regulators.,Demonstrated experience executing risk projects across multiple business lines offering a wide variety of financial services products and services.,Demonstrated judgement in escalation, ensuring risk-based clear line of sight for senior executives into existing and emerging issues/incidents., Demonstrated thought leadership and application of operational risk identification and mitigation practices and procedures.,Excellent analytical and complex problem solving skills.,In depth research and analysis skills for more complex and critical data, interpret and communicate industry trends.,Strong understanding of BSA/AML and OFAC regulations, regulatory expectations and industry leading practices.,Superior project management skills. [PHYSICAL DEMANDS] Minimal physical effort such as sitting, standing, and walking. [COMPETENCIES] Brings out the best in each team member by consistently motivating and acknowledging peer contributionsUnderstands and leverages team dynamics,Effectively conveys difficult or complex information in an easy to understand manner, by providing the big picture and illustrating important linkages Asks open-ended questions that encourage others to give their points of view,Ensures people receive the information they require, and brings the team together to share information,Ensures that all directs and colleagues have appropriate knowledge of risk and the regulatory environmentInvestigates and identifies the root cause and corrects items deemed non-compliant, regardless of pressures from business or management,Fully accountable for timeliness, completeness, quality of projects, processes, products and servicesRemains calm and focused on goals while facing pressures, obstacles or short-term setbacks,Improves relationships between key individuals to achieve seamless cross-team work flow and positively impact resultsUses informal networks to gain support for ideas and projects,Keeps up -to-date with external market events, pressures and regulations which may impact the organization and assesses whether similar issues exist in the organizationCan identify functional and organizational implications associated with major trendsDesigns solutions to address industry activities that impact the organization,Monitors adherence to policies, regulations, processes and procedures within function and actively undertakes corrective action where necessaryUnderstands end to end processes across the organization and how processes are integratedHas a practical knowledge of regulations impacting area supported Job :Business Control Primary Location :Massachusetts-Dorchester-2 Morrissey Boulevard - 06367 - Columbia Park Organization :Technology (5900) Schedule :Full-time Job Posting :May 6, 2019, 2:34:52 PM

ad.title: Universal Operations Specialist, Needham, MA - Santander Bank - Needham, MA
ad.content: Universal Operations Specialist, Needham, MA-1902595 Description As a member of Santander’s retail banking division you’ll help serve Santander’s retail and small business customers as part of one of the top banks in the United States based on deposits. With principal presence in the northeast U.S., Santander’s retail division offers consumer and lending products to help our customers reach their financial goals. Santander currently serves nearly 2 million retail customers and 5.2% of the 2.7 million small businesses in the US footprint have a transactional account with Santander Bank. The Senior Specialist, Universal Banking Operations performs the operations and service functions of the branch, including adherence to all security, reconciliation, monitoring and balancing policies and procedures. In addition, s/he identifies customer needs and refers financial products and services. The incumbent plays a vital role in delivering a quality customer experience, by working directly with the branch sales team to create an environment that demonstrates core behaviors that enhance and grow the branch. S/he specializes in our branch customer experience through lobby management, transactions, and servicing for retail and business customers. Responsibilities Adheres to applicable compliance/operational risk controls in accordance with Company or regulatory standards and policies Completes branch currency ordering, and maintain negotiable inventory Effectively uses available resources for problem resolution, which may involve analysis of information received from Loan Processing, Deposit Operations, ATM, Reconcilement, Loss Management or Financial Intelligence Unit or other internal Santander departments Functions as the ATM Custodian, to include balancing Functions as the Vault Custodian Markets a full range of consumer and small business banking services to existing and potential customers through proactive techniques such as lobby leadership, outbound telemarketing calls, marketing campaigns, or in banking center events Participates in telemarketing and other banking center calling and marketing initiatives Performs sporadic cash counts for ATM and Service Associates Provides a variety of transactions for customers, including typical consumer transactions i.e., cashes checks and processes checking and savings account withdrawals and balancing duties, etc. while seeking opportunities to develop customer relationships and identify sales opportunities; utilizes basic sales techniques to deepen existing customer/prospect relationships Researches and resolves account problems in conjunction with branch management Utilizes sales techniques to uncover customer needs and match to the organization's products and services; sells a full range of consumer and business products/services such as deposit accounts, loans, credit cards, and safe deposit boxes to meet or exceed established sales goals to support overall sales objectives Qualifications H.S. Diploma, or equivalent work experience; 3-5 years; Experience in customer service, sales, call center and/or cash-handling along with branch operations experience Ability to function in a team environment Ability to interact with customers, partners, vendors and team members in a professional and personable manner Ability to maintain and balance a cash drawer Ability, motivation and preference to succeed in a goal-driven environment Basic knowledge of small business, mortgages, and lending services a plus Basic understanding of personal finances and concept of budgeting Comfortable making outreach calls to consumer or business customers and/or prospect Comfortable with technology & i.e. smartphones, ipads, online banking, remote deposit capture, ATM deposits, etc Decision-maker with well-developed interpersonal skills Detail oriented and ability to follow established policies and procedures Excellent verbal and written communication skills Good organizational skills Passion for customer service and helping people Self-motivated with a demonstrated aptitude and desire for sales achievement Strong commitment to personal growth, learning and success Superior customer relationship building skills Minimal physical effort such as sitting, standing, and walking Addresses customer’s requests, ensures concerns are recorded accurately and action is initiated appropriately Makes extra effort to satisfy customer’s needs and meet commitments Assesses problem situations and initiates effective interventions that result in customer satisfaction Takes time to develop and maintain relationships with customers Builds and maintains one’s network of contacts and resources and knows who to involve in problem resolution Communicates in a timely and straightforward manner Probes for additional information, clarifies assumptions and confirms agreed-upon actions Keeps everyone involved informed about progress and issues Creates a good working environment in the team; works towards shared goals contributing ideas and accepting change Provides assistance and coaches less experienced team members Follows through to meet commitments to others Takes responsibility for achieving strong results, despite balancing multiple complex demands Understands rationale for change and adjusts schedules and tasks to make things work Anticipates and plans for changes in work schedules and assignments Understands the relevant products and services and the markets in which they are sold and their risk return to the organization Can identify and speak to major operational issues across the organization At Santander, we value and respect differences in our workforce and strive to increase the diversity of our teams. We actively encourage everyone to apply. Job :Retail Operations Primary Location :Massachusetts-Needham-695 Highland Avenue - 00684 - Needham Heights - Branch Organization :Consumer & Business Banking (1001) Schedule :Full-time Job Posting :May 6, 2019, 1:50:34 PM

ad.title: Vice President, Digital Marketing Analytics - OneMain Financial - Wilmington, DE
ad.content: OneMain has been helping consumers take care of life’s expenses through personal loans for over 100 years. We’ve grown to 10,000 employees in 44 states, and we are consistently seeking ways to innovate and better reach our customers. Our digital programs represent some of our largest and most critical acquisition channels, offering more consumers exposure to our services and delivering value to organizations that share our vision and commitment. The Vice President of Digital Marketing Analytics will leverage data to recommend and implement initiatives that improve the performance of our digital channels across all products. Responsibilities include: Analyze data from multiple disparate sources around performance of digital channels, including affiliate network, search (SEM, SEO), display, social, e-mail and web testing. Understand funnel performance and recommend and implement initiatives to improve conversions across all steps of the funnel Perform channel optimization in terms of pricing and competitive positioning in market. Communicate plans and results across the organization including executive management and the operations group. Perform trend analysis, maintain volume forecasts and manage the marketing budget and spend associated with digital channels. Partner across the marketing and analytics organization to make recommendations and propose solutions to efficient and profitable growth within acceptable credit targets. Track loan performance across marketing channels to ensure marketing efforts are driving profitable customers Maintain an environment of control and compliance. Direct the efforts of the digital marketing analytics team and aid in professional career development of the individuals on the team. Work with technology and product teams to build out additional data fields and to ensure accuracy of all data Skills or Experience we want you to have: Superior communication skills with the comfort to interface with all levels of management Track record of achievement, with direct responsibility for implementing change and producing positive results The ability to thrive in a fast-paced, innovative, and entrepreneurial environment Experience mining and analyzing data from digital marketing outcomes (SAS or SQL knowledge a major plus) Experience managing marketing budgets in excess of $20MM Strong problem solving, project management and organizational skills Proficient in MS Office (Excel w/ Pivot Tables, Word, PowerPoint, etc.)

ad.title: Administration Specialist - OneMain Financial - Fort Mill, SC
ad.content: Our Company Founded over 100 years ago, OneMain is America’s premier personal finance company. Our company provides personal loans, insurance, and other related financial products to more than 2.4 million consumers in communities across the country through a network of over 1,600 branches with more than 10,000 employees. We are committed to responsible lending, regulatory compliance, and an active program of outreach to the Investment Community. Job DescriptionAs a OneMain Administration Specialist, you will be involved in decisions on controlling business risks, staff results, and the provision of quality service to customers and merchants. This position fields difficult calls from staff and determines a satisfactory resolution based on approved strategies. Fact-finding analytical activities are required. The successful candidate will be in contact with staff, co-workers, internal departments, customers, financial institutions, third parties and merchants. Responsibilities include one or more of the following: Perform analysis and performance tracking of individual departmental results. Maintain and generate daily, weekly and monthly statistical reports. Develop and/or deliver training for department staff. Maintain an understanding of departmental systems, personal computers, software applications and policies and procedures. Assist in the identification and implementation of departmental improvements. Perform quality audits and /or service observations. Communicates with management on operational process improvement opportunities and/or trends. Provide back-up support in absence of a supervisor. Maintains Appropriate Position Documentation. Required Skills and Qualifications: High School / GED Diploma required but an Associate Degree is preferred 2 (Two) years of call center or administrative experience Strong problem solving skills Creative research skills Strong verbal and written skills Ability to maintain confidentiality and sensitive information Proficient in basic MS office applications COMPENSATION: OneMain offers an excellent compensation package including a competitive base pay Benefits include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401K, profit sharing, holiday and vacation time offOneMain prides itself on internal growth opportunities through training and development as well as career growth opportunities through internal promotions. Take the first step toward a challenging and rewarding career at OneMain and apply today!OneMain is an equal opportunity employer and is proud to maintain a smoke and drug free workplace! Want to know more? Text OneMain to 97211 #LI-DG1

ad.title: Director, Digital Partners - OneMain Financial - Chicago, IL
ad.content: OneMain has been helping consumers take care of life’s expenses through personal loans for over 100 years. We’ve grown to 10,000 employees in 44 states, and we are consistently seeking ways to innovate and better reach our customers. Our digital affiliate program is one of our largest and most critical acquisition channels, offering more consumers exposure to our services and delivering value to organizations that share our vision and commitment. The digital partnership team oversees and maximizes performance for our digital partners in coordination with other teams such as analytics, finance, legal, and supplier management. We are looking for a manager to join our digital partnerships team. This individual will be a critical member of the team managing partner relationships for selected partners, implementing strategies to build awareness, influence buying decisions, generate demand, drive and accelerate leads and support revenue growth for OneMain Financial. They will also have business ownership over the partner forecast and partner with the analytics team to identify opportunities for improving operational performance. Key responsibilities: Build deep key relationships within our affiliate partner’s organization Partner with Legal, Supplier Management and Finance organizations to oversee contract negotiations and navigate required approvals within both organizations Ensure our affiliate partner needs align with OneMain Financial Create and oversee marketing plans (specialized digital promotions, emails, badges) to support lead gen efforts designed to drive volume within the partner digital ecosystem Become the subject matter expert on that partner, grow a deep understanding of their operations and team to better align, and work together on building production volume Build and enhance comprehensive and metrics-driven partnership strategies, success criteria and metrics (including return on digital media spend), mutually agreed upon KPIs, revenue targets and operating procedures Analyze data from multiple disparate sources around performance of digital channels, including affiliate network, search, display, social, e-mail and web testing Perform channel optimizations in terms of pricing and competitive market positioning Work with analytics team to identify business opportunities and make implementation and optimization decisions to improve overall profitability In collaboration with the analytics team build and own partner production delivery forecast Requirements: 5+ years of experience in digital partnerships, relationship management and analysis A keen focus on a customer’s digital marketing experience Up-to-date on latest digital acquisition trends Strong written and verbal communication skills Proven history of creating and analyzing performance of effective marketing programs Experience building and navigating cross-functional teams Financial Services experience is a plus #LI-SL1
