ad.title: Senior Data Analyst - Glidewell Dental - Irvine, CA
ad.content: Glidewell Dental is an industry-leading provider of dental technology products and services to dental professionals worldwide. Headquartered in Newport Beach/Irvine, CA, the Glidewell campus is home to 3,300 employees and complete with an employee gym, cafeteria, massage therapist, acupuncturist, and of course, a dentist. Glidewell Dental employs over 5,000 employees worldwide and is privately owned. So what is a dental company doing with technology? Glidewell is dedicated to building the future of dental through additive manufacturing, data science, and even machine learning. We research and develop new innovative products and services for the dental industry at affordable costs. Just ask your dentist! Responsibilities: Analyze data to discover and interpret trends, patterns, and relationships. Monitor and evaluates trends for performance and growth opportunities. Work cross-functionally to establish instrumentation and reporting standards. Create dashboards and reports to communicate KPI’s and actionable data. Review data quality to provide guidance and controls to upstream data providers and sources. Perform ad hoc data requests. Communicate with Data Analyst team members on findings, solutions, and recommendations. Participate in the on-call support rotation. Mentor team members to abide by departmental guidelines such as the Agile Methodology by leads sprint planning/reviews/grooming. Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or other quantitative field. Minimum of four (4) years of relevant experience or equivalent combination of education and experience working with Tableau. Tableau certification highly preferred Must possess effective oral communication and interpersonal skills with ability to deal with all levels of personnel in a professional and effective manner General knowledge with Agile Scrum development methodologies. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and innovative environment. Benefits: Full Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits 401k plan with employer match Vacation, sick time Employee Gym with showers Employee Medical Center with on-site Physician, Massage Therapist, Acupuncturist, Physical Therapist Employee Dentist and Hygienist Can be selected to get reconstructive work done on teeth for free $1000 per year on Glidewell products Opportunities to attend industry conferences and events On-site cafeteria Game room Employee appreciation days (Company BBQ, special events, etc.) Theme park trip (friends and family invited)

ad.title: Senior Engineer, Quality Assurance - SoFi - Helena, MT
ad.content: We are seeking a Senior Quality Assurance Engineer to join our Underwriting and Central Services team. This individual should thrive on being self-driven to execute tasks with limited supervision. At SoFi, you’ll become part of a new kind of finance company whose ambition is to help our members achieve financial independence and reach their goals. We aim to be at the center of our members’ financial lives, and to help every member get their money right. We created student loan refinancing, addressing the biggest financial challenge of a new generation through a modern approach to lending and personal finance. Next we expanded our products and services across loans, wealth management, and insurance. SoFi has achieved significant growth, with ambitious plans ahead, but to continue this growth we need great talent. And that starts with you. Key Responsibilities: Work closely with Product Managers and Developers throughout Underwriting and Central Services projects and features to ensure that all areas of testing are successfully completed and documented and all problems are resolved before release. Coordinate with cross-functional teams and communicate any impactful changes to the team. Ability to lead Underwriting and Central Services initiatives from a QA perspective. Demonstrated experience writing test plans and test cases and have a Quality mindset. Work closely with Product when presented with a project where requirements may not be clear and involving appropriate teams when scope creep occurs. Create detailed defect reports and work with developers to narrow down the root cause of issues. Requirements: Minimum of 5+ years of experience in software quality assurance. Strong attention to detail. Self-motivated with strong decision-making skills. Superior written and verbal communication skills. Prior experience with development methodologies like Kanban, Agile, Scrum etc. Proven ability to manage competing priorities in a dynamic environment. Strong knowledge of test process, testing techniques and software test tools. Knowledge of tools such as Postman, Testrail, Docker, and JIRA a plus Knowledge of Agile or Scrum based development a plus Benefits Competitive salary packages and bonuses. Comprehensive medical, dental, vision and life insurance as well as disability benefits. 100% of medical, vision, and dental premiums paid by SoFI for employees and their dependents. Generous vacation and holidays 401(k) and education on retirement planning. Tuition reimbursement on approved programs, up to $5,250 a year. Monthly contribution to help you pay off your student loans. Employer paid lunch program and subsidized gym membership. Fully stocked kitchen (snacks & drinks)

ad.title: Software Engineer - ViaSat - Atlanta, GA
ad.content: Bigger challenges. Bolder ideas. Global impact. At Viasat, we’re on a mission to deliver connections with the capacity to change the world. We’re the company behind the world’s fastest satellite internet service, with technology that’s helping to bridge the digital divide and improve life for our customers around the globe. By providing powerful new ways for people to connect with one another, gain greater access to education, entertainment, medical research, commerce, and much more, our team is empowering millions of customers worldwide.We’re growing rapidly and looking for passionate, innovative professionals to join our team and connect the world to more. You’ll work in a collaborative and inclusive environment that values diverse perspectives and continuous learning, and provides industry-leading benefits with unmatched opportunities for career growth. Our team is fearless in pursuit of new ideas and uncompromising in our quest to become the world’s first truly global Internet Service Provider. Interested in joining our mission? Take a look at career opportunities at Viasat today.Job ResponsibilitiesWe are seeking for an experienced Software Engineer in C/C++ or Python. We are looking for ambitious software engineer to work on the requirements, design,implementation, integration, and test of application software. As a Software Engineer you will be performing full-cycle software development work as amember of a team on various projects. The work focuses on developing and supporting a Satellite ground station monitoring and control system. Looking for a capable self-starter, self-motivated software engineering, disciplined in software development methods including Agile/Scrum.Requirements5-10 year’s experiences in full SW development cycle including requirement analysis, design, programing, testing, debugging Experience with a distributed application development Knowledge of multi-threaded applications and inter-process communication Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies Experience with CM and issue tracking tools such as Perforce, GIT, Artifactory, JIRA, Fisheye Familiarity with networking and cloud computing concept Bachelor’s degree in CS/CE/EE or related discipline US Citizenship Required. Travel Up to 10%PreferencesKnowledge of virtualization and experience with virtualization tools highly desired Continuous Integration & development(CI/CD) experience AWS experience is a plus Experience with a Message broker base application development (such as RabbitMQ) Experience with Ansible playbook based SW/system deployment Experience with NMS/EMS system Radio Frequency and/or Antenna Experience

ad.title: Freelance Delivery Manager - WONGDOODY - New York, NY
ad.content: ContractJob DescriptionWONGDOODY is hiring a Delivery Manager as part of our growing Project Management team. This role will be key to our growth efforts, partnering closely with the NY CX team supporting the execution and delivery of client work. The Delivery Manager role will have been exposed to UX/UI design, multiple stakeholder projects, and software development. This role includes: Organizes and facilitates daily stand-up meetings, reviews, estimation, retrospectives, sprint and release planning, demos, burn down tracking and other scrum-related meetings. Works collaboratively with business, product and technical teams to support development and software delivery. Assists the product owner and business owner in user story prioritization and product backlog grooming via emergent requirements. Ensures development team is working efficiently towards sprint goals. Understands delivery impediments, issues, risks, and changes associated with the product development initiatives; works with responsible owners to address the items on a timely basis; updates the appropriate stakeholders as needed. Asks difficult questions, and makes issues and problems visible. Escalates as necessary. Partners with product and technical leads to assign and monitor work, ensuring that project steps are in alignment with business objectives, on-time and within budget. Coaches the development team and stakeholders on how to use Agile, Scrum and Kanban practices at a pace that is sustainable and comfortable for the team and organization. Creates a method of change management including ownership of a documentation, communication plans, process training, etc. Establishes, plans, and executes major milestone reviews and decision gates to complete the program and project life cycle. Ensures all the required products are produced and reviewed, including the technical leadership of requirements management, design, implementation, system integration, verification, test, quality assurance, delivery, operations, and sustainment of the technical solution. Manages and tracks team velocity and other KPIs in relation to the plan and published progress reports. Builds strategic relationships that will increase team output, process accuracy, improve time to market and customer experience. Leverages the capabilities, insights, and ideas of others. Demonstrates trust. Qualifications5-7 years’ progressive experience scoping and project management within a product, UX design or marketing agency in a project/delivery management capacity Demonstrated understanding of project management processes, artifacts and tools. Fluent with Agile practices as applied to software development. An ability to drive to big picture goals and milestones while valuing and maintaining a strong attention to detail. An ability to quickly identify and drive to the optimal solution when presented with a series of constraints. A demonstrated ability in strategic planning, risk management, change management, project management. Excellent judgment, analytical thinking, and problem-solving skills. Hands on quality management approaches, techniques, and principles to ensure quality. Knowledge of both theoretical and practical aspects of project management. Self-motivated individual that possesses excellent time management and organizational skills. Strong cross-functional collaboration skills, relationship building skills and ability to achieve results without direct reporting relationships. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group: developers, product owners, and subject matter experts. Strong sense of personal responsibility and accountability for delivering high quality work. Certified Scrum and/or Kanban preferred A sense of humor! Additional InformationTO APPLY: For full consideration please upload both a resume and cover letter At WONGDOODY we are focused on equity, diversity and inclusion. We believe our employees should reflect the diversity of the populations where we live, including racial and ethnic diversity. People of color are strongly encouraged to apply. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

ad.title: Technical Project Manager - FireEye, Inc. - Milpitas, CA
ad.content: Job DescriptionFireEye’s program management team is looking for a Junior Technical Project Manager who will be responsible for managing multiple cross functional software teams developing cloud-hosted applications. A strong candidate is an advocate for integrity, visibility, and collaboration across agile teams. Responsibilities: Manage and track project resources, forecasts, and schedules to achieve project objectives and goals and control communications with project stakeholders Manage cross-team dependencies, coordinate cross-team initiatives and blocker issues Work closely with engineering managers, technical leads and product managers to drive project planning and execution of multiple complex software development projects Collaborate with cross-functional groups across FireEye thru the software development life cycle, from definition to successful delivery of releases Assist in developing and implementing Project Management Best practices, tools and templates within engineering Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related technical discipline is required or equivalent experience 2+ years of technical project management experience successfully managing engineering projects/software product releases Hands-on experience with agile methodologies and process; understanding of Scrum Experience with Project Management tools – Jira, Microsoft Teams or similar tools Experience advocating for adoption of best practices suited to program/projectAdditional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. PMP, CSM, PMI-ACP, and/or related project management certification is a plus Experience with managing and delivering a Cloud-hosted application is a plus Excellent organizational skills Excellent verbal and written communication skills Team player

ad.title: Senior Project Manager - MRY - New York, NY
ad.content: Job DescriptionA Senior Project Manager leads a variety of projects within MRY, manages/mentors project managers/associate project managers, and is responsible for successful delivery on time, on budget, top quality, and meeting clients business objectives. Responsibilities Manage a large, integrated portfolio of business (up to $4MM) and responsible for overall team leadership, negotiating annual SOWs, profit margin, resource management, management of junior project managers, quality of service, and ensuring work meets agency standards and client objectives. Lead ideation process on large engagements and accurately scope projects, defining project requirements and success metrics. Work in an independent fashion, solve problems, make decisions, and communicate effectively in difficult situations. Management of complex projects from kick-off to delivery on time, on budget, and on brief. Be the point of contact for all departments, the senior project manager is the person clients and internal team members rely on for everything they need to know about a project: what to expect, what to do next, where they need to be, where an image is on the server, what the dial in number is for a conference call, what the staffing plan is, and much more. Independently reduce projects to a set of manageable tasks and develop SOWs, staffing plans, and executional strategy. Provide leadership and direction to all departments and team members on projects: drive the critical path, send out hot sheets on an ongoing basis, lead daily status meetings/scrums, ensure the team is hitting milestone dates, keep time intensive tasks on track and up-to-date, and manage the team to the scoped financial parameters. Define the scope of projects (goals, deliverables, schedule, and budget). Serve as the main client interface on projects from a project management perspective, helping define vision, clarifying strategic requirements, explaining complex ideas clearly, and managing expectations. Keep projects on track through clear task lists, issue tracking, status reports, and meeting notes. Lead efficient meetings and conference calls with the ability to effectively setup the presentation of creative work. Clearly communicate project issues and resolution to the client and internal team Responsible for owning all aspects of financials from scoping, financial health, financial forecasting, and client billing of all fees and OOP costs. Leads billing meetings with the finance team on a bi-monthly basis to ensure the client is being billed and paying invoices. Qualifications6+ years in the advertising industry or related experience managing large crossfunctional teams and clients. Experience overseeing multi million dollar client portfolios of up to $1 million with responsibility for account growth, client satisfaction, and retention. Experience with various projects types in digital and traditional agency settings – traditional and digital production. Experience managing large interdisciplinary teams of more than 10 people. Excellent negotiation experience (especially contract negotiations) with both clients and partners Public speaking skills and experience. Additional InformationMRY values diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines

ad.title: Principal Project Manager, Automation - Genentech - Vacaville, CA
ad.content: Principal Project Manager reports directly to the Associate Director of CCP1 Process Automation and is responsible for managing automaton projects from initiation through right the first time and timely delivery and close out. This role contributes to the definition of an overall Automaton strategy and guides project teams to deliver on automation project objectives and strategic initiatives. Additional responsibilities include the following: Establish and maintain functionally integrated project schedules to enable accurate project, financial and portfolio analyses and ensure accurate inputs are provided into business planning processes. Ensure alignment with project sub-teams and functional partners. Provide input and assist in the development and maintenance of the CCP1 Process Automation Road Map. Oversee and prepare project team budget including resources and costs, collaborating with Finance and other cross-functional departments. Communicate, document and archive project team activities and decisions. Act as a primary contact for project team related information. Facilitate project team meetings, cross-functional communication and decision making, ensuring alignment with internal and external stakeholders. Identify, recommend and implement opportunities for streamlining team and business processes. Ensure the team achieves and maintains a high-level of sustainable performance by contributing to appropriate team management best practices. Successful candidates will meet the following minimum requirements. The level of the position will be based on the qualifications of the selected candidate: Minimum 12-15 years of experience in the successful delivery of of multi-disciplinary Automation related projects in the biotech/pharmaceutical industry. Experience using Project Management software to manage complex project timelines and resources. Certified Scrum Master:Experience leading in an agile framework (i.e. using Scrum, sprints, etc.) Experience in coaching, empowerment and collaboration Experience using agile operating tools (e.g. Jira, Slack, etc.) Experience leading and motivating people towards a common goal Experience facilitating large, complex projects, scrums and/or sprints Experience driving innovative thinking and solutions Experience in removing barriers and assisting teams to problem-solve Demonstrated ability to work in a results-oriented environment, while modeling integrity, passion, ethics and compliance Demonstrated ability to communicate, influence without authority and strategize with leaders Ability to train other individuals on the agile framework and mindset Bachelor's degree or Advanced degree in Engineering or Computer Science PMP (Project Management Professional) certification is a plus. At a minimum, strong candidates will demonstrate the following: Strong proficiency with project management practices, tools and methodology. Financial acumen with capability to plan and oversee project budgets and product valuations Understanding of portfolio management concepts. Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to develop important relationships with customers and key stakeholders. Good conflict management skills. Excellent analytical skills. Strong communication and presentation skills with the ability to communicate complex information effectively. Ability to translate strategy into action. Strong influencing and negotiation skills. Proven track record of good decision making and exercising sound judgment. Embraces working in a culture where receiving and providing feedback is valued. Results and detail-oriented. Self-motivated.

ad.title: Front-End Software Engineer - Framework Homeownership, LLC - Boston, MA
ad.content:
About the Team The Engineering team’s mission is to architect and develop innovative mobile and web applications by applying computer science, mathematics, engineering and other disciplines, and collaborating with other business units and external stakeholders. The team plays a vital role in leading collaboration across the company by putting together a tech stack to support platform strategy, which in turn supports various revenue models. They do all this while adopting agile practices and experimenting with emerging technologies for the organization to innovate, as well as remaining compliant and secure and enforcing internal policies which are aligned to organizational strategy and vision. About the Role The Front-End Software Engineer will develop and launch initiatives that expand our platform and position the company as a leading online resource for our next phase of growth. You will join the engineering team and work to develop interactive, engaging products. What You'll Do Develop new Framework platform, features, and Enhance platform as needed Author and maintain clean, consistent, and elegant code while delivering clear business value Create scalable and reliable web applications by fully testing the codes Regular status updates to all assigned sprint tasks in daily stand-up meetings Identify key gaps/need areas that require further development and enhancement Analyze, troubleshoot, and resolve production system issues and defects Collaborate and work closely with the product team and scrum master to complete tasks assigned during the sprint planning Thrive in entrepreneurial and nimble environment Understand Framework’s business, customers, and product Participate on UI/UX discussion of our product as well as platform What You'll Bring 5+ years of hands-on experience with front-end web development Experience with web applications and programming languages such as HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and API. Experience with frameworks such as ReactJS, Angular etc. would be a strong plus! Experience on web user interface design (UI) principles and willingness to apply the principles to develop the platform Deep understanding about the Service Oriented Architecture (SOA) and Micro-services architecture Functional knowledge with web services (REST, SOAP, etc.) Understanding of security principles and how they apply to business applications Cross-device development experience focused on web and mobile technologies Understanding of Agile development methodology (Scrum) Education in computer science or related work experience Excellent analytical/organizational and decision-making skills Knowledge and Experience: JSON, JavaScript, ReactJS, Angular, JQuery, AWS, GraphQL, PostgreSQL, HTML5, CSS, CSS3, XML, User Interface (UI), object-oriented programming, Web Services (REST/SOAP), API Work Environment This job is in a professional office environment. Routine use of standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets is required. Occasional travel is required, including overnight travel for up to four days at a time.
Physical Demands This position requires the employee to work in an office environment. It requires the ability to speak and hear in person, over the phone, and in settings where there are groups of people. It requires the ability to travel to a variety of meeting locations including via airplane.
About the Company
Framework is a startup social enterprise built on a simple idea: every homebuyer should have access to unbiased information about the mortgage process and feel knowledgeable about the responsibilities of owning a home, throughout their homeownership journey. We are proudly pro-homeownership and believe it’s a uniquely accessible and powerful way for people to plant and grow seeds of generational wealth. We make it easier for people to do this by providing the tools we believe will lead people into homes that improve their quality of life, giving them the space to grow into their future, and gain value over time. We’re dedicated to helping our customers make decisions with confidence, build wealth in their homes, and protect their investment for generations to come. As we leverage the power of technology to strengthen communities one homeowner at a time, the individual contributions of our tight-knit team play a vital, daily role in shaping our products and services. Creative thinking, collaboration, and problem solving are at the core of the Framework culture, and we’re seeking team members with drive and creativity to add to the mix. The position description is a guide to the critical duties and essential functions of the job, not an all-inclusive list of responsibilities, qualifications, physical demands and work environment conditions. Position descriptions are reviewed and revised to meet Framework’s changing needs, at the sole discretion of management.

ad.title: Hiring---FullStack C#/.NET Developer--Bloomington, MN--Contract - Software Technology Inc - Minneapolis, MN
ad.content: Job DescriptionHello, Hope you are doing good. I am a Lead Talent Acquisition Specialist at STI (Software Technology, Inc) and I am reaching out to you with an exciting job opportunity. Position is of a FullStack C#/.NET Developer. Location: Bloomington, MN.Below is a detailed job description. Should you be interested, please feel free to reach me via call or email. Amrutha.duddula at stiorg.com/732-664-8807 Title: FullStack C#/.NET Developer Duration: 3-6 Months Location: Bloomington, MN Job description: Responsibilities: Design, develop and deliver code required to support new feature developments and enhancements in an agile environmentPerform thorough unit testing and some functional testingMaintain the integrity of the application design and architectureContinually refactor legacy components to evolve into a modern target architectureMaintain knowledge of new and emerging technologies to utilize in enhancing new and existing productsParticipate in the agile process including standups, planning, reviews and retrospectives Requires Skills:5-7+ years professional experience with C# / .NETExperience creating and consuming RESTful services using JSON and XMLExperience with modern Javascript frameworks (Angular, Node) and related frameworks and toolsExperience with object-oriented design, design patterns and SOLID principlesProficiency with designing and working with relational databases, SQL Server preferredProficiency with Git, or comparable distributed version control systemWrite quality code that ensures stability and extensibility of the platform Preferred Skills:Experience in a continuous integration / continuous delivery environment.Experience with ServiceStack is a huge plusExperience with NoSQL databases a plusExperience with IIS (7+) is a plusExperience with Material Design is a plusExperience with technologies such as Elastic, Kibana, RabbitMQ or Redis is a plus If you have any questions, please feel free to reach me via email or phone. Thank you, Amrutha DuddulaLead Talent Acquisition Specialist Software Technology Inc (STI) 100 Overlook Center, Suite 200 Princeton, NJ 08540 Email: amrutha.duddula at stiorg.com Phone : 732-664-8807 www.stiorg.com www.linkedin.com/in/amruthad/ QualificationsnullAdditional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

ad.title: Head of Global Partnerships - Optimizely - San Francisco, CA
ad.content: Job DescriptionOptimizely is looking to hire a Head of Global Partnerships who will be responsible for leading our global alliance organization. As a leader within our go-to-market organization, you will collaborate with Optimizely’s sales, success, marketing, and product leaders to develop Optimizely’s Partner Ecosystem, GTM strategy and drive key initiatives to achieve Optimizely’s sales and customer success objectives. This position reports to our Chief Revenue Officer. RESPONSIBILITIES: Lead the activities of the global partnerships team including partner management, partner enablement, partner marketing and partner program management Achieve an annual channel influenced bookings quota across North America and Europe Collaborate with our customer success organization to insure our partners are aligned with Optimizely’s professional services and net retention goals Collaborate with our marketing organization to increase engagement with partners through campaigns and events and to achieve Optimizely’s pipeline generation targets through co-marketing with our partners Operate the Partnerships business with discipline around forecasting, consistency, and accountability for high performance Lead the hiring, training, and ramping of new Partner Managers Manage a team of Partner Managers responsible for acquiring partners and growing Optimizely’s book of business with agency and ISV partners Coach your team to develop strategic territory and account plans and build integrated partnerships with complex organizations. Join your team on sales calls and QBRs to coach them through collaborating with executives and improving their fundamentals Be the visible leader of Optimizely’s Partnerships team: maintain personal relationships at key partner accounts, speak at industry conferences, organize Optimizely partner events, etc. Embody Optimizely’s cultural values and lead by example. QualificationsYou have managed a high performing partnership, sales, or business development team for 5+ years You have 10-15 years experience in partnerships, sales, and channels for a B2B technology company; experience with marketing technology and SaaS is a must. You have experience selling to and building partnerships with (i) global system integrators and (ii) digital agencies particularly in EMEA. Relevant professional connections to leading system integrators and digital agencies is an advantage You work well with optimization focused solutions partners. You have established successful, enterprise partnerships that were measured based on the revenue driven to both organizations You have a carried a quota as both an individual contributor and a manager, with a demonstrated track record of success You put the needs of customers, partners, the business, and your team above your own personal goals You are entrepreneurial, able to own and develop a strategy, and not afraid to take risks You can communicate clearly and collaborate effectively across global regions and departments Experience conducting business internationally in Europe, Australia and Asia Additional InformationAt Optimizely, we embody inclusion and embrace diversity. Optimizely is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. Optimizely prohibits discrimination based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual identity, gender identity, marital status, veteran status, nationality, citizenship, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or any other unlawful consideration. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

ad.title: Temporary Special Education Teacher (6-8 SPED LBS) - Chicago Public Schools - Chicago, IL
ad.content:
TemporaryTemporary Special Education Teacher (6-8 SPED LBS)(Job Number: P065750) Description
ABOUT CPS: We are an urban district on the rise. The support and resources we provide to our staff enables them to make the greatest difference where it’s needed most. Be a part of the change. Our mission is to provide a high quality public education for every child, in every neighborhood, that prepares each for success in college, career and civic life. Position Title: Diverse Learners Teacher Under the supervision of the school principal, teachers are responsible for the instruction, progress, tracking, and discipline of all students in assigned classes, and performs other duties as assigned and required. Specialty Functions: A valid teaching license issued by the Illinois State Board of Education, endorsed in LBS1 Set goals for the individualized education plan that are achievable and comparable to a student's peers in accordance with the State of Illinois IEP guidelines Work collaboratively with case managers, counselors, and general education teachers to determine instructional and social needs of students that ensure success while also participating on the multidisciplinary team to promote students' wellbeing Essential Functions: Within the context of the CPS Framework for Teaching, all teachers should utilize a continuous improvement process that refines his or her teaching practice. Each teacher should... Demonstrate a deep understanding of content, pedagogy, and student knowledge, in order to select learning objectives and design coherent instruction and assessments Create an environment for effective student learning and growth by establishing a respectful classroom culture with strong management of student behaviors and classroom procedures that promotes and appreciates the cultural, racial, and linguistic diversity of students Respond to the needs of all students by designing engaging classroom instruction with appropriately challenging questions, communication and discussion techniques, and instructionally aligned assessments Exhibit excellent oral and written communication skills, strong interpersonal skills, and exercise sound, professional judgment especially in interactions with administration, colleagues, families, and students Prioritize student safety through consistent implementation of the Student Code of Conduct and school wide systems of management and discipline Personalize student learning through mastery and innovative use of curriculum supplements and technology resources, as available Advocate for the district’s vision and commit to our district’s common themes of equity, cultural competence, high expectations, developmental appropriateness, attention to individual students (including those with special needs), appropriate use of technology, and student assumption of responsibility Minimum Qualifications & Requirements: A bachelor's degree or higher from a regionally accredited institution of higher education Completion of the CPS online application and teaching profile at cps.edu/teach A valid teaching license issued by the Illinois State Board of Education, with the appropriate endorsement(s) for the role - information on obtaining a valid teacher license can be found at isbe.net/licensure Physical Requirements: Light Work: Exerting up to twenty (20) pounds of force occasionally, or up to ten (10) pounds of force frequently, or a negligible amount of force constantly to move objects. Employment Expectations: As a condition of employment with the Chicago Public Schools (CPS), an employee must be an actual resident of the City of Chicago or be willing to become a resident within six months of the date of his/her employment with Chicago Public Schools. For certain high-needs positions, exemptions to this policy may be available. All new hires must satisfactorily complete all CPS on boarding requirements which include, but are not limited to, passing a tuberculosis test, drug test and state and federal criminal background checks. CPS is a drug and alcohol free workplace. It is the policy of the Board to prohibit unlawful discrimination, harassment and retaliation on the basis of any classifications protected by the Constitution of the United States, the Constitution of the State of Illinois and applicable federal, state or local laws or ordinances, including but not limited to discrimination on the basis of race, color, sex (including pregnancy discrimination), gender identity/expression, age, religion, disability, national origin or sexual orientation. Concerns or Inquiries should be made to the Equal Opportunity Compliance Office Administrator at (773) 553-1013. Inquiries concerning the application of Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 and related regulations concerning sex discrimination also should be referred to the CPS Equal Opportunity Compliance Office (773) 553-1195.

ad.title: Summer Associate - Product Development, Personalized Healthcare - Genentech - South San Francisco, CA
ad.content: TemporaryStart date: Summer 2019 Length: 10-12 weeks We are committed to delivering the promise of truly personalised healthcare (PHC). Across Roche, we are creating meaningful value for patients and healthcare systems by leveraging meaningful data at scale (MDAS) and applying advanced analytics. Together we’re generating unprecedented insights about patients, disease heterogeneity, and clinical outcomes. Our mission is utilizing these insights to discover, develop and deliver highly personalised treatment plans that have the potential to significantly improve patient outcomes. Project Overview We are interested in assessing the total economic value of our PHC portfolio in the near term and in the long term, acknowledging the added uncertainty. This would be for the purpose of (1) justifying investment, (2) getting the Roche community excited about PHC, and (3) accelerating adoption by teams. For the near-term assessment, we are interested in forecasting the value of key case studies and developing average estimates for the smaller work. For the long-term assessment, we are interested in forecasting the value of investments such as Digital Health and recent partnerships. Qualifications Seeking majors in business, economics and finance or other quantitative disciplines with interests in valuation modeling (discounted cash flow / net present value / revenue forecasting). Master's degree student preferred

ad.title: Marketing Supervisor - The Westin Maui Resort & Spa - Vistana Signature Experiences - Lahaina, HI
ad.content:
The primary responsibilities of the Marketing Supervisor are to successfully lead, mentor and supervise the Vacation Services Coordinators on the Westin Maui marketing team. This position is responsible for maintaining excellent customer service scores, sustaining high tour penetration rates, generating qualified leads and tours, and developing talent for the Westin Maui Sales Gallery. Responsibilities: Achieve the monthly budgeted “Net Penetration” percentage and net sales volume for all WM In-House marketing channels. Perform the functions of a Vacation Service Coordinator when deemed necessary by Marketing Management. Lead our Peer Mentor Program, and have a passion for training and development. Represent Vistana Signature Experiences in a professional, ethical, and passionate manner that drives performance and builds culture. Provide both timely and accurate performance analysis of all current program responsibilities. Ensure all initiatives follow brand standards (standard operating procedures, Westin brand standards, collateral, uniforms, etc.). Build a productive working relationship with Hotel Operations, Sales, Finance and WVP leadership. Requirements: Excellent verbal, written, and computer skills required Must have prior experience and successful production in either the marketing or sales fields Must have extensive knowledge of our branded concierge model Must embody professionalism, and consistently demonstrate high quality guest service Must be willing to work flexible hours including evenings, weekends and holidays Diversity Commitment
We celebrate the diversity of people, ideas and cultures. We believe our differences are what make us better – a better place to work, a better place to grow, enabling a better way to see the world. We are fully committed to providing equal employment opportunities in all employment practices, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, age, veteran's status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. The Company complies with the law regarding reasonable accommodation for disabled employees and applicants.

ad.title: DevOps Engineer - Franchise World Hqts, LLC - Milford, CT
ad.content: Hungry for a fresh, new career? Look no further because one of the world’s most iconic brands can help you get there. The DevOps Engineer I assists with implementation and improves the development, deployment and testing tools that increase the effectiveness of our engineering teams within our development and quality domains. This position will be responsible for delivering high-quality solutions that meet business objectives in a flexible, collaborative and rapidly changing delivery environment. It requires highly motivated and focused people curious to build new and innovative solutions for our clients. Essential Functions: Influence, develop and execute processes and testing best practices (20%) Implement C/I and deployment strategies with a DevOps philosophy (30%) Monitor systems and take corrective actions accordingly (10%) Automate risk decisions allowing self-service tools to support CI/CD (20%) Make recommendations for improvements to existing architecture (20%) Must have: experience working with VMware, Azure, AWS. Server OS Installing & Configuration. Experience working with C#, .Net, Python, scripting languages (such as BASH & PowerShell) and complementary programming languages, operating systems and supporting software Configuration management experience with Puppet, Chef, Ansible or similar Experience with performance & hardening techniques and Security/Authorization patterns and practices Experiencing working Microsoft SQL Server Configurations and TSQL, SSIS Programming Experiencing networking skills, a good understanding of TCP and Firewalls. Proven problem solving, and analytical skills complemented with sound interpersonal and team skills Proven ability to effectively perform in Agile / Scrum and at advanced levels in Vendor facing Teams Curiosity to learn and grow intellectual and technical knowledge Consistent record of dependable performance at advanced levels with minimal supervision Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Related Fields, Science or Engineering - Or - Equivalent Advanced Level Work Experience of 3 to 5 Years in a DevOps role Demonstrates knowledge of a broad range of hardware and software products. Experience designing, developing, testing, and deploying applications/ systems using proven or emerging technologies, in a variety of technologies and environments. Experience with automation tools. OUR WORK PERKS: While we offer a competitive salary for the position, we also have additional perks you might enjoy, such as: Free breakfast & lunch – Subway of course! A gorgeous campus surrounded by walking trails and a relaxing lake – perfect for a mid-day break After work yoga – good for the body and mind Tuition reimbursement – for those who wish to further their education The Company is only considering applicants who are currently authorized to work in the U.S. AA/EOE/M/F/D/V Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information.

ad.title: Solutions Analyst – Media - Numerator - Chicago, IL
ad.content:
Primary Responsibilities
Support Media (Agencies, Publishers, and Networks) vertical in the function of Pre-Sales and Solutions. Own all media measurement and audience targeting feasibility requests by creating a streamlined process to ensure a fast and comprehensive response to accelerate sales cycles. Participate in prospecting calls to match client objectives with Numerator solutions and help assess feasibility of ad hoc project requests. Support the solutions and sales team in developing and reviewing proposals (and providing feedback) for clients related to custom project analyses. Collaborate with Client Services and Marketing team to document ROI case studies and create playbooks for external use. Develop short “teaser” sales material by connecting industry news with Numerator’s omni-panel insights. Develop a deep understanding of Numerator solutions and services including their key differentiators versus legacy approaches and competing offerings. Understand everything there is to know about Numerator’s data collection and attribution process to be an external and internal technical expert and contributor. Actively play a lead role with Solutions Consultant or Manager in support of Sales Directors during pre-sales period. Identify process and solutions improvement opportunities to allow the business to scale more efficiently. Travel, as required, to support the above responsibilities.
Key Skills
Knowledge of the Media landscape, including Agencies, Publishers, and Brands. Familiarity of syndicated household panel data as well as media data (Nielsen, IRI, MRI-Simmons and/or NPD). Understanding of key market research use cases – survey or purchase analytics. Generally curious; an aptitude to learn more and identify creative solutions. Positive, solutions-focused demeanor and approach. Skilled at developing relationships with internal stakeholders to become a trusted and value-added business partner. Strong oral, written, and presentation skills, particularly with customers or prospects present. Microsoft Office expertise (PowerPoint, Excel, Word). Experience Required
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree with 1-3 years relevant experience. Desired Agency/Publisher experience in developing media strategy, tactics, and new business development. Desired experience in media targeting, measurement, and evaluation Working knowledge of enterprise software applications and services designed for the media, retail and consumer goods industries is highly valued (e.g., Nielsen, IRI, MRI-Simmons, etc.). Proficient in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint.

ad.title: Sr. Digital Marketing Analyst - Connexity - Los Angeles, CA
ad.content: Are you an ambitious go-getter who is passionate about data analytics? Does problem-solving in a dynamic, fast-paced environment get you fired up? Are you a natural at interpreting data and translating them into actionable insights? Do data inaccuracies keep you up at night? If you answered, “Yes,” to all of the above, then we want to hear from you. As a Senior Digital Marketing Analyst, you will dive deep into big data to extract, manipulate, and report on findings that drive growth for Connexity, Inc. and our partners. You will monitor and optimize lead-generation performance across multiple Traffic Acquisition channels, identify opportunities and limitations for growth, and present and execute on recommendations for improving the overall health of our expansive marketing network. ResponsibilitiesAnalytics Allocation of time: 40% Produce and report on business unit metrics relevant to traffic, monetization, and conversion quality Formulate hypotheses that can be tested, measured, and reported on to a larger audience Support business initiatives by identifying key trends in big data that can drive growth for the business Validate data integrity in all analyses performed Operations & Execution Allocation of time: 40% Manage day-to-day operations of meaningful marketing campaigns, focusing on Shopping Ads (PLAs) Monitor daily and intraday vital signs of business units owned and ensure performance tracks to expectations Manage the quality of inbound and outbound traffic and optimize toward business targets daily Partner with multi-disciplinary teams to identify and resolve business short-falls and build upon wins Act as internal and external source expert of business unit owned Strategy & Innovation Allocation of time: 10% Produce and present executive reports that provide recommendations to drive high-level decision-making Lead projects and pitch ideas for products/processes that enhance operational effectiveness Develop project and product roadmaps that support the growth of business units owned Remain current on professional and industry developments directly impacting area of responsibility Leadership & Team Development Allocation of time: 10% Play a key a role in mentoring and guiding the professional development of junior-level analysts Participate in hiring process when possible (define role, evaluate resumes, screen, hire) Develop training protocol and onboard new hires to be operationally effective within three months Supervise mentees’ daily activities against goals and provide them with frequent feedback for growth Demonstrate ability to maximize mentee performance and contribution to the team Manage and maintain strong relationships with media vendors Qualifications5+ years of experience in a data analytical role; 3+ years of experience managing digital marketing campaigns Paid Search experience is a must; Shopping Ads (PLAs) experience preferred Ability to transform complex facts, figures, and numbers into plain English that can be easily understood Keen attention to detail, financial responsibility, and strong organizational skills Adept at compiling accurate reports and presenting analytical findings in a clear, concise manner Excellent communication skills Strong working knowledge of Excel and capacity to work with technical systems and teams Adaptable and resourceful self-starter with the inquisitiveness and hunger for optimization and problem-solving BS / BA Degree in business, economics, mathematics, computer science, or statistics preferred Knowledge of SQL, Perl, Python a plus We seek self-starters, team players, and visionaries to join our group. Headquartered in Santa Monica, the company operates sites and business services in the US, UK, EU, and AU. We offer top benefits including flexible time off, casual work environment, free lunch (EVERYDAY), competitive comp, and much, much, more! To top it off, you get to work with this awesome team: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NAmra2pxH8MCould you be our next X'er?

ad.title: Sr. Power BI Developer - Trianz - Chicago, IL
ad.content: ContractJob Description Job Title: Sr. Power BI Developer Location: Chicago, IL Terms: Contract through 2019 About Trianz Trianz is a global professional services firm committed to enabling leaders to develop and execute operational strategies, leverage new business and technology paradigms, and achieve results expected by senior management in their organizations- predictably. What We Stand For Our clients are transforming their businesses, competitive strategies, product and service portfolios, customer-partner-employee interactions and their ecosystem. The cost of misses is not financial alone but a lost window of opportunity. So getting things right the first time is absolutely critical. As a result, Trianz is focusing on three important themes in our engagement model with clients. Crystallize business impact from a top management point of view Help Clients achieve results from strategy-by making execution predictable through innovative execution techniques Create a positive, enriching partnership experience in everything we do Industries, Clients & Practices Trianz works with clients across High Technology, Banking, Insurance, Manufacturing, Retail, Telecom, e-businesses and Public Services. Most clients are Fortune 1000 organizations and our relationships are sponsored by senior leaders in Enterprise Analytics Sales, Finance, Marketing, Human Resources, Operations and Information Technology. We partner with our clients to address the following key service areas: Cloud Analytics Digitization Infrastructure Security Job Description Power BI Developer Directly works with internal business partners in understanding their data needs and transform requirements into reporting/data visualization. Works independently to develop new reports and maintain/enhance existing reports. Works with the senior leaders to identify gaps and opportunities by running analytics on the market information and make recommendations. Key Responsibilities Performs adhoc report analysis, design and implement the solutions Works with business, client and technical teams to gather and define requirements, author concise functional/technical documentation. Designs, develops and publishes data visualizations using Power BI integrating existing on- premise systems and data sources such as Data Warehouse data marts and cubes. Acts as point of contact for junior analysts to solve queries and handle escalations. Works with complex queries; using specialized business technologies and applications. .• Performs unit testing to validate accuracy and validity of reports and data integrity. Provides user (business and client) training in BI reporting tools and reports as needed. Troubleshoots and resolves data integrity and performance issues. Share any new reporting, analytics and technology concepts in order to maximize user engagement and proficiency. Supervise small team of onshore/offshore development and quality assurance resources to ensure timely delivery of all reporting solutions. Provide status and project updates Conduct ongoing BI market tool research and evaluation, with a strong focus on the evolution of the Microsoft BI stack suite of tools for both cloud and on-premises analytics. Requirements 3 years of experience with Power BI 3 years' experience within the Microsoft stack. Strong understanding of Data Warehousing and Business Intelligence Experience guiding developers in delivering BI/Visualization dashboards and reporting. Requires strong analytical, conceptual and problem-solving abilities We are Growing Rapidly: 2019 Highlights Trianz is growing above the average of the professional services industry. Here are some highlights. Voted significantly above other services firms by 90% + of clients for business impact, execution predictability and organizational commitment in the recent Trianz wide client satisfaction survey. Won the “Customer Obsession Award” from Amazon Web Services for our innovation and execution record in Cloud Infrastructure and Business Applications strategy and services. Won UNICOM awards for the #1 Digitization and #1 Analytics project over a wide array of competition. Featured by IDC in their Spotlight series under the theme of “Operationalizing Strategies through Execution Excellence: A New Paradigms in Technology Delivery”. Achieved 50%+ revenue and employee growth compared to prior year’s exit showing an increasing acceptance of our models and success from our differentiated methodologies in strategic execution. Talk to us, Join us & Develop into Leaders Come join a dynamic global company. We are an open, non-bureaucratic and no-nonsense culture. We believe in a culture of innovation, encouraging our people to create. We believe training and development of all our associates is the most important thing we can provide to our talent. We are investing heavily- in classroom, online and on the job training. Seeing our talent develop into leaders- is what’s fundamental for everyone at Trianz. We are hiring at all levels of Trianz. And we are hiring globally. So- if you have a passion for execution and would like to develop into a leader capable of taking on anything, or are already a leader, talk to us! Equal Opportunity Employer Trianz does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, national or ethnic origin, gender, religion, disability, age, political affiliation or belief, disabled veteran, veteran of the Vietnam Era, or citizenship status (except in those special circumstances permitted or mandated by law).

ad.title: Business Systems Analyst – Sales/CRM Systems (Salesforce) - RingCentral - Belmont, CA
ad.content:
Business Systems Analyst – Sales/CRM Systems (Salesforce) Job Type: Full-TimeLocation: Belmont, CADepartment: Business Services RingCentral, Inc., a leading provider of Unified Communications as a Service (UCaaS), fosters a dynamic, success-driven, and team-oriented environment committed to delivering simple and delightful products for our customers. We are looking for a candidate with an entrepreneurial spark and a passion for redefining how people communicate.RingCentral is one of the fastest growing SaaS companies in the world, and is hands down the largest and fastest growing company in pure cloud business communication and collaboration space. We are committed to innovation, and we continuously out-innovate the competition. Our award winning products are recognized leaders by Gartner and other prominent analysts. Communication is at the heart of every business, and our products enable people to do the work they want on the channel of their choice whether it’s voice, video, text or chat while eliminating the complexity and unnecessary expense of managing business communications. We are relentlessly focused on user experience.RingCentral fosters career development and provides leadership training, education, workshops, and coaching for all employees. We promote a healthy work-life balance by providing catered lunch and breakfast on a daily basis as well as a kitchen stocked with a variety of complimentary beverages and delicious snacks. Job Description: We are looking for an experienced Business Systems Analyst – Sales/CRM (Salesforce) Systems who will engage with business stakeholders in Sales to understand their systems and user needs, drill into the details to analyze complex processes and translate them into business and functional requirements. You will be responsible for documenting requirements, defining scope and objectives, systems configuration, testing, implementation, continuous improvement and ongoing support. To ensure we provides optimal service, you will be skilled at business processes and methodologies along with a strong analytical and data modeling background. This is a full-time position at RingCentral’s new Belmont Campus.Responsibilities:Business Requirements & Analysis:Interview cross functional Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to elicit business requirements Acts as the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams Analyze existing and future state business processes, systems and flows of data Develop and maintain documentation related to developing and modifying business processes and systems Partner with business, internal and external technology teams to define associated system requirements and solutions Participate in systems implementation projects (requirements documentation, systems configuration, test documentation/execution, issue identification and resolution) Critically evaluates information gathered from multiple sources, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding Distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs to align with macro vision and strategyBusiness Solutions Design & Delivery:Proactive and takes initiative to gather information, investigate gaps / issues, identifies potential solutions and presents to both Business and IT stakeholders Work closely with Vendors, Implementation Partners, Architects, Developers and Business Units to ensure technical compatibility and user satisfaction Facilitate review sessions with functional owners, subject matter experts and end-user representatives Oversee the project lifecycle for projects within Sales Systems Work with various teams to develop project milestones and timelines for development, UAT, production validation and go live Ensure training and timely communications in accordance with project timelines Engage other areas of HRIS such as security, reporting, production and participate in change management support to ensure projects are addressed from end to end and the needs, interests and success criteria of the business are met Show Leadership:Interface and partner with Business Management TeamsAbility to think critically, solve problems, make decisions and build trust across the organizationExcellent negotiation, influencing, collaboration, communication, and presentation skills,Build and manage global teams. About RingCentralRingCentral, Inc. (NYSE: RNG) is a global provider of cloud unified communications and collaboration solutions. More flexible and cost-effective than legacy on-premise systems, RingCentral empowers today’s mobile and distributed workforces to be connected anywhere and on any device through voice, video, team messaging, collaboration, SMS, conferencing, online meetings, contact center, and fax. RingCentral provides an open platform that integrates with today’s leading business apps while giving customers the flexibility to customize their own workflows. RingCentral is a leader in the 2016 Gartner Magic Quadrant for Unified Communications as a Service Worldwide for the second consecutive year. RingCentral is headquartered in Belmont, Calif.RingCentral is an EEO/AA employer.

Makes recommendations for strategic decision making and implementation of global initiatives. departments, and vendors to identify areas of frustration, then collaborate with team members to develop new or improved solutions to command center processes and systems on a global scale Manage and/or support global and regional-specific projects and implementations Drive quarterly initiatives; work through challenges, report progress and manage project risk Foster an environment of stakeholder needs; improve systems and processes to enhance the overall experience Ensure ad-hoc quote requests from customers and other internal/external stakeholders are actioned quickly and appropriately Develop and utilize Exception Management tools to drive adherence to SLAs and customer satisfaction; identify problems and trends before they can be of greater risk to the organization or its partnerships Ensure all processes and procedures are documented in updated SWIs/SOPs; ensure process maps and visual charts are included for activities and functions Identify global inconsistencies and develop methods to standardize them across regions to ensure proper operational backup and escalation are always availableDevelop tasks list to ensure all responsibilities are identified, assigned, and monitored Proactively manage the team’s training, professional development, performance management and evaluation Support and/or lead talent acquisition and onboarding activities Assist with other transportation and logistics requirements as needed Meet minimum annual company training requirements QualificationsUndergraduate degree in Business, Logistics, Supply Chain, or other related field Works collaboratively within a team, has excellent proficiency using multiple communications platforms (i.e. email, chat, video conference, etc.) Effective interpersonal likely to arise Critical thinking using logic, data & qualitative reasoning Ability to develop, evaluate, and recommend best options Analytical with a strong attention to detail Proactive self-starter ad.title: Financial Analyst - Thurston County - Olympia, WA
ad.content: $5,296 - $7,044 a monthThe Thurston County Financial Services office is looking for a professional and reliable Financial Analyst to join our team. In this position, you will provide complex technical support to the organization in the area of governmental accounting, grants and contracts with sub-recipient providers and vendors.You have the lead responsibility for preparation of revenue and expenditure transactions and modifications to County-wide budget. Instrumental in preparation of the annual financial statements and Comprehensive Annual Financial Report. In addition, you will serve central County grant manager responsible for research, preparation, monitoring, and compliance in federal, state and local grants; assist County offices and departments in the identification and reporting of federal and state grant dollars; and track revenue and expenditure budget adjustments for County departments and local taxing districts; prepares budget adjustment requests to County Administrator and Commissioners.Your typical day may also include, but would not be limited to, the following: Oversees various accounting functions and related financial reports, and serves as a key team member in the development of financial information systems. Reviews, analyzes, develops and recommends new or improved efficiencies, policies, procedures and accounting standards and coordinates their implementation. Reviews the work of accounting staff and when assigned, may review the work of accounting staff within other County departments. Oversees accounting activities to assure that they are in compliance with generally accepted accounting principles as well as federal, state and County financial accounting procedures. Analyzes and recommends changes to departmental accounting procedures and approves adjustments to department accounting and financial records. Provides training as needed. Creates monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reporting in assigned functional area. Creates financial publications, documents, and other reporting projects as needed. Serves as central contact for public requests involving financial information. Leads, trains, and motivates the work of subordinates and, when delegated, supervises the work of assigned employees. Plans and organizes workloads and staff assignments, reviews progress, and adjusts priorities as needed to assure work is performed efficiently. Establishes work rules, performance standards and measurements. Conducts and/or provides input on performance evaluations. Analyzes and resolves the most complex problems that arise, and provides on-going technical expertise. Interprets federal and state guidelines and ensures the County 's compliance with federal, state, County and other applicable accounting rules and regulations. May serve as a liaison with other governmental agencies.For a COMPLETE listing of the essential job functions of this position, click HERE. QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or closely related field. Relevant experience may substitute for up to two years of education. Minimum three years of increasingly responsible governmental accounting experience including budgeting, financial analysis, forecasting, grants and contracts, general ledger, and fixed assets and one year of supervisory experience. Ability to utilize a personal computer and related software packages to perform word processing, analysis, information retrieval and tracking. Knowledge of federal and state grant regulations as well as cost accounting standards is required. Must have knowledge of the State of Washington's Budgeting Accounting Reporting System (BARS) regulations governing local governments. Current Washington State Driver's License of have requested and obtained an appropriate accommodation.
