ad.title: Senior Enterprise Analyst - Framework Homeownership, LLC - Boston, MA
ad.content:
About The Team The Information Systems (IS) team’s mission is to apply information and technology in collaboration with other business units and external stakeholders to improve operating efficiencies and promote innovation across the company. The team plays a key role in leading collaboration with others while creating digital strategies, embracing organizational changes, adopting agile practices, and experimenting with emerging technologies. They do all this while being compliant and secure by enforcing internal policies which are aligned to organizational strategy and vision. About The Role The Senior Enterprise Analyst will be a member of the Information Systems team and will be responsible to execute and support IS projects in collaboration with the Business Insights, Information Systems, Marketing, Customer Success, Engineering, and Product teams with direction from the Director of Information Systems. We are looking for a creative problem solver who is passionate about leveraging technology in support of greater operational efficiency for the entire organization. The ideal candidate is analytical, empathetic, customer centric, and thrives in a fast-paced startup environment. This position reports to Director of Information Systems and is located in Boston, MA. What You'll Do Work closely with Business Insights team in providing services related to Data Modeling/Analytics, Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing and Reporting Develop workflow diagrams and functional requirements to communicate with stakeholders Implement and proactively manage the ETL design and development based on MS SQL Server, SSIS, Azure Data Service (Data Factory, Data Lake Storage, Data Warehouse etc.) Communicate effectively to various stakeholders with status updates Identify and cleanse data from external data sources (SalesForce, Marketing Cloud, Google Analytics, Google Adwords, Zendesk, Paypal, Quickbooks etc.) Pursue training and professional development opportunities, strive to continuously build knowledge and skills, stay on top of new trends in Data Modeling, Analytics, ETL and related technologies and share expertise to the team Work closely with marketing team to support/enhance MarTech stack including but not limited to all the integration Prepare and update documentation related to work done What You'll Bring Experience developing data warehousing solutions using SSIS, SQL Server, Azure Data Service Strong ETL experience coupled with Strong SQL knowledge Experience with creating and using SQL procedures, functions and queries • Experience with data cleansing, data analysis and profiling Experience creating KPI dashboards and reports using PowerBI from data warehouse Experience with MarTech stack such as Google Analytics, AdWords, Marketing Cloud etc. is a plus Strong communication skills Strong passion for data, analytics, modeling, and relevant technologies Enthusiasm for continuous learning in the always changing information systems landscape Experience working independently and within a team with diverse internal stakeholder groups Ability to work in a fast-paced agile software development environment, handling multiple projects, requests and tasks effectively Preferred Qualifications/Experience BS or equivalent in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science or equivalent technical degree 5+ years’ experience in relational and data warehouse database design, optimization and performance; preferably with SSIS, SQL Server Experience developing ETL specifications and mappings to support data integration from external datasources Experience with Azure SQL products and services will be a plus Strong knowledge of referential integrity, triggers, stored procedures and functions Experience with reporting and data visualization application (PowerBI) Understanding of project management and software development lifecycle Experience in maintaining high level of customer satisfaction Possess excellent problem-solving, analytical and time management skills Self-starter, highly motivated, able to shift directions quickly when priorities change Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with ability to present complex ideas in a clear, concise manner Work Environment This job is in a professional office environment. Routine use of standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets is required. Occasional travel is required, including overnight travel for up to four days at a time.
Physical Demands This position requires the employee to work in an office environment. It requires the ability to speak and hear in person, over the phone, and in settings where there are groups of people. It requires the ability to travel to a variety of meeting locations including via airplane.
About the Company
Framework is a startup social enterprise built on a simple idea: every homebuyer should have access to unbiased information about the mortgage process and feel knowledgeable about the responsibilities of owning a home throughout their homeownership journey. We are proudly pro-homeownership and believe it’s a uniquely accessible and powerful way for people to plant and grow seeds of generational wealth. We make it easier for people to do this by providing the tools we believe will lead people into homes that improve their quality of life, giving them the space to grow into their future, and gain value over time. We’re dedicated to helping our customers make decisions with confidence, build wealth in their homes, and protect their investment for generations to come. As we leverage the power of technology to strengthen communities one homeowner at a time, the individual contributions of our tight-knit team play a vital, daily role in shaping our products and services. Creative thinking, collaboration, and problem solving are at the core of the Framework culture, and we’re seeking team members with drive and creativity to add to the mix. The position description is a guide to the critical duties and essential functions of the job, not an all-inclusive list of responsibilities, qualifications, physical demands and work environment conditions. Position descriptions are reviewed and revised to meet Framework’s changing needs, at the sole discretion of management.

ad.title: IT Applications Analyst - Rayonier Advanced Materials - Jacksonville, FL
ad.content: Rayonier Advanced Materials is the leading global manufacturer of forest products, including lumber, paper, packaging and a global leader of high purity cellulose, a natural polymer commonly found in cell phones, computer screens, filters and pharmaceuticals. With manufacturing operations in the U.S., Canada and France, Rayonier Advanced Materials employs approximately 4,200 people and generates approximately US$2 billion of revenues. Rayonier Advanced Materials’ intellectual property and manufacturing processes have been developed over 86 years, resulting in unique properties and very high quality and consistency. Rayonier Advanced Materials is consistently ranked among the nation’s top 50 exporters and delivers products to 79 ports around the world, serving customers in 20 countries across five continents. The Applications Analyst is responsible for modeling complex problems, discovering institutional insights and identifying opportunities using statistical, algorithmic, mining and visualization techniques. In addition to analytic skills, this role is also proficient at integrating and preparing large, varied datasets, architecting specialized database and computing environments, and communicating results. This position also works closely with clients, data stewards, project/program managers, and other IT teams to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound organizational decisions. The Applications Analyst role also needs to be able to present their findings back to the business by exposing their assumptions and validating their work in a way that can be easily understood by their business counterparts. The Application Analyst position would be focused on the administrating operator facing applications (e.g. Ekhosoft and Proficy) as well as data historians (e.g. PI and ParcSuite). Previous experience is preferred but not required. Duties and Responsibilities Designs experiments, test hypotheses, and build models. Conducts data analysis and moderately complex design algorithms. hypotheses, and build models Provide customer support to complex system issues in all business systems while resolving issues without guidance. Works with stakeholders to identify the business requirements and the expected outcome. Works with and alongside business analysts by suggesting other products of interest to the client. Models and frames business scenarios that are meaningful and which impact on critical business processes and/or decisions. Collaborates with subject matter experts to select the relevant sources of information. Works with team leaders and members to solve client analytics problems and documents results and methodologies. Works in iterative processes within IT and validates findings. Performs experimental design approaches to validate finding or test hypotheses. Validates analysis by comparing appropriate samples. Employs the appropriate algorithm to discover patterns. Maintain business and process information systems including configuration, code, jobs, reports, test plans, and documentation and assist other IT personnel in support of technical issues Performs system testing as part of the release management process. Mentors less experienced members of the support team in developing thorough test plans. Ensures that systems and documentation are maintainable and meet life cycle process standards established by management. Monitor the progress of assigned tasks to ensure timelines are met in a ticketing system. Participate in on-call rotation for afterhours P1 resolution. Work with the IT Director and other team members to: Develop a roadmap for operator facing applications (e.g. Ekhosoft and Proficy) as well as data historians (e.g. PI and ParcSuite) across the enterprise. Manage the configuration of operator facing applications (e.g. Ekhosoft and Proficy) as well as data historians (e.g. PI and ParcSuite) across the enterprise. Test, communicate and deploy new versions as they come out Assist in the development of PowerApps Additional duties as assigned.Minimum Requirements Undergraduate college degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent experience 2-4 years related experience in Information Systems Development or Support Some experience should be in customer support, problem solving, or maintenance environment Experience in either C#, vb.net or JAVA is required, with C# and SQL preferred Experience in data warehouse development and SAP ABAP is a plus Excellent problem solving skills required Familiarity with Excel, Access, Word and other Microsoft applications and experience with automated systems Strong knowledge of business and/or accounting principles Excellent knowledge of computer systems and IT life cycle development Knowledge of mill systems, forestry, and/or paper/pulp manufacturing environments is a plus EOE/Vet/Disability

ad.title: Buyer/Planner (senior/experienced) - Wurth Adams - Brooklyn Park, MN
ad.content:
We’re looking for a Buyer to join our growing team in our corporate headquarters in Brooklyn Park, MN! As a fast growing company we provide employees with endless opportunities to grow and develop in their careers!
POSITION SUMMARY
This position is responsible for planning and procuring materials, supplies, and services for the company while meeting established quality, cost, and delivery requirements. The buyer/planner position manages the operational flow of items including new product setup, material acquisition, inventory reconciliation, and margin management.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Inventory Management
Utilize system reports as well as experience and judgement to order materials to meet sales requirements Submit purchase orders for materials, establish priorities to meet customer orders, and resolve shipping or billing issues Proactively identify product availability issues and provide supply status and shipment tracking to internal partners Maintain accurate system planning parameters per established processes, including recommending process improvements to improve efficiencies Product Analysis and Process Improvement Opportunities
Optimize material costs through vendor analysis, and identify and implement cost savings initiatives surrounding product cost, transportation cost, and freight terms Analyze safety stocks, manage material inventory, support demand planning, and provide backup coverage for other purchasing functions Drive collaboration with suppliers and internal customers
Supplier Relationship Management
Provide leadership in the preparation for and/or participation in supplier negotiations Execute supplier performance initiatives to improve vendor accountability Resolve customer service or product quality issues and complaints by identifying root cause and ensuring appropriate actions are taken with suppliers as needed including charge backs from customers and expedited freight charges Work with accounts payable to investigate and resolve vendor billing discrepancies
QUALIFICATIONS, SKILLS & ABILITIES
Bachelor’s Degree in supply chain, operations, logistics, materials management, or related field preferred Minimum of 3 years directly related experience in purchasing, production planning/scheduling, or inventory management, preferably in the fastener industry APICS certification (CSCP or CPIM), CPP or CPM certification preferred Proficiency in MRP/ERP systems and MS-Office applications, including Excel. SAP experience a plus but not required. Must possess the ability to organize and prioritize tasks, work collaboratively in a cross-functional environment, and ensure timely completion of responsibilities Demonstrated proficiency in written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills Ability to read and interpret blue prints Effective negotiation skills Required SkillsRequired Experience

ad.title: Coordinator, Sales & Operations Support - Graphic Packaging International - Atlanta, GA
ad.content:
At Graphic Packaging International (NYSE: GPK), we produce the box you may have poured your child’s cereal from this morning, the microwaveable tray that heated your lunch, the paper cup that held your coffee throughout the day, and the carrier of those bottles of craft beer you may enjoy tonight! We’re one of the largest manufacturers of paperboard and paper-based packaging for some of the world’s most recognized brands of food, beverage, foodservice, household, personal care and pet care products. Headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, we are a team of collaborative, innovative, passionate individuals who are committed to providing consumer packaging that makes a world of difference.
With almost 18,000 employees working in more than 70 locations in North and South America, Europe and the Pacific Rim, we strive to be an environmentally responsible leader in our industry and in the communities where we operate. We are committed to workplace diversity and offer compensation and benefits programs that are among the industry’s best to reward the talented people who make our company successful.
If this sounds like something you would like to be a part of, we’d love to hear from you. Learn more about us at www.graphicpkg.com.
Inspired Packaging. A World of Difference.
Job Title: Coordinator, Sales & Operations Support
Location: Atlanta, GA
Reports to: Supervisor, Sales & Operations Support
MISSION / SUMMARY: A Sales and Operations Support Coordinator’s primary responsibility is to complete tactical and strategic processes associated with servicing a specific set of customer accounts. This person will have responsibility for the day to day management for all aspects for an assigned account or accounts. They understand and align the process with Sales, Operations, Logistics, Design, Graphics, and the Sales and Operations Support group and as he/she executes their role in the overall order fulfillment process to exceed customer expectations and align with GPI business, financial and operational objectives.

ad.title: Part Time Parts Buyer - Synovos - Emeryville, CA
ad.content:
Part-timeThe Buyer is primarily responsible for routine MRO procurement transactions within the Synovos software system, and/or the client's CMMS system. The Buyer ensures materials are accurately ordered and entered into the site's procurement system. This position is responsible for placing routine orders to be processed and expedited in a timely and efficient manner, and employ problem solving methods to resolve issues with delivery, price or any other order issues. It is incumbent upon the Buyer to develop and maintain strong client relationships, keep an open line of communication, and maintain control of all aspects of purchasing.
Follow all site Safety and Security Procedures at all times, attend required safety trainings Place mainly stock buys per the Stock Replenishment/Re-Order Report, cutting PO, verify unit of measure, estimated delivery dates (EDDs) and verifying cost Maintain the vendor database and setup local vendors as needed. Follow preferred supplier program as instructed by corporate office adhering to prescribed goals Generate purchase orders (POs) using Synovos or client CMMS purchasing system. Verify quoted prices when generating a PO for any item including reorders. Updating POs, pricing updates and delivery dates as needed or when changed Expedite orders, manage status of purchasing needs via the creation of Non-Stock and Stock PO using the site''s "Open Order Report." Regularly check Open Order Report and communicate delays or issues to supervisor and client as required. Ensure timely delivery of items, keeping supervisor and client informed of delivery status Establish and build relationships with client's employees, within the maintenance, facilities, planning or other affiliated departments in order keep abreast of client needs Routinely monitor reports such as Run PO Cost Analysis Report to flag purchases outside guidelines and to maintain target pricing. Also monitor Shared Savings Report for any discrepancies on guarantee and to make corrections as needed Work with Manager/Buyer to obtain quotes on items not pre-sourced Review invoices for price and/or quantity discrepancies and follow guidelines to resolve discrepancies, with a focus of assisting Site Manager or Supervisor in reducing discrepancies (IDRs) Work with Site Manager to streamline processes and implement quality improvements, documenting any changes into the Synovos system or site SOP Adhere to min/max levels as required at specific site Routinely perform duties of Attendant including: cycle counting, cleaning the storeroom, issuing materials, receiving and putting away stock, and other storeroom duties as directed or needed Required SkillsStrong organizational and time management skills Solid interpersonal skills including verbal and written communication Highly detail oriented and good problem-solving skills Proficiency in basic Excel Computer literacy - Windows Operating System, Microsoft Office and ability to learn and demonstrate proficiency in the use of the ERP systems (i.e. SAP, Maximo, etc.) #CBRequired Experience0-2 years of purchasing experience; high school diploma required; two year degree preferred Basic knowledge of MRO materials Experienced at working with customers in a corporate or professional environment

ad.title: Payroll Accountant - Seakeeper, Inc. - California, MD
ad.content:
Seakeeper, the global leader in marine stabilization, is committed to revolutionizing the boating world. Our patented technology completely eliminates boat roll, improving the experience of everyone on board—from the seasoned captain to their grandchildren, the toughest sport-fishermen to the first-timer. If you thrive on the challenge of pushing yourself to do and be better every day, you’ll fit right in with our rapidly growing team.
Role and Responsibilities:
The Payroll Accountant will report directly to the Human Resource Manager. The role our Payroll Accountant will assume is performing tasks to establish and maintain employee payroll and benefit records. Responsibilities for this role are the following:
Process bi-weekly and semimonthly payroll runs ensuring paychecks are correct and delivered on time Enter monthly payroll and benefits data in the accounting system Enter appropriate accruals for month end close; ensure all costs have been recorded in the correct period Update new hires and terminations in payroll system Reconcile the payroll and benefits general ledger accounts on a monthly basis Manage the general ledger of new pay codes and deduction codes set up in the payroll system Prepare payroll and efficiency metrics as well as health care cost analysis Prepare Form 5500 and Excise Tax Filing Assist with schedules for 401K audit and Tax Returns Other projects as needed Required SkillsQualifications and Education Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, or related field. 1-3 years of accounting experience; payroll accounting experience preferred. Advanced Excel Skills are essential. Strong command of Microsoft Office products, and experience with ERP systems; NetSuite preferred. Superior time management skills, multitasking skills, and the ability to prioritize tasks with minimal supervision are essential. Strong communication skills, interpersonal skills, be a team player and be detailed oriented. Must be professional, responsive, resourceful, flexible, well organized, and maintain a positive work attitude. Ability to work independently, maintain filing systems and basic databases, gather and analyze information skillfully, and the ability to make sound, timely, and accurate judgments. Required Experience

You must have excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, be detail oriented, able to work in a team environment and independently, and have the ability to solve complex problems. You will be Business-Value-Focused working closely with technical experts to deliver an optimized systems solution.ResponsibilitiesBusiness Analysis/design/configuration/coordination implementation and support o Lead specific system development and deployment activities for international operations. Functional requirements definitionDevelop an understanding of business strategy and user needs, document specifications, and translate business objectives into proper system requirement specifications  Conceptual and logical design Detailed technical design System configuration Conversions and Integrations Testing (Unit, Integration, UAT) Go-Live Support and Enhancementso Conceptualize new processes, systems and information needs that add value to our business. Coordinate process improvements including: Formulation and definition of technical scope and project objectives Analysis of current business practices, processes and systems Define detailed project tasks Team-based approach to project execution Proactively engage technical staff to schedule and execute required taskso Cultivate and maintain successful relationships between Information Technology and business resources from various global organizations: Actively participate in change management processes associated with system revisions Work with business partners to manage project/enhancement priorities Focus on continuous improvement for both the business process and the underlying technologies and system support Focus on identifying information needs and delivering on these needs through identified reporting solutions.o Provide hands-on technical support for ERP, operational reporting and relevant 3rd party solutions Research, analysis and resolution Performance-related issues Track and address bugs identified in testing and production Security and access managemento Maintain thorough system documentation to support turnover and trainingo Miscellaneous projects and tasks as assignedQualificationsExperienceThe ideal candidate will have 5+ years business experience with sales, supply chain, customer service, financial operations and 8+ years working in a IT Business Analyst capacity, including extensive hands-on experience with ERP systems.SkillsCommunication using English language is mandatory; communication using Chinese language is a plus.Deep functional understanding of the following operations and systems that support them: o Saleso Supply chaino Customer serviceo Financial operationsAbility to manage multiple tasks and manage small projectsin a cross-functional, multi-country environmentDemonstrated experience implementing and supporting complex ERP solutionsMust have strong interpersonal skills, be self-motivated, have a strong desire to learn, and be adaptable to a fast-paced, ever-changing environmentSuperior organizational, written, and oral communication skillsHigh degree of professionalism and an approach that promotes progress through teamwork in a collaborative environmentTeam leadership and influence skills to ensure alignment and focus on Company and Department objectivesMeeting and task facilitation skills – ability to take the lead and guideNegotiation and conflict resolution as challenges ariseDecisivenessOrganizational awarenessRapport buildingArchitect-level skills for system designResponsible for ensuring that IT controls are implemented and maintainedManage enterprise-wide network and systems projectsEducationMaster in related field

ad.title: Account Executive CRM (East) - Campus Management - Boca Raton, FL
ad.content:
The Account Executive is responsible for finding, developing and securing new clients within an assigned geographic region for Campus Management’s CRM solutions and services. The Account Executive establishes and develops new strategic business relationships with prospective clients with a focus on introducing Campus Management CRM/ Application solutions for purchase. The Account Executive also identifies opportunities to introduce consulting services, managed services solutions and ERP/ SIS RSM’s. The Account Executive also coordinates with the sales leadership, sales support, account managers and services professionals in their region on territory planning and account planning activities to ensure a coordinated strategy where relevant.
Essential Job Responsibilities
Owns the overall relationship and communication with all key client stakeholders and decision makers with NET NEW clients to Campus Management for CRM/ Application Management Acts as a liaison between primary prospect contacts and all Campus Management staff who support new sales initiatives Engages in strategic and, at times, tactical conversations at multiple levels of the institution’s organization with relevant stakeholders Represents the prospect’s voice and communicates their interests and needs to other departments within Campus Management Coordinates with the corresponding Account Manager and Professional Services team on transitioning new accounts to ensure proper continuity of new client experience post-sale Works closely with the Professional Services team to maintain a continuous knowledge of account status to identify potential issues and/or opportunities within or related to the opportunity Appropriately identifies, handles and runs point on any account escalations through the point of account transition Escalates opportunities to sales leadership that grow broader than CRM and could involve other Campus Management solutions Selling
Manages the sales and contract process for prospects of CRM/ Application Management for new clients Identifies and cultivates the introduction of products and/or professional services opportunities to new prospects Coordinates with Sales VP and the corresponding RSM to identify opportunities and sales leads for CRM and/or ERP/ SIS opportunities Coordinates with the Professional Services team on the scoping of services needed to properly implement products in the Campus Management portfolio Incorporates strategic and consultative selling techniques throughout the sales process for sales opportunities Delivers against quarterly and annual targets Focuses on selling Campus Management Platform products and services to new clients Manages and documents all sales-related activities for each client within the CRM system (Unify) Provides accurate forecasting to sales management for all new business opportunities
Account Planning In unison with the corresponding RSMs and Account Managers, creates territory plans that includes an analysis for the territory and a strategy for achieving annual revenue targets Thinks strategically about the prospect’s goals and objectives and advises prospect on best practices or new ways of thinking that support leveraging Campus Management solutions to make operational and strategic improvements Understands prospect challenges that may be hindering purchase and proposes solutions to overcome those challenges to ensure investment in Campus Management solutions Works with the corresponding Account Executives and Professional Services team to strategize, plan and execute prospect initiatives (client webinars, visit campaigns, communications) Utilizes information gathered throughout the sales process to develop a strategic account plan. Product Knowledge
Stays well informed about current industry trends and be able to talk intelligently about the education industry as well as the EdTech solutions industries Develops a specialized understanding of the business requirements and practices involving student recruitment, student success and retention strategies in higher education Has a working knowledge of the higher education CRM competitive landscape in order to improve sales outcomes and share information with internal teams to improve our competitive performance Has a high-level product knowledge of the Campus Management CRM solution set in order to provide recommendations and best practice suggestions to clients Keeps abreast of Campus Management company vision, product set, and services as well as the competitive landscape and is able to articulate Campus Management’ capabilities and service offerings effectively to client Stays in contact with the Products and Business Development team to provide feedback from the market to help shape product and partnership roadmaps Completes and successfully passes all product certifications to demonstrate a working knowledge of the Campus Management product portfolio Delivers in-person and online presentations and product demonstrations to prospects to showcase Campus Management portfolio capabilities to fit client’s needs
Bachelor’s degree required Minimum of 3-5 years selling experience, with a demonstrated record of target achievement Higher Education solutions selling experience preferred Experience in writing and executing territory plans to achieve annual quota Experience utilizing a sales methodology to identify and develop new client engagements Ability to be innovative, analytical and proactive in solving prospective client objectives and proposing product and services solutions through sales activities Ability to own sales activities and work collaboratively with multiple teams to best support the sales process Excellent listening and communication skills, both written and oral, including the ability to relate to prospective clients across all phases (pre-sale, implementation and post-sale). Strong presentation skills and ability to prepare and deliver formal presentations to large groups, online and in person A technical aptitude and strong understanding of the product portfolio and can demonstrate the product capabilities and how it can address the prospective client’s needs Strong conflict resolution, negotiating and influencing skills Ambition, drive, and ability to learn quickly and adapt to change Highly organized, detail oriented, responsive and persistent Willingness to travel to meet with clients in an assigned territory is required

ad.title: Director Development - CentralSquare Technologies - Greensboro, NC
ad.content:
If you have exceptional leadership skills in software development, and you thrive working on a dynamic development team with equally talented peers, we need to talk…
Join CentralSquare and work on a large, complex multithreaded ERP application with large and small customers all over the United States, leveraging your leadership and development skills, and working with a remarkably talented group of development professionals. If you would like to work on interesting projects in a fantastic company within a wonderful community, we may be a fit for you!
We are looking for a leader with experience building development new development teams. Someone who is a true technologist and also has the skills to lead a development group. Attributes we are looking for include:
Leadership: Experienced leader that can manage dynamic teams and products, solve problems and encourage and motivate employees to succeed in a fast-paced organization Technologist: Strong engineering and technology background with the ability to learn new technologies quickly and bring adoption to use within development teams Motivated: Must have deep technical credibility with engineering organizations and ability to recruit and retain top talent Passionate: Bring energy and enthusiasm to the job and organization Communicator: Proven collaborator and proven presenter Inquisitive: Propensity to dig into technology and figure things out The Development Director will have significant latitude in researching, designing & guiding development of solutions, helping to solve complex problems, and will be expected to provide expertise in architecture, design, development & testing best practices and methodologies. You will work in a collaborative agile team environment. Responsibilities:
Manage application suites and the activities of multiple teams that maintain and develop solutions Manage set of full stack technologies Mentor and motivate the existing and growing application development talent Collaborate with others who provide governance on Scrum/Agile, reporting metrics, and architecture Collaborate with product owners and others on product needs Champion new ideas and initiatives to improve development process and quality Deliver project, progress, quality, projection and other relevant information about development group to superiors and stakeholders
Education and Experience:
BS or MS in Computer Science preferred, equivalent experience considered Minimum of 5 years development leadership experience, Director experience preferred Minimum of 5 years development experience with .Net technologies Minimum of 5 years development experience with front end JavaScript technologies Experience with Visual Microsoft C++, COM, ATL Experience developing within a complex enterprise application Experience with Azure and/or AWS

ad.title: Sr Project Manager/ERP Data Integration - Affinity, Inc. - Milwaukee, WI
ad.content: Sr Project Manager/ ERP Data Integration Location: Milwaukee, WI (on-site) Who we are: Affinity is a privately held national Solutions Consulting firm based out of Milwaukee. We serve as strategic advisors and thought leaders to our Fortune 500 clients. Our clients and employees value our approach as a company “big enough to do complex, high impact work, but small enough to truly care”. We focus on hiring motivated, intelligent professionals who have a passion for their work and a desire to grow along with us. Visit our website to learn more about us and all the exciting things we are doing here at Affinity: www.affinityit.com. What you will do in this role: As an ERP Data Integration Project/Program Management consultant, you will coordinate closely with both customer and internal teams and be responsible for the execution and successful implementation of products and services. You will work with cross-functional teams who are responsible for delivering the approved projects on time, within budget, and with quality results. You should feel comfortable working with senior management, client contacts and implementation engineers. The ideal candidate will be organized, possess a strong technical aptitude with stellar communication skills and can succeed in a fast-paced ambiguous environment. Responsibilities: Manage ERP implementation/ migration projects by creating step-by-step project plans with timelines to meet deliverables Ensure development teams deliver projects on-time and effectively according to project plans Confirm project deliverables are provided to the customer and executive team Work effectively with other departments to ensure follow through including accurate completion of time entries, creating accurate proposals, and timely delivery of invoices to customers Effectively communicate all project plan needs and requirements to engineering teams and additional departments involved in the process Requirements: 7-10+ years of experience in ERP Project and/or Project Management at the enterprise level Large scale ERP migration, data integration experience; Invoices, Bills of Material or similar Financial Services modules Expertise in identifying data migration issues and bringing to the attention of appropriate functional teams Coordinate transactional and historical data conversion requirements across the business and technical teams Successful experiences reporting through both centralized PMO and leadership team. Define and manage updated ERP data archival strategy Deliver go-live plan, manage change and release management practices for ERP conversion; including cutover planning, dependency tracking, and risk management Prior experience with data movement, file transfer, and/or data cleansing strongly preferred Skilled with interacting and coordinating across multiple technical and business teams Ability to work on multiple projects concurrently Exceptional verbal, written and presentation skills to all levels of the organization including C-level What we offer: Competitive base salary w/full benefits; medical, dental, 401K, disability, life, Holidays, PTO A culture of collaboration, mentorship, and knowledge sharing Challenging work at the enterprise level Contemporary and emerging technologies The opportunity for high-impact work Respected partners Entrepreneurial spirit Opportunities for advancement Apply here or contact me directly! JANE KNAUS Fulfillment Leader Mobile: 310.292.6740 jknaus@affinityit.com

ad.title: Plant Manager - ACH Foam Technologies - Washington, IA
ad.content: Job Summary: Oversee all plant operations including materials, labor and OH in relation to manufacturing products that meet or exceed our customer’s expectations. Support and lead ACH operations personnel in achieving our goals and objectives related to quality, safety, plant efficiency and overall continual improvement of ACH operations. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Communicate goals and objectives through the ACH team at the plants and maintain culture for continual improvement. Direct supervisors using both oral and written communication, scheduling meetings when necessary. Set short term and long term goals and objectives giving clear expectations. Actively communicate resource needs to the appropriate Operations Director and take part in Operations team meetings (conference calls and/or off site meetings). Communicate with Human Resources concerning personnel issues related to disciplinary action, accident reporting or hiring / termination of employees. Identify problems and opportunities for improvement, and then lead the team through appropriate action to capitalize on the opportunity. Manage the supply of materials for manufacturing requirements while meeting inventory targets. Understand and follow regulatory guidelines and rules related to EHS and ISO compliance; including company, local, state and federal laws or policies/procedures. Direct the Plant Engineering and Maintenance staff on a day-to-day basis to ensure that systems and equipment are being optimized. Evaluate equipment status and priorities based on current and future needs. Utilize this information to assist with the development of the annual Capital Expenditures budget for the related plant. Direct the logistics, scheduling and works with customer service staff to ensure that ACH meets our customer’s expectations for delivery and quality. Participate in resolving customer issues and concerns in a timely manner. Initiate and maintain contact with other departments, to obtain and provide complete, detailed and accurate information. Assist in the development of the annual budget for the related plant. Strive to meet or exceed plant budget in the areas of Materials, Labor, OH and Freight. Review and understand the monthly financial statements to help drive decision making related to Materials, Labor, OH and Freight costs. Work with all Operations Directors to support initiatives in various functions within the plant. Maintain the ability to drive for business purposes, including annual satisfactory DMV report, proof of insurance, valid driver license, and signature of statement related to notification to company of any changes related to driver record and insurance coverage Must help drive the culture for Best in Class Safety Perform all other functions and responsibilities as assigned. Supervisory Responsibilities: Responsible for managing plant operations personnel. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required. Education and Experience: At least 2 years of post-high school education or equivalent required. Must have at least 3 years of experience in plant management or related level of responsibility. Possess a valid driver’s license, satisfactory driving record report and insurance coverage appropriate to enable legal and safe driving of vehicle(s) for company related business. Job Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Must be fluent in the English language, both written and spoken. Strong management skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize. Exceptional communication, leadership & interpersonal skills. Strong attention to detail and advanced analytical skills. Ability to build strong positive working relationships with vendors, customers, and production team members. Must be able to learn and understand the manufacturing processes, quality standards, equipment operations, safety requirements, and departmental procedures necessary to lead and troubleshoot assigned production areas. Must be computer literate: Excel, Word, Outlook, ERP systems. Training Requirements: General Safety. Quality System Awareness. ACH General Management Training. Physical Demands: Light to moderate physical effort required including sitting, standing, walking, kneeling, squatting, climbing steps or ladders, grasping, and fine and course manipulation, reaching both forward and above head level and tolerant of temperature changes for the entire shift. Must be able to deal with stressful situations in a professional manner. Must be able to push, pull and/or lift up to 50 pounds. Occasional travel may be necessary - less than 15% of time.

ad.title: 2nd Shift Production Lead - ACH Foam Technologies - Washington, IA
ad.content: Job Summary: Responsible for training and leading the daily activities of production personnel to ensure production schedules and quality standards are met for assigned departments. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Directs production personnel to ensure that orders are produced in a timely fashion and adhere to safety and quality standards in accordance with company policies and applicable laws. Must be able to learn and understand the manufacturing processes, quality standards, equipment operations, safety requirements, and departmental procedures necessary to lead and troubleshoot assigned production areas. Analyzes discrepancies to devise and implement a corrective plan of action. Trains and provides support to new and current employees to ensure complete understanding of roles and responsibilities. Provides feedback in employment decisions such as performance appraisals, disciplinary actions, and the hiring and termination of production personnel. May perform various functions in Vantage including creating jobs, printing job travelers, issuing materials, and reporting quantities. May lay out orders to maximize yield and reduce scrap. May be required to report plant metrics such as LF/HR, Blocks/HR, and scrap rates. Must help drive the culture for Best in Class Safety Perform such other functions and responsibilities as assigned. Supervisory Responsibilities: Directs production personnel and provides on-the-job training. May be responsible for managing staffing levels such as approving time cards and paid time off. Does not have the authority to hire or fire but is expected to make recommendations. May participate in corrective action, disciplinary or performance appraisal meetings. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required. Education and Experience: High school diploma or general education degree (GED) required. Prior experience in a manufacturing / industrial environment required. Prior supervisory experience preferred. May be required to possess a valid driver’s license, satisfactory driving record report and insurance coverage appropriate to enable legal and safe driving of vehicle(s) for company related business. Job Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Must be fluent in the English language, both written and spoken. Must be able to use simple math and use basic hand held measuring tools. Must be a computer literate; Excel, Word, Outlook, ERP systems. Training Requirement General Safety. Quality System Awareness. Physical Demands: Light to moderate physical effort required including sitting, standing, walking, kneeling, squatting, climbing steps or ladders, grasping, fine and course manipulation, reaching both forward and above head level, and tolerant of temperature changes for the entire shift. Must be able to deal with stressful situations in a professional manner. Must be able to push, pull and/or lift up to 50 pounds.

ad.content: Job DescriptionThe PROCESS PARTNER is tasked with working with the leadership team, warehouse, and call center advisors to implement, sustain and execute the returns, credits, debits, and process customer complaints. The PROCESS PARTNER should be able to lead continuous improvement activities. The PROCESS PARTNER serves as a coach to Call Center Associates and project team members at various functional and organizational levels. Managing and executing the CORE complaints, returns, credits, and debits within Bosch's automotive aftermarket division for remanufactured products Resident expert in the subject matter and associated tools and forms Assists and collaborates with the RPC (Regional Process Consultant), Managers in identifying key opportunities for improvement and initiating new projects to close gaps Responsible for coaching and leading CORE process improvements Responsible for testing topics during ERP upgrades & developments Looking for a “Lean” Process, identifying waste and coordinating “Lean” initiatives Has the broadest knowledge on End to End Process or willing to learn all aspects of the process Teach, coach, and mentor team members in execution Act as a Change Agent by continuously challenging the status quo Lead special/complex projects/task as defined by Manager Proven track record of taking initiative, working well in a team environment Ability to clearly define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions QualificationsBachelor’s Degree required Minimum of 3+ years’ experience in customer service, supply chain, or order to cash processes Demonstrated excellent analytical and statistical skills Excellent communication skills with strategic approach Excellent PC skills (MS Office Suite: PowerPoint, Excel, Word, Access, MS Project). SAP experience strongly preferred, and strong query reporting capabilities Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills Strong process improvement facilitation skills Ability to handle multiple tasks and projects at the same timeAdditional InformationBy choice, we are committed to a diverse workforce-EOE/Protected Veteran/Disabled We are not offering VA/VN transfer or sponsorship for this position.

ad.title: Senior Production Planner - Cevians - Costa Mesa, CA
ad.content: Job DescriptionSummary: The Senior Production Planner performs planning and purchasing functions to assure manufactured products meet customer requirements. The position will be directly engaged with production, manufacturing engineering, suppliers and program management. The individual must be versatile, know the important steps associated with manufacturing planning, purchasing, inventory management and logistics, and have a great attention to detail, and initiative. The Senior Production Planner would report directly to the Manufacturing Manager and be responsible for managing customer orders, job orders, tracking production schedules, setting production priorities, monitoring inventory levels, and ordering key raw materials to support production needs while working in a fast-paced team driven environment. Job Duties: Manage and expedite production priorities and schedules by studying work order specifications Manage subcontractor relationships and schedules, where required Establish and maintain production schedules to meet customer demand Manage current and future production requirements Monitor and maintain daily ship schedules Publish the weekly inspection report Resolve scheduling problems by collecting and analyzing information; coordinating solutions. Contribute to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed. Place purchase orders for inventory items, Kanban requests and purchase requisitions. Negotiate price, payment terms, vendor relationships Provide Engineering support with ECO’s and part number releases QualificationsQualifications BA degree in Business Management or the equivalent of 3-5 years in manufacturing operations, including manufacturing systems, product costing and planning Experience with and a demonstrable knowledge in ERP system(s) Proven experience in a senior planning role (3-5 years of planning experience in a manufacturing environment) Experience with Scheduling, Analyzing Information, Data Maintenance, Reporting, and Supply Management Quality control process knowledge Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with proven ability to build positive work relationships across functional lines. Excellent ability to multi-task and prioritize ]Strong communication skills] Proficiency in Microsoft Office Software applications such as Excel, Access, PowerPoint, and Word Competence & attitude requirements: Positive and Professional attitude Team player Strong organization and problem-solving skills Results oriented, ability to work under pressureAdditional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Hours M-F 7:00 am - 4:00 pm; Excellent benefit package: Medical/Dental/Vision/Life/LTD, 401(k), Profit Sharing, Generous Paid Holidays, Vacation. It is the policy of Cevians to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Cevians will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

ad.title: SAP Fieldglass Business Analyst - SAP - Chicago, IL
ad.content: Requisition ID: 216812Work Area: Customer Service and SupportExpected Travel: 0 - 10%Career Status: ProfessionalEmployment Type: Regular Full TimeCareer Level: T2Hiring Manager: Katie Coologeorgen Recruiter Name: Meghan Butterfield COMPANY DESCRIPTION SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives. Job Description: Account Services Business Analyst What We Do: Fieldglass, an SAP company, provides a cloud-based Vendor Management System (VMS) to manage contingent workforce and services procurement programs. More than 300 customers leverage Fieldglass to gain visibility into their external workforces, including contingent labor, services managed through Statements of Work and independent contractors while optimizing spend, quality, compliance and efficiency. What Sets Us Apart: Fieldglass was “born cloud”. As one of the forerunners of today’s highly successful cloud delivery model, Fieldglass has been a Software-as-a-Service application since its start. At a time when many buyers were using behind-the-firewall ERP applications to manage their non-employee workforce, this VMS industry first is now the industry standard. Some of our attributes include: We are the VMS market leader in global spend and in March 2014 were named the top company in our industry by Forrester Research. Multilingual help desk support is available around the clock 365 days a year – in addition to a dedicated Account Services team. Not only an industry leader but a thought leader - Fieldglass keeps customers up to date with VMS industry knowledge on our ‘From the Field’ blog and social media accounts. We work with the world’s leading companies, including AIG, Verizon, GlaxoSmithKline, Johnson & Johnson, CVS/Caremark, United Airlines, Panasonic, Rio Tinto, Monsanto, and many, many more. We are now part of SAP, a market leading enterprise application software company, helping companies of all sizes and industries run simple. Company Culture: Fieldglass encourages an open door policy and a collaborative office environment. Team members across all departments can easily meet together in any of our open office layouts. Those with an entrepreneurial and can-do attitude keep Fieldglass at the top of its industry. Traditional perks include casual dress, generous paid time off, charitable activities, stocked kitchens, great healthcare coverage and more! Account Services, Business Analyst AS Business Analysts maintain a deep knowledge of the SAP Fieldglass application and are responsible for consulting on industry best practices and deploying simple, easy to maintain, high quality solutions that help customers meet the goals of their external workforce strategy. They will be responsible for strategically leading client projects as well as for tactical execution of project work for our clients/partners. Responsibilities Include: Consults on multiple client projects to facilitate the implementation of new functionality for existing programs Influences and drives customer behavior toward best in class solutions Manages relationships with internal and customer stakeholders throughout the course of the project; keeps stakeholders informed of progress, risks, and issues in order to manage expectations Leads requirements gathering sessions with customers, analyzes requirements, and designs the technical configuration of the SAP Fieldglass solution Communicates information effectively across a broad audience, both technical and non-technical Prepares test environments for customers/partners when they are implementing new solutions Adheres to SAP Fieldglass project methodology and ensures that project management documents are accurate, complete and signed off by client/partner. Properly manages clients’ expectations and delivers prompt status updates as necessary Effectively manages project scope and change requests Identifies project risks and develops mitigation plans in conjunction with internal and external stakeholders. When applicable, triages to the Critical Customer Engagement Manager in a timely manner Maintains up to date knowledge of the SAP Fieldglass solution, roadmap, trends, and industry through self-study, meeting attendance, project participation and partnering with Learning Services team to present Did You Know webinars. Acts as a trusted subject matter expert (SME) within and outside the organization Participate on special projects and teams when required We’re Looking For: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or related course of study 3+ years relevant work experience, preferably implementing software solutions Strong analytic skills with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions Outstanding interpersonal skills (written & verbal); the ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical experience; competence in clear concise and tactful communication with senior management, clients, peers and team members Must be able to set priorities, adjust to client driven changes quickly, firmly commit to tasks and meet deadlines, and apply problem-solving techniques to application, environment, and data issues Results-oriented, self-motivated, and organized with the ability to balance multiple priorities simultaneously Ability to work with minimal supervision while maintaining a high level of work performance and service excellence A strong knowledge and advanced skills in MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint, & Outlook is required, as well as a solid work ethic and dedication to producing high quality, accurate work Proficiency with project management tools used in SAP as well as industry best practices A clear vision of what determines a successful project for the customer, partner and SAP Knowledge of and competency in project management processes including risk management, time management, quality management, documenting, and record keeping WHAT YOU GET FROM USSuccess is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now. SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENTTo harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company. SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team. (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor. EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability. Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.Additional Locations:

ad.title: System Administrator - Lone Wolf Technologies - Dallas, TX
ad.content:
This is a great opportunity to get a foot in the door of a rapidly changing technology organization as it moves to cloud based technologies such as AWS, Azure, and Office 365. Be a part of shaping the organization as it grows and matures. Bring your strong system administrator experience and we will provide training and hands on experience in the latest cloud technologies. Work closely with our Engineering group, learn DevOps and continued integration techniques, and help to shape the way we build and deploy software.
The primary duties of the Windows System Administrator are managing performance and tuning Windows Terminal Server/Remote Desktop Services to ensure high levels of availability and security for the supported business. This position will participate in the planning and implementation of policies and procedures to ensure Windows Services are consistent with company goals, industry best practices, and regulatory requirements; participates in and support capacity planning and the development of long-term strategic goals for Lone Wolf’s infrastructure.
Skills & Requirements
Duties and Responsibilities: Manage large Terminal Server/Remote Desktop Services farms in a VMWare environment Manage access controls through users and groups in Active Directory Interact directly with external customers to coordinate setup of services Perform proactive capacity planning, including short- and long-term trend analysis Provide primary system administration, configuration, and troubleshooting of the Windows servers environment and performance issues. Identify and automate routine tasks to improve performance and efficiency. Analyze user requirements and statistics to identify trends and resolve performance issues. Follow ITIL standards with regards to Incident, Change and Problem management Plan, install, build, manage, support, configure, and test server infrastructure components and connectivity. Demonstrate the ability to manage competing priorities, take a proactive approach to improving services, and have an innovative and keen interest in learning new technologies. Availability to provide 24x7x365 support while operating in a rotational, on-call status
Required Education and Certifications: Bachelor’s degree in information technology (IT) field or equivalent military or professional work experience Required Skills and Experience: Availability to provide 24x7x365 support while operating in a rotational, on-call status A keen sense of urgency to facilitate prompt incident identification and resolution Ability to work independently or with a team to analyze and solve complex technical problems through research, diagnosis, identification of the best course of action, presentation of technical roadmap to key stakeholders, testing, and validation Incredible verbal and written communication skills required to gather, synthesize, and analyze highly technical information from subject matter experts (SMEs) and to provide clear and concise status updates to diverse technical and non-technical stakeholders Experience supporting SQL Server environments for mission-critical, production applications Must be able to travel Internationally Travel requirement 10-15%
Desired Skills, Experience, and Certifications: AWS and or Azure experience Proven ability to write PowerShell scripts Windows Server 2012/2016 certification Strong understanding of data center infrastructure, including UNIX, Linux, VMWare ESX, Oracle, and network equipment and operations Windows scripting and automated software deployment experience Experience with Citrix XenDesktop, VMware vSphere (ESXi), vCenter technologies, and virtualization Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) Foundation certificate with experience supporting service-oriented operational projects
About Lone Wolf Real Estate Technologies At Lone Wolf Real Estate Technologies, we believe that when we work together we can build solutions that really make a difference in our clients’ lives and in the real estate industry. This is why we have created the industry’s leading real estate software to help our clients focus on achieving their goals by providing them with a complete enterprise solution.
In the ever changing world of real estate technology, we believe that our success comes from embracing our employees’ diverse skill sets and by developing and leveraging our client relationships.
We’ve become the largest real estate software company in North America. Our products provide our client’s with a competitive advantage in today’s market and nearly 10,000 offices are utilizing our feature rich, fully integrated windows and web based software solutions.

ad.title: App/Install Consultant I - CentralSquare Technologies - Lake Mary, FL
ad.content:
Application/Install Consultant I
Plans and coordinates activities concerned with installing software, both CentralSquare Technologies and 3rd party, investigating and resolving technical problems, and eliminating future operational or service difficulties by performing the following duties:
Responsibilities:
Install, troubleshoot and test new or add-on software at customer's facility to ensure full functionality according to specifications Ensure installation meets quality standards and all software is fully functional Coordinate problem resolution with engineering, customer service, and other personnel to expedite resolution Write reports to document installation specifics, customer configuration, trends and concerns Collaborate, as necessary, with other departments Provide customer support as it relates to project work Plan and prepare project work to ensure client experience with CentralSquare Technologies is positive and meets or exceeds client expectations for technical expertise Lead meetings with clients to discuss project scope/project preparation steps and outlines Train fellow team members on implementation skills, as needed Work in a team environment, as well as independently when needed Responsible for completing internal reports such as project smoke tests, project work scope documents, time and expense reports, and others as required Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or equivalent experience 0-2 years of experience customer service or technical systems support Read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals Speak effectively with customers on phone calls, in meetings or in person Provide proper feedback, in written and/or oral format, regarding projects Solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists Interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form Must have basic knowledge of various versions of Microsoft operating systems Basic understanding of SQL database administration and write simple SQL statements
Knowledge of the following a plus, but not required:
Database software Web server and IIS configuration Ability to understand and write complex SQL statements Debug and troubleshoot programming languages Working knowledge of PowerShell scripting Experience with Informix or Oracle databasesAbility to travel a minimum of 25%
As part of the requirements of this position, it is necessary that you have access to a major credit card that will support the required travel. It will be your responsibility or use your own credit card. If at any time during your employment your credit card will not allow you to meet the required travel obligations, it may be grounds for dismissal.
Our clients include government public safety agencies and other government entities. A contractual obligation we have with most of them is that employees working with them must meet their security requirements. This often requires separate background checks by those agencies and providing them with documents that include personal identifiable information. Please be aware that this is a contractual requirement that we must meet and represents a condition of employment for those employees affected.

ad.title: COOK (FULL-TIME) 4 openings at Oracle - Willing to train! - Compass Group - Redwood Shores, CA
ad.content: Posted Date: May 6, 2019 We have an opening for 4 full-time COOK positions. Location: Oracle - room 118; 400 Oracle Pkwy, Redwood City, CA 94065. Note: online applications accepted only. Schedule: F/T Schedule; Monday-Friday, AM start time (more details available upon interview). Requirement: Previous cook experience is a plus but WILLING TO TRAIN! This position is eligible for an Employee Referral Bonus! If you know someone that would be a great fit for this role, you can refer them to this position and potentially earn an Employee Referral Bonus! Click here to view the step-by-step instructions to refer a friend to this position. If you have a positive attitude and a love for learning, you may be interested in joining our team. Are you looking for a job with competitive wages and benefits, one in which you can learn and grow while making a difference in the world? We’re hiring! Bon Appétit Management Company operates more than 1,000 cafés around the country for corporations, universities, and museums, as well as a few dozen public restaurants. We’ve led the industry in socially and environmentally responsible sourcing, from sustainable seafood to cage-free eggs. We cook everything from scratch using fresh, local ingredients. Full-time associates at Bon Appétit are eligible for many benefits, including: Paid vacation and sick leave Medical, Dental, and Vision 401(k) with matching by company Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs) Commuter Benefits Wellness Program Employee Assistance Program Life Insurance for Associates and Eligible Dependents Short Term Disability (STD) and Long Term Disability (LTD) Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance On-the-job training Learn more about careers with Bon Appétit: http://www.bamco.com/careers/Summary: Prepares food in accordance with applicable federal, state and corporate standards, guidelines and regulations with established policies and procedures. Ensures quality food service is provided at all times.Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Prepares high-quality food items according to standardized recipes and instructions to meet production, delivery and service schedules. Serves meals or prepares for delivery by using correct portioning, meeting outlined standards, ensuring that food is at the correct temperature and is attractive and tasty. Tastes all prepared food items. Uses established ticket collection procedures during service. Responsible for records from area worked during service periods. Cleans kitchen after preparation and serving, maintaining high standards of cleanliness. Stores or discards excess food in accordance with safe food-handling procedures. Keeps refrigerators and storerooms clean and neat. Ensures food and supply items are stored per standards. Operates and maintains kitchen equipment as instructed. Assists in production planning, record keeping and reporting as required. Assists in the ordering and receiving of all food and supplies as required. Reports needed maintenance, faulty equipment or accidents to the supervisor immediately. Attends in-service and safety meetings. Maintains good working relationships with coworkers, customers, administrators and managers. Performs job safely while maintaining a clean, safe work environment. Performs other duties as assigned.About Compass Group: Achieving leadership in the foodservice industry Compass Group is an equal opportunity employer. At Compass, we are committed to treating all Applicants and Associates fairly based on their abilities, achievements, and experience without regard to race, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other classification protected by law. Qualified candidates must be able to perform the essential functions of this position satisfactorily with or without a reasonable accommodation. Disclaimer: this job post is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all essential responsibilities, skills, tasks, or requirements associated with this position. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the position posted, the Company reserves the right to modify or change the essential functions of the job based on business necessity. *Los Angeles applicants: Compass Group will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring (Ban the Box ordinance).Req ID: 275777 Bon Appetit Hourly

ad.title: Sr. Financial Analyst - Pacific Life - Newport Beach, CA
ad.content: Currently, we are seeking a talented Sr. Financial Analyst to join the Retirement Solutions Division based in Newport Beach, California. The Retirement Solutions Division leverages its strengths in product development, technology, services and risk management to create retirement solutions for individuals, families, and businesses. With the guidance of financial professionals, customers have access to an array of an array of annuities and mutual funds designed to help grow assets and to provide retirement income for financial independence.Job Summary:The Sr. Financial Analyst will analyze key business drivers and analyze business performance, forecasting expected results and developing recommendations for strategic decisioning and measuring profitability. Expand analysis around product, producer, and channel profitability and expense recovery ratio (ERR) performance. Maintain drivers for activity based costing and analyze business results.Primary Responsibilities: Assist in identifying emerging trends through analytics associated with financial & business drivers and other key metrics. Assist in developing recommendations and communication plan to Leadership. Perform Product, Channel, and Producer profitability analysis, identifying emerging trends and communicating findings to leadership with recommendations of opportunities and / or action plans Design, implement, and maintain financial dashboards & KPI reporting Partner with key stakeholders to create, maintain and analyze key business & expense drivers (Operations, Technology, Sales and Marketing) Assist with monthly, quarterly, and annual expense analysis Develop and maintain financial models Communicating and collaborating with Leadership on findings and recommendations resulting from analysis performed Assist in identifying opportunities to drive business growth initiatives which deliver customer value and meet company growth objectives Engage in annual strategic business activities and support translation of strategies into high-level roadmap and execution scope Maintaining data integrity, data mining, and process improvements: Partner with key stakeholders to design, implement, and maintain reporting solutions that will allow easier modeling and improved analysis around financial levers (Risk Management, Actuary, and Product Design) Support and utilize new analytic and reporting tools (Hyperion Planning, PCMCS) Identify and execute on opportunities for continuous improvement within the functional area as well as throughout the organization Factors for Success: Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or Mathematics CPA or MBA preferred 5+ years of relevant experience Ability to innovate and leverage technology for efficiencies and enhanced analytics Advanced computer skills in Microsoft Office and Oracle products (i.e. PeopleSoft, Hyperion, etc.) preferred Proven organizational skills with the ability to work under tight deadlines Demonstrated interpersonal skills and communication (written and verbal) skills and the ability to collaborate with others to effectively solve problems#LI-NL1 Req Number3940BR Position Location(s) Newport Beach, CA Full Time / Part Timefull time About Pacific Life Celebrating 150 years of service in 2018, Pacific Life offers life insurance, annuities, and mutual funds, along with a variety of investment products and services, all of which provide The Power to Help You Succeed. We firmly believe each employee plays a part in our continued growth and success, and we pride ourselves in providing a work environment that is challenging, inclusive, collaborative, and results-oriented. With a powerful past and a strong future, Pacific Life offers an environment where you’re empowered to achieve your personal best. In return, we look to your passion and insight to help us grow. For additional company information, including current financial strength ratings, visit www.PacificLife.com. To explore the heritage of Pacific Life and learn more about our history, visit www.pl150years.com. Benefits Join the Pacific Life team and watch your career grow! We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package that includes: • Competitive salary and bonus program • Medical, dental, and vision as part our commitment in investing in the health and wellbeing of our employees • Two retirement savings plans: 401k savings plan with company match and Company Retirement Contribution (company-paid) • Generous vacation time and holiday pay • And much more! EEO Statement Pacific Life Insurance Company is an Equal Opportunity /Affirmative Action Employer, M/F/D/V. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you have the right to request an accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access our career center as a result of your disability.
