Demonstrates complete understanding of menu items and ingredients. Advises guests on appropriate combinations of food and drinks when requested; accommodates reasonable requests and notes preferences. As needed, demonstrates knowledge of specialized diets and allergens. Maintains a high level of sensitivity and confidentiality regarding personal or medical information that is shared. Promptly addresses complaints or issues; relays relevant information or complaints directly to supervisor. Ensures that the dining room is properly set up prior to and after the service period; keeps area clean and neat while meeting established sanitation standards. Operates a variety of equipment, including fire extinguishers, telephones, iced tea/soda machines, soup wells and coffee machines. Works with staff of other departments to perform job duties during special events and functions. Performs other duties as assigned. ad.title: Software Engineer - AI Systems - SK hynix America - San Jose, CA
ad.content: With technology evolving, it begins to require more and more memory in the devices to function. Our memory research team is leading the technology in developing NAND technology to increase speed output and storage. Emerging technology utilized in industries like biotech, bio-pharma, medical devices will continuously need advance technology to revolutionize into the new era.Perhaps, it is an opportunity for you to dive deeper, explore, and build into the next chapter of the solid state drive. What drives you?Job Duties:Individual technical contributor within the research team focused on AI/ML Analyze deep learning network and framework implementation to identify bottle necks and optimization opportunities Develop high-performance and highly parallel software kernel implementations Explore and implement various distributed algorithms such as model/data parallel frameworks Work together with a partner to analyze their applications and understand how they use deep learning and where optimization is needed Ability to work with ambiguity Presenting technical solution in industry conference Demonstrated effective communication and collaboration skills Requirements:7+ years of experience with B.S degree; 5+ years of experience with M.S degree or PhD degree in developing deep learning software with high proficiency in data structures and algorithms Strong programming skills and experience with C/C++, Python and Java preferred Software development experience in Deep Learning, GPU acceleration, and Model Optimization Experience in Deep Learning and Machine Learning frameworks and models like Tensorflow Experience in system software, GPU acceleration, DL model execution and performance optimization Experience in Neural Network architectures for Video Analytics and Image Classifications

ad.title: Machine Tech - 2nd Shift - Hearth & Home Technologies - Mount Pleasant, IA
ad.content: Manufacturing – Machine Operator Help us build quality products that people love as a Machine Operator in Mt. Pleasant, IA at Hearth & Home Technologies. This rewarding career includes competitive compensation, comprehensive benefits and a supportive environment focused on developing your skills. Our Machine Operators are responsible for set up and operation of various machines to construct Hearth & Home Technologies’ industry-leading fireplaces, stoves and hearth products. You’ll be performing basic machine set up, load/unload, and manufacture of programmed parts including the disassembly and assembly of machines, and maximize efficiencies in changeover necessary regarding tools, equipment, jigs, carts, etc. The ability to complete finished product within the parameters outlined in blueprints, mini-bills, and/or schedule along with adherence to all quality standards by producing products which align with the print specifications is critical to this position. Hearth & Home Technologies believes in the power of Lean Manufacturing. Our production environments emphasize flow and continuous improvement efforts. Our Machine Operators work within a team-driven environment to assemble quality products and improve our efficiencies. About Working for Hearth & Home Technologies Take ownership of your career with a job that ignites your passions and rewards your hard work. At Hearth & Home Technologies, you will have the opportunity to Burn Brighter working with a supportive team developing industry-leading hearth products. Hearth & Home Technologies is an operating division of HNI Corporation (NYSE: HNI). We design, manufacture and distribute a wide variety of gas, electric, wood and biomass burning fireplaces, inserts, stoves and accessories. All in the USA. Lakeville, Minnesota is our home, but we have locations throughout the United States. As we continue expanding our operations, we’re looking for leaders who are confident in what they do, but open to learning from others. Hardworking professionals who take pride in their company as much as their work. Are you ready to drive meaningful change to our business, to learn through challenging work experiences and to act like an owner? Take the next step in your manufacturing career by applying for a job today. Here’s how to get started:Apply today for this position orIs this position not perfect for you? Keep in touch with us and our opportunities by: Joining our Talent Community Following us on Facebook and Twitter

ad.title: Azure Data Technologist - Slalom Consulting - Seattle, WA
ad.content: Slalom is a purpose-driven consulting firm that helps companies solve business problems and build for the future, with solutions spanning business advisory, customer experience, technology and analytics. We partner with companies to push the boundaries of what’s possible—together. Founded in 2001 and headquartered in Seattle, WA, Slalom has organically grown to nearly 7,000 employees. We were named one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For in 2018 and are regularly recognized by our employees as a best place to work. You can find us in 29 cities across the U.S., U.K., and Canada. Slalom is proud to be a Microsoft Gold Partner, 2018 Microsoft Power BI Global Partner of the Year, Premier AWS Partner, Google Premier Partner, 5x Tableau Partner of the Year, and 2018 Snowflake Partner of the Year. Job Title: Azure Data Technologist We are seeking an Azure Data Technologist to join our Regional Delivery Team – West. You will be part of The Microsoft Center of Excellence (CoE), which focuses on Azure technology consulting for applications and analytics, Power BI, and the Power Platform plus Dynamics 365. This role is for someone who is passionate about developing innovative analytics solutions to help organizations drive strategic business outcomes and to enable data-driven insights. You will be responsible for client delivery, complex solutioning, and knowledge management. Responsibilities: Work as part of a team to design and develop analytics platform solutions throughout the West Coast (up to 30-40% travel is expected) Implement Azure data services including Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory and Azure Analysis Services. May also include Snowflake or Azure SQL Data Warehouse Design and develop scalable data ingestion frameworks to transform a wide variety of datasets Research, analyze, recommend and select technical approaches for solving challenging and complex development and integration problems Assist in designing multi-phased Azure data strategies, including designing multi-phased implementation roadmaps Serve as a subject matter expert in Azure analytics platforms for larger the Slalom practice and contribute back to community Qualifications: 7+ years data engineering/data warehousing experience 2+ years real-word experience implementing production Azure analytics platforms Strong knowledge of database, storage, collection and aggregation models, techniques and technologies – and how to apply them in business The ability to apply such methods to solve business problems using one or more Azure data services in combination with building data pipelines, data streams, and system integration Mastery of .NET, C#, and T-SQL Proficient with SSIS, experienced with Azure Data Factory Experience with Azure SDKs and programmatic access services Working experience with version control platforms Working knowledge of agile development including DevOps concepts Strong communication skills Educational degree in IT, applied mathematics, statistic or other relevant field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience Preferred Skills: Familiarity with Azure IoT, Azure HDInsight + Spark, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Databricks, Azure Stream Analytics Knowledge of Python Experience preparing data for Data Science and Machine Learning use cases Designing and building Data Pipelines using streams of IoT data Knowledge of Lambda and Kappa architecture patterns Azure certifications Consulting experience Slalom Is An Equal Opportunity Employer And All Qualified Applicants Will Receive Consideration For Employment Without Regard To Race, Color, Religion, Sex, National Origin, Disability Status, Protected Veteran Status, Or Any Other Characteristic Protected By Law.

ad.title: VP of Sales - Concertio - New York, NY
ad.content:
New York City We’re seeking a VP of Sales who has “done it before” – experienced in setting up a sales process in an enterprise software company. The candidate is expected to be well versed in recent enterprise software trends and preferably have a technical background.
Roles & Responsibilities:
Set up and implement the sales process of the company Articulate & devise compelling value propositions Accelerate customer adoption Manage relations with partners and distributors to extend reach & drive adoption Manage contract negotiations Develop long-term strategic relationships with key accounts Track and ensure customer satisfaction Expect moderate travel This person is expected to be in the NYC office except when attending meetings Basic Qualifications: At least 5 years in a direct sales role for an enterprise software company At least 3 years in a partner / channel manager role Experience in building a sales process from scratch in an enterprise software company Technically knowledgeable in the cloud, machine learning, hardware and software space Ability to work independently Preferred Qualifications: Technical academic degree To apply please reach out to us at careers@concertio.com

ad.title: Staff Counsel - Verizon - Ashburn, VA
ad.content: What you’ll be doing... Join our team. Verizon is seeking an experienced attorney to provide support and counseling for Verizon’s Business Products and Marketing organization, with an emphasis on Managed Network and Advanced Communications Services. Verizon delivers the promise of the digital world. Our superior networks give us a competitive edge in delivering the digital experiences that are vital to customers’ lives and business success. This is a unique position that allows you to work in a global business that is at the juncture of Telecommunications and Information Technology. The successful candidate will review new products and feature enhancements for compliance with applicable regulations and industry standards. Specifically, you will review inputs and approvals from internal stakeholders and SMEs (including but not limited to product managers, audit, IT, privacy, operational assurance, etc.), support negotiations with strategic partners, advise on go-to-market and demand generation activities, draft contract templates, support customer negotiations and monitor launched products for on-going product compliance. The ideal candidate will have a solid knowledge of legal issues related to communications, privacy, open source, data security, encryption requirements, and third-party licensing. Position Responsibilities: Conduct thorough legal review of new products and enhancements to existing products. Manage SME inputs and issue final legal approvals for products and feature enhancements. Draft, review, negotiate, and advise clients on commercial arrangements with strategic partners. Draft contract templates and advise on compliance and marketing matters, as needed. Participate and counsel clients through all stages of the product lifecycle (design, review, approve, go-to-market, and decommissioning) Stay knowledgeable of, and communicate business impacting regulatory changes. Provide day-to-day advice and counseling to business products clients. Coordinate with internal security, IT, audit, product, privacy, and other stakeholders as needed to remediate any deficiencies to support timely product launches and ongoing product compliance. What we’re looking for... You’ll need to have: JD degree and six or more years of relevant work experience. Bar membership of at least one state. Six or more years of recent legal practice experience with a corporate legal department or law firm, preferably supporting IT, Advanced Communications, Cyber security or new technology products and services. Even better if you have: Knowledge of data privacy laws, security compliance requirements, relevant industry standards, such as HIPAA, PCI, and FISMA are preferred. Experience working in a fast-paced deliverable driven environment managing multiple executive visibility obligations under tight deadlines. Ability to work independently as well as part of a collaborative team, with excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to interact comfortably with all levels of personnel and communicate legal requirements without losing focus of client objectives. Strong with Microsoft Office and Google G Suite products. Ability to handle extremely sensitive and confidential information. When you join Verizon... You’ll be doing work that matters alongside other talented people, transforming the way people, businesses and things connect with each other. Beyond powering America’s fastest and most reliable network, we’re leading the way in broadband, cloud and security solutions, Internet of Things and innovating in areas such as, video entertainment. Of course, we will offer you great pay and benefits, but we’re about more than that. Verizon is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at Verizon. Equal Employment Opportunity We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences,including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.

ad.title: Cyber Security Customer Support Analysts - GTB Technologies - United States
ad.content:
The Cyber Security Analyst will be supporting GTB customers Location: USA- Midwest
Technical Knowledge & Skills Required
Proficiency in security technologies, including firewalls, email encryption such as Proofpoint, Mimecast, Zix and Enterprise DLP such as GTB DLP, Triton or Symantec DLP, and a general networking background Proficiency for fielding and resolving customer and business data owner requests. Proficiency in defending and / or preventing attacks utilizing security technologies, including web application firewalls, anti-DDoS technologies, advanced Enterprise DLP tools, advanced anti-malware solutions and network forensics and visibility solutions Information Systems architecture and security control design and development experience Strong empathy for customers Enthusiastic and creative team player with the ability to inspire others Preferred
Experience with deploying and using Enterprise Data Loss Prevention solutions such as the GTB Technologies DLPthatWorks platform ( gttb.com ) Experience deploying and managing Splunk and / ArcSight Experience deploying and administering Windows, Mac, *NIX servers and desktops
Educational & Professional Credentials
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline or equivalent experience 5 – 8 years of security customer support experience in the Information Security industry Previous sales experience is strongly preferred Ability to deal with changing priorities and multi-task several projects Maintain at least one Industry Standard Security certification, such as: CISSP, CISM, etc... Excellent presentation and communication skills. Excellent technical and business writing skills.
Required Experience and Skills Existing hands-on Technical Support or Systems Engineer background with networking and UNIX 2+ years’ experience in customer and account management experience Self-starter with ability to multi-task in a high-pressure, fast-paced, fast growth environment Be intuitive and inventive by providing solutions and workarounds for customers Team player that shares technical information freely and willingly Ability to manage influence through persuasion, negotiation, and consensus building Ideally combined background of both post-sales and pre-sales experience Strong empathy for customers AND passion for revenue and growth Deep understanding of value drivers in recurring revenue business models Analytical and process-oriented mindset Enthusiastic and creative team player with the ability to inspire others Relevant Bachelor’s degree; preference for computer science or related degrees Required Technical Experience:
Excellent knowledge and prior experience with network security technologies including: Proxies, NG Firewalls, SSL/IPSec, VPN’s, SSO, DLP and Encryption gateways Demonstrable experience with systems installation, configuration and administration UNIX/Linux and Windows-based systems (prior Active Directory/LDAP experience desirable) What is needed from you:
Current resume Cover letter/summary expressing: Why you are interested in working at GTB Technologies The skills and expertise you will contribute to our diverse team This position requires a highly-motivated, results-oriented individual with a "can do" attitude. Strong communication skills and entrepreneurial drive are essential.
Please apply for the above role by sending your cover letter and resume to careers @ gttb.com At this time, we will only be considering applicants who are currently eligible to work in the US.

ad.title: Senior Project Manager - Cloud - Smartronix - Herndon, VA
ad.content:
ContractSmartronix, Inc., is an information technology and engineering solutions provider specializing in Cloud Computing, Cyber Security, Health IT, Network Operations, and Mission-Focused Engineering.
Smartronix Inc., a Premier Amazon Web Services Consulting Partner, a Gold Microsoft partner and a Google Cloud Platform Premier Partner is currently seeking a Technical Project Manager with a passion for technology, the ability to understand and assess new technologies understanding their applicability to business. We are seeking a driven individual who has a desire to work with some of the best Cloud Architects in the market. Today Smartronix serves Fortune 1000 Financial, Healthcare, and government agencies and other regulated markets worldwide in delivery of Cloud Services. Our architects support the full life cycle from client needs analysis, through design, build migration and go live. They are continually assessing emerging products and services that improve the business of the clients we serve. #CJPOST
Daily Duties:
Oversees all aspects of multiple complex Cloud projects including finance, scheduling, technology, methodology, tools, and reporting. Prepares long and short-range plans for complex Cloud services projects and for necessary support resources. Serves as the primary interface and point of contact with customer program authorities and representatives on program/project issues. Oversees contractor personnel program/project operations by developing procedures, planning and directing execution of the technical, programming, maintenance and administrative support effort and monitoring and reporting progress. Manages program/project resources and controls financial and administrative aspects of the program/project with respect to contract requirements. Manages all project meetings. Track and mitigate project related risks and issues. Conduct project financial analysis to understand burn rate, profitability, resource utilization. Ensure accurate invoicing for professional services, managed services, Cloud resources and other direct costs (ODCs) Manage procurement of all required project tools, technologies and services and maintain inventory and license tracking. Ensure adherence to SLAs Required SkillsExpert project and program management skills Excellent organizational skills Excellent financial management skills Demonstrated knowledge of and experience with the requirements of the Federal government and/or large financial institutions Demonstrated ability to work with large and diverse teams and the ability to effectively provide guidance, direction, and supervision in all areas of contracted effort such as program management, systems engineering, major system acquisitions, and financial management. Demonstrated experience working with large scale systems for an organization with widely distributed geographic sites. Demonstrated managerial experience leading employees supporting IT services Expert Microsoft Office skills Required ExperienceAt least five (5) professional experience supporting large, complex programs. Experience working with public Cloud technologies and managing Cloud projects PMP and ITIL Foundations Certification preferred.

ad.title: Senior Systems Architect - Precise Systems - Lexington Park, MD
ad.content:
Precise Systems is a professional services company currently working for the U.S. Navy, U.S. Marine Corps, and U.S. Air Force; competing as a Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) under several NAICS codes. Our core competencies include systems engineering, program and project management, logistics, information technology and cyber security, and software development services. We were founded in 1990 and since our establishment we have been providing cutting edge solutions and support to our warfighters. We understand and provide expert consultation on network and weapons systems acquisition programs, maintenance/modernization programs, and sustainment programs. We are currently seeking an Information Assurance Manager to support our PAX River customer.
We are currently seeking a highly technical Senior Lead Systems Architect. The incumbent will lead a software development team to define architecture, build and implement solutions, and support development and deployment of web-based applications. The Systems Architect will be responsible for the overall software, database, and deployment architecture.
Responsibilities:
Lead a team of software developers, product owners, product consultants and testers to define system requirements and determine the best approach to ensure the overall software and database architecture supports the mission. Coordinate with the lead software architect to develop a strategic Concept of Operations. Leads Agile teams to ensure effective end-to-end capability is being implemented, focused on meeting the expectations of the customer Ensure the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into total systems solutions that acknowledge technical, schedule, and cost constraints. Performs functional analysis, timeline analysis, detail trade studies, requirements allocation and interface definition studies to translate customer requirements into software and infrastructure designs and specifications. Leads software architecture design activities and provides critical contributions to software architecture implementation, integration, and troubleshooting, including consideration for both networking and cloud aspects. Provides technical consultation, training and support to staff as designated by project management or the customer. Frequent inter-organizational and outside customer contacts. Represents organization in providing solutions to difficult technical issues associated with specific projects. This position is will often communicate with customer throughout the development process to ensure the end product meets expectations. Interacts with the government client to discuss requirements, review progress, present recommendations and address tool/model enhancements. Reviews existing software to ensure that requirements are met and that appropriate software engineering/development discipline is applied. Chairs architectural reviews for multiple data-driven tools/models under development, to ensure compatibility and scalability.
Required Education: MS degree desired or BA/BS degree or 2 years of additional relevant experience will be considered in lieu of each year of non-degree.
Required Experience:
Requires 10-15 years’ relevant experience. Undergraduate degree or equivalent combination of education and work experience. Graduate degree preferred.
Hands-on experience with the below technologies, tools, and platforms:
Language(s): C#, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JQuery, XML Framework(s): ASP.NET, .Net 4, WCF, Entity Front-end Development: ASP.NET, Bootstrap, AngularJS, MVC, AJAX, Web Services, Kendo Database(s): Oracle 11g, PL/SQL, SQL Plus, Toad Platform/Tools: Visual Studio, TFS, IIS, Windows Server, HTTPS Team Foundation Server (TFS) Strong Agile, SDLC, and development process experience Experience in all phases of the software development lifecycle including analysis, design, implementation, test, integration, and maintenance. Experience designing secure, scalable, and extensible software architectures. Experience developing applications, services, and systems using Agile and Scaled Agile methodologies. Experience with relational database systems. Experience developing Java-based systems/services using test-driven development methodology. Experience developing web applications deployed to clustered application servers. Experience with application lifecycle tooling, including those related to agile project management, version control, continuous integration, code scanning, automated testing, and issue tracking. Experience with dashboard/visualization software. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with demonstrated experience preparing concept papers, briefings, trade studies, proposals, and similar documents. Leverage advanced technical knowledge, perform analysis, and troubleshoot software, boundary and database applications and their production environments. Experience with web development frameworks/technologies, including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery. Analyze customer requirements, integrate with enterprise architecture, and document cloud architecture, strategy, governance, processes, and business case analyses. 15+ years of software architecture experience. Ability to work from high-level requirements through detailed specifications. Familiar with Agile processes (Scrum/Kanban) and their implementation. Strong analytical skills and the ability to lead in a collaborative team setting. End-to-end understanding of SDLC methodologies and the ability to independently engineer, analyze, and test complex applications, systems, and/or services. Ability to make critical decisions with limited guidance while ensuring visibility into those decisions. Big data management experience.
Must have an Active Secret Clearance
Precise Systems, Inc. is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Precise Systems, Inc. participates in E-Verify.Required SkillsRequired Experience

ad.title: Intelligence Analyst (Team Lead) - Halfaker and Associates - Arlington, VA
ad.content:
Halfaker and Associates, LLC, an award winning high growth small business, creates innovative and customer-centric technology solutions in the areas of Cyber Security, Data Analytics, Software Engineering and IT Infrastructure to improve the health, security and well-being of all Americans. Our commitment to excellence and our vision to “Continue to Serve” has resulted in steady growth and an expanding client base across government agencies in the health, defense, security and intelligence sectors. Headquartered in Arlington, VA, we have employees nationwide and were recently named a 2018 Top Work Place by the Washington Post. Please take a moment to browse through our website and learn more about what it means to serve with Halfaker.
Halfaker has an opening for an Intelligence Analyst (Team Lead) to join our talented, dynamic team. The key responsibilities for this position include:
Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends Follows up reports with meaningful interaction with appropriate government and other contractor representatives Works closely with private industry and/or other government agencies to gain necessary information and directs personnel to appropriate action with regard to information generation and other communication priorities Coordinate with the National Operations Center (NOC), Office of Infrastructure Protection (IP), National Cyber Communications and Integrations Center (NCCIC), and other government agencies and Critical Infrastructure Key Resources (CIKR) owners & operators Participate in tests and exercises to maintain preparedness and improve coordination; supervise others actions during exercises and provide feedback and after action reporting During incidents, triage information from a variety of resources and conduct initial analysis of the incidents and events During major incidents or events, collect and review input to national-level situational awareness Serve as a 24x7 customer service interface for CIKR partners by collecting (via email and phone), tracking, and facilitating responses to requests for information and assistance Conduct daily teleconferences with CIKR stakeholders Provide access to approved DHS situation reports, bulletins, press releases, and other important documents to serve industry partner’s continuity-of-business information needs Required SkillsAbility to work in a fast-paced environment, handle multiple, concurrent activities with short turn-around times with multiple internal and external customers Excellent communication skills both written and verbal Enjoy working in a team environment Candidates must be US citizens and will be required to undergo a background investigation in order to be granted access to classified information Knowledge of National Incident Management System (NIMS) structure, emergency management operations, and background knowledge critical infrastructure sectors Capable of synthesizing, synopsizing, and presenting information at an executive level Must also demonstrate the ability to conduct research, analysis, and technical writing skills and be able to perform triage on questions, issues, or events involving the nation’s critical infrastructures and key resources. Personnel shall have experience in operating during high-tempo mission critical operations Possesses a general understanding of cybersecurity and cyber related current events and how they could impact critical infrastructure Has working/ user-based knowledge of social media and had ideas about how to implement it as an intelligence gathering tool Must be willing to work shift work as a salaried employee Required Experience5+ years experience working in an operations center College graduate (BA or BS) preferred; will substitute significant military experience or other operations experience TS/SCI
Halfaker and Associates, LLC, is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/ Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

ad.title: Technical Targeter - CENTRA Technology - Arlington, VA
ad.content: CENTRA Technology, Inc. (CENTRA) is an employee-owned company providing analytic, consulting, and staffing support to U.S. Government national security agencies, including the Departments of Homeland Security and Defense, and similar Government clients. CENTRA Technology is looking for candidates for Technical Targeter Technical Targeter positions include initiative, creativity, integrity, technical excellence, and strong interpersonal and communication skills. Ideal candidates have a self-starter attitude, the ability to work independently and in a group. As a Technical Targeter, you will be a pivotal member of a mission that pioneers solutions that enables intelligence collection against our nation's highest priority threats in a global environment that is often hostile, fast-paced, and technologically savvy. CENTRA is looking for high-energy, intellectually curious individuals who thrive on tackling the most difficult all-source analytic efforts in support of cutting-edge operations using specialized, state-of-the-art tools and technologies. This work is increasingly complex and highly dynamic. It affords the successful candidate considerable opportunity to address high-profile intelligence issues and apply the full-range of analytic tradecraft to sophisticated, challenging worldwide missions. Concurrently the successful candidate will develop substantive expertise on terrorism, proliferation, cyber threats, narcotics trafficking and money laundering. Technical Targeter positions involve research, critical thinking skills, as well as writing, and briefing both current and longer term intelligence studies to senior officials and to steer intelligence operations and exploit key data. Key to this work is being able to identify and assess the right entities and the right vulnerabilities and technology trends to enable new collection operations that answer critical intelligence issues. This endeavor requires strong analytic, research and investigative skills combined with ops sense and personal initiative and some technical expertise or aptitude. Opportunities exist for further professional development, to include inter-agency and task force assignments, as well as, the potential for stateside and overseas travel. Knowledge of advanced technologies including next generation telecommunications systems and capabilities as well as analytical tools and methodologies. Required Qualifications:Minimum required Bachelors OR 5 years of operational experience & 1+ years of verifiable experience within the specific field of expertise appropriate to the level applying Applicants must also possess strong written and oral English communications skills.

ad.title: Senior Software Engineer, Cloud Test Automation - ExtraHop Networks, Inc. - Seattle, WA
ad.content: Do you like to break things just to see how meticulously they were constructed? Do you enjoy working closely with developers who share the responsibility to develop with uncompromising quality? We are looking for people who have passion for building secure and scale-able systems that can operate in some of the largest and most demanding environments. Have you perfected your manual testing approach but find betters ways via automation? Do you want a role that maintains a technical challenge but fosters your growth within the automation domain? Think you have what it takes to build, test, and support components that will enable our team to innovate rapidly? We have a global and diverse user base—we believe in actively investing in a diverse engineering organization. We are seeking technically-qualified people from all backgrounds, who offer dynamic perspectives, influences, and experiences. Are you as passionate as we are about positive culture and amazing technology? If you are, we can't wait to chat with you. Are you looking to make an impact? Do you love seeing your work implemented and hearing how your contributions have made a difference? ExtraHop offers an exciting, high energy, and versatile environment in which people are encouraged and supported to collaborate on industry-leading technology while they develop and enrich their individual growth. And we're doing it with creativity, intellectual curiosity, and a sense of humor (it's required here, seriously). Duties & Responsibilities Be part of a small team that tests the ExtraHop product line. Plan and Implement Automated tests to validate ExtraHop features/functionality in all areas, focusing on the Cloud. Translate Manual test cases into robust Automated tests using existing toolset. Triage and maintain test suites in a CI environment Work with other Engineering teams as necessary to ensure proper coverage Drive product quality and feature growth through informative issue writing Track and manage feature testing tasks to completion. Assist in the release process as needed Required Skills & Experience 3+ years scripting and/or OOP programming experience (plus for Python) Linux OS experience Experience with an Issue Tracking systems (e.g. Perforce, JIRA, trac, Bugzilla, etc.) and following Bugs to resolution Prior Test Framework development and maintenance experience Preferred Skills & Experience Experience with Test Automation, preferably using BDD (e.g. Python Behave driving Selenium) History of creating test infrastructure for complex products and networking solutions. CI Pipeline experience Web application (Javascript, CSS, etc) testing experience. Prior experience automating REST API testing Working knowledge of TCP/IP networking Knowledge of Testing methodologies Experience with SDLC, preferably Agile (Scrum or Kanban) Someone who's excited about not only finding issues, but is only satisfied by understanding the how and why of the issue Experience with open source software, especially test automation solutions Experience with AWS/Azure or other Clouds platforms Experience with on site-virtualization platforms or containers About ExtraHop ExtraHop is an enterprise cyber analytics and performance monitoring company helping the world’s leading organizations understand and secure their entire environment from core to edge to cloud. Our breakthrough approach to analytics and machine learning helps our customers investigate threats, ensure the delivery of critical applications, and secure their investment in the cloud, resulting in 95% faster threat detection and reducing unplanned downtime by 86% while providing the best possible customer experience. ExtraHop is recognized by leading organizations for both its innovation in the market and its commitment to building a world-class team. We’ve been named to Wealthfront’s Career-Launching Companies list for the last four years, and JMP Securities put ExtraHop on its 2018 Super 70 List as one of the most strategically positioned private companies in the cybersecurity industry. Credit Suisse recognized ExtraHop as a member of its inaugural Disruptive Technology Recognition Program, and SC Media named ExtraHop a 2019 Industry Innovator for enterprise network traffic analysis. With well over $100 million in bookings in 2018, and 10x growth in security, the opportunity with ExtraHop has never been greater. Are you ready to rise above the noise? ExtraHop is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, military status, or national origin or any other characteristic protected under federal, state, or applicable local law #LI-SF1

ad.title: Network Engineer 4 - Technamo LLC - Staunton, VA
ad.content: Job DescriptionThe responsibilities of the Network Engineer will include maintenance of all current network hardware and software at the TOC as well as new hardware and software that will be installed in the future. These services will be primarily for central control room hardware, communications infrastructure and software. Field equipment maintenance is primarily performed by other personnel. However, the Network Engineer will be expected to provide support for the field equipment installation, maintenance and troubleshooting as necessary. This position will also be required to perform some system administration related duties. Such typical duties expected of the Network Engineer shall include, at a minimum, the following:Monitor network performance/utilizationAdd / delete system usersChange user privilegesProvide full system backups and restoration, if necessaryManage network security policies and proceduresParticipate in Configuration Change Board (CCB) meetingsManage network configurationArchive data as directedDevelop reportsImplement bug fixes, patches and upgradesSupport the addition of field devices to the systemManage maintenance support agreementsProvide other network related technical support as directed by the Regional Transportation Operations Manager (RTOM) or designee. Listed below are examples of long-term/planning duties the Network Engineer is expected to perform:Hardware and software upgrades of network components.Network performance planningNetwork Capacity planningComponent warranty monitoringHardware lifecycle managementSoftware version managementCommunications planning (local and wide area) Over time, additional field equipment will be added to the TOC. The Network Engineer will be responsible for supporting the testing, configuration management, and troubleshooting associated with the integration of the new equipment with the TOC central software. Work in the System Integration area may include writing specifications, preparing drawings, providing procurement support, and installing and configuring equipment. Specific duties related to procurement support include:Support in determining equipment specifications, selection of equipment, and selection of models.Support in determining if vendor recommendations of equipment meet requirements.Assisting in commercial-off-the-shelf procurement decisions.Review of vendor proposals/bids/submittals as required. Specific duties related to equipment installation and configuration include:Unpack new hardware and inspect it for any signs of damage. The Network Engineer will record in the configuration management database the make, model, and serial numbers of each individual piece of equipment.Install the equipment in its intended location. The network hardware will be rack mounted. The Network Engineer will verify all connections to and from the equipment including power and communications connections.Setup and configure each piece of equipment. This may include the installation of an operating system or other COTS software. It may also include the setting of configuration parameters, such as IP routing parameters in the network switch. The Network Engineer will record any setup parameters used in configuring the equipment.Test the system configuration to verify that each piece of equipment is connected and configured as specified. Cyber Security is a rapidly increasing area of focus for agency. The Network Engineer will be expected to be current with emerging security trends, issues and alerts. Other expectations include:Ability to communicate known security risks and solutions to leadership in order to mitigate risks to business and technology partners as needed.Ability to identify, document, and recommend new or revised security processes, policies, and SOPs.Participate in knowledge sharing with other security engineers and partners.Interface with technical personnel from various disciplines to rapidly resolve critical security issues.Familiarity with secure network protocols and authentication services such as IPsec, TACACS and RADIUS Required Skills: Network Engineering/Design (Experience with Cisco Products - CCNP or equivalent preferred, please upload certification) – Required 10 years Network Administration (Experience with Cisco Products - CCNA or equivalent preferred, please upload certification) – Required 10 years Experience working with network monitoring applications. (Solarwinds, Nagios, etc.) – Required 10 years Experience performing network data capture and analysis with tools such as Wireshark, etc. – Required 10 years Ability to effectively troubleshoot complex network issues – Required 10 years Ability to produce accurate technical documentation to include network topology maps, implementation plans, migration plans, etc. – Required 10 years MS Windows Server admin and support – Required 5 years Experience with VMWare/Vsphere – Required 5 years Experience with Intelligent Traffic System field device integration/trouble – Required 5 years Experience with administration of Video Management Systems – Desired 5 years Experience with Active Directory Administration – Required 5 years QualificationsnullAdditional InformationAll your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

ad.title: Professional Services Consultant - Nexthink - Boston, MA
ad.content: Job Description Assist and provide expertise during a Nexthink project implementation, including: Analysis of the customer needs, goals, strategic plans and constraint in order to advice the best possible use of Nexthink; Understanding and analysis of the customer needs, goals and challenges related to compliance and cybersecurity; Translate the identified compliance and security needs into a Nexthink solution, inline with industry best practices; Integrate Nexthink into existing customer processes (e.g. Risk Management) to maximize usage and value; Provide new insights to integrate Nexthink with existing security solutions; Planning and delivering the deployment of the solution; including the installation and configuration of the server and reporting components in line with the agreed architecture; Identifying and delivering against agreed use cases so that Nexthink is successfully operationalized inside of the client organization; Educating and empowering the client to take full advantage of the Nexthink solution, so that the solution is fully adopted; Preparing all client facing and internal deliverables that are technology related; Seeking to continuously improve how we drive the adoption of the solution and create incremental customer value; create content that is of value to customers, partners and the sales organization; Following up with the customers to ensure the solution is well implemented, and successfully used by the customers. Coordinate and communicate about all aspects of the project with other teams, such as Sales, Presales, Support, Product Management and Engineering Improve Customer and Partners satisfaction Write Services documentation Contribute to our OnLine community by publishing articles, posts, etc This position requires 50% travel This position is remote within the US Seniority level: Mid-Senior Level Function: Consulting Qualifications Minimum of 5 years of experience in a consulting position Extensive technical knowledge Good troubleshooting skills Proven experience in at least one security operational domain (e.g. SOC, vulnerability assessment, pen testing, incident response) Excellent knowledge of the current industry security standards and regulations (e.g. ISO27k, PCI-DSS, GDRP, NIST) Comfortable with Risk Management frameworks, ideally with experience in risk assessments Excellent knowledge of the current Cyber threats landscape Security certification(s) such as CISSP, CISM, CCSK, CEH, ISO27 would be highly appreciated Good knowledge of IT operations in challenging environments Ability to quickly learn new technologies in an unsupervised environment Ability to articulate business value to senior stakeholders Demonstrated ability to collect customer feedbacks, handle them and understand customer pain points, coming out with a solution to it Excellent communication, customer facing and teamwork skills Exceptional analytical skills; outstanding communication and teamwork skills, social awareness Enthusiasm for working in an international, collaborative and fast-paced environment and learning new technologies Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Windows clients and applications, Linux is a plus Practical knowledge of SQL, XML, VBA. Practical experiences in data integration Education in computer science or strong background in IT roles Fluent in English (spoken and written).Additional InformationThis is an exceptional opportunity to join a fast-growing, successful and innovative company. Nexthink allows you to thrive in a unique work environment where the emphasis is on excellence, innovation, openness and collaboration.

ad.title: Digital Producer - The Integer Group - Dallas, TX
ad.content: The Integer Group is seeking a Digital Producer for our Dallas office. Everyone is a shopper. At all hours, day and night. In every imaginable place. So the landscape of what’s possible is limitless. We are curious, inventive and brave. We utilize cultural insights to fuel big ideas that connect with people where they are living, looking and buying, accelerating shoppers toward commerce. We call this connected creativity, and it places us at the Intersection of Branding and Selling®. Job Summary:The role is part of a high-performance team, with high expectations of all it's team members with one goal: to produce amazing digital experiences in line with the creative vision of the team and agency. You need to be a highly motivated, organized and passionate person that is willing to tackle demanding tasks and take responsibility for actions, using your initiative to make suggestions and working to make things happen. The ideal candidate will have an exceptional understanding of the functions, processes, and production requirements of digital and technical deliverables (web, mobile apps, interactive content, AR/VR experiential), and excel at managing delivery with the ability to define team and project objectives.DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Work with the team and our clients to understand the client’s marketing objectives and how each project fits into to their overall strategy. Develop project scope documents (including but not limited to functional and technical specifications and project plans), manage the development process to minimize scope creep and ensure on time and on-budget delivery. Create project communications plans, prepare status reports and conduct internal and external status meetings regularly as necessary to ensure effective issue resolution and quality project delivery. Attend (and in some cases lead) workshops and other discovery sessions to develop business requirements for projects. Communicate those requirements to the team and ensure that solutions meet those requirements. Work with the creative, account and development teams to brainstorm possible solutions to our client business needs and prepare estimates and timelines for Digital projects and work with our account teams to present them to clients as necessary. Manage the client relationship from approval to launch by conducting regular calls, monitoring and escalating project risks, soliciting client feedback, making modifications to deliverables and processes, and partnering with the client relationship manager to ensure client satisfaction. Develop detailed project plans for project delivery, communicate and track project milestones and monitor progress for all team members against plan. Ensure that all projects meet accepted best practices in usability and digital design and support agency developed branding and strategic initiatives. Manage third party vendors, including consultants, contractors, and product vendors as necessary in the delivery of projects, including gathering estimates, negotiating rates, and working with the finance team to ensure prompt settlement of invoices. Ongoing Keep on top of trends in digital development and project management through reading appropriate industry publications, Web sites, and e-mail lists as well as through attendance at conferences. Maintain relationships with top production vendors to ensure proper delivery of creative vision. Work with the Account, Creative and Insights & Strategy teams on process improvements, and other initiatives designed to improve the effectiveness and quality of Interactive delivery within the agency. QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS Bachelor’s degree in advertising, marketing, digital or equivalent experience. Minimum 2-5 years experience producing digital/online projects. Interactive agency experience a plus. Digital/interactive agency experience required Minimum 2+ years of experience producing digital/interactive projects Structured and proven foundation of Project Management activities and skills A great set of examples of digital/interactive campaigns that you have brought to fruition Proven experience leading the projects within the ecosystem of functions, platforms and stakeholders as it relates to the data, insights, and intel that will impact the constant evolution of digital properties Familiarity with a range of project management methodologies and tools Experience working with strong UX strategists/architects - solid foundation in being able to interpret and manage the development of site strategies, user flows/journeys, personas, sitemaps, wireframes, prototypes, and content strategies Foundational knowledge of software, tools, techniques, and various file formats used within digital deliverables Strong desire to keep up with emerging technologies and best practices with a passion to share and inspire those around you Excellent communication and problem-solving skills with high attention to detail and thoroughness in approach Ability to communicate and collaborate with colleagues, vendors, clients, and management and be able to translate concisely for non-savvy colleagues or clients Ability to work under tight deadlines within a fast-paced environment Participate in agency training Ability to travel as needed Flexibility to work extra hours with little or no advance notification About The Integer Group®The Integer Group® is the world's leading commerce agency, relentlessly focused on delivering Great Work That Works. We believe in creativity that is fueled by data, informed by culture, and delivered to the touch points that create connections and ultimately drive transaction. Through shopper marketing, retail strategy & design, eCommerce, integrated branding, and Commerce Connections Media, we accelerate conversion and build a brand's lifetime bond with its consumers. It's what we call living at the Intersection of Branding and Selling®. A key member of Omnicom Group Inc., The Integer Group has more than 1,100 associates in 25 offices across the globe, including locations in Africa, Asia, Australia, Europe, the Middle East, and North and South America. The Integer Group’s clients include AT&T, FedEx, Mars/Wrigley, Michelin, Nestlé, P&G, PepsiCo, Starbucks and more.www.integer.com

ad.title: Manager, Experience Initiatives - Northwell Health - Melville, NY
ad.content:
A successful Manager within Northwell Revenue Cycle, has a passion for delivering extraordinary service to our customers, who deserve and expect the ultimate in health system experiences. The Manager will be an exceptionally customer focused individual that will develop high touch, premium service experiences to drive revenue and satisfaction. We want extraordinary people who can surpass our customer’s expectations by providing a unique interaction with our organization that strives to drive high satisfaction and loyalty. 1. Responsible for day-to-day management and oversight of Revenue Cycle business line customer experience initiatives with a focus on driving new, innovative experiences and technology – including design, development and implementation coordination.
2. Coordinate ongoing revenue cycle customer journey mapping efforts; identify critical moments of truth across customer touchpoints
3. Establish process to recommend policy and/or procedure changes to eliminate customer and/or employee pain points; draft business case(s) to support recommended change(s)
4. Evaluate, prioritize and manage experience improvement efforts - including discovery, requirements gathering, planning, and implementation - to facilitate and enable end-to-end customer experiences that demonstrate Northwell’s culture of C.A.R.E. across multiple touchpoints
5. Responsible for employee and team engagement; identify mechanism(s) to measure engagement, identify issues and key drivers of engagement - monitor feedback, learn, and iteratively improve strategy
6. Set goals and craft plan(s) for improving overall engagement within Revenue Cycle, involving internal employees (supervisors, managers, etc.)
7. Support creation and standardization of overall Revenue Cycle business line Voice of Customer (VoC) strategy; identify baseline(s), implement overall program and processes to manage customer feedback and generate insights to identify opportunity improvements and drive positive, customer-centric change
8. Manage daily oversight of Revenue Cycle business line VoC surveys and overall program evolution; identify trends and key insights - determine plan for ongoing communication to key stakeholders
9. Ensure communication bridges are initiated and upheld between Revenue Cycle and other key stakeholder groups related to experience initiatives
10. Regularly partner with internal teams such as Patient Access Services, Marketing, Digital Patient Experience and Office of Patient & Customer Experience regarding experience related initiatives and associated coordination efforts 11. Responsible for advocating on behalf of the customer and supporting overall employee experience strategies; support readiness efforts for any change that impacts the customer
12. Participate in and contribute to experience strategy roadmap discussions; consider internal employee experience needs as well as optimizing external customer experiences 13. Team Subject Matter Expert with acute awareness of the broader market for any experience related trends; including pain points and expectations 14. Ensure compliance with all regulations, policies, and procedures Qualifications General:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or related field, required. Minimum of 3 - 5 years contact center, customer experience, loyalty marketing, retention strategy or relevant experience required. Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Visio). Strategy:
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills including the ability to develop/analyze business cases Meticulous attention to detail and follow-up; ability to apply a customer-focused lens to experience design and enhancement efforts Creative problem solver with the ability to ‘think on your feet’ and collaborate with various internal teams to provide in-depth solutions quickly and efficiently. Successful multi-tasker with the ability to quickly and confidently navigate several efforts in parallel, while managing time efficiently and effectively Communication:
Leadership and communication abilities to drive ideas across an organization; excellent customer service and problem resolution skills required. Clear and concise communicator, accomplished at building consensus without direct authority Ability to communicate complex analyses in a clear and actionable manner

ad.title: Digital Associate Creative Director - Mirum - Chicago, IL
ad.content: Digital Associate Creative Director The Digital Associate Creative Director is responsible for inspiring, training and directing teams to create effective shopper marketing digital experiences and interactive design solutions. From digital products and design systems to digitally-led marketing campaigns and activations, you infuse digital-first processes and thinking into all creative outputs across the team. The Digital Associate Creative Director has a strong affinity for business, strategy, a deep understanding of technology, and curiosity of what’s next. These attributes are evident when you are presenting work to clients or internally. Responsibilities: Be the lead creative for digital best practices across multiple shopper marketing creative teams – infusing digital knowledge throughout the team via ongoing training and mentorship of other creatives. Be a hands-on contributor for assigned projects and initiatives; provide your insights, expertise, ideas, designs and solutions. Create user flows and wireframes for digital experiences. Develop customer experience maps within a shopper marketing framework. Present your work and others’ work with a clear understanding of the assignment and strategy. Work closely with other ACDs, Creative Directors and the GCD in developing and evangelizing digital best practices across the creative team. Work quickly, independently and with a can-do attitude. Develop great relationships with clients, co-workers and partner agencies. Embrace, evolve and evangelize our methodologies, philosophies and commitment to Beautiful, Usable, Interesting, and Smart Design. Accountability: Complete commitment to project and client success Deepest understanding of client brands and customers Outstanding quality of your deliverables Be a leader, example and inspiration or our department Win awards because of your ideas, leadership and brilliant execution Strong communication skills and persuasive abilities Stability and maturity under pressure Ability to juggle multiple clients and assignments Qualifications: 7+ years of relevant [Digital, Social, Shopper Marketing] agency experience Breathtaking portfolio of amazing digital design work Experience creating and designing omnichannel deliverables Experience in .com, mobile, video, motion and installation design Experience in complex UI design, product design and application An overall understanding of Web production and the capabilities within digital channels Disclaimer: It is expected that you will perform additional duties and assume additional responsibilities as needed by the Company for the efficient operation of the Company. In addition, in order to adjust to changes in our business, it may become necessary to modify your job description, add to or remove certain duties and responsibilities, or reassign you to an alternate job position. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

ad.title: Production/Manufacturing - 1st Shift - Associated Materials - Fife, WA
ad.content: $15 an hourJob DescriptionWe are looking for production associates to join our team. Our plant positions assemble, process, and ship all components for the windows and doors produced at this location. JOB SUMMARY: Successful candidates for our plant must have the ability to keep up with the physical requirements within a fast paced physically demanding and repetitive work environment, which includes moderate to heavy lifting or working with large and heavy pieces of window units. These positions are physically demanding and SAFETY is our top priority! SHIFTS: DAY SHIFT (6:00AM- 4:30 PM) (Saturday's during busy season Mar-Oct) Starting pay $15/hr QUALIFICATIONS / JOB FUNCTIONS: Experience in a hands on manufacturing environment or experience in window manufacturing preferred Excellent hand / eye coordination Ability to understand and calculate fractional measurements Able to read a tape measure to the 16th of an inch Use of hand tools and basic computer skills preferred but not required Safety oriented – Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) must be worn at ALL times Able and willing to be trained and learn different areas of production Ability to stand for long periods of time & Moderate to Heavy lifting will be involved Excellent attendance (ability to arrive to work on time, as scheduled on a daily basis) WORK ENVIRONMENT: Manufacturing environment with exposure to seasonal temperatures (winter & summer), equipment noise, moving glass and window products, and equipment. Benefits: Here at AMI our Employees who meet eligibility requirements are eligible for benefits the 1st of the month following 60 days of employment. We offer Medical, Dental, Vision, Company paid Life Insurance, paid holidays and vacation time. Also we offer a 401k that matches as soon as you are eligible for benefits! Must be able to pass a pre-employment drug screen and criminal background check Qualifications Some past experience working in a fast-paced environment while on your feet for extended hours i.e. lawn maintenance, delivery drivers, construction, etc. Prior experience working in a production or warehouse environment is preferred. Must be able to stand for long periods of time.Additional InformationAssociated Materials is the parent company for leading building product brands such as Alside, Gentek, Revere, Alpine and Preservation. With a legacy of over 65 years in business, we create, develop, manufacture, extrude and distribute beautiful siding, windows and more throughout our network of North American company-owned distributors. If you’re searching for a rewarding career, consider AMI! All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. #Indeed - Associated

ad.title: Manager, Operations- Weekend Shift - Abercrombie and Fitch Co. - Columbus, OH
ad.content: Job DescriptionOur distribution network is built to deliver stock to our stores and fulfill direct-to-consumer orders with speed and efficiency. Merchandise is shipped to our distribution centers ("DCs”), where it is received and inspected before being shipped to stores or direct-to-consumer customers. Our two company-owned DCs are in New Albany, Ohio and total more than 2 million sq. ft. By joining the Abercrombie and Fitch Co. team, you will become part of a world-class leader in retail, while utilizing your skills and talents in a fast-paced environment. The Operations Manager is responsible for overseeing a portion Direct to Consumer (DTC) fulfilment operation, including managing multiple supervisors and directing a large group of hourly associates. Core functions include coaching, training, counseling and motivating the team as a mentor, as well as their supervisor. This position will lead the department to meet and exceed internal and external customer expectations by focusing on achieving department goals and initiatives. The Manager should exhibit innovative, forward thinking, continually improving and strengthening the business by challenging the status quo. QualificationsWhat will you be doing? Ensuring department goals are being met including order aging, accuracy and fill rate.. Working with leadership across all shifts to maintain process consistency. Operating cross-functionally with key business partners. Working well in group problem solving situations; Developing alternative solutions. Ensuring the business is running effectively and efficiently on a daily basis. Driving department results and managing department hours to achieve predetermined budget and UPH goals. Identifying and driving departmental budget goals. Fostering and reinforcing a positive, collaborative environment that respects and values diversity. Promoting safety awareness and supporting the safety culture through the company. What will you need to bring? A four-year degree (B.S. or B.A.). Strong leadership style with a focus on team development. Experience in working with engineered and/or discreet standards. Proven experience in leading and driving process improvements. Ability to react to unforeseen challenges with creativity and a strong sense of urgency. Strong background in large scale distribution processes is a plus. Excellent computer skills, including experience with Microsoft Office programs. 3-5 years of leadership experience preferred, specifically leading exempt associates. Ability to multi-task in a fast paced environment. Experience with WMS systems. Outstanding written and face to face communication skills. Willingness to work a Friday- Sunday scheduleAdditional InformationABERCROMBIE & FITCH CO. IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY / AFFIRMATIVE ACTION EMPLOYER © ABERCROMBIE & FITCH CO. 2012

ad.title: Technician, Assistant Technology Support Specialist, 260 day, 8 hrs/day - Lincoln Public Schools - Lincoln, NE
ad.content:
Assistant Technology Support Specialist - Multiple Positions Available
Computing Services
The Assistant Technology Support Specialist is assigned to work as part of a team to provide technology support in the district. This individual provides direct support services and supervised repair services related to Chromebooks. This individual also assists in providing support for workstation computers, peripherals, network devices, and software/applications.
Demonstrable experience troubleshooting computer operating systems. Verifiable experience working in a fast paced, customer centric information technology environment. Excellent oral and written communication skills are essential.
Review of applications to continue until all positions are filled.

ad.title: Sales Manager - Brookdale Senior Living - Stuart, FL
ad.content:
Overview Full Time Sales Manager Brookdale Stuart – 3401 South East Aster Lane, Stuart, FL 34994
Every day is an opportunity for our associates to deeply connect with people in a profound and personal way. Our associates are the core of our mission and we know that offering them genuine rewards and heart filling job satisfaction is the key to our success as a company. Here you'll find opportunities to grow your career at any level whether you have direct contact with resident or support someone who does, and be inspired personally. With over 60,000 associates, there's a place for you to make a difference in lives of the families we serve throughout our continuum of care.
Responsibilities We are looking for a sales/marketing professional with a proven track record of generating and closing qualified leads. As our Sales Manager, you will partner with the executive director and regional sales managers to improve occupancy at our community. We will provide you with the training and support to develop referral sources and bring in new residents. This position can be highly rewarding from both a compensation and community service standpoint. We have recently increased payout opportunities based on growing occupancy, which reward all commissionable sales associates in a community or selling network. Come be part of a team committed to improving the lives of seniors. We're passionate about serving seniors…are you? Now's your chance to build your sales career with us. Brookdale. Bringing new life to senior living. Your responsibilities: * Maintain and/or improve community occupancy level and revenue production in accordance with business and marketing plans * Manage sales process by understanding prospective residents' needs and educating them about the community's services and programs * Coordinate and complete all activities needed for sales, including visiting prospects' homes, conducting initial assessments or sales presentations, and ensuring all required forms are completed prior to move-in * Increase community awareness through participation in outside events, professional groups and local community involvement Qualifications Education and Experience
Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business, or related field from an accredited college or university is preferred, or equivalent combination of experience and education is required. A minimum of two to five years sales experience, preferably in the retirement industry or medical or pharmaceutical sales, with a proven track record of generating and closing a high percentage of qualified leads is required.
Certifications, Licenses, and Other Special Requirements
Frequent car travel requires the incumbent to possess and maintain a valid driver's license.
Management/Decision Making
Applies existing guidelines and procedures to make varied decisions within a department. Uses sounds judgement and experience to solve moderately complex problems based on precedent, example, reasonableness or a combination of these.
Knowledge and Skills
Possesses extensive knowledge of a distinct skill or function and a thorough understanding of the organization and work environment. Has working knowledge of a functional discipline. Knowledge of sales and marketing to include principles and methods for showing, promoting and selling products or services to include marketing strategy and tactics, sales techniques, and sales control systems. Knowledge of Medicare and Medicaid regulations to include applicable processes for the product line(s) being sold. Knowledge of state regulations impacting or directing the delivery of services. Ability to operate smart-phones, personal computers and related software. Ability to effectively manage time, tasks and projects in a dynamic environment is required. Ability to build trust and act honestly in relationships with others. Ability to assess and understand customers' expectations, needs and circumstances. Ability to work effectively with diverse personalities and to treat people with dignity, respect, fairness and maturity. Ability to effectively listen and communicate verbally and in writing is essential.
If you are a Brookdale associate, please consider referring someone through the Good People Program! Brookdale is an EOE-(Equal Opportunity Employer) and drug-free workplace. Brookdale offers a number of benefits to full-time associates including, but not limited to: medical, dental, vision, disability, life, paid time off, educational reimbursement. All associates, age 21 and older, are eligible to participate in the 401(k) retirement savings plan. Schedule: Regular Full-Time

ad.title: Healthcare Administrative Assistant - Atlanta GA - Brookdale Senior Living - Roswell, GA
ad.content:
Overview Every day is an opportunity for our associates to deeply connect with people in a profound and personal way. Our associates are the core of our mission and we know that offering them genuine rewards and heart filling job satisfaction is the key to our success as a company. Here you'll find opportunities to grow your career at any level whether you have direct contact with resident or support someone who does, and be inspired personally. With over 60,000 associates, there's a place for you to make a difference in lives of the families we serve throughout our continuum of care.
Responsibilities Performs various administrative and clerical functions to include filing, faxing, scheduling, reporting, tracking, data collection and entry, etc. that are required to maintain an organized, efficient, and functional agency. Responsible for maintaining personnel records, on-boarding new associates, and assists with payroll and HR questions, as directed by supervisor. Completes special projects as assigned by management team. Submits, receives, organizes, and communicates insurance verification forms, orders, etc. and faxes, as assigned for purposes of medical and personnel records inventory management.Assists with inputting, retrieving, compiling, and printing report data from Brookdale Senior Living software, HomeCare HomeBase (HCHB), Rehab Optima (RO), etc. as directed by the leadership team. Examples include the Records Inventory Management (RIM) report, RO Closeout report, HCHB and PointCare reports, labor reports, the Manager tool, payroll reports, spend down report, etc.Retrieves, opens and sorts mail received at the agency and provides indicated follow-up communication to team members.Assists with document compilation, copying, and submission of Additional Development Requests (ADRs) to the Brookdale Appeals team.Travels to communities to assist team and or visitors with filing, faxing, copying, office organization, agency compliance activity (i.e. Temperature checks, sanitizing equipment, etc.) and new associate orientation, as assigned.Responsible for tracking and maintaining associate personnel files and required personnel file documentation. Completes personnel records filing and personnel records updates as assigned. Assists in the On-Boarding process of new associates and assists answering associate payroll and HR questions.Facilitates communication with local agency office personnel, Central Office Associates, Patient Account Representatives, and any Brookdale home office team members, as indicated and/or assigned (e.g. assists with accounts payable, payroll and Paid Time Off (PTO) needs or issues).Reviews and updates PTO and compares to calendar and submits for approval requests in coordination with management team. Maintains assigned team PTO Calendars.Assists with weekly schedule of management staff.Assists management team in preparing for network management meetings to include making copies, working with office or the community for meeting space, lunch, etc.Assists with scheduling candidate interviews for management team assigned for designated positions and candidates. Completes candidate and vacancy updates with recruiting team as requested.Completes supply, marketing material, training material orders and follows-up with supply orders, as assigned. Serves as primary contact for new office lease, movers, deliveries, etc.Maintains positive relationships and rapport with co-workers, associates, patients, and their family members and community personnel.Adheres to communication and accountability guidelines established by local and regional administration.Maintains a safe and clean work area and adheres to agency safety standards.Adheres to established confidentiality standards as required by Brookdale and HIPAA concerning community and patient information. This job description represents an overview of the responsibilities for the above referenced position. It is not intended to represent a comprehensive list of responsibilities. An associate should perform all duties as assigned by his/her supervisor.
Qualifications Education and ExperienceHigh school diploma or general education degree (GED); or one year related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Certifications, Licenses, and Other Special RequirementsNone
Management/Decision MakingMakes standard and routine decisions based on detailed guidelines with little independent judgment. Problems are generally solved with clear, detailed guidelines or by reporting them to a supervisor. Knowledge and SkillsHas a basic level of a skill and can follow written or verbal instructions. Has basic technical skills to complete a few repetitive and well-defined duties. Has a basic knowledge of the organization in order to answer basic questions. Effective written and oral communication skills are essential. Basic typing skills are essential along with basic knowledge of PC's and word processing software, preferably in a Microsoft Windows environment.
Physical Demands and Working Conditions
Standing Walking Sitting Use hands and fingers to handle or feel Reach with hands and arms Climb or balance Stoop, kneel, crouch crawl Talk or hear Taste or smell Ability to lift: up to 50 pounds Vision Requires interaction with co-workers, residents or vendors Occasional weekend, evening or night work if needed to ensure shift coverage Possible exposure to communicable diseases and infections Exposure to latex Possible exposure to blood-borne pathogens Possible exposure to various drugs, chemical, infectious, or biological hazards Subject to injury from falls, burns, odors, or cuts from equipment Requires Travel: Frequently Brookdale is an equal opportunity employer and a drug-free workplace.Schedule: Regular Full-Time
