ad.title: Sr. Principal Quality Analyst IV - Northrop Grumman - Clearfield, UT
ad.content: Sr. Principal Quality Analyst: Northrop Grumman Innovation Systems designs, builds and delivers space, defense and aviation-related systems to customers around the world. Our main products include launch vehicles and related propulsion systems; missile products, subsystems and defense electronics; precision weapons, armament systems and ammunition; satellites and associated space components and services; and advanced aerospace structures. Northrop Grumman is currently seeking a Sr. Principal Quality Analyst to provide support to ourACS Program Team. (Must have current and Active Secret Clearance to be considered) Role Description and Responsibilities: Ensures performance and quality products conform to established company and regulatory standards. Reviews, analyzes and reports on quality discrepancies related to assembly, process, mechanical, electrical and electro-mechanical systems. Investigates problems and develops disposition and corrective actions for recurring discrepancies. Interfaces with manufacturing, engineering, customer, vendor and subcontractor representatives to ensure requirements are met. Recommends corrective actions, dispositions and modifications. Candidate will work in an industrial environment and support solving complex engineering problems. Will effectively interact with design engineering team and provide support across Factory Value Streams,Materials and Process experts, Process engineering,and Tool Design. Skills and Qualifications: Emphasis in coursework or prior experience in the following areas required: Application of Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (ANSI/AMSE Y14.5) Dimensional Inspection Techniques Root Cause Analysis and Corrective Action Strong knowledge of MRB (Material Review Board) standards. Strong understanding of PES (Lean) principles with experience leading and implementing significant improvements. Engineering Design, Solids of Mechanics, Design of Experiments, Systems Engineering and Statistics Microsoft Office Suite Strong working knowledge of AS9100 Experience in implementation and maintenance of risk management Experience developing, collecting, and analyzing metrics Demonstrated ability to present information to a variety of stakeholders and to package (arrange/assemble) data in a manner consistent with the target audience Customer Interface Routinely coordinates technical issues with various programs and customers with no supervision. Candidate should have experience in the following areas: Digital inspection techniques using Leica and Romer arm equipment Experience using and programming CMMs Mechanical Design Tooling Computer Aided Design and Software i.e. Verisurf, Cameo, CAD/CAM, etc. Understanding of Continuous Improvement concepts, process and tools. Qualified candidate must have excellent written and verbal communication skills. They should be a great problem solver and critical thinker. They should also be a self-starter and independent worker and have the ability to multi task. Education and Experience Requirements: Nine years' experience with BS degree or 15+ year's equivalent experience in quality or, Six years' quality experience with MS degree Demonstrated leadership Demonstrated Customer Interface Preferred Experience: Quality and Lean certifications QCMR (Quality Control Material Review) authority or history of authority. Familiar with Six Sigma concepts Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

ad.title: Systems Technical Analyst - Northrop Grumman - Raleigh, NC
ad.content: Northrop Grumman is seeking an Information Systems Technical Analyst with large enterprise deployment, and remote system support experience to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals. This position will be located in Raleigh, NC. This is an on-site position with no telecommute possibilities. This position is part of the Northrop Grumman's ETS Contract with the United States Postal Service, bringing top of the line professional technologists to their teams. Roles and Responsibilities:Support 49,000+ USPS retail systems at 19,000+ sites worldwide. Systems include Point-of-Sales terminals and self-service kiosks. Automating operational tasks Troubleshoot LAN, WAN, and network infrastructure issues as they relate to retail systems Operating system and software upgrades in a very large enterprise environment Work independently with minimal supervision or as a part of a team. May be required to create time sensitive deliverables. Must be available for on-call or non-standard hours Basic Qualifications:To be considered for this position, you must minimally meet the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed below: Bachelor's degree in a relevant field and 7+ years of relevant experience or 9+ years of relevant experience Extensive knowledge of and experience with PowerShell and PowerShell scripting Experience with SCCM and WSUS and knowledge of MS Windows server, desktop operating systems and Windows registry Knowledge of local and wide area networks in an environment utilizing MS Windows and TCP/IP, to include DNS, WINS, and DHCP Experience with remote desktop and server support. Experience working with and administering Windows Active Directory, to include GPO's, creating/modifying users and groups, assigning rights to directories, troubleshooting domain issues with clients Experience with patch management at the enterprise level. Ability to develop and maintain IT documentation. Familiarity with change management in a large enterprise environment Must be able to work independently and have a demonstrated ability to do ad hoc and proactive technical research Must be able to obtain a Position of Public Trust Clearance US Citizen or Permanent Resident (Green Card Holder), and must not have traveled outside the US for a combined total of 6 months or more in last 5 years. Must have resided in the US for the last 5 years Preferred Qualifications:Candidates with these desired skills will be given preferential consideration: Experience with packaging applications and application updates for remote deployment to a large enterprise Familiarity with PCI and SOX compliance requirements Experience with ServiceNow service management software Experience with Point of Sales hardware and peripherals Experience working in a large enterprise environment Experience creating and deploying images Experience installing, configuring and troubleshooting PC hardware and peripherals Experience testing PC hardware and software Microsoft certification Network certification ITIL certification Working knowledge of USPS networks Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

ad.title: AEM Technical Architect - Perficient - Pleasanton, CA
ad.content: OverviewAt Perficient you’ll deliver mission-critical technology and business solutions to Fortune 500 companies and some of the most recognized brands on the planet. And you’ll do it with cutting-edge technologies, thanks to our close partnerships with the world’s biggest vendors. Our network of offices across North America, as well as locations in India and China, will give you the opportunity to spread your wings, too. We’re proud to be publicly recognized as a “Top Workplace” year after year. This is due, in no small part, to our entrepreneurial attitude and collaborative spirit that sets us apart and keeps our colleagues impassioned, driven, and fulfilled. About Our Adobe National Business Unit: The Adobe Practice at Perficient was established in 2010 and has expanded to a global presence. We offer a wide array of solution offerings that help our customers create more meaningful connection points with their audiences across all channels. Our digital technologists help forge the path toward the connected enterprise by using the complete Adobe Digital Marketing technology stack. Perficient is currently looking for a hands on Adobe AEM Technical Architect for our National Adobe Digital Marketing Practice. This position will be located in the Bay Area, California. If not local, client tavel expectation is up to 75%. When not on the client site, work will be done remote from home. Job Overview: The AEM Technical Architect for Adobe will play a vital role in the architecture design, testing and deployment of Adobe Digital Marketing solutions, including Adobe Experience Management, Adobe Analytics, and Adobe Target. You will work closely with clients, developers, system administrators, project managers, business analysts and end users to build a state-of-the-art Digital Marketing Platform using Adobe's Digital Marketing suite of products. Responsibilities Install and configure Adobe Experience Manager for on premise solutions or cloud based solutions. Architect and design the component model that will be used to construct a Digital platform for both web and mobile using Adobe Experience Manager for global enterprises. Key understanding of AEM Managed Services Streamlining components and templates to work across multiple digital properties (medicare net; school of medicine, microsites) Ability to take a hands on approach to resolving complex code issues Configure OSGI settings for an AEM install base. Install and Configure core code bundles for AEM related projects. Effectively communicate physical architectural designs to customers and present design options/considerations. Help to establish overarching program goals and objectives in the Digital marketing program for a customer. Hands on development of AEM templates and components leveraging AEM Sightly framework. Employ strong coding standards for efficiency, readability, and reuse. Help design analytics scenarios Design Content targeting Scenarios and architect how those scenarios will be implemented in AEM and Adobe Target.QualificationsExperience in architecting at least 2 large implementation of Adobe Experience Manager. (6.0 and later required; AEM 6.4 is a plus) Experience in designing content lifecycle using Adobe and Adobe Marketing tools. Strong leadership and communication skills Minimum 6 years of experience in Web Content Management and 10 years of IT experience. Strong JEE and front-end technology experience in Angular, JQuery, SASS, CSS Hands-on architect, to do Proof of concepts and building framework as needed. Good to have mobile hybrid application development experience SOA development experience using NodeJS and related technologies Experience in complete project life cycle activities on development and maintenance projects. Knowledge and experience in developing software using agile methodologies. Proven track record of technical leadership roles delivering solutions within defined timeframes. Skilled in building relationships with clients and in practice development activities. Demonstrated success in performing work and managing complex and/or large consulting projects. Excellent written and oral communication skills; Ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical staff. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field. Must be open to travel. Preferred Skills and Education: Experience working with a globally distributed team and managing off-shore teams. Master’s degree in Computer Science or related field. Certification in (Insert technologies). Experience with authoring, editing and presenting technical documents. Perficient full-time employees receive complete and competitive benefits. We offer a collaborative work environment, competitive compensation, generous work/life opportunities and an outstanding benefits package that includes paid time off plus holidays. In addition, all colleagues are eligible for a number of rewards and recognition programs including billable bonus opportunities. Encouraging a healthy work/life balance and providing our colleagues great benefits are just part of what makes Perficient a great place to work. More About PerficientPerficient is the leading digital transformation consulting firm serving Global 2000 and enterprise customers throughout North America. With unparalleled information technology, management consulting and creative capabilities, Perficient and its Perficient Digital agency deliver vision, execution and value with outstanding digital experience, business optimization and industry solutions. Our work enables clients to improve productivity and competitiveness; grow and strengthen relationships with customers, suppliers and partners; and reduce costs. Perficient's professionals serve clients from a network of offices across North America and offshore locations in India and China. Traded on the Nasdaq Global Select Market, Perficient is a member of the Russell 2000 index and the S&P SmallCap 600 index. Perficient is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national, origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Disclaimer: The above statements are not intended to be a complete statement of job content, rather to act as a guide to the essential functions performed by the employee assigned to this classification. Management retains the discretion to add or change the duties of the position at any time. #LI-SG1

ad.title: Electric Sector Analyst Intern - Sierra Club - Oakland, CA
ad.content:
InternshipJob Title: Electric Sector Analyst InternDepartment: ConservationLocation: OaklandDuration: Up to 10 weeks, 37.5 hours per weekContext: The intern will work with campaign and analytical team staff to help apply results of a study on clean energy portfolios to coal plants and proposed new gas plants.Scope: The intern will support the electric sector analysts of the Beyond Coal and Dirty Fuels campaigns in applying clean energy portfolio data to specific coal and gas units to help inform our on the ground advocacy, as we fight for a just transition to a 100% clean energy future. Job Activities:
Analyzing and data gathering from Integrated Resource Plans for regulated utilities Organizing datasets on generation and capacity portfolios for utilities Designing and running scenarios using Excel, Python, and other tools Helping analyst team to interpret and communicate results to state based campaign teams across the country
Knowledge & Skills:
Working knowledge of energy sector and one or more cross-cutting components such as economics, finance, or policy Knowledge or willingness to learn about environmental justice and incorporate related datasets into ongoing analysis Collaborates well in a team environment, sharing knowledge and skills while seeking out mentorship as needed Preferred: currently enrolled in a graduate program in economics, public policy, engineering, or other technical discipline Preferred: proficiency with Excel Preferred: some Python experience, or willingness to learnSierra Club is a 501(c)(4) non-profit organization.Sierra Club employees are not eligible to participate in the Federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF) Program.Sierra Club does not sponsor H1B visas.The Sierra Club is an equal opportunity employer committed to workforce diversity Back Share Apply Now

ad.title: Analyst - Technology - Southwest Airlines - Dallas, TX
ad.content: We are committed to provide our Employees a stable work environment with equal opportunity for learning and personal growth. Creativity and innovation are encouraged for improving the effectiveness of Southwest Airlines. Above all, Employees will be provided the same concern, respect, and caring attitude within the organization that they are expected to share externally with every Southwest Customer. WORK ACTIVITIES/CONTEXT: Technical Expertise: Effectively applies knowledge and skills of analysis, business processes, tools, domains, project methodologies, requirements definitions, and testing to solve a range of problems. Partners with other Technology Teammembers to provide advice or solutions within his or her area of expertise. Stays informed about current developments within his or her expertise. Analytical Expertise: Identifies problems, performs root cause analysis, investigates information, performs impact analysis, and formulates and executes plans to develop solutions. Identifies strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to problems. Understands and can estimate effort and value for solutions Understands at a broad level how technology platforms/architectures are applied to automated business solutions. Business Knowledge: Actively engaged in industry, domain, process, or technology trends. Task Management: Acts as a coordination and facilitation point for organizing work efforts. Sets up or follows established procedures to ensure high quality of work. Understands dependency identification processes in technology work, verifies information and carefully reviews and checks the accuracy of own work. Establishes or follows prioritization process to drive work, and has a sense of urgency about getting work completed. Looks for and seizes opportunities to do more or to do things better. Communication: Appropriately shares ideas and information with others. Practices attentive and active listening. Ensures that regular and consistent communications take place. Expresses ideas as well as business or technical requirements clearly and concisely in writing using appropriate levels of summary and synthesis. Expresses oneself clearly in conversation and interaction with others. Must be able to meet any physical ability requirements listed on this description. May perform other job duties as directed by Employee’s Leaders. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:High School Diploma, GED or equivalent education required. Must be at least 18 years of age. Must have authorization to work in the United States as defined by the Immigration Reform Act of 1986. EDUCATION: BS, Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or Information Systems, or formal training preferred. WORK EXPERIENCE: 2 - 4 years work experience as an Analyst or equivalent position required. PHYSICAL ABILITIES: May be asked on occasions to lift and/or pull weights loads of approx. 20 lbs. on a periodic basis. May require extended work hours per Leaders' request. May be asked to climb, bend, kneel, crawl, and stoop on a periodic basis. SKILLS/ABILITIES/KNOWLEDGE/WORK STYLE:Core Knowledge: Proficient knowledge of business analysis, process modeling and redesign. Proficient knowledge of technical environments. Proficient knowledge of software development methodologies. Critical Skills: Proficient partnering, communication, and negotiation skills in working with various Teams and/or external partners. Able to analyze medium to large Business or technical problems, articulating the problem or root cause, and translating the analysis into viable solution recommendations. Able to work effectively in a strong Customer service / team oriented environment. Able to research, create, and document requirements, processes, and technical specifications. Able to manage and prioritize multiple and widely varied work streams / tasks. Able to take on multiple assignments, whether administrative or project related, while maintaining a successful level of completion in all responsible work. Able to mentor others to do the same. Able to prioritize effectively. Able to develop, present and effectively communicate ideas and strategies to a variety of audiences. Able to teach and mentor others concerning technical and business subjects. Must be able to comply with Company attendance standards as described in established guidelines. OTHER QUALIFICATIONS: Limited travel with potential for increased/decreased travel based upon Technology Department needs. Must maintain a well-groomed appearance per Company appearance standards as described in established guidelines. Southwest Airlines is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

ad.title: Senior Technical Project Manager - Fashion Nova - Los Angeles, CA
ad.content:
About Us Fashion Nova is one of the top e-commerce brands in the world! In 2018, we became the #1 most-searched fashion brand on Google. Our headquarters is centrally located in the heart of Los Angeles, with 5 retail locations throughout Southern California. At Fashion Nova, we make it easy and affordable for our customers to be their own fashion icon. We believe everyone deserves to look like a million bucks, without breaking the bank. Fashion Nova is devoted to delivering the most sought-after, head-turning, up-to-the-moment trends, to anyone, anywhere in the world! Our customers' outward image reflects the confidence they feel inside. They are bad-ass, fashion-forward, and in control of their own destiny. "Nova style" is making the rules, and breaking the rules; our customer is the leader of the pack, the last one standing, in the front row, and always on the list. About the Role FashionNova is currently looking for a Technical Project Manager. As the Technical Project Manager, you would be responsible for focusing on the successful deployment of cross-functional strategic projects. In addition, you will work in collaboration with key business stakeholders, other Project Managers, Product Managers, Developers and QA personnel to shepherd projects to production in a repeatable, predictable and timely manner, to be the driving force for the team to ensure deadlines and project outcomes are met. The right candidate is a strong communicator with heavy experience in an agile environment, who is not easily frazzled by volume or deadlines. This role is critical in spearheading change and optimization of the execution process by ensuring cross-functional projects are running according to timelines. This position will report to the Director, Strategic Delivery. Responsibilities: Manages highly complex, cross functional projects impacting the enterprise Scope and deliver multiple projects at any given time with a track record of delivering projects on-time and within budget Defining new process and workflows that improve efficiency of a delivery team and adjust process according to company needs and structure. Own full project life cycle: define, manage, and execute project activities including adherence to delivery schedules, stakeholder, scope and risk management, budget control, and critical path scheduling The ability to present to all levels within the company and work with both technical and non-technical individuals, as this role is immersed with cross-functional teams (Product, Engineers, etc.) Adheres to best practice project management methodology and PMO standards Status reporting and executive level reporting as necessary for critical projects Identify complex project risks, develop risk mitigations, and implement action plans to reduce or eliminate project risks. Manage external contracts and suppliers where required Ensures alignment of project objectives and activities with the overall corporate strategy and roadmap
Required Skills: Minimum of 7-8 years of project management experience in a software development pm role 7-8 years of experience in a role managing the development and implementation of complex process, program or software development projects 7-8 years of experience in a role managing a project team of at least 20+ members from multiple business units or geographic locations Must demonstrate proficiency in project management discipline and advanced software tools required to execute the responsibilities of the position such as Atlassian's Jira and Confluence. Experience defining workflows and processes in Fast Paced, Agile & Distributed model and ability to model those processes using tools like whiteboarding, Visio, LucidChart, PowerPoint or mind maps Ability to operate as a Systems Analyst as required Excellent written and verbal communication skills Excellent Facilitation and Executive management Skills Prior Experience in retail apparel and/or e-commerce companies PMP, ACP, Scrum Master, ITIL, Lean or other project management certifications with demonstrable application desired. Fluency with Microsoft Office and related business applications 4-year degree or equivalent experience required Strong meeting management skills to actively engage participants in productive work sessions Ability to work collaboratively and demonstrate effective teamwork and leadership Negotiation and convincing skills to challenge business and IT users on their assumptions and help craft innovative and effective solutions Willingness to step outside the PM role when needed Ability to work autonomously, proactively and effectively in a fast-paced environment
Pluses: Retail industry experience Order Management or Supply Chain Experience in working on complex integration projects
What's Cool About Us
Amazing employee discount program Celebrate every milestone we hit on Instagram with good food and music Company sponsored Medical (HSA, HMO, PPO), Dental (DMO & DPO), Vision, Company Paid Life Insurance & Voluntary Insurance 401k Retirement Plan Unlimited PTO

ad.title: Technology Risk - Consultant - CohnReznick - New York, NY
Global Accounts Payable Shared Services Manager - LexisNexis - Dayton, OH
ad.content: Global Accounts Payable Shared Services Manager The Global Accounts Payable Shared Services Manager is responsible for managing worldwide accounts payable activities for LexisNexis Legal & Professional and LexisNexis Risk Solutions business units, as well as RELX US shared functions. The AP activities include, but are not limited to, supplier invoice and travel & expense report processing, closing AP sub-ledger, recording expense accruals, performing internal controls including SOX controls, managing the global supplier database, forecasting trade payables and reporting AP metrics. The Global AP Shared Services Manager works collaboratively with business partners worldwide, ensuring compliance with company policies and local laws, aligning procedures with RELX and integrating acquired companies into Global AP Shared Services. The Global AP Shared Services Manager directs the activities of the Global AP team located in Philippines as well as team members in US, UK, Europe and Asia. While the position is based in Dayton, OH, the role is expected to occasionally visit the Global AP team in Philippines. Job DutiesAccurate, timely and complete processing of all AP transactions and coding to the GLHire, train, evaluate, lead and develop staffIdentify, contract and own relationships with third-party suppliers to compliment AP shared services group in non-English speaking countriesDevelop, implement and enforce policies and proceduresWork collaboratively with the AP shared services group and review department performance via monthly AP SLA metricsMaintain effective relationships with business partners through timely and accurate payment and response to inquiriesAccurate and timely completion of AP month-end closing processesPrepare, review and analyze select GL account reconciliations, journal entries and accrualsCoordinate with Procurement, IT and Facilities to ensure efficient and accurate purchase order processing, matching, and resolution of discrepanciesAssist RELX Procurement with management of corporate credit card programs, including policies and procedures and address escalated issuesOversee electronic systems interfaces within PeopleSoft ERP and Perceptive workflow systemsIdentify process improvements and new approaches to processes to scale with company growthSupervise maintenance and filing of AP records in accordance with company guidelinesReview account activity in AP and monitor trends in supplier invoice processing or aging while escalating priority issues timelyLead or participate in special projects to enhance AP technology or to resolve issues raised by other departmentsProvide payables KPI's and other metrics to senior management for measuring efficienciesMonitor, maintain and enhance controls in relation to the AP and cash disbursement functionsCollaborate on audits with RELX Audit & Risk Management and RELX ComplianceAssist with Sarbanes-Oxley and other compliance requirementsPrepare annual 1099 form, escheatment, and other AP compliance reporting requirementsResponsible for ad-hoc reporting, special projects and other duties as assigned.Position RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Accounting or FinanceMinimum 8 years of experience in Accounting/Finance and managing staffMust have excellent management skillsProven ability to multi-task, delegate and prioritize tasksStrong knowledge of AP and purchasing processes and ability to work dynamically with a variety of internal/external business partners and communicate financial concepts to non-finance peopleDemonstrated ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environmentExcellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal, conflict resolution, presentation and customer service skillsAbility to be flexible as a member of multiple teams and across functional areas as well as amongst all levels of managementEffective time management, work prioritization and delegation skillsExcellent analytical and business support skillsAble to learn new systems quickly and leverage them to increase efficiencies and quality of business processes LexisNexis Legal & Professional (www.lexisnexis.com) is a leading global provider of content and technology solutions that enable professionals in legal, corporate, tax, government, academic and non-profit organizations to make informed decisions and achieve better business outcomes. As a digital pioneer, the company was the first to bring legal and business information online with its Lexis and Nexis services. Today, LexisNexis Legal & Professional harnesses leading-edge technology and world-class content, to help professionals work in faster, easier and more effective ways. Through close collaboration with its customers, the company ensures organizations can leverage its solutions to reduce risk, improve productivity, increase profitability and grow their business. Part of RELX Group plc, LexisNexis Legal & Professional serves customers in more than 100 countries with 10,000 employees worldwide. LexisNexis, a division of RELX Group, is an equal opportunity employer: qualified applicants are considered for and treated during employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, national origin, citizenship status, disability status, protected veteran status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. ad.title: Senior Accountant - Breg - Carlsbad, CA
ad.content:
Are you looking for an exciting opportunity?
We currently have a full-time opening for a Senior Accountant in Carlsbad, CA. If you are looking for a fast paced environment where you can make a difference every day, then this is the opportunity for you!
Your day will be very busy… you will: Maintain the monthly trial balances, financials, runs consolidation and prepares related journal entries, analysis and communication to management. Act as liaison during the annual external audit and assists in preparation of the Audited Financial Statements, including Footnotes, in accordance with GAAP. Provide expertise in US GAAP, which involves mentoring team members and other departments, and implementing improvements to internal controls. Manage company leases and revenue recognition ensuring compliance with new accounting guidance. Complete monthly bank financial reports and perform accounting for Equity transactions. Prepare accurate general ledger account reconciliations and ensures that open items are resolved in a timely manner. This includes administering Accounting Close management software ensuring closing duties are assigned properly and completed timely. Complete special projects as needed including M&A integration. The right person to join our team is... Demonstrates ownership and accountability; the ability to communicate effectively both written and verbal; to exercise judgement effectively; to work successfully under tight deadlines while maintaining a high level of accuracy and attention to detail; demonstrates comfort with escalating issues and requesting support when needed.
What your background will be:
Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting is required. Active CPA license strongly preferred. 4+ years Accounting experience including Financial Reporting. Knowledge of US GAAP and SOX compliance is highly preferred. Former Big 4 and M&A experience is a plus. Strong analytical and technical skills are required. Strong computerized accounting skills and advanced spreadsheet skills; proficiency in the use of Oracle or similar ERP system strongly preferred. For four consecutive years Breg has been awarded The National Business Research Institute (NBRI) Circle of Excellence Award for employee engagement AND Breg has been awarded as one of the Best Places to work in San Diego in 2014 by “The U-T San Diego Top Workplaces”
If you meet the requirements above and would like to apply for this position, please visit our website at www.breg.com and click on the ‘Careers’ section.
Breg is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and dedicated to a diverse work force and Drug Free work environment. EOE/Minorities/Females/Vet/Disabled are encouraged to apply.

ad.title: Senior Applications Analyst - Finance EPM - Providence Health & Services - Beaverton, OR
ad.content:
Providence is calling a Senior Applications Analyst EPM to Providence Health & Services in Renton, WA. We are seeking a Senior Application Analyst to use a wide application of principles, theories, and concepts related to Finance and/or IS busines processes and ERP systems, to provide solutions to a diverse array of difficult problems. The individual in this position may lead medium project and work teams and will work on a number of complex business applications. Analyzes and evaluates existing or proposed systems and devices or modifies procedures to process data and solve problems. Review schedules, cost and documentation to ensure success of projects. Mentors and assists others in support of applications, projects and goals. Typically deals with users to determine appropriate requirements of complex systems. In this position you will have the following responsibilities: Involved in the implementation and ongoing daily support of business applications.
Work very closely with the organization’s Finance departments, vendors and contractors, and other IS caregivers to implement and maintain these applications.
Assist business partners with business requirements gathering and test planning including the creation of comprehensive end to end test plans.
Design, configure and test systems functionality changes, such as but not limited to creating flexfields, modifying fast formulas, building elements and table setup.
Consult with functional departments to identify necessary definition or changes to systems.
Coordinate with other IT areas who are responsible for file transfers, security administration, reporting, databases and other functions.
Help investigate and resolve system functional and technical errors. Troubleshoot on systems and data, and generate solutions which may include systems modifications enhancements or new procedures.
Identify and analyze operational and systems issues and opportunities and produce effective solutions
Identify and create standards and processes to support the application portfolio management.
Lead small to medium project teams as needed.
Manage upgrades for complex systems
Perform complex qualitative and/or quantitative analyses.
Prepare design specifications and test plans, test scenarios and test scripts.
Report, track, and resolve application related issues with internal and vendor support organizations
Understanding of applications that are supported within team, including how to deploy applications, customizations, design, and configuration.
Use in-depth information and analysis to provide management with advice and counsel on a variety of business issues. Issues are often highly technical and complex in nature.
Mentor less experienced analysts in use of tools, techniques, and analysis skills.
Perform rotational on-call responsibilities.
Collaborate with team members and demonstrate willingness to lend support and help.
Communicate effectively orally and in written form with multiple stakeholders within and across IS teams and business counterparts.
Create options analyses to facilitate decision-making
Define plans for post-deployment support, including engaging/preparing Service Desk, incorporating into operational support, etc.
Demonstrate a clear understanding of the difference between an issue and a risk; resolves lower-level issues independently and provides status; raises higher-level issues to management and independently proposes options and/or approach to resolve; anticipates and manages risks
Demonstrate whole systems thinking
Execute and deliver work thoroughly and with high quality; learn from mistakes and apply learning. Understand and manage inter-dependencies of work;
Guide end-users through UAT
Interpret and apply complex technical instructions and specifications.
Demonstrated ability to provide solutions considering applications beyond installed footprint.
Management of specific work items and/or projects, including: planning, scoping, estimation, status reporting.
Organize work, set priorities and meet critical deadlines.
Regularly demonstrate empathy and positive attitude in performing work and in working with others.
Share knowledge, insights and work among team members and partners.
Work effectively and professionally with all caregivers and leaders.
Organizational, interpersonal, and communications skills and the ability to manage shifting priorities.
Qualifications: Required qualifications for this position include: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business Management, Information Services, Engineering, Commerce or an equivalent combination of education and relevant experience (at least 5 years of functional experience)
Five years’ experience in application design, implementation and/or maintenance of PBCS/EPBCS applications
Two years demonstrated ability to successfully execute medium to complex projects; methodologies related to application management such as system deployment, support, and life cycle; experience in process improvement methodology, change management, operational improvement in complex systems.
Advanced knowledge of writing Business Rules and Calc scripts
Knowledge of hierarchies and dimensions, enterprise structures and offerings in Oracle cloud applications.
Experience in BSO, ASO cubes and MDX member formulas
Experience with Forms Building, Task List, Security and other artifacts of the planning tools
Proficient in Microsoft office products
Demonstrates ability to work independently
Demonstrates complex problem solving skills
Good understanding and experience with Data movement between applications.
Expertise in Data Validation
Good documentation and presentation skills
Preferred qualifications for this position include: Two years’ experience with large scale business transformation and Planning & Budgeting Project with scope spanning multiple regions and/or geographies and business process
Oracle Certified Professional
Strong accounting/finance process knowledge
About the department you will serve. Providence Strategic and Management Services provides a variety of functional and system support services for all eight regions of Providence Health & Services from Alaska to California. We are focused on supporting our Mission by delivering a robust foundation of services and sharing of specialized expertise. We offer a full comprehensive range of benefits - see our website for details http://www.providenceiscalling.jobs/rewards-benefits/ Our Mission As expressions of God’s healing love, witnessed through the ministry of Jesus, we are steadfast in serving all, especially those who are poor and vulnerable. About Us Providence Health & Services is a not-for-profit Catholic network of hospitals, care centers, health plans, physicians, clinics, home health care and services guided by a Mission of caring the Sisters of Providence began over 160 years ago. Providence is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Providence does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, disability, veteran, military status, religion, age, creed, national origin, sexual identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, or any other basis prohibited by local, state, or federal law. Schedule: Full-time Shift: Day Job Category: Applications Location: Oregon-Beaverton Req ID: 213245

ad.title: Production Control & Customer Service Manager - Clarios - Florence, SC
ad.content:
Production Control & Customer Service Manager - WD30058855331 Production Control Customer Service Manager
What you will do Under general direction and in conformance with Divisional policies, procedures and objectives, plans and controls the production and warehousing activities and the inventory investment of a branch plant. Plans, develops necessary procedures and directs the activities for which responsible. Provides analysis, counsel, advice and recommendations where appropriate to assist plant in achieving goals and objectives. Responsible to Division Manager, Production Control for compliance with Division policies and procedures.
How you will do it Analyzes customer orders and sales forecasts to prepare plant production and inventory plans. Reviews actual plant performance against sales and production plans. Recommends corrective action(s) to bring results in line with plans or recommends change in production and inventory plans to recognize differences between actual and forecasts. Directs and monitors production control activities to assure that balanced inventories are maintained and that production and purchase releases are scheduled to meet production and inventory investment objectives. May be responsible for directing purchasing activity for expense items. Maintains contact with all vendors of material and components to insure uninterrupted supply. Resolves discrepancies concerning items that fail to meet in-coming quality standards. JCMS Principle Champion for Material Control Prepares capacity planning analyses. Recommends purchase of additional capacity where necessary. Assists in the development and maintaining the integrity of computerized production/inventory control systems. Supervises the operation of such systems. Insures data integrity by developing systematic cycle counting to maintain accuracy. Directs warehousing activities and insures adherence to governmental safety and health regulations and personnel policies, procedures and collective bargaining agreements. Performs special assignments and analyses as directed by Plant Manager or Division Manager, Production Control. Qualifications
What we look for Bachelor's degree – Supply Chain, Engineering, Business preferred 8+ years of experience within manufacturing environment 5+ years of experience in leadership or management role Previous Lead Acid battery experience is helpful but not required. Excellent organization and communication skills (speak/read/write) Ability to understand ERP, MRP system. The use of an ERP system and variety of a PC based tools are used daily and require highly developed query, report writing, problem solving and data manipulation skills. Advanced level of Microsoft Excel knowledge Strong interpersonal skills with experience working in a multicultural environment preferred. Clarios, formerly Johnson Controls Power Solutions, is a world leader in advanced energy storage solutions. We partner with our customers to meet increasing market demand for smarter applications, on a global scale. Our 16,000 employees develop, manufacture and distribute a portfolio of evolving battery technologies for virtually every type of vehicle. Technologies that deliver uniquely sustainable, next-generation performance, and bring reliability, safety and comfort to everyday lives. We add value at every link in the supply chain, contributing to the progress of the communities we serve and the planet we all share. Learn more about Clarios at www.clarios.com.
Clarios, LLC is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. For more information, please view EEO is the Law, EEO is the Law (supplement), and Pay Transparency Non-discrimination. If you are an individual with a disability and you require an accommodation during the application process, please email SpecialAccommodations@tyco.com. Job Supply Chain & Procurement Primary LocationUS-SC-Florence Organization Power Solutions Overtime Status-Exempt

ad.title: Supply Chain Expeditor (part-time, days, FF) - Northbay Healthcare - Fairfield, CA
ad.content: Part-timeSupply Chain Expeditor (part-time, days, FF)Part Time, FTE: 0.5Administration CenterFairfield, CAJob Summary:Performs various functions related to expediting the delivery and receipt of commodity and physician preference supplies, goods and services. Processes purchase orders utilizing electronic methods to acquire standard types of material, equipment supplies and services through established contracts or approved sources consistent with consideration of quality, source reliability and urgency of need.Education:1. High school diploma or GED.2.Associate degree or equivalent from college or technical school preferred. Licensure/Certification:1. Certified Materials and Resource Professional (CMRP) certification preferred. Experience, Knowledge and Skills:1. Two years’ experience in procurement2. Ability to use Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio, Project) at a beginner’s level. ERP software experience preferred.3. Ability to interpret and make recommendations based on data. Other:1. The NorthBay Way: a set of value-based behaviors that are to be consistently demonstrated and role modeled by all employees that work at NorthBay Healthcare. The NorthBay Way principles consist of Caring, Communication, Collaboration, and Competence.2. Dealing with ambiguity: Demonstrates the ability and willingness to cope with change and can act and decide without excessive amounts of data or information. Can comfortably handle risk and uncertainty3. Builds effective relationships with others: Uses listening and empathy and asks questions to understand what it is like to walk in another’s shoes. Creates and maintains a safe environment for conveying information openly, accurately and honestly; creates a common understanding amongst all parties.4. Self- awareness and communication: Understands own strengths, growth opportunities, attributes, and emotions. Models courage, authenticity, service, truth telling, and effectiveness. Can determine the best way to get things done with senior executives, physicians and clinicians by understanding their language and responding to their needs.5. Decision quality: routinely makes good decisions based upon a mixture of data, analysis, wisdom, experience and judgement.6. Problem solving: Uses logic and methods to solve difficult problems with effective solutions

ad.title: Senior Business Development Director/Account Manager – Army & Defense - Indrasoft - Reston, VA
ad.content:
Job Details Description Job Title: Senior Business Development Director/Account Manager – Army & Defense
Job Number: 3303
Location: Montgomery, VA
Clearance: ***Candidate must be able to obtain a Secret or Top-Secret clearance.
Job Title: Senior Business Development Director/Account Manager – Army & Defense
Job Number: 3303
Location: Montgomery, AL ISI Office
Clearance: ***Candidate must be able to obtain a Secret or Top-Secret clearance.
IndraSoft, Inc. is looking for a dynamic and successful Senior Army Business Development Director/Account Manager to join one of the DC region’s fastest growing and successful company. IndraSoft has a successful history in the DoD and is expanding our Army account for software engineering, data analytics, cloud services and cybersecurity support. The Army Business Development Director/Account Manager will be responsible for increasing business opportunities, managing the Army pipeline, supporting strategic capture efforts and building teams for individual pursuits and support the operations portfolio of the Defense Accounts.
The Army Business Development Director/Account Manager will lead business development activities leveraging the ITES-3S, SSES Next Gen, Encore 3, and Army ERP vehicles. The candidate must have a successful track record in the capture and delivery of solution-based systems integration engagements, IT consulting services engagements and experience in market assessment/strategic planning for Army and DoD customers. Opportunities will primarily be Full and Open pursuits with strategic use of small business vehicles and relationships. This individual will have a hands-on role in re-compete and new revenue attainment. Exceptional communication skills with C-Level executives.
Qualifications:
To perform the job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Qualifications Required:
BS/BA or equivalent with 10+ years of experience in business development, capture and/or operations. 8 – 10 years of demonstrated success selling IT services to Army and/or DoD or in a similar role such as business development, capture manager specifically for IT services within Federal Agencies. 10+ years of experience in Program Management. Experience and success leading customer engagements and strategic pursuits. Dynamic, success driven, entrepreneurial self-starter with collaboration skills with the innate drive to win Specific extensive experience in growing services business with at least one of the Federal verticals. Strong understanding of complex Federal government requirements and procurement process. Proven track record of developing key relationships with major system integrators and other IT services focused partners. Demonstrated ability to successfully identify and qualify prospective teaming partners. Able to capture business successfully from new and vetted customers. Team-player with ability to motivate others to support capture of new opportunities. Ability to make timely and effective decisions in assessing business opportunities. Proven ability to build and grow revenue in accounts. Effective communication skills and leadership qualities, capable of influencing and convincing others to follow their lead and ideas; innovative and enthusiastic. Experience providing insight and contributing to writing winning proposals and responses to Federal Task Orders, RFPs, RFQs, RFIs, and Sources Sought. Experience addressing the needs of Federal agencies. Knowledgeable of information technology trends and their application to the Federal Government (e.g., cloud, BI, IA). Able to identify company past performance and past performance of subcontractors to maximize award potential. Knowledge of Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio). Understanding of Federal procurement business platforms such as: GovWin, FedBizOpps, GSA eBUY, GSA STARSII. Strong organizational, problem-solving, listening, and interpersonal skills. Enthusiastic and highly motivated with strong work ethic. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Ability to work effectively and perform multiple tasks under pressure. Proactive in collaborating with internal stakeholders and building support. Strong English language skills (both written and verbal). Ability to complete assignments correctly, independently and in a timely manner. Qualifications Desired:
BS with15+ years of experience in business development, capture and operations. PMP Certification. Essential Functions and Responsibilities:
Maintain understanding of the Federal and DoD marketplace, buying trends and capabilities for the IT labor services market within Federal Agency arena. Extensive understanding of: Application/Software Development and System Integration Services Mission Support services Information Technology (IT) solutions Sell in a consultative manner to identify and address client issues. Develop and/or manage relationships between IndraSoft and new or existing customers by cultivating relationships with key stakeholders throughout the market or customer community. Able to managing all aspects of the BD lifecycle from account penetration, pursuit strategy, and contracting. C-Level selling and relationship building experience – both business and IT organizations. Able to work with clients to craft innovative solutions to address client problems and issues. Able to partner with Alliances and work with partners for crafting and selling solutions. Excellent written and verbal communications skills. Exceptional relationship development skills. Experience in creating, editing and providing inputs for proposal content. Clear demonstration of successful roles in a multi-tasking environment especially with Small Businesses. Able to create and communicate value propositions. Able to develop accounts through serving as a trusted advisor to executives rather than through traditional sales models. Experience with operations and industry trends. Able to design, scope, and sell innovative, business-focused IT solutions to prospects and clients via integration of IndraSoft’ services, solutions, and capabilities. Identify, develop or evaluate marketing strategy based on knowledge of corporate objectives, market characteristics. Evaluate the financial aspects of product development such as budgets, expenditures, research and development appropriations, or ROI and profit-loss projections. Develop pricing strategies, balancing firm objectives and customer satisfaction. Compile lists descripting product or service offerings. Analyze business developments and monitor market trends, initiate market research studies and/or analyze their findings. Travel, as required, to prospective and existing customer facilities. Participates in professional/trade association activities, customer events and federal government meetings. In addition to business development activities, the role will support the operations of a portfolio of Defense accounts and act as the point of contact for communication and collaboration between IndraSoft’s customers and on-site employees. Lead and mentor direct reports and maintain consistency and quality of IndraSoft services and solution implementations. Develop and/or manage relationships between IndraSoft and new or existing customers by cultivating relationships with key stakeholders throughout the market or customer community. Work with customers ensuring quality of delivery, customer satisfaction and continually sources for ways to improve processes and solutions. Non-Essential Functions:
Additional responsibilities as assigned by management.
Physical Demands: While performing duties of the job, incumbent will be exposed to Normal demands associated with an office environment. Ability to work on computer for long periods, and communicate with individuals by telephone, email and face to face. Travel will be required. This position requires incumbent to have the ability to stand, walk, sit, use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls, reach with hands and arms, talk and hear. Employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust and focus.
Work Environment: The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.Qualifications Behaviors Preferred Leader: Inspires teammates to follow them Enthusiastic: Shows intense and eager enjoyment and interest Motivations Preferred Entrepreneurial Spirit: Inspired to perform well by an ability to drive new ventures within the business Ability to Make an Impact: Inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization Education Preferred Bachelors or better. Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information.
