ad.title: Production Associate 1 - 10x Genomics - Pleasanton, CA
ad.content:
10x Genomics ( http://www.10xgenomics.com/ ) is building tools for scientific discovery that reveal and address the true complexities of biology and disease. Through a combination of novel microfluidics, chemistry and bioinformatics, our award-winning Chromium™ System is enabling researchers around the world to more fully understand the fundamentals of biology at unprecedented resolution and scale. Learn more at 10xGenomics.com ( http://www.10xGenomics.com ). #GOEXPONENTIAL Fueled by equal parts scientific vision and determined passion, we are delivering unprecedented innovation to short-read sequencing technologies and transforming how genomic information is accessed. You will feel the 10x difference the moment you enter our offices and labs. There's a dynamic energy here, and we're looking for the best of the best to be a part of it. We are seeking talented professionals excited to build new technology that advances scientific research while growing their career within a dynamic, supportive environment. Production Associate 1 10x Genomics is looking for an outstanding individual to join its consumable manufacturing team. This individual will be responsible for production consumable products associated with Next Generation Sequencing chemistries. This role requires excellent laboratory skills in performing production operations consistently. The ideal candidate will have an education background in one or more of the following disciplines: Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, Molecular Biology or equivalent. Experience in production and QC of similar products in a manufacturing environment a plus. This is an entry to junior level position in 10x reagent manufacturing team. Individuals applying to this position should understand basic lab techniques. This individual must be a self-starter, quick learner and detail oriented, work well in a team atmosphere, have good communication skills, ability to adapt and thrive in working at a fast-paced environment. Key Responsibilities
Execute production operations according to defined procedures and ensure the integrity and quality of products under ISO requirement Ability to quickly come up to speed on novel assembly procedures and custom tooling or test methods Follow procedures and assemble in-process parts into final configurations Operate robotic system and complex manufacturing equipment for process processes under supervision Operate and maintain laboratory to clean room standards required in the production of Life Science products Process work orders accurately using an ERP system in a timely manner Maintenance of production batch records and good documentation under ISO requirement Accurate tracking of production data, test data and inventory Disposition material based on QC and production data
Required Skills and Background
S. in one of the following disciplines –Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, Molecular Biology, Microfluidics or equivalent 1 – 5 years of relevant laboratory experience (Life Science preferred but not required) Basic understanding of DNA sequencing, PCR or other nucleic acid based technologies and relevant experience a plus Experience with fabrication of microfluidic devices Experience working with PDMS, SU8 or similar materials Experience with spin coating is strong desired Ability to multi-task and prioritize work load to meet strict deadlines under supervision Good documentation skills and ability to write procedures and reports Desire to be part of a rapidly evolving organization and taking products and processes to the next level
Desired Skills and Background
Experience in optical imaging, microscopy, and metrology measurements Relevant experience in manufacturing or QC of Life Science products preferred Relevant experience in a production environment working with standard production control tools – ERP, LIMS, inventory control, work orders a plus Experience with common lab equipment such as pipettes, nanodrop, centrifuges, thermocyclers, microscopes, etc. a plus
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

ad.title: Oracle Cloud / Oracle Technology - Business Architect (Property Tax Assessments) - Los Angeles preferred - California - Technical Consulting Director - Consulting Technical Director - Oracle - California
ad.content:
Oracle Cloud / Oracle Technology - Business Architect (Property Tax Assessments) - Los Angeles preferred - California - Technical Consulting Director - Consulting Technical Director-19000J9O
No Visa Sponsorship is available for this position.
Preferred Qualifications
Oracle Cloud / Oracle Technology - Business Architect (Property Tax Assessments) - Los Angeles preferred - California - Technical Consulting Director Description: The North America Oracle Technology Consulting organization specializes in providing digital transformation, Cloud Advisory and Cloud Implementation services for customers across Industries with in North America. Focused on achieving business outcomes, the organization collaborates with customers to achieve success through architecture, process and delivery excellence. We have this exciting new opportunity for a Business Architect with experience in Property Tax Assessments. We are looking for a Business SME/leader who has experience with Property Tax assessment systems, processes and data. Somebody who has both leadership skills and ability to get into the details in helping drive business discussions and arrive at appropriate process decisions. An individual who is technology savvy, who thrives on innovation, and working in a dynamic environment. This is an excellent opportunity, allowing you to work with Oracle, a leader in providing Enterprise solutions to businesses in all industries and the government. You will help shape solution in the Property Tax Assessments area. You will have the opportunity to work with many of the world's leading organisations that use Oracle technology, and be part of a smart, high performance team. Job Description: The Oracle Technology Consulting team is looking for a Lead Business Architect for a large multi-year program. This architect will be part of a team of business, application and infrastructure architects to deliver an ambitious modernization program, built on Oracle Technology. We are looking for a very experienced architect and leader who is passionate about business automation and has several years of experience in the property tax domain. You will be interacting with senior business and technology leaders at the customer and lead the business functionality decisions for the program. You will lay the business architecture vision and with the help of the architecture team ensure that this vision is implemented as part of the project across phases. You will mentor Business Analysts and Product Owners of the different business components. We are looking for excellent communication and leadership skills. You will represent the program in steering committee meetings and help present the achievements and future roadmap. You will help evangelize the solution in Industry events and conferences. You will help drive continued Oracle solution adoption. You will mentor and manage the business analyst team to achieve project and program milestones. Knowledge and Competencies: Business Architecture experience: Detailed Process Experience with the three principal functions of property tax at the local government level – Assessment, Recording, Tax Collection Deep knowledge of Assessor business function to include, eligibility determination, appraisals and assessments Extensive knowledge of Secured and Unsecured Property Assessments, Special Assessments, Case management, Assessor Metrics, Property Statements, New Construction, Market Approach and Roll Support Detailed knowledge of Property Tax codes and propositions preferably in the state of California Experience in conducting fit-gap reviews to compare an organization’s current state with future state Technology Knowledge: Knowledge of Technology Products, preferably Oracle used in Property Tax Assessments Experience in implementing property tax solutions, preferably in the State of California Design Governance: Aligning teams to Future Vision for current and future phases Experience leading teams Ensuring Detailed Solution designs align with Future state Business Architecture/Vision Leadership: Confidence/Leadership/Verbal and Written communication Ability to challenge/guide customer and oracle teams Requirements, Skills and Qualifications: 15+ years of industry experience with 5+ years working in the Property Tax Assessments domain. Familiarity with cloud and digital technologies in use. You have extensive experience and a proven track record of delivering business process design and optimization. Proven ability to effectively communicate conceptual ideas and design rationale, to business and technical audience You are comfortable engaging with and guiding stakeholders across multiple business and technology domains. You have excellent interpersonal skills and ability to build good working relationships with both internal team members and customers. Experience with management consulting to include - business strategy design and implementation, functional consulting, business consulting, enterprise architecture. . Prior team leadership or management experience is preferred. Large consulting firm experience (Big 4) is preferred. You are educated to an undergraduate degree or greater level. You have the ability and willingness to travel as much as 75% of the time within US and Canada. 50-75% of time will be spent travelling to customer sites within region/country. Detailed Description and Job Requirements
As an acknowledged authority within Oracle, this senior level consulting position is responsible for creating and implementing innovative solutions with industry-wide impact. Leads the solution design and implementation aspects of engagement(s) ensuring high quality, integrated solutions within constraints of time and budget.Analyzes business needs to help ensure Oracle solution meets the customer’s objectives by combining industry best practices, product knowledge, and business acumen. As a position of technical/professional influence, this individual frequently operates at the leading edge of technology. Recommends and justifies enhancements to Oracle products to meet very complex customer needs. Exercises creativity and independent judgment in developing methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria to deliver functional and technical expertise on a wide range of business and technology solutions. Leads experienced consulting teams on challenging projects; works on significant and unique issues. As a thought leader and trusted advisor, effectively influences difficult decisions at the leadership-level of customer organizations. Enables business development efforts by providing subject matter expertise. Resolves very complex customer escalations. Drives customer process direction and decisions by providing domain leadership within relevant industries on end-to-end enterprise solutions. Creates new solution sets based on assessment of industry needs, market demands and knowledge of competitive product offerings.10+ years of experience relevant to this position including 5 years of consulting experience. Management or team leadership experience preferred. Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience preferred. Product or technical expertise relevant to practice focus. Ability to lead large teams. Strong influencing and negotiation skills. Ability to travel as needed.Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.

ad.title: Senior Websphere Application / Commerce Administrator - Emerson - St. Louis, MO
ad.content:
Senior Websphere Application / Commerce Administrator
Requisition ID: (19006528) Primary Location: United States-Missouri-St. Louis Job Function: Information Technology Job Posting Date: May 6, 2019, 4:45:00 PM
Description
Emerson is seeking an experienced Senior Websphere Application / Commerce Administrator with extensive experience in successfully administering medium to large scale, and moderately to highly complex Websphere Application and Commerce environments running in the cloud, i.e. Microsoft Azure or Amazon AWS. The Senior Websphere Application / Commerce Administrator role is an integral component of Emerson Corporate’s Digital Engagement team. The Senior WebSphere Application / Commerce Administrator must have extensive product knowledge on installs, configurations, and maintenance of e-commerce B2B and B2C sites using IBM WebSphere Commerce V7.0 – V9.0. This position requires a general awareness of how the product components interact and the capabilities of the components, as well as the configurations and architecture of development, staging and production systems. Additonally, Emerson.com includes a content management system, so a general knowledge on integrating WebSphere Commerce with content management solutions, i.e. Coremedia Live Context or Adobe Experience Manager, is preferred. The Senior Websphere Application / Commerce Administrator is responsible for proactive and reactive troubleshooting, monitoring and maintaining existing Websphere Application Environment. The administrator performs the installation, configuration, and day-to-day tasks associated with ensuring the smooth and efficient operation of a WebSphere runtime environment. This includes the design and implementation of infrastructure from specifications, configuration and deployment of applications, connecting to back-end resources, and advanced troubleshooting of moderately complex software applications. This role requires the candidate to be highly flexible in hours of work because of its customer-facing, highly available infrastructure necessity.
This position will interface with Emerson Electric Corporate IT support teams, i.e. Linux Adminstration, Oracle Database Administration, Enterprise Architecture, Vendor Management Office, and Security, and Emerson Electric’s business teams as required to maintain the environments. Successful candidates will also have excellent communications skills, and will have experience in working in a matrixed team environment. You will provide Websphere Administration mentoring / coaching to other Emerson Electric resources. Overall objective of the Senior Websphere Application / Commerce Adminstrator role is to ensure that all environments are maintained and available according to established Service Level Agreements (SLA) with minimal business disruption. Primary location for this job will be in St. Louis, however this role may require some travel within North America (up to 15%).
PRINCIPAL FUNCTIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES
Build and maintain Development, QA, Staging and Production environment infrastructure in a cloud hosting provider Maintain environments by applying necessary fixpacks/feature packs/mod packs Knowledge and experience supporting WebSphere Commerce implementations with connectivity to ERP systems using Rest APIs, JMS Queues, and SFTP. Must be able to create and execute complex SQL statements Strong scripting skills Knowledge of Staging propagation and workspaces Configure IBM WebSphere WCBD build & deployment tool for Commerce applications Understanding of IHS and proper processes for customer facing SEO configurations Under general direction, devises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems Competent to work at the highest technical level of all phases of applications server activities Remains current with emerging software enhancements, security patches and bug fixes Monitor application and server performance, and create proper alerting for environment/application events Modifies, installs, and prepares technical documentation for system software applications Assists development and operations staff in the creation of scripts for automating deployments, operations monitoring and alerting
PROFESSIONAL SKILL REQUIREMENTS:
Excellent organizational and task management skills, including ability to execute and prioritize a number of tasks simultaneously Mentor more junior level members of the team Strong experience working in a matrix environment Excellent communication skills including strong presentation / communication / facilitation skills (oral and written) Innovative, flexible, and adaptable On-Call support Customer-focused Results oriented, detailed and analytical with the ability to lead others Excellent relationship management, interpersonal, conflict and negotiation skills Able to work in a team environment.
Requirements EDUCATION Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, computer engineering or similar discipline Master’s degree is a plus Websphere Commerce certification is a plus
EXPERIENCE 8 – 14 years of experience in technology, business, management or project leadership
LANGUAGES Fluent in EnglishWork Authorization No calls or agencies please. Emerson will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1, H-1, H-2, L, B, J, or TN or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire.
Equal Opportunity Employer Emerson is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, marital status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability or protected veteran status. We are committed to providing a workplace free of any discrimination or harassment.
If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, you can request help by sending an email to idisability.administrator@emerson.com.
About EmersonAt Emerson, we are innovators and problem-solvers, focused on a common purpose: leaving our world in a better place than we found it. Each and every day, our foundational values—integrity, safety and quality, supporting our people, customer focus, continuous improvement, collaboration and innovation—inform every decision we make and empower our employees to keep reaching higher.As a global technology and engineering leader, we provide groundbreaking solutions for customers in industrial, commercial, and residential markets.Our Automation Solutions business helps process, hybrid, and discrete manufacturers maximize production and protect personnel and the environment while optimizing their energy and operating costs. Our Commercial & Residential Solutions business helps ensure human comfort and health, protect food quality and safety, advance energy efficiency and create sustainable infrastructure.Emerson, a Fortune 500 company with $17.4 billion in sales, more than 20 Innovation, Solutions & Engineering Centers, and 200 manufacturing locations worldwide, is committed to helping employees grow and thrive throughout their careers.Whether you're an established professional looking for a career change, an undergraduate student exploring options or a recent MBA graduate, you'll find a variety of opportunities at Emerson. Join our team and start your journey today.

ad.title: Operational Accounting & Management Director - CareFirst BlueCross BlueShield - Owings Mills, MD
ad.content: Resp & Qualifications SUMMARY:This position is directly responsible for the Operational Accounting departments including Accounts Payable and Payroll as well as Management Accounting departments including Cost Accounting and Budget & Expense Management.RESPONSIBILITIES:Directs the Company’s Payroll function ensuring that all transactions are completed in a timely and accurate manner and the presentation adheres to GAAP and STAT industry standards. Ensure all associated supporting documentation is current, accurate and complete.Directs the Company’s Accounts Payable function ensuring that all transactions are completed in a timely and accurate manner and the presentation adheres to GAAP and STAT industry standards. Ensure all associated supporting documentation is current, accurate and complete.Directs the annual corporate budget process and monthly administrative expense analysis for CareFirst, Inc. Responsible for the data integrity, analysis and budgeting of administrative expenses and capital expenditures. This role is accountable for directing the preparation of the annual budget; leading the development of budgeting tools/strategies for the executive management decision process; forecasting the course of spending; monitoring monthly expenses for significant variances, risks, and opportunities; and providing support and direction to all levels of management (including the CEO and Board of Directors) on administrative expense issues, including special projects as requested.Directs Cost Accounting staff in the performance of allocating administrative costs, ensuring adherence with various rgulations including Federal Acquisition Regulations, Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association requirements, guidelines and bulletins, IRS Regulations, and accounting principles. Manages and maintains control over highly sensitive information in a confidential manner. Reviews cost data and correspondence for internal consistency and conformance with corporate policies.Contributes to the development of accounting policies related to GAAP and STAT technical accounting issues. Also contributes to the preparation of financial reporting including: presentations to executive management and the Board of Directors; the issuance of the audited GAAP and STAT year-end statements; BCBSA monthly and quarterly financial and enrollment reports; and other sources that require documentation about CareFirst business activities and related indicators. Assists with formulating and administering the monthly financial close and internal reporting process, continually assessing opportunities for efficiencies in the process. The position requires knowledge of the fundamental doctrines, theories, principles and terminology of cost and financial accounting and federal government contracting performed within the organization.This role provides a controlled financial framework for all entities of the CareFirst BlueCross BlueShield organization. This control aspect is a critical step towards the accumulation of the organization’s GAAP and STAT financial information.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES may include, but are not limited to, the following:1. Oversee the management of the Company’s Payroll and Accounts Payable functions ensuring that all transactions and associated documentation is current, accurate, and that the presentation adheres to GAAP and STAT industry standards, produced in a timely manner.2. Responsible for the cost allocation process and assumptions.3. Oversee the annual budget process for corporate administrative expense functions.4. Act as liaison with external auditors, external insurance department examiners and internal audit staff. Assist with preparation and presentation to Board of Directors—Audit Committee concerning financial and control issues.5. Manage fixed asset accounting, including corporate initiative accounting.6. Maintains appropriate internal controls and safeguards ensuring a strong internal control environmentManagement: Direct reports: 3 Indirect reports: 40 full-time associates Projected Budget: $5,500,000 QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:This position requires a Bachelor’s degree in accounting , finance, or business and a minimum of 10 years of progressively responsible financial and managerial experience, preferably in a health insurance oriented organization. Incumbent must have demonstrated expertise in accounting and financial operations, and a highly developed understanding of financial reporting rules and regulations for CareFirst. This position requires a high degree of interpersonal skills, and incumbent must be able to effectively manage and cultivate development of staff. The incumbent must posses excellent written and oral communication skills to explain the results of operations and related disclosures to a diverse audience. Incumbent must be analytical and able to identify problem issues quickly, and must have knowledge of PC and mainframe based applications. Position requires extreme flexibility in meeting deadlines, and a team oriented perspective.Must be able to effectively work in a fast paced environment with frequently changing priorities, deadlines, and workloads that can be variable for long periods of time. Must be able to meet established deadlines and handle multiple customer service demands from internal and external customers, within set expectations for service excellence. Must be able to effectively communicate and provide positive customer service to every internal and external customer, including customers who may be demanding or otherwise challenging.CPA or CMA certification preferred. Experience with payroll and accounts payable in a multi-entity, multi-state environment is preferred. Experience with PeopleSoft and Oracle EBS is preferred.Department Department: Corporate Controller Equal Employment Opportunity CareFirst BlueCross BlueShield is an Equal Opportunity (EEO) employer. It is the policy of the Company to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information. Hire Range Disclaimer Actual salary will be based on relevant job experience and work history. Where To Apply Please visit our website to apply: www.carefirst.com/careers Closing Date Please apply before: 06/05/2019 Federal Disc/Physical Demand Note: The incumbent is required to immediately disclose any debarment, exclusion, or other event that makes him/her ineligible to perform work directly or indirectly on Federal health care programs. PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential duties and responsibilities of the position successfully. Requirements may be modified to accommodate individuals with disabilities.The employee is primarily seated while performing the duties of the position. Occasional walking or standing is required. The hands are regularly used to write, type, key and handle or feel small controls and objects. The employee must frequently talk and hear. Weights of up to 25 pounds are occasionally lifted. Sponsorship in US Must be eligible to work in the U.S. without Sponsorship

ad.title: Application Engineer II - Healthtrust Supply Chain/Purchasing Group - Brentwood, TN
ad.content: Description SHIFT: No WeekendsSCHEDULE: Full-timeWHY PSG?The Physician Services Group (PSG) is responsible for several lines of business, including Physician Practices, Hospital-based physician services, Urgent Care Services, Graduate Medical Education, and Health 2 You. PSG currently has over 3,000 providers and 800 physician practices. PSG is growing rapidly in the Urgent Care setting, with 90 Urgent Care Clinics currently and over 300 projected by the end of 2018. The Graduate Medical Education program is projected to double in size, to become the largest in the World by the end of 2020 with over 5,000 residents. PSG IT&S will need to handle the demands of such rapid growth. PSG IT&S supports centralized departments supporting the lines of business, such as Financial Services, Accounting, Human Resources, Information Protection and Security, Ethics & Compliance, Quality and Government Programs, Coding Operations and HIM, Ambulatory EHR, Management Services, Marketing and Digital Services, Physician Development, and Practice Operations.JOB SUMMARYThe Application Engineer II is a part of the Physician Services Group organization of HCA. This technically-focused position with the Data Management and Business Intelligence team is responsible for designing, developing, testing and deploying our business intelligence solutions across the enterprise. This goal will be achieved by working with cross-functional business teams and utilizing MicroStrategy, Teradata, and other database platforms and tools. The Application Engineer II is responsible for application creation, administrative tasks, and supporting dashboard and report solutions development at PSG. The Application Engineer II will collaborate with Business Customers, Department Heads, and Project teams, provide leadership regarding application design, as well as support and develop subject matter knowledge for internally developed applications. The Application Engineer II will ensure the effective design, build, deployment, documentation and maintenance of relational and multidimensional databases to support end-user processes.REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE3-5 years' relevant work experienceTechnical Expertise/experience in data acquisition, data cleansing and parsing required.Expertise/experience in data analysis, modeling and visualization required.Teradata, Oracle, SQL Server, or other DBMS.MicroStrategy, Business Objects, or other Enterprise BI tools.SyncSort DMExpress or other ETL tools.Experience in Teradata SQL or extensive experience in other ANSI SQL languages (e.g., MSSQL, Oracle, Postgres) required.Expertise/experience in the areas of data structures and data warehousing required.Report writing experience.Soft Strong analytical and design skills.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Participate in strategic design, construction and implementation of software and analytics solutions in the BI development environment. This includes selecting, gathering specifications for, designing and implementing solutions for consumers throughout the enterprise.Works to build technical knowledge by taking advantage of internal team mentoring and attending professional development opportunities.Contributes to the development of goals and objectives related to the business.Lead troubleshooting activities to resolution.Works on unique and unusually complex projects.Self-driven learner of technology and programming.Works independently with limited supervision and acts as a resources for colleagues with less experience.PREFERRED SKILLSTechnical Knowledge of Clinical and Financial Applications.Knowledge of EMR or Practice Management Systems such as E-Clinical Works, Epic, GE Centricity, NextGen, etc.Broad application of health industry data standards.Actively participates in application design sessions.Seasoned data professional and subject matter expert with a full understanding of data tools and concepts; ability to resolve a wide range of highly-complex issues in creative ways.Experience in UNIX shell scripting.Soft Demonstrates continual learning and improvement of knowledge and expertise in the health industry data standard as well as industry applications and tools.Ability to create clear and concise documentation on design and operational topics.Acts as a consultant on large projects that affect organization's long-term goals and objectives.Actively builds strong bonds and relationships with all customers and department heads. Encourages and guides staff to be customer-focused. Partners with colleagues and customers to achieve meaningful discussions regarding data outputs and feedback on usage activities to improve Data and Analytics output. EDUCATIONBachelor's Degree required

ad.title: Principal Software Engineer - Caterpillar - Chicago, IL
ad.content:
DescriptionJOB PURPOSE: Principal Software Engineer responsible for system integration and performance testing. This position will participate in all stages of Caterpillar’s state-of-the-art digital platform software development, including refining product vision, gathering requirements, project planning, software system design, coding, testing, release, deployment and support. This individual will also work collaboratively with other engineering teams to ensure cross-functional goals are met. JOB DUTIES: Responsibilities of the incumbents are across functional lines with individuals assigned in new program development and/or maintenance of existing mobile, WEB, Cloud, server, personal computer, mainframe, and/or distributed computing systems. 1. Serve as lead engineer for an end-to-end system integration testing team of developers, automation engineers and devOps professionals 2. Review current test frameworks, and automated tools looking for improvement and enhancement opportunities 3. Architect new automation frameworks as needed 4. Analyze, plan and implement test automation standards and strategies 5.Competent to perform all programming, project management, and development assignments without close supervision; normally assigned the more complex aspects of systems work. 6. Lead role in complex projects spanning across multiple system components 7. Work in all phases of product creation process including creating technical requirements, project planning, identifying dependencies, system architecture and development. 8. Investigation and root cause analysis of software and system defects. 9. Focus on productivity, quality and competitiveness of major technology initiatives. 10. Apply knowledge and skills to solve most complex engineering problems. 11. Organize and drive configuration management activities of the development process 12. Works directly on complex application/technical problem identification and resolution, including responding to off-shift and weekend support calls. 13. Works independently on complex systems or infrastructure components that may be used by one or more applications or systems. 14. Drives application development focused around delivering business valuable features 15. Mentor and assist software engineers, providing technical assistance and direction as needed 16. Maintains high standards of software quality by establishing good practices and habits 17. Identifies and encourage areas for growth and improvement 18. Communicate with end users and internal customers to help direct development, debugging, and testing of application software for accuracy, integrity, interoperability, and completeness 19. Performs integrated testing and customer acceptance testing of components that requires careful planning and execution to ensure timely, quality results.The position manages the completion of its own work assignments and coordinates work with others. Based on past experiences and knowledge, the incumbent normally works independently with minimal management input and review of end results. Typical customers include Caterpillar customers, dealers, other external companies who purchase services offered by Caterpillar as well as internal business unit and/or service center groups. The position is challenged to quickly and correctly identify problems that may not be obvious. The incumbent solves problems by determining the best course of action, within departmental guidelines, from many existing solutions. The incumbent sets priorities and establishes a work plan in order to complete broadly defined assignments and achieve desired results. The position participates in brainstorming sessions focused on developing new approaches to meeting quality goals in the measure(s) stated. Qualifications Basic qualifications:
Position requires a four-year degree from an accredited college or university.
Ten years or more of software development experience or at least eight years of experience with master’s degree in computer science or related field.
Ten years or more of experience in designing and developing software applications in Java or Scala or at least eight years of experience in Java or Scala with master’s degree in computer science or related field.
Three years or more of experience in public cloud technologies such as AWS or Azure. Top candidates will also have:
Demonstrated leadership on medium to large-scale projects impacting strategic priorities.
Ability to cope with shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to effectively prioritize, delegate responsibilities and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
Proven experience in many of the following,
Designing, developing, deploying and maintaining software at scale.
Batch or stream processing systems such as Apache Spark, Flink, Akka, Storm
Message brokers such as Kafka, Rabbitmq, AWS SQS, AWS SNS, Apache ActiveMQ, Kinesis. Datastores such as MongoDB, Cassandra, Redis, Elasticsearch, MySQL, Oracle.
Developing software applications using relational and Nosql databases.
Application architectural patterns, such as MVC, Microservices, Event-driven, etc.
Deploying software using CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, GoCD, Azure Devops etc. At least three plus years of deploying and maintaining software using public clouds such as AWS or Azure.
Working within an Agile framework (ideally Scrum).
Debugging and maintaining software in Linux or Unix platforms.
Strong understanding and/or experience in many of the following,
Designing well-defined Restful APIs
Writing API proxies on platforms such as Apigee Edge, AWS API Gateway or Azure API Gateway
API tools such as Swagger, Postman and Assertible
Test driven development and behavior driven development.
Testing tools such as Selenium and Cucumber and their integration into CI/CD pipelines
Must demonstrate solid knowledge of computer science fundamentals like data structures and algorithms.
Ability to work under pressure and within time constraints.
Passion for technology and innovation.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer science or Electrical engineering or related field is required.

ad.title: Associate Support Analyst, IT Selling Systems Support Services - Tractor Supply Company - Brentwood, TN
ad.content: Overview Tractor Supply Company (TSCO), the largest retail chain of rural lifestyle products in the United States, is dedicated to enhancing our strong company culture built on our team members’ commitment to our Mission and Values. With over 1,700 stores in 49 states and an innovative e-commerce platform, Tractor Supply ranks in the Fortune 400 with revenues of $7 billion and growing!Come grow your career with us as we serve those who live “Life out Here”! This position is responsible for 2nd level technical support for all store hardware and software systems. This includes problem management to minimize down time and increase store productivity as well as supporting new technology projects. This requires an understanding of hardware design and interfaces including POS components and networking technologies. Responsibilities Provide Tier 2 Technical Support for Store Systems Maintains timely communication with customers on work progress Monitors and resolves proactive application alerts to improve store uptime Make decisions to send replacement hardware and/or technicians to stores for issue resolution Perform configuration updates to store devices Create support documentation for Tier 1 team to assist with first call resolution Maintain policies and procedures to support IT production store systems Participate in operational readiness activities for projects and holiday support Qualifications Experience: 1+ years of experience in technical support in a fast paced environment.Education: Associates Degree in Computer Science or related field and/or 1+ years equivalent work experience in a technical support role.Professional Certifications: None Required IT Specialized Skills: SuSe Linux, Windows, Oracle, SQL, Mobility Other knowledge, skills or abilities: Knowledge of POS hardware and software Knowledge of retail business processes Experience with the following tools: SAP, Airwatch, Toad, Nagios, Service Now, Blade Logic, Microsoft SCCM, Moba/Putty, RDP, Confluence Ability to write and execute SQL queries Strong written and verbal communication skills Demonstrate customer focus and ability to handle conflict positively Strong ability to work independently and manage prioritization in a fast paced environment Working Conditions Normal office conditions Some travel for store visits Evening and/or weekend work based on set schedule 24x7 on-call rotations

ad.title: SID Premium Services SME - Computer World Services - Ogden, UT
ad.content: Designs and implements information systems solutions which will adequately address the enterprise infrastructure needs of the organization. Analyzes system requirements and ensures that systems will offer security and will be effectively integrated with current applications. Ensures that all systems are working at optimal levels and offers support to application development department regarding new technologies and system requirements. Has thorough knowledge of infrastructure, application programming, and web and software applications. Key Tasks and Responsibilities As part of a team, perform consulting assistance related to application level activities and execution of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and Non-ERP application software and infrastructure. Maintain a working knowledge of the applications and hardware operational functions in order to provide subject matter expertise. Provide coordination between mission partner development and sustainment organizations and DISA production personnel for implementations, upgrades, releases, application changes, transports, and migrations for DISA and mission partner programs.ERP products and applications include: Systems Applications Products (SAP) Enterprise Central Component (ECC) SAP Customer Relationship Management (CRM) SAP Business Warehouse (BW) SAP Product Data Management Initiative (PDMI) Multi-Vendor Hyper Converged Infrastructures (HCI) SAP KONA High Availability Analytical Appliance (HANA) HANA Sidecar Business Warehouse Accelerator (BWA) Oracle SuperCluster HP-CX700 HADOOP Open Text (OT) Adobe-Life-Cycle Supply Chain Management (SCM) Process Integration (PI) Governance Risk and Compliance (GRC) Green Light External Enterprise Portal Internal Enterprise Portal Business Objects Enterprise/Business Intelligence (BI/BOE) SAP Routers SAP Landscape Transformation (SLT) Auto Desk/Carahsoft Customer Relationship Management Sales (CRM-Sales) Mission Partner Application Project PlanningWeb/platform specific technologies for JAVA and .NET JDA Manugistics Collaborate/Supply Chain Planning, Optimization (SCPO) JDA Manugistics Inventory Policy (IPO) Netegrity Single Sign-on DLA developed Internet Bid Board System (DIBBS) Account Management Provisioning System (AMPS) Citrix XenApp Single Sign-On Presentation Server(s) XML/STA Server(s) Secure Gateway Web Servers License Server Fuels Manager Defense (FMD) Employee Activity Guide for Labor Entry (EAGLE) Energy Procurement Support Tool (EPST)Support COOP activities including: assisting with planning an executable IT COOP and Disaster Recovery (DR) plan for operations that aligns with DISA and mission partner COOP guidelines and provides the mission partner with an assigned Alternative Processing Site (APS); creating and updating the detailed COOP plan; maintaining listings of COOP/DR organization and team structures/members; ensuring appropriate COOP/DR capabilities are mapped in the APS to support declared disasters; managing plan updates and infrastructure mappings; adjusting plans to reflect DISA and mission partner organizational changes; and assisting with the design and scheduling of backups.Perform BMC, Patrol, and Tivoli event monitoring including: Configuring the automated ticket generation capability for the Account Management and Provisioning System (AMPS), batch processing errors, managing hardware/software/application events, and monitoring performance of software products, such as BMC Patrol and Tivoli. Designing, implementing, and maintaining performance monitoring modules, monitors, and application architectures. Providing overall coordination and liaison with mission partners and DISA for performance monitor installation, troubleshooting/resolution of issues, and performance tuning. Supporting design, integration, and test activities required to adequately confirm that changes to the performance monitor application and modules are installed and operating in a manner equivalent to or exceeding the current installation. JOB REQUIREMENTS Education & Experience Bachelors 5+ years’ experience maintaining and supporting business applications architectures Certifications Appropriate DoD 8570 IAT/IAM Level certification (CCNA Security, CySA+, GICSP, GSEC, Security+ CE, SSCP, or higher), as well as technology-specific certifications such as MCSA Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2016, Certified UNIX Security Administrator (GCUX), etc. Security Clearance NIPRNet Access – Secret IT-I Requires Final (Interim is acceptable to start) DoD Security Clearance level of Secret Other (Travel, Work Environment, DoD 8570 Requirements, Administrative Notes, etc.) Note, all positons are identified as DoD 8570 IT-1 (privileged level systems access), which requires a favorably adjudicated Tier 5 investigation (formerly known as a Single Scope Background Investigation (SSBI)). Travel requirement is not expected. EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability

ad.title: SID Operations Support SME - Computer World Services - Ogden, UT
ad.content:
Designs and implements information systems solutions which will adequately address the enterprise infrastructure needs of the organization. Analyzes system requirements and ensures that systems will offer security and will be effectively integrated with current applications. Ensures that all systems are working at optimal levels and offers support to application development department regarding new technologies and system requirements. Has thorough knowledge of infrastructure, application programming, and web and software applications. Key Tasks and Responsibilities As part of a team, perform SID Operations Support: Notify the end users of application issues associated with applications for batch processing delays, application degraded, or application unavailability. Create and distribute Broadcast Messages (BM) for batch processing delays, application degraded, and application unavailability, for both scheduled and unscheduled outages. Create InfoSpot (IS) messages and notify mission partner management of any unexpected degradation to batch processing or application availability. These IS messages are more technical in nature, and provide details for daily mission partner-produced outage reports which are ultimately delivered to senior management. Perform the role of collaboration call facilitator for all troubleshooting calls including system availability, system degradation, project implementations, and project planning. Develop and maintain a complete understanding of the mission partner’s business functions related to products and applications below: ERP products and applications include: Systems Applications Products (SAP) Enterprise Central Component (ECC) SAP Customer Relationship Management (CRM) SAP Business Warehouse (BW) SAP Product Data Management Initiative (PDMI) Multi-Vendor Hyper Converged Infrastructures (HCI) SAP KONA High Availability Analytical Appliance (HANA) HANA Sidecar Business Warehouse Accelerator (BWA) Oracle SuperCluster HP-CX700 HADOOP Open Text (OT) Adobe-Life-Cycle Supply Chain Management (SCM) Process Integration (PI) Governance Risk and Compliance (GRC) Green Light External Enterprise Portal Internal Enterprise Portal Business Objects Enterprise/Business Intelligence (BI/BOE) SAP Routers SAP Landscape Transformation (SLT) Auto Desk/Carahsoft Customer Relationship Management Sales (CRM-Sales) Mission Partner Application Project Planning
Non-ERP products and applications and components include: Web/platform specific technologies for JAVA and .NET JDA Manugistics Collaborate/Supply Chain Planning, Optimization (SCPO) JDA Manugistics Inventory Policy (IPO) Netegrity Single Sign-on DLA developed Internet Bid Board System (DIBBS) Account Management Provisioning System (AMPS) Citrix XenApp Single Sign-On Presentation Server(s) XML/STA Server(s) Secure Gateway Web Servers License Server Fuels Manager Defense (FMD) Employee Activity Guide for Labor Entry (EAGLE) Energy Procurement Support Tool (EPST)Develop and maintain understanding of mission partner project planning. Develop and maintain understanding of the applications coordination process between DISA, vendor, and mission partner resources for system/application issue resolutions. With this understanding, create/update all documents related to collaboration calls to include: collaboration timeline notes, issue status reports to management every 2 hours during the troubleshooting process, root cause analysis (RCA), After Action Reports (AAR), and senior management white papers. JOB REQUIREMENTS Education & Experience Bachelors 5+ years’ experience maintaining and supporting business applications architectures Certifications Appropriate DoD 8570 IAT/IAM Level certification (CCNA Security, CySA+, GICSP, GSEC, Security+ CE, SSCP, or higher), as well as technology-specific certifications such as MCSA Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2016, Certified UNIX Security Administrator (GCUX), etc. Security Clearance NIPRNet Access – Secret IT-I Requires Final (Interim is acceptable to start) DoD Security Clearance level of Secret Other (Travel, Work Environment, DoD 8570 Requirements, Administrative Notes, etc.) Note, all positons are identified as DoD 8570 IT-1 (privileged level systems access), which requires a favorably adjudicated Tier 5 investigation (formerly known as a Single Scope Background Investigation (SSBI)). Travel requirement is not expected. EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability

ad.title: SID Infrastructure Management Systems Architect - Computer World Services - Ogden, UT
ad.content: Responsible for designing and implementing information systems that will adequately support the enterprise infrastructure of the organization. Analyzes system requirements and defines system architecture that will meet business needs, including server infrastructure, capacity planning, storage requirements, and networking protocols. Ensures that architecture project roll-outs meet security standards and be effectively integrated with current applications. A specialist on complex technical and business matters. Work is highly independent. May assume a team lead role for the work group. Key Tasks and Responsibilities As part of a small team, support SID Infrastructure Management with knowledge and subject matter expertise in order to design, engineer, and architect implementation plans for DISA staff to implement, configure, upgrade, and secure infrastructure devices according to best practices, DISA policy and DOD IA compliance.Knowledge and expertise includes the following: Operating System – o Microsoft Windows, UNIX, Solaris, Solaris on Oracle SuperCluster and Linux. High Availability (HA) Service Guard, Oracle RAC and SQL Cluster.Storage – o Enterprise Class Storage Systems (ECSS) including Storage Area Network (SAN) switch implementation and configuration, Network Attached Storage (NAS) implementation and configuration, Content Addressable Storage (CAS) implementation and configuration, DataDomain implementation and con- figuration, and Enterprise Class Storage Arrays. Also provide SME support for VERITAS Netbackup and provide technical assistance with backup configurations and troubleshooting for backup failures.Appliances – o Expertise on implementation and configuration of SAP HANA and BWA according to vendor best practices, DISA policy, and DOD IA guidelines.Database/Application –o Database – § Expertise on implementation and configuration of database recovery using Oracle Real Applica- tion Clusters (RAC), Oracle Recovery Manager (RMAN) and Oracle DataGuard for database technologies including Oracle, Microsoft SQL, and SAP HANA. In addition, the contractor shall provide SME support for database security requirements according to vendor best practices, DISA policy, and DOD IA guidelines.o Application – § Expertise on the implementation, configuration, upgrades, releases, changes/transports/migrations, patching, and securing ERP applications according to vendor best practices, DISA policy, and DOD IA guidelines.Multi-Vendor Hyper Converged Infrastructures (HCI) – o Architect specifications for the product applications listed below. Perform all maintenance activity coordination to include patching, firmware update, capacity increase, power and cooling, backup, and recovery on all components to include network architecture, performance/capacity/trend analysis, and high availability (failover). Comply with all security compliance requirements, to include data encryption, in accordance with vendor best practices, DISA policy, and DOD IA guidelines.§ Oracle SuperCluster § SAP HANA § SAP KNOA § Business Warehouse Accelerator (BWA) § HP CX700Network - Ports, Protocols and Services Management (PPSM) – o Work with the mission partner’s application owners to implement/update PPSM information for all ports the applications require, end user access ports, and system interfaces ports. Create and process the proper PPSM registration for the network team to allow connectivity between the systems/applications through the determined ports listed in PPSM.IP Address – o Work with DISA and mission partner Network teams to document required IP address space and provide IP address details including IP configuration instructions to the DISA technical teams as it relates to the production, out of band (OOB) and enterprise backup network (EBN) networks.Virtualization/EVT Coordination – o Work with the DISA Enterprise Virtualization Team to provide details on switch, Virtual Local Area Network (VLAN), and profile information per operating environment. Document virtual network configuration details including network VLAN and profile configuration instructions to the DISA technical teams as it relates to the production, OOB and EBN networks.Performance Monitoring and Reporting – o Complete performance monitoring of hardware/software components related to Central Processing Unit (CPU), Memory, and DISK Input/Output (I/O). Complete technical performance monitoring and provide documented baselines including quarterly updates with the goal of proactive notification when the environment is reaching peaks and providing documented details of performance gaps to prevent system degradations due to hardware constraints.Suggestion Tracking and Status – o Perform as project leader to document and provide quarterly status on performance improvement suggestions offered by the technical teams. Develop document according to the action officer guide, and present to the mission partner’s senior leaders providing technical suggestions for system improvements. JOB REQUIREMENTS Education & Experience Bachelors 10+ years’ maintaining and supporting applications architectures in an enterprise environment Certifications Appropriate DoD 8570 IAT/IAM Level certification (CCNA Security, CySA+, GICSP, GSEC, Security+ CE, SSCP, or higher), as well as technology-specific certifications such as MCSA Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2016, Certified UNIX Security Administrator (GCUX), etc. Security Clearance NIPRNet Access – Secret IT-I Requires Final (Interim is acceptable to start) DoD Security Clearance level of Secret Other (Travel, Work Environment, DoD 8570 Requirements, Administrative Notes, etc.) Note, all positons are identified as DoD 8570 IT-1 (privileged level systems access), which requires a favorably adjudicated Tier 5 investigation (formerly known as a Single Scope Background Investigation (SSBI)). Travel requirement is not expected EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability

Works on complex projects and problems. A specialist on complex technical and business matters. Work is highly independent. May assume a team lead role for the work group. Establish and maintain database development and operating procedures, design descriptions, and application documentation. Perform database administration support for Oracle databases maintained by DISA Special Services, Software Release Management Section. Design and maintain the logical and physical databases and associated schemas. Ensure the security posture of the Oracle databases. Establish and maintain documentation for database software maintenance procedures. Coordinate all testing of and implementation of software and document all related procedures. Provide, document, and administer operating system security and operating system support to include the storage subsystems of Solaris/Linux servers maintained by the section. Ensure the security posture of supported Solaris systems, maintain availability, and initiate recovery from failure or incidents. Travel requirement is not expected. EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability

ad.content:

Preferred:At least 1 year of warehouse and customer service experience.Oracle experience.Knowledge of perpetual inventory management system. ad.title: Project Manager - Spectrum Brands - Middleton, WI
ad.content:
Spectrum Brands utilizes a Shared Services model that enables resources to be leveraged across the organization. The Shared Services team is made up of information technology, human resources, indirect sourcing, finance & accounting professionals that support all business units. Shared services teams are headquartered in Middleton, Wisconsin but have members across the country. Job Summary The Project Manager is responsible for successfully managing business development work. The position works directly with other project managers, business leaders, and sub-teams. Responsibilities include general facilitation, scope definition, timeline creation, project tracking & reporting, issue escalation/resolution. Additional responsibilities include evaluating opportunities, resource management, and implementation support of long term strategic plans. The Project Manager is key to internal and external value optimizing strategies as measured by cost, quality, delivery and service levels. Job will at times require occasional travel. Primary Duties & Responsibilities Manages project teams or work streams. Facilitates execution through cross functional team members and follows-up accordingly. Develops, coordinates, and maintains integrated project timelines for all assigned projects. Facilitates the definition of project scope, goals, deliverables, project tasks and resource requirements. Tracks project progress and creates reports used in steering committees by senior leadership teams Works closely with project managers and functional leaders to ensure projects meets defined metrics such as customer service levels, quality, savings, budgets and schedules. Helps to escalate and resolve all issues related to the project in a timely manner. Acts as a liaison between leadership and other functions as necessary Organizes planning and implementation of strategic projects on schedule and within project and product cost targets. Supports initiation, development and implementation of strategic projects involving new technology and/or multi-plant coordination. Participates in the establishment and control of project investment and expense budgets for projects All other duties as assigned. Education and Experience Profile Bachelor’s degree in business or technical field. Minimum of 5 years combined project/project management, finance, strategic planning, operations, and/or business development experience. PMP certification preferred. Prior experience with business integration, separation or expansion preferred. Required Skills Ability to analyze and organize facts to effectively present material both verbally and in writing. Effectively utilize communication skills, both oral and written for audiences inside and outside of the organization. Interface with employees at varying levels within the organization. Must be skilled in facilitating dynamic, cross-functional teams to achieve outstanding performance. Must demonstrate the highest degree of confidentiality and integrity. Prior experience with organizational change management. Ability to manage effectively, directly and indirectly, in a team-oriented environment; lead and influence without authority. Self-motivated and able to work independently at times to complete tasks efficiently, timely and accurately. Ability to multi-task in a time sensitive & dynamic environment. Comfortable with ambiguity. Curious and willing to learn new things. Intermediate to advanced skill levels in MS Excel, Word, Power Point, SharePoint, Project. Detail-oriented and well-organized. Positive, “Whatever it takes” attitude. Able to travel on occasion (less than 25%) internationally and domestically to perform assigned duties. Work Environment Working conditions are normal for an office environment.
The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this job/classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.
Spectrum Brands is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.
#LI-AR
#SPB

ad.title: Executive Assistant I - Liberty Mutual Insurance - Fairfield, OH
ad.content:
$54,600 - $66,900 a yearProvides administrative support for one or more executives, exercising confidentiality, tact and diplomacy. Manages executive calendars, coordinates and optimizes executive travel plans, prepares materials for meetings, triages phone calls, voice mails and e-mails, and helps to keep the executive(s) on schedule. Essence of the role is to enable the executive(s) supported to be more productive with their time and to work as efficiently and effectively as possible. Additionally, provides business segment support including but not limited to running reports, maintaining data bases, updating organizational charts, supporting Salesforce (CRM tool). Responsibilities: Identifies the preferred method of support for assigned executives and appropriately accommodates the working style. Partners with executive(s) to help them be more efficient and effective with their time, consistently maintaining strong communication. Assists executive(s) in calendar planning. Acts as a gatekeeper to include prioritization of meetings and managing scheduling conflicts. Keeps the executive(s) informed of changes. Assists the executive(s) with preparing for meetings, to include preparing materials, obtaining materials in advance, distributing materials, and keeping the executive on schedule. Obtains appropriate support for virtual attendees as we as various media needs and other logistics.
Provides phone coverage and screens/triages calls and voice mail. Greets and assists planned guests and manages unannounced visitors. Optimizes travel arrangements (transportation, accommodations, agenda) based on the executive’s travel needs and preferences. Manages complex itineraries, to include any changes. Enables remote decision-making. Processes related expenses. Coordinates and/or assists with team meetings (staff meetings, all-hands meetings, quarterly on-sites/off-sites, team gatherings, etc.) May assist with event planning. Prepares, updates and organizes information for inclusion in huddle boards, reports, correspondence, presentations, budgets, etc. Edits documents for accuracy, format and arrangement of material. Sorts, screens and distributes incoming and outgoing mail for the executive(s). May highlight particular information of interest and/or curate reading material. Assists in keeping the executive(s) well organized, to include online retrieval and archiving of documents as well as supporting the Company`s records and retention schedule. Supports business by running reports, managing SharePoint sites, maintaining data bases and customer relationship management (CRM) tools, processing licensing requests, monitoring electronic mailboxes and updating and maintaining records. Qualifications: Knowledge of administrative procedures, software applications (such as Microsoft Office Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) records management systems, and other business procedures and terminology. Excellent organizational skills, time management skills and attention to detail, to include anticipating needs and being proactive; Displays high degree of professionalism in order to maintain confidential information, deal with people tactfully, and help establish strong relationships and positive communication; as normally acquired through an Associate’s degree (or equivalent) and 5 years of relevant administrative experience, to include prior experience providing support at the management level. Benefits: We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to positive change. In return for your service, it’s our privilege to offer you benefits and rewards that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/BenefitsOverview: At Liberty Mutual, we give motivated, accomplished professionals the opportunity to help us redefine what insurance means; to work for a global leader with a deep sense of humanity and a focus on improving and protecting everyday lives. We create an inspired, collaborative environment, where people can take ownership of their work; push breakthrough ideas; and feel confident that their contributions will be valued and their growth championed. We’re dedicated to doing the right thing for our employees, because we know that their fulfillment and success leads us to great places. Life. Happiness. Innovation. Impact. Advancement. Whatever their pursuit, talented people find their path at Liberty Mutual.

ad.title: Senior Program Assistant (Part-Time), Valente Center for Arts & Sciences - Bentley University - Waltham, MA
ad.content: Part-timeJob Description Summary PLEASE NOTE: This Senior Program Assistant position is a regular part-time (20 hours per week), benefits eligible, year round position. The start date for this position will be in August 2019. The Senior Program Assistant provides administrative and programmatic support in the Valente Center for Arts & Sciences, working with the Valente Center director, faculty, and student leaders. The incumbent serves as a point of contact both within the university and for external clients, facilitates activities and evets, manages workflow within the office, assists with project coordinator, and supervises and trains student workers. The Program Assistant II maintains records of the Center, assists with the Center’s financial management, and may manage the website and social media accounts for the department. The position coordinates logistics and planning for events, recurring academic seminars, and programs for the center, performing various administrative, bookkeeping, and record keeping tasks. Administrative Support: Provides general administrative support for the implementation and successful continuation of programs in the Valente Center for Arts & Sciences at Bentley, including database administration and information management utilizing Drupal, Cognos, Workday, and Microsoft Office 365 including OneDrive, SharePoint and Teams Makes travel arrangements for Center visitors, faculty and staff and students Creates, organizes, and maintains hard copy and digital documents and folders associated with Valente Center programs, including flyers and advertisements, visitor forms and contracts, acknowledgement letters, payment requests, and other important documentation Assists with the hiring and management of student research assistants and researchers in the center. Makes requests for maintenance. Orders office supplies, stationery, business cards, office equipment, furniture, keys, etc. Assists in providing visitors with Bentley ID, office space in the Valente Center, internet access, etc. Provides a welcoming presence for all Bentley students, faculty, staff, and visitors on behalf of the Valente Center. Works with the Valente Center team and Valente Center suitemates (Honors Program, Liberal Studies Major) to create a collegial, fun, and exciting atmosphere. Program Support: Responsible for coordinating event management such as seminars, private and public events include room reservations, catering orders, audio-visual setup including audio/video-recording requirements. Financial Support: Monitors and reconciles department budget by running budget reports and keeping track of expenditures and reimbursements for expenses authorized by the Director Processes charges and expense reports using a cloud-based financial reporting software system (Workday) Assists with all details of multiple semester-long academic seminars. Responsibilities include student and faculty enrollment and financial processes as well as all event management related activities Supervisory Responsibility: Interviews, selects, hires, and manages work study students. Coordinates all student employment scheduling and payroll issues for Work Study students in the center. Provides feedback and corrective action when necessary Website and Social Media: Assists in the design and maintenance of the Valente Center website, including frequent updating of event schedules, linking recorded events, and keeping the Valente Center program information current Oversees social media utilization to promote Center activities Minimum Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent plus 3-5 years demonstrated administrative support experience. Must be proficient with technology (PC, Mac, and mobile) including Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, among other programs and online platforms as required. Abilities to task-switch and prioritize work are a must. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail required. Strong written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal skills are essential, as are proven sense of initiative and oversight. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree strongly preferred. Physical Demands: This position spends about 80% of time at the computer. Extended sitting and working on a computer; some walking around campus for deliveries or events. PLEASE NOTE: This Senior Program Assistant position is a regular part-time (20 hours per week), benefits eligible, year round position. The start date for this position will be in August 2019. Bentley University requires references checks and may conduct other pre-employment screening. DIVERSITY STATEMENT Bentley University strives to create a campus community that welcomes the exchange of ideas, and fosters a culture that values differences and views them as a strength in our community. Bentley University is an Equal Opportunity Employer, building strength through diversity. The University is committed to building a community of talented students, faculty and staff who reflect the diversity of global business. We strongly encourage applications from persons from underrepresented groups, individuals with disabilities, covered veterans and those with diverse experiences and backgrounds.

ad.title: Senior Engineering Applications Administrator - Garmin - Olathe, KS
ad.content:
As a leading worldwide provider of navigation devices and wearable technology, our focus is on developing, designing and supporting superior products. Our advanced technology promotes performance, safety and ease of use in every market we serve. That makes us an engineering and technology company with a keen focus on recruiting talent in those fields. But the same vertical integration business model that keeps all design and manufacturing processes in-house also gives us the incentive to hire top performers from different backgrounds, including operations, finance and accounting, information technology, sales, marketing and communications.We are looking for a full time Senior Engineering Applications Administrator at our headquarters in the Greater Kansas City Area. In this role, you will provide technical leadership and project planning for administration and support of software engineering applications (tools) in a team-oriented environment.Other essential functions may include: Serve in a leadership capacity for supporting administrative needs for software engineering applications used within the Engineering department, including but not limited to software configuration management, issue tracking, and other software development related applications. Provide technical leadership for software engineering application installations and upgrades. Support database related needs for software engineering applications. Create and maintain programs/scripts for supporting the administration of complex software engineering applications. Lead monitoring and testing of complex software engineering applications. Assist with software engineering application server capacity planning, backups and other server based activities. Participate in disaster recovery activities. Provide technical leadership in evaluating, integrating, administrating, and supporting new software engineering applications as they apply to existing functions. Balance quality, quantity and complexity in work output. Make substantial contributions toward determination of project goal/objective feasibility. Mentor and/or supervise less experienced Engineering Application Administrators (1 & 2). Independently determine general approach and specific solutions to technical problems. Offer process improvement suggestions and author new procedures as appropriate. Provide reliable solutions to a wide range of difficult problems using sound problem solving techniques. Apply good judgment in setting schedules and risk taking. Exemplify Garmin’s Mission, Vision, Values and Quality Policy and proactively work to improve Garmin’s image and culture. Accept and complete complex projects and other miscellaneous duties as assigned. Qualifications
Qualified candidates will possess the following education, experience and skills: Bachelor of Science Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or another substantially similar field AND a minimum of 5 years experience in software engineering applications management. Excellent academics (cumulative GPA greater than or equal to 3.0 as a general rule). Must demonstrate competence with researching fundamental problems and implementing appropriate solutions. Must possess the ability to decompose functional requirements into well-defined tasks while balancing quality, quantity and complexity in work output. Must demonstrate proficient experience with HTML, JavaScript or other related web technologies as appropriate for performing the essential functions of this job description. Must possess relevant experience with writing Perl and/or Python scripts. Must possess experience with Linux operating system. Must possess relevant experience working with Apache web servers and Java application servers. Must demonstrate proficiency and possess experience with relational database systems (MySQL and/or PostgreSQL). Previous experience working in a team environment. Demonstrated strong and effective verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills. Superior academics (cumulative GPA greater than or equal to 3.5). Experience with Atlassian’s JIRA and Confluence applications. Experience with Microsoft SharePoint. Experience with software development processes. Experience programming in Java and/or C/C++. Our benefits, designed to lead an evolving marketplace, support innovation and encourage a healthy balance between work and life, keep us competitive and allow our associates to make their own decisions about their well-being and future. We offer a choice of healthcare plans—with low or no premiums—which consistently rank in the 90th percentile when compared to other high-tech employers, plus dental and vision plans for you and your family. In addition, our financial benefits rate 82% above the median for technology companies comparable in size. Our 401K retirement plan provides 5% of pay base contribution plus a match of 75 cents for every dollar you contribute to a maximum of 10% of your compensation. The employee stock purchase plan allows for shares to be bought at a 15% discount. Garmin International is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran’s status, age or disability. Job Engineering Primary LocationUS-KS-Olathe Organization Consumer Engineering Schedule Full-time

ContractKey Role:Link the business mission, strategy, and processes of an organization to its IT strategy and document this using multiple architectural models or views that show how the current and future needs of an organization will be met in an efficient, sustainable, agile, and adaptable manner. Serve as a liaison between varying business units to promote smooth and timely delivery of software products or updates. Help identify, analyze, or implement processes or products to manage the release of code efficiently. Represent the organization as a prime technical contact on contracts and projects. Interact with senior external personnel on significant technical matters often requiring coordination between organizations. Basic Qualifications: 11+ years of experience with technical work Experience in a leadership role, including delivering IT solutions to improve business delivery services, reengineering business processes to improve performance and productivity, and applying technology, where appropriate Knowledge of the tools and techniques used to analyze and document business process architectures, including Agile software development processes Ability to plan and lead major technology assignments Ability to evaluate performance results and recommend major changes affecting short-term project growth and success Ability to function as a technical expert across multiple project assignments and help troubleshoot problems with an application outside of the code level Ability to provide ad hoc strategic planning and subject matter expertise, as necessary Ability to obtain a security clearance BA or BS degree
Additional Qualifications: Experience with delivering SharePoint or Dynamics CRM-based solutions Knowledge of using Jira or Team Foundation Server to manage agile software development processes Ability to conduct enterprise resource planning and management processes Active Secret or Top Secret clearance
