ad.title: Product Marketing Manager, Versal AI and AI Engine Tool Flow - Xilinx - San Jose, CA
ad.content: DescriptionXilinx is the leading provider of All Programmable FPGAs, SoCs, MPSoCs and 3D ICs. Xilinx's all-programmable devices are designed into tens of thousands of products that improve the quality of the everyday lives of billions of people worldwide. For over 30 years, Xilinx has been behind some of the greatest advancements in technology and science - from the industry's first fabless semiconductor model to the NASA Curiosity Mars Rover, to today's autonomous vehicles and hyperscale data centers. Xilinx uniquely enables applications that are both software-defined, yet hardware optimized - enabling smart, connected and differentiated applications across technology's biggest megatrends, including Machine Learning, 5G Wireless, Embedded Vision, Industrial IoT, Cloud Computing, Prototyping/Emulation, and more. If you are a passionate, innovative and an out-of-the-box thinker that enjoys challenging projects, Xilinx is the right place for you. Our global team is growing and we are looking for bold, collaborative, and creative people to help deliver groundbreaking technologies that enable our customers to differentiate. Come do your best work and live your best life through collaboration, wellness and giving back to your community as a member of the ONEXILINX team. Responsibilities: Business development of AI solutions for Versal and AI engine development tool flow / methodology Secure strategic early-access customers and ecosystem partners for well-defined project Project manage the early access programs and work with technical marketing for a successful execution Develop customer and sales presentations Develop and align with multiple stakeholders on the multi-phase Go-To-Market plans Develop field training strategies Support special meetings / conference calls with the field Provide market trends and customer feedback to technical marketing and product planning for roadmap and collateral updates MS/BS Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field Strong background in AI frameworks Strong background in software development tools like CUDA, OpenVINO, OpenCL SDK, nGraph, CodeComposer Strong background in libraries and ecosystem like OpenCV, BLAS, signal processing, communication libraries Strong communication skills, verbal and written Strong customer / internal facing communication skills

ad.title: Vice President, Corporate & Marketing Communications - Xilinx - San Jose, CA
ad.content: Description At Xilinx, we are leading the industry transformation to build an adaptable, intelligent world. ARE YOU bold, collaborative, and creative? At Xilinx, we hire and develop leaders and innovators who want to revolutionize the world of technology. We believe that by embracing diverse ideas, pushing boundaries, and working together as ONEXILINX, anything is possible. Our culture of innovation began with the invention of the Field Programmable Gate Array (FPGA), and with the 2018 introduction of our Adaptive Compute Acceleration Platform (ACAP), has made a quantum leap in capability, solidifying our role as the adaptable platform supplier of choice. From the start, we have always believed in providing inventors with products and platforms that are infinitely adaptable. From self-driving cars, to world-record genome processing, to AI and big data, to the world’s first 5G networks, we empower the world’s builders and visionaries whose ideas solve every day problems and enhance people’s lives. If you are PASSIONATE, ADAPTABLE, and INNOVATIVE, Xilinx is the right place for you! At Xilinx we care deeply about creating meaningful development experiences while building a strong sense of belonging and connection. We foster an environment of empowered learning, wellness, community engagement, and recognition, so you can focus on work that matters – world class technology that improves the way we live and work. We are ONEXILINX.Role Responsibilities: At Xilinx we are transforming into a platform company. We see tremendous growth potential in the post-Moore’s Law era of adaptive computing. In support of this transformation, this role will work closely with the Marketing leadership team as well as the CEO and executive leadership to help position Xilinx in new emerging markets and advance our platform positioning in our established markets to continue our rapid growth momentum.The detailed responsibilities include: o Develop and lead a world-class corporate and marketing communications team to position Xilinx as the adaptable intelligence platform leader in each of our target markets o Create and lead Xilinx corporate positioning, outbound messaging, web and digital, and PR strategies to achieve near-term and long-term company objectives and position Xilinx to key target audiences including the editorial/investor/analyst community and target customers o Create, implement, and own brand strategy and standards o Drive executive presentations and messaging, and support key technical campaigns and presentations o Lead internal & employee communications aligned with brand objectives and new company strategy to inspire and motivate employees and collaborate with HR to support new talent acquisition o Develop a digital strategy including Xilinx.com, Xilinx Forums and other communities; define and create a world class customer experience; build out a strong digital team including user experience (UX) expertise o Effectively influence, align, and collaborate with key functions, particularly Sales, Product and Vertical Marketing, key vertical business units, R&D, Finance, HR and IR o Support key go-to-market campaigns, external events, 3rd party or Xilinx-led ecosystem activities, IR and analyst relations, and ensure consistent and appropriate corporate messaging worldwide Organization & Reporting: o PR/AR o Executive Communications o Brand & Creative o Digital & Web o Internal Employee Communications o Events including Xilinx Developers’ Forum (XDF) o Regional Marcom and WebKey Success Factors: o Corporate positioning, brand strategy and digital strategy expertise in complex technology markets, preferably semiconductors o Proven record of organizational leadership, team development and change management o Effective cross-functional collaboration skills o Fast and continuous learner with passion for building world-class teams, culture, and best in-class processes/practices o Decisive decision making based on clear & creative thinking, data analysis, and experience o Strategic thinking and ability to execute strategy with agility and flexibility on tactics o Seeker of great ideas from any source, including personal networks in multiple disciplines; open to free discussion of alternate ideas and proposals in order to find the best solution to the issue at hand o Early adopter and exhibitor of Xilinx culture of teamwork, excellence, and accountability o Thorough understanding of analyst, press, and customer care-abouts; in particular, experience marketing to software and application developers o Strong attention to detail and hands-on management o Willingness and ability to engage in all levels of work of the team, from strategic planning to tactical execution Required Experience:o Demonstrated leadership and organizational experience in corporate marketing and/or corporate communications functions, or successful marketing communications leadership experience in a large technology companyo Significant work experience and business success with companies with complex silicon or system products in one or more of Xilinx’s targeted market segmentso Demonstrated success in leading large-scale corporate/BU positioning or re-positioning campaigns and major product launches - including primary research and brand studies, market and target customer segmentation, communication strategy development with a strong grasp of Xilinx’s overall business and technology strategy, and driving effective executiono Track record of success in developing and prioritizing corporate communications themes, and mobilizing and aligning both external and internal PR efforts at Xilinx’s or larger scale (several thousand employees)o Leadership of web/digital strategy with demonstrated high-quality resultsDesired/Preferred Experience:o Experience in Data Center market, AI/Machine Learning, and cloud providers/hyperscalerso Experience in the semiconductor industry combined with experience in software and Data Center industrieso o Experience leveraging and working with 3rd party ecosystems to project Xilinx’s leadershipo Experience with mergers and acquisitions communication and integrationo Familiarity with or experience developing university and educational programs to develop long-term brand image with our future customersEducation:o Bachelor’s degree is required, a BA or BS in Marketing, Communications, English or related majors are preferredo MA/MS in a related field is a pluso At least 20 years of related experience, as assessed by hiring managementLocation:o San Jose, and expect 15% travel to all regionso Relocation assistance available for the right candidateo Remote worksite arrangements not being considered for this role

ad.title: Systems Analyst III - Iowa State University - Ames, IA
ad.content:
The College of Liberal Arts and Sciences (LAS) at Iowa State University is seeking qualified candidates for a Systems Analyst III. This position is part of the LAS Research Computing and Infrastructure Operations team and provides system architecture design and planning, systems analysis, systems operations, and user support in the areas of research computing (including High Performance Computing – HPC), web, virtual machine, containerization, cloud hosting, server administration, and endpoint management infrastructure to the faculty and staff of multiple departments, programs, and colleges.
Responsibilities for the Systems Analyst III include planning, architecture, installing, and maintaining and securing Linux, Windows, and Mac OS X systems (most frequently servers) in a networked environment; developing as-needed programs and tools; managing software licensing; working with vendors such as server vendors, operating system manufacturers, and cloud service providers; and installing hardware and software. As a member of this team, the person in this position will maintain and enhance systems and facilities, which include HPC systems, large server clusters, complex scientific applications, petabyte scale storage, server virtualization, databases, and client software, and provide backup support for these functions for the remainder of the group. The person in this position will help the University stay current with large scale infrastructure, high performance computing, and research computing practices.
This position is expected to provide direction and procedures in technology planning and implementation across all programs, administrative units, and technology spaces in the college and lead the requirements gathering, planning, specification, and implementation of new server hardware and systems. In addition, this position will provide planning, support, and administration of network storage infrastructure used by researchers across the entire University.
The successful candidate will possess excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate with faculty, staff and students; the ability to handle multiple projects; the ability to interpret, apply, and write complex technical documentation; and the ability to apply creative problem solving, critical thinking, and advanced troubleshooting skills to complex technical problems. About Iowa State University and the Ames Community Iowa State University is classified as a Carnegie Foundation Doctoral Universities: Very High Research Activity, a member of the Association of American Universities (AAU), and ranked by U.S. News and World Report as one of the top public universities in the nation. More than 34,000 students are enrolled and are served by over 6,200 faculty and staff.
Iowa State University is a global and culturally diverse university committed to providing an inclusive, equitable, and diverse environment for both learning and employment. We know that diversity in experience and perspective is vital to advancing innovation, critical thinking, solving complex problems, and building an inclusive academic community. At Iowa State, we translate these values into action by seeking individuals who have experience working with diverse students, colleagues, and constituents. The university has an expectation that all employees will demonstrate a contribution to diversity and inclusion as embodied in Iowa State University’s Principles of Community.
Ames, Iowa is a progressive community of 60,000, located approximately 30 minutes north of Des Moines, and recently voted one of the best college towns in the nation.
Iowa State University is an equal opportunity employer committed to excellence through diversity and strongly encourages applications from all qualified applicants, including women, underrepresented populations, and veterans. ISU is responsive to the needs of dual career couples, is dedicated to work-life balance through an array of policies, and is an NSF ADVANCE institution.
All employees are expected to exhibit and convey good citizenship within the program, the department, college, university activities, collegial interactions, and maintain the highest standards of integrity and ethical behavior. Required Education and Experience Bachelor’s degree and 4 years of related experience; OR a Master’s degree and 2 years of related experience. Supplemental Required Education and Experience Experience must include systems analysis for large multi-server systems, server administration, and support. Preferred Education and Experience 1. Experience writing Linux shell scripts, Windows Powershell, and experience with other languages such as C, C++, Python, R, Julia, Perl, JavaScript, and/or PHP in a compute intensive environment2. Experience with parallel applications utilizing technology such as MPI, OpenMP, CUDA, OpenCL, OpenACC, thread pools, etc.3. Experience with system configuration and automation tools such as Ansible, Chef, Puppet, SaltStack, SCCM, WinRM4. Experience with job scheduling systems such as slurm, pbs, torque, sge, or similar5. Experience with logical volume managers and distributed or parallel storage systems such as zfs, lustre, ceph, gluster, or similar6. Experience administering Active Directory, group policy, multi factor auth solutions, and Microsoft System Center in a large organization which includes Windows, macOS, and Linux clients7. Experience with server virtualization technologies, container orchestration, and cloud computing infrastructure (e.g. RHV, kvm, vmware, kubernetes, openshift, aws, azure, gcp, etc.)8. Experience with version control, ticketing systems, automated software testing, and continuous integration / continuous deployment tools9. Experience writing complex system documentation and procedures, as well as concise and understandable end-user documentation10. Bachelor’s degree in computer science, computer engineering, mathematics, statistics, computational biology, or closely related field. Location (if other than Ames) Additional Information This position has been reposted. Department Contact Name Mallory Hamilton Department Contact Phone Department Contact Email mhamil@iastate.edu Department/Unit Website Application Instructions To apply for this position, please click on “Apply for this Job” and complete the Employment Application. Please be prepared to enter or attach the following:1) Resume/Curriculum Vitae2) Letter of Application/Cover Letter3) Contact Information for Three ReferencesIf you have questions regarding this application process, please email employment@iastate.edu or call 515-294-4800 or Toll Free: 1-877-477-7485. Special Instructions Summary Guaranteed Consideration Date 05/05/2019 Pre-Employment Screening All offers of employment, oral and written, are contingent upon the university’s verification of credentials and other information required by federal and state law, ISU policies/procedures, and may include the completion of a background check and/or a consumer credit check. Quick Link http://www.iastatejobs.com/postings/40062 EO Statement Iowa State University is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, marital status, disability, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against. Inquiries can be directed to the Office of Equal Opportunity, 3410 Beardshear Hall, 515 Morrill Road, 515 294-7612, email eooffice@iastate.edu.

ad.title: Elementary Art Teacher (K-6) - Spring Grove Area School District - Spring Grove, PA
ad.content: Elementary (K-6) Art TeacherPosition PurposeTo develop students' interest, abilities, talents and skills for artistic expression and creativity in the visual arts, as well as aesthetic understanding and appreciation by implementing district approved curriculum; documenting teaching and student progress/activities/outcomes; developing lesson plans; modeling the necessary skills to performing assigned tasks; providing a safe and optimal learning environment; and providing feedback to students, parents and administration regarding student progress, expectations, goals, etc.Essential Functions Develops and administers school art curriculum consistent with school district goals and objectives. Develops lesson plans and instructional materials and translates lesson plans into learning experiences so as to best utilize the available time for art instruction. Teaches knowledge and skills in art, including crafts, drawing, painting, lettering, design, commercial art, art history, and three-dimensional art to secondary pupils, following the course of study adopted by the Board of Education, and other appropriate learning activities. Provides instruction by which students develop aesthetic concepts and appreciation and the ability to make qualitative judgments about art, art appreciation and what constitutes art. Conducts ongoing assessment of student skills and learning in artistic techniques and expression, and modifies instructional methods to fit individual student's needs, including students with special needs; conducts individual and small group instruction as needed. Demonstrates techniques in activities such as drawing, painting, and modeling, using standard and teacher-prepared instructional aids. Develops instructional plans and organizes class time to provide a balanced program of instruction, demonstration, and working time. Instructs students in proper care and use of tools and equipment used in art classes. Evaluates each student's performance and growth in knowledge and aesthetic understandings, and prepares progress reports. Plans and presents art displays and exhibitions designed to exhibit pupils' work for the school and the community. May sponsor exhibits from outside. Continues to acquire professional knowledge and learn of current developments in the educational field by attending seminars, workshops or professional meetings, or by conducting research. Organizes and maintains a system for accurate and complete record-keeping, grading, and reporting for all student activities, achievement and attendance as required by district procedures and applicable laws. Encourages parental involvement in students' education and ensures effective communication with students and parents. Ensures that student conduct conforms to the school's standards and school district policies, and establishes and maintains standards of pupil behavior needed to achieve a functional learning atmosphere in the classroom. Coordinates with other school professional staff members, especially within grade level, and participates in faculty meetings and committees. Selects and requisitions appropriate books, art materials, instructional aids and other supplies and equipment and maintains inventory records. Additional DutiesPerforms other related tasks as assigned by the Principal and other central office administrators as designated by the Superintendent.Note: The above description is illustrative of tasks and responsibilities. It is not meant to be all inclusive of every task or responsibility.EquipmentUse standard office equipment such as; personal computers, printer, copy and fax machines, and telephone.Travel RequirementsTravels to school district buildings and professional meetings as required.Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Knowledge of current art instructional teaching methods and educational pedagogy, as well as differentiates instruction based upon student learning styles. Knowledge of art curriculum and concepts. Knowledge of applicable federal and state laws regarding education and students. Ability to use computer network system and software applications as needed. Ability to organize and coordinate work. Ability to communicate effectively with students and parents. Ability to engage in self-evaluation with regard to performance and professional growth. Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with others contacted in the course of work. Physical and Mental Demands, Work HazardsWork in standard office and school building environments.Certification/License: PA State Certification as an Art Teacher (K-12) or as required for position. Motor Vehicle Operator's License or ability to provide own transportation. Education Bachelors from an accredited college or university in education discipline applicable to teaching assignment. ExperienceSuccessful prior teaching experience for the appropriate grade level and/or subject is a plus.FLSA Status: Exempt

ad.title: Staff Sys S/W Analyst - Northrop Grumman - Fairfax, VA
ad.content:
Do you desire a patriotic role and the chance to defend our nation's cyber infrastructure? Do you enjoy learning about new technologies and how they can be used to provide cutting edge services to our customers? If so, then look to join the Northrop Grumman Mission Systems team.
Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) is seeking a Staff Systems Software Analyst to support an IT infrastructure network consolidation program in Fairfax, VA. The Systems Software Analyst will be a member of the Engineering, Sciences & Technology (ES&T) Eastern Region homeroom. Our team is chartered with providing the skills, innovative technologies to design, develop, produce and sustain product lines across while providing a decisive advantage to our customer's missions.
A Systems Software Analyst analyzes, enhances, installs, tests and modifies enterprise-wide operating systems for both new and existing systems. Develops requirements, workflow and systems analysis. Corrects program errors, prepares operating instructions, compiles documentation of program development, and analyzes system capabilities. Establishes standards for development and maintenance of new and existing products.
The Systems Software Analyst 5 position will be located in Fairfax, VA.Roles & Responsibilities: Deploy/test monthly patch updates to Window machines. Deploy, manage, maintain, and support Microsoft Window servers and workstations. Create and configure VMs with VMWare vSphere. Create user accounts and administer user privileges within active directory. Deploy/test monthly patch updates (rpms) to RHEL servers. Assist with implementation of automated processes or functions to improve daily operations as directed. Assist with implementation of technical security technology and IT projects. Manage/Deploy AV server and client products. Integrate updated management/monitoring tools. Collaborate in authoring system documentation and procedures.
Basic Qualifications - To be considered for this position, you must minimally meet the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed below. Bachelor's Degree and a minimum of 14 years' related experience is required. An additional 4 years of experience may be substituted in lieu of a degree. Active TS/SCI with Polygraph is required. Experience loading, configuring, maintaining, and troubleshooting Windows operating systems, including Windows Server and Windows 7. Experience with virtualization and/or cloud technologies such as VMWare vSphere, Oracle PCA, Hyper-V, or Amazon Web Services. Strong background in Windows administration including Active Directory, Group Policy, and WSUS.
Preferred Qualifications - Candidates with these desired skills will be given preferential consideration: Experience with implementing infrastructures within Amazon Web Services. Experience with Linux/Unix system administration. CompTIA Security+ Certification or equivalent DoD 8570 IAT II or III certification. Scripting experience with bash, Python, or PowerShell. Experience with automation tools such as Puppet, Chef, or Ansible. Strong working knowledge of IP address/Networking theory including common command line tools and commonly used ports to troubleshot and test network/connectivity issues. Familiarity with Firewall types/theory and configuration of OS installed FWs. Experience with Red Hat Enterprise Linux operating systems to include rpm management, user account management, dns, centrify, and AV tools. Familiarity with DB products/theory including Oracle, mySql, and MS SQL. Familiarity with SNMP operation, configuration. Strong working knowledge of DNS, zone management and IPAM. Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

ad.title: Analyst, Advanced Analytics - BMO Financial Group - Chicago, IL
ad.content: The Analyst will work with manager and business partners to support the development and implementation of advanced analytical solutions. We are looking for a go getter with the ability to conduct research and advance statistical analysis to identify trends, variations, patterns, and insights relating to branch performance and customer activities, and build end-to-end analytical solutions to drive profitable growth for the businessThis is an exciting opportunity that is on the forefront of a critical enterprise capability, providing business value through data and analytics. The incumbent will get to work with and support multiple lines of business around the enterprise to help them achieve their objectives.So if you have a statistical modeling experience, like to work in a start-up mode and have a long term orientation, join us to make meaningful difference in the lives of our customers, the community we serve in and the company.Support Senior Management on analytical projects of varying sizes and complexities, including: Participate in business partner interviews, brainstorming sessions, and workshops to capture business objectives and prioritize opportunities Identify best analytical techniques that can be effectively applied to achieve business objectives and interpret next best action through data driven insights Building end to end automated analytic solutions that are intuitive, simple to maintain, and drive real business outcomes Responsible for the development, and implementation of analytical solutions, including but not limited to: Data gathering and cleansing, statistical transformation, feature engineering & selection Build statistical models like linear/non-linear models, clustering, optimization & forecasting techniques like ARIMA etc. Leverage machine learning packages like Gradient Boosting, Random Forecasting, Pathing & Attribution, Link Analysis etc. to determine Product Propensity & prioritization as well as Channel Preference & Attribution Conceptualize & build reports leveraging visualization tools like Tableau to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiencesQualifications Knowledge Bachelor’s Degree with 2+ years of experience or Masters with 1+ years of experience in mathematics, statistics, behavioral economic, econometrics, engineering, computer science and/or physics, (Masters preferred) and/or 1+ years of analytical experience in financial services, Marketing, E-Commerce, Advertising, Fraud, Digital and/or consulting Basic skills in SQL or SAS a must, including relevant packages and statistical methodologies. Knowledge of Python, R, Spark or HiveQL will be big plus Deeper understanding of statistical modeling techniques like Regression, Decision Trees, Segmentation & Classification, forecasting techniques like ARIMA, Exponential Smoothing etc. Knowledge of machine learning techniques like Gradient Boosting, Random Forest, SVM, Pathing & Attribution etc. a strong plus Skills Demonstrates solid communication skills (both written and verbal) and relationship management skills at a senior management level Shows strong knowledge of mathematical and statistical models in a highly technical context, with proven record of building solutions to complex problems Demonstrates ability to build a good fact base, apply sound reasoning, and generate relevant recommendations that get implemented and lead to business success Demonstrates strong attention to detail and a high level of due diligence We’re here to helpAt BMO Harris Bank we have a shared purpose; we put the customer at the center of everything we do – helping people is in our DNA. For 200 years we have thought about the future—the future of our customers, our communities and our people. We help our customers and our communities by working together, innovating and pushing boundaries to bring them our very best every day. Together we’re changing the way people think about a bank.As a member of the BMO Harris Bank team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.To find out more visit us at https://bmoharriscareers.com .BMO Harris Bank is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. BMO Harris Bank N.A. is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.Job Business Analytics & Reporting Primary Location United States-Illinois-Chicago Organisation US Personal & Business Banking-X000004 Schedule full-time Job Posting 05/06/19 Unposting Date Ongoing

ad.title: Sales Operations Manager - TrueMotion - Boston, MA
ad.content:
There are 1.2B drivers in the world. TrueMotion combines the power of mobile technology, machine learning and SaaS to drive intelligence and digitization throughout the entire motor insurance lifecycle - and to save lives while we're doing it. Our clients include leading insurers, rideshare companies, auto manufacturers, telcos, etc. These clients embed and integrate our software into theirs and offer new products & services to their customers. The Sales Operations Manager is responsible for the infrastructure, process, and strategy for all of the customer facing teams (Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success). Your work will unlock the effectiveness and efficiency of the people on these teams and allow us to exceed our revenue and customer success goals. Responsibilities: Own all systems, processes, and reporting related to Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success Lead weekly, monthly, and quarterly operational, goal-setting, and performance cadence Lead forecasting, pipeline, deal, and customer health reviews Develop, implement, operationalize, and improve key performance metrics Manage sales compensation plans and process Implement customer lifecycle management strategies to track relationships from lead generation to revenue recognition Identify ways to continually improve and exceed our sales & customer success goals Develop revenue operations strategies for North America and Europe
Qualifications: 5+ years experience in Sales/Business Operations for enterprise SaaS companies Experience supporting large account marketing, sales, and customer success teams Advanced expertise in Salesforce, Hubspot, Zendesk, and Excel Analytical, data-driven problem solving skills Ability to foster high performance, metrics driven environment Strong written & verbal communication Organized and detail oriented Experience as a quota carrying Enterprise Saas Account Executive is a plus
TrueMotion offers: The best products and technology in our industry Satisfied, reference-able customers in the US and Europe Financial stability and A-list investors like General Catalyst, Bain, and Lakestar Seasoned exec team (Liberty Mutual, Salesforce.com, Zipcar, Harvard, MIT) Great culture with 4.9 rating on Glassdoor
Why TrueMotion? At TrueMotion we build solutions that make driving safer, lower cost, and more fun. We use the smartphone as a sensor and machine learning to turn phone data into driving data. We believe distracted driving is a solvable problem and partner with insurance companies and other relevant organizations to drive change (pun intended). We are a band of entrepreneurs dedicated to our mission and having fun at our office on Fort Point Channel! TrueMotion is backed by General Catalyst, Bain Capital Ventures and Lakestar. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

ad.title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer - Meetup - New York, NY
ad.content:
Getting together with real people in real life makes powerful things happen. Side hustles become careers, ideas become movements, and chance encounters become lifelong connections. Meetup brings people together to create thriving communities. Show up. Change lives. Activity on Meetup is growing faster than ever and by studying it, we're learning how to help members discover the Meetups that are right for them -- sparking more new ways to make their worlds come alive greater than ever before. While our team is small, our impact is amplified by the breadth of problems we get to solve and engineer every day. We are a collaborative and dedicated team seeking machine learning engineers to join us in designing and building the future vision of Meetup. About you:You imagine a world more easily connected, where people come together in real life, meet, and do more of the things that contribute to their lives. You are inspired by the people you work with, sharing ideas and ways to connect multiple systems and tech together:
Use machine learning to improve Meetup's recommendation and notification systems Develop your leadership skills while mentoring other specialists Design, build and own every aspect of our low-latency machine learning systems
You look to push yourself in how you think about applied machine learning, you are motivated by the challenges from engineering to machine learning, from deployment to production, and more. You're not interested in building within a silo, but democratic in team problem-solving. And what you've come to know after each day is a renewed excitement, knowing you've made a difference in a product that has the ability to transform people's lives every day. Additional responsibilities: Collaborate with product and design to leverage data and algorithms to help people Meetup Implement machine learning algorithms in modern cloud (AWS, Google Cloud) and horizontally scalable environments (MapReduce, Hadoop, Spark) Recruit and present on behalf of Meetup at technical conferences and Meetups
Preferred qualifications (or if you have transferable experience we'd like to hear from you, too!):
MS/Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics or related technical field 4+ years work/educational experience with recommendations, predictions, or NLP Develop code fluently in Scala, Java or Python Hands-on experience using machine learning frameworks to robustly build, validate, test, and monitor statistical models Experience with both relational and NoSQL (DynamoDB, Redis) databases and RESTful APIs
Our team is bold, supportive, and passionate about bringing people together in real life to create community for everyone. We care about moving fast, real-world change and building diverse, dynamic teams. You in?

ad.title: Cybersecurity Analyst - Leidos - Whitehall, OH
ad.content: Job #: R-00011694Location: Whitehall, OH Category: Cyber SecuritySchedule (FT/PT): Full timeTravel Required: NoShift: RotatingPotential for Telework: NoClearance Required: Top SecretReferral Eligibility: EligibleGroup: DefenseJob Description:Leidos has a current job opportunity for a Cyber Security Analyst for the DISA Global Network Assurance Team on the DISA GSM-O program in Columbus, OH. POSITION SUMMARY:This position provides cybersecurity services for Department of Defense networks. As part of incident investigation, this position will analyze threat intelligence, correlate actionable security events, and review network traffic alerts to identify compromises in DoD customer networks or hosts. This position requires shift work. There are three available shifts where you can state your preference: 7am-3pm, 3pm-11pm, and 11pm-7am.PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:Review DoD and open source intelligence for threats.Identify Indicators of Compromise (IOCs) and integrate those into sensors and SIEMs.Triage alerts to identify malicious actors on customer networks.Report incidents to customers and USCYBERCOM.Utilize alerts from endpoints, IDS/IPS, netflow, and custom sensors to identify compromises on customer networks/endpoints.Review massive log files, pivot between data sets, and provide evidence for incident investigations.Perform incident reporting in accordance with DoD requirements.BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:BS and 4+ years of prior relevant experience; additional years of related experience may be substituted in lieu of degree.Must have active 8570 IAT II Certification (Security+ CE or equivalent) to start on program and must obtain a CSSP-A 8570 certification within 6 months and maintain certification throughout assignment on GSMO.Demonstrated understanding of TCP/IP, common networking ports and protocols, traffic flow, system administration, OSI model, defense-in-depth and common security elements.Knowledge of malware and other threats targeting large government enterprises.Demonstrated commitment to training, self-study and maintaining proficiency in the technical cyber security domain.Willing to perform shift work.Active Top Secret clearance with ability to obtain a TS/SCI.PREFERRED SKILLS:CND experience (Protect, Detect, Respond and Sustain) within a Computer Incident Response organization.Demonstrated understanding of the life cycle of network threats, attacks, attack vectors and methods of exploitation with an understanding of intrusion set tactics, techniques and procedures (TTPs).Advanced understanding of TCP/IP, common networking ports and protocols, traffic flow, system administration, OSI model, defense-in-depth and common security elements.Demonstrated hands-on experience analyzing high volumes of logs, network data (e.g. Netflow, Full Packet Capture), and other attack artifacts in support of incident investigations.In-depth knowledge of architecture, engineering, and operations of at least one enterprise SIEM platform (e.g. ArcSight, Splunk, Nitro/McAfee Enterprise Security Manager, QRadar, LogLogic).Experience and proficiency with any of the following: Anti-Virus, HIPS/HBSS, IDS/IPS, Full Packet Capture, Network Forensics.Experience with malware analysis concepts and methods.Unix/Linux command line experience.Scripting and programming experience.Motivated self-starter with strong written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to create complex technical reports on analytic findings.Familiarity or experience in Intelligence Driven Defense and/or Cyber Kill Chain methodology.Existing 8570 CND Analyst Certifications (CEH).GSMOExternal Referral EligibleLeidos is a Fortune 500® information technology, engineering, and science solutions and services leader working to solve the world's toughest challenges in the defense, intelligence, homeland security, civil, and health markets. The company's 32,000 employees support vital missions for government and commercial customers. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, Leidos reported annual revenues of approximately $10.19 billion for the fiscal year ended December 28, 2018. For more information, visit www.Leidos.com . Pay and benefits are fundamental to any career decision. That's why we craft compensation packages that reflect the importance of the work we do for our customers. Employment benefits include competitive compensation, Health and Wellness programs, Income Protection, Paid Leave and Retirement. More details are available here . Leidos will never ask you to provide payment-related information at any part of the employment application process. And Leidos will communicate with you only through emails that are sent from a Leidos.com email address. If you receive an email purporting to be from Leidos that asks for payment-related information or any other personal information, please report the email to spam.leidos@leidos.com . All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Leidos will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with relevant laws.

ad.title: Remedy ITSM Application Administrator - Computer World Services - Ogden, UT
ad.content: Leads the research, analysis and modification of programming systems including encoding, testing, debugging, and installing to support an organization's application systems. Consults with users to identify current operating procedures and to clarify program objectives. Gathers and determines requirements needed from other departments and develops the solution to achieve business objectives. Requires a bachelor's degree. Typically reports to a manager or head of a unit/department. Works on advanced, complex technical projects or business issues requiring state of the art technical or industry knowledge. Works autonomously. May provide a leadership role for the work group through knowledge in the area of specialization. Key Tasks and Responsibilities As part of a team, support SID Enterprise Processing Center-IT Service Management (EPC-ITSM) Application Management and Sustainment by providing end-to-end responsibility and subject matter expertise to manage the version, application, design, implementation, systems analysis, software maintenance, and centralized operational support services. Install, configure, upgrade, customize, and maintain the BMC Remedy EPC-ITSM application, to include the ITIL-based processes for incident, problem, change, release, configuration, asset, service level, availability, and capacity management. Install and configure all patches and updates as published by the software provider and DISA CYBER. Follow the DISA change management process to document all changes to the ITSM application. Update application functionality and process flow for service requests approved in process owner Change Advisory Board (CAB) and vetted through the change management process. Assist DISA personnel with the operation, maintenance, and troubleshooting of Remedy ITSM to include all databases and external application interfaces used to transfer data to and from Remedy ITSM. Implement, configure, and update auto ticket generation. Assist DISA personnel with system administration, operating system and security patches, and bug fixes. Implement fixes and suggest alternatives for deficiencies for the security posture of Remedy ITSM systems. Provide training plans and conduct training to DISA and mission partner personnel on the usage and administration of Remedy ITSM to ensure that the operational usage and administration of Remedy ITSM are understood and to ensure standardized usage concepts and procedures are followed. Provide user training, including: starting up the tool, access tickets, updating diary fields, passing tickets to other users, starting up and responding to the notification tool, using screen icons, closing tickets, queries to the database, and using the power of Remedy ITSM to fully utilize the incident, problem, configuration and Service Level Agreement (SLA) Management process functionality embedded in the product. Provide local administration training as well as, demonstrate and assist Remedy ITSM administrators with creating and using queries; formatting and customizing reports; reading and interpreting application workflow and making minor modifications; and creating and modifying screens and menus. JOB REQUIREMENTS Education & Experience Bachelors 10+ years’ experience providing application administration in an enterprise environment Certifications Appropriate DoD 8570 IAT/IAM Level certification (CCNA Security, CySA+, GICSP, GSEC, Security+ CE, SSCP, or higher), as well as technology-specific certifications such as MCSA Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2016, Certified UNIX Security Administrator (GCUX), ITIL, etc. Security Clearance NIPRNet Access – Secret IT-I Requires Final (Interim is acceptable to start) DoD Security Clearance level of Secret Other (Travel, Work Environment, DoD 8570 Requirements, Administrative Notes, etc.) Note, all positons are identified as DoD 8570 IT-1 (privileged level systems access), which requires a favorably adjudicated Tier 5 investigation (formerly known as a Single Scope Background Investigation (SSBI)). Travel requirement is not expected. EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability

ad.title: SID Team Support Information Systems Architect - Computer World Services - Ogden, UT
ad.content: Responsible for designing and implementing information systems that will adequately support the enterprise infrastructure of the organization. Analyzes system requirements and defines system architecture that will meet business needs, including server infrastructure, capacity planning, storage requirements, and networking protocols. Ensures that architecture project roll-outs meet security standards and be effectively integrated with current applications. A specialist on complex technical and business matters. Work is highly independent. May assume a team lead role for the work group. Key Tasks and Responsibilities As part of a small team, provide liaison duties between DISA and DLA for premium services applications. Align liaison duties with DLA’s business forecast planning using the ITIL life cycle process of implementation in production and COOP, for the following: Implementing new architecture/applications. Coordination for system, database, storage, and application changes. Coordination for hardware/software changes. Coordination with mission partner for the configuration and build documentation that is supplied to DISA technical teams for implementation in the production environment. Coordination for security policy changes related to IA associated with Cyber Configuration Validation (CCV), Interim Production Connectivity (IPC), Information Assurance Vulnerability Management (IAVM), vendor patch bundles/releases, Host Bases Security System (HBSS), Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIG)/Security Requirements Guide (SRG), Command Cyber Readiness Inspection (CCRI) and Assured Compliance Assessment Solution (ACAS). Coordination for hardware tech refreshes for Operating Systems (OS), Storage, Networks, and Infrastructures. Coordination for software tech refreshes. Coordination of Cyber Command security tasking. Tracking mission partner life cycle through test/development for IA requests. Coordination of changes to batch processing. Coordination for annual maintenance Window Schedule. Coordination for out of cycle maintenance. Planning/Coordination for new application functionality. Coordination for network troubleshooting, and implementation/change. Planning for future architecture. Lead Troubleshooting/Collaboration calls. Coordination of changes for mission partner requested ITIL changes. Submit changes on behalf of the mission partner for vendor patch releases. Maintain knowledge and expertise of multi-vendor Hyper Converged Infrastructures (HCI) and how they function in relation to Enterprise Business Applications in order to support implementations. Document system architectures for the EPC premium services applications. Provide project planning and implementation, Technical Deep Dives (TDD), to include: Providing technical expertise to DISA Engineering concerning infrastructure changes that support mission partner’s business requirements. Tracking and documenting all projects related to the applications listed in 6.3.6. Documenting mission partner’s 3-month forecasting schedule. Lead TDD collaborations including providing expertise for applications, data transfer interfaces, network, database, storage, appliances, hardware, and software solutions. Tracking and documenting milestones for each assigned project including technical check points and go/no-go decisions. Provide technical build documents including: o Providing technical build documentation for all projects. The contractor shall include in the build documentation details supporting implementation/changes to operating system configuration, data- base configuration, application configurations, network configuration, batch processing require- ments/changes, application acronym and description, application availability impacts, and mission partner contact information. o Submitting build Change Requests (CR) assuring the build documentation is complete and attached to the CR for processing through the Change Advisory Board (CAB). JOB REQUIREMENTS Education & Experience Bachelors 5+ years’ maintaining and supporting business applications architecture Certifications Appropriate DoD 8570 IAT/IAM Level certification (CCNA Security, CySA+, GICSP, GSEC, Security+ CE, SSCP, or higher), as well as technology-specific certifications such as MCSA Windows Server 2012, Windows Server 2016, Certified UNIX Security Administrator (GCUX), etc. Security Clearance NIPRNet Access – Secret IT-I Requires Final (Interim is acceptable to start) DoD Security Clearance level of Secret Other (Travel, Work Environment, DoD 8570 Requirements, Administrative Notes, etc.) Note, all positons are identified as DoD 8570 IT-1 (privileged level systems access), which requires a favorably adjudicated Tier 5 investigation (formerly known as a Single Scope Background Investigation (SSBI)). Travel requirement is not expected.

The E&Porganization delivers innovative and effective ground and airborne mission subsystem and control solutions for our system operators' current and emerging missions, by utilizing industry leading processes and tools. E&P is responsible for many mission critical subsystems such as RF Communications, IP Networks, Radar, SIGINT, Electronic Warfare, EO/IR, Full Motion Video, Ground Moving Target Indicator, Weapons, Mission Management Computers, and Ground Control Systems. ad.title: Network Engineer – Taclane/WAN Optimizer SME (19-102) - Northrop Grumman - Colorado Springs, CO

Northrop Grumman Mission Systems is seeking a Network Engineer Taclane/WAN Optimizer SME in support of the C2BMC program.
What You'll get to Do:
Candidate will be a S8.2 Network Development Engineer TACLANE/WAN Optimizer SME responsible for developing, deploying, integrating, and testing the S8.2 C2BMC networks.The candidate will perform the following tasks:Candidate will work independently to perform troubleshooting, and provide status updates to Program personnel. Candidate will be embedded with the network design team in Colorado Springs supporting network development as well as integration testing. Candidate will work collaboratively in a team environment with other highly motivated network engineers as well as independently at times on large field projects. Candidate will use hands-on experience and knowledge of network architecture design, development and testing methodologies. Candidate will provide network traffic analysis, diagnostic and troubleshooting experience. Candidate will be required to travel to remote locations to perform network installations in accordance with Program configuration management processes. The candidate will also be required to perform other duties as assigned by the Functional Manager or Product Owner.Additional Northrop Grumman Information
Northrop Grumman has approximately 85,000 employees in all 50 states and in more than 25 countries, we strive to attract and retain the best employees by providing an inclusive work environment wherein employees are receptive to diverse ideas, perspectives and talents to help solve our toughest customer challenges: to develop and maintain some of the most technically sophisticated products, programs and services in the world.
Our Values. The women and men of Northrop Grumman Corporation are guided by Our Values. They describe our company as we want it to be. We want our decisions and actions to demonstrate these Values. We believe that putting Our Values into practice creates long-term benefits for shareholders, customers, employees, suppliers, and the communities we serve.
Our Responsibility. At Northrop Grumman, we are committed to maintaining the highest of ethical standards, embracing diversity and inclusion, protecting the environment, and striving to be an ideal corporate citizen in the community and in the world.
Basic Qualifications: You'll Bring These Qualifications:
Active Secret clearance
9 Years with Bachelor's degree in a STEM-related field; 14 years' experience in lieu of a degree. DOD 8570 IAT II certification (Security +, CCNA Security, CySA+, GICSP, GSEC, and SSCP)
Hands on experience developing configurations for WAN Optimizers (Riverbed), GEM Encryptor management, TACLANEs (KG-175s) and optical transport equipment. Firewall experience is required; prior experience with Juniper or Fortinet a plus Must be an effective communicator with excellent writing and presentation skills using Microsoft PowerPoint and Visio drawing tools. Preferred Qualifications: These Qualifications Would be Nice to Have:
Experience designing and implementing network configurations with scripting and/or network automation toolsets such as Ansible. A solid understanding of the OSI Model, TCP/IP, routing protocols BGP and OSPF.
Experience in UDP multicast, SONET, MSPP, VLANs, GRE Tunnels, and TCP/IP network designs.
Understanding of standard DOD security practices such as, STIG compliance and system accreditation implementation efforts.
Candidates with knowledge, skill sets or experience using protocol analyzers/sniffers (such as tcpdump, Wireshark, OPNET ACElive & ITGuru). Industry vendor certifications from Juniper (JNCIA, JNCIS, JNCIP, JNCIE) a plus; equivalent certifications from Cisco (CCNA, CCNP) considered. While not required candidates with experience in the following areas are desired: Authentication & encryption methods/capabilities ( TACACS+, Active Directory, GEM-X), Virtualization technologies such a VMWare vCenter and vSphere. What You'll get to Do: Responsibilities include: Directly support Warfighter Customers with GFC and simulation behavior expertise during daily training scenario runs Perform log file analysis, root cause analysis, and research in order to provide timely responses to customer questions and concerns Identify, investigate, and document GFC anomalies Develop and integrate new scenarios into the training scenario baseline, in accordance to customer requirements and training objectives Integrate and evaluate GFC and simulator HW/SW changes to the training architecture. - Provide Integration and test for all warfighter exercise activities to include but not limited to: technical planning, system integration, Interface connectivity and messaging, element functional and performance assessment and comparison to real-world, GMD/GFC behavior analysis and troubleshooting, analysis of system anomalies, develop/implement/evaluate anomaly response plans and solutions, brief warfighter on the peculiarities of the exercise architecture, SIMISMS, and GFC issues for the event Candidate must have excellent technical analysis, communication, and teamwork skills as position requires interface with MDA customers, military warfighters, GFC product, and multiple MDIOC contracts and organizations Candidate must maintain key technical data and historical files containing behavior and technical implementation information Candidate may support flight test and ground test operations as a GMD/GFC system behavior technical analyst Position requires up to 10% travel MSCOMSTR You'll Bring These Qualifications: 5 Years with Bachelors in Science; 7 years with an Associates; 3 Years with Masters; 0 Years with PhD; OR9 years of relevant experience will be considered in lieu of a degree. Must be able to obtain and maintain Secret security clearance Willing to submit and obtain an DoD Top Secret (TS) security clearance Proactive, Self-starter, eager to learn and assist customer with GMD Work effectively on a small team with multiple external teammates and customers Experience working on UNIX/Linux platforms These Qualifications Would be Nice to Have: Higher education within the Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM) discipline. What You'll get to Do: The candidate will support architecture and integration needs, to include designing, validating, and maintaining the architecture against requirements baselines. He/she may lead trade studies, gap analyses, and other activities to assess proposed changes to the architecture with respect to impacts on technical performance, cost, and schedule baselines and ensure interoperability between segments and external agencies. Candidate must have the ability to work effectively within a team environment, ability to interface with other groups within the project, well developed problem-solving skills, and ability to work within a dynamic environment. This position's standard work schedule is a 9/80. Apply model-based system engineering (MBSE) to define architectural views using UPDM (DoDAF/MoDAF) and SysML. Derive mission threads and use cases. Define system functions and trace to requirements. Facilitate subject matter experts, stakeholders, and customers throughout the process of developing architectural specifications. Identify proposed changes to technical baseline documents (i.e., interface documents, specifications documents, architecture products). Prepare and present engineering analysis, gaps, and recommendations to senior leadership. Systems Engineering skills, including requirements definition/allocation, interface definition, verification & validation, and life-cycle management. Proficiency with commercially available architecting tools such as Enterprise Architect, Rhapsody, etc. Ability to provide a wide variety of technical analyses and program management support to a government customer. Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools. Current DoD Secret security clearance with an investigation within the past 6 years 9 years of System Engineering experience with a Bachelors of Science in a STEM discipline; 7 years of System Engineering experience with Masters; 4 with a PhD. These Qualifications Would be Nice to Have: Demonstrated ability to develop and present technical material to senior management and customers. Familiarity and experience working with DoD acquisition organizations. Experience designing and testing space systems and/or command & control systems. Previous experience in developing architectures for Information Support Plans (ISPs). Previous experience in supporting capability based assessments (CBAs) for Capability Development Documents (CDDs). ad.title: Sr. Principal Engineer Systems Architect - Northrop Grumman - San Diego, CA
ad.content: At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems in air and space that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our work preserves freedom and democracy, and advances human discovery and our understanding of the universe. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have a lot of fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history. Northrop Grumman Aerospace Systems has an opening for a Sr. Principal Electronics Hardware Architect to join our team of highly skilled and motivated engineers at Northrop Grumman's Autonomous Design Center of Excellence located in San Diego, California. You'll be joining the Electronics& Payloads(E&P) organization. The E&Porganization delivers innovative and effective ground and airborne mission subsystem and control solutions for our system operators' current and emerging missions, by utilizing industry leading processes and tools. E&P is responsible for many mission critical subsystems such as RF Communications, IP Networks, Radar, SIGINT, Electronic Warfare, EO/IR, Full Motion Video, Ground Moving Target Indicator, Weapons, Mission Management Computers, and Ground Control Systems. The Sr. Principal Electronics Hardware Architect will develop and maintain detailed system architecture documentation for complex IT systems. The candidate will function as an interface between Systems Engineering and the Hardware Infrastructure teams. The selected candidate will develop and maintain Python scripts and UML diagrams to improve process efficiency and information flow between those teams. Essential Functions: Collaborating with other engineers to architect a system to meet design requirements and stakeholder needs. Developing and releasing engineering documentation for detailed system architecture and requirements. Developing internal software tools to improve process of organizing, documenting, and visualizing information. Perform liaison duties to disseminate information to suppliers, customers, technology development partners, management and other Integrated Product Teams. NGLinkedAS ELEPAY Basic Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics) discipline from an accredited university and 9 years of Engineering experience or 7 years with a Master's Degree or 4 years with PhD in a STEM related field. Experience developing and maintaining detailed system architecture documentation for complex IT systems. Must have a current active in-scope DoD Top Secret security clearance for this position with the ability to obtain Special Program Access. Preferred Qualifications: Master's Degree in engineering or related technical discipline from an accredited university and 7 years of relevant experience is preferred. Familiarity with the following technologies: Microsoft Operating Systems, Active Directory, Fibre Channel Storage Area Networks, Layer 2 and 3 networking, VPN, IPSec, Storage technologies, UNIX, Linux, Glassfish, Docker, Virtualization, Physical and Cyber Security Familiarity with Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) / System Design Documents (SDDs) / Department of Defense Architecture Framework (DoDAF) / Familiarity with Agile development methodology Familiarity with the following tools or languages: Python, UML, Sphinx, REST, YAML, Jinja Demonstrated ability to communicate and collaborate with inter-organizational and outside customer contacts. Familiarity with complex network systems.Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

ad.title: Manufacturing Supervisor 1 (4th Shift) - Northrop Grumman - San Diego, CA
ad.content:
At Northrop Grumman we develop cutting-edge technology that preserves freedom and advances human discovery. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We continue to innovate with developments from launching the first commercial flight to space, to discovering the early beginnings of the universe. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.
No matter the assignment, Northrop Grumman is committed to being a leader in Cyber, Logistics and Modernization, Autonomous Systems, C4ISR, and Strike. For us, it's about more than just performing. It means realizing the values that define us: responsibility, trust, integrity and protecting freedom worldwide. These values inspire and unite our people- who make everything we do possible.
Some of the world's most technically advanced products are manufactured by employees, who work within Northrop Grumman Missions Systems, a leading provider of sensor systems for a variety of global security applications, including situational awareness and self-protection. Northrop Grumman manufacturing plants are highly-automated, cutting-edge centers of excellence where employees leverage the latest technology, including the strategic use of automation, 3-D printing and robotics. There are a myriad of job functions associated, either directly or indirectly, with the manufacture of our products that range from machinists, engineers, operation program managers, and quality inspectors. Our mission is to deliver differentiated value to our programs, by manufacturing products with the highest possible quality at the most affordable rate. Search our current job openings and join us to be at the front line of innovation.
What You'll get to Do:
Where Technology and Teamwork come together... The Manufacturing Supervisor 1 - 4th Shift will become part of Northrop Grumman's Avionics and Tactical Networks (ATN), which is an operating unit within the Communications division of Northrop Grumman Mission Systems. ATN is located in the Spectrum Facility in San Diego, California. The business has developed and advanced software-defined radio technology for sophisticated communications in a network-centric environment. Our expertise is in delivering complex equipment to enable modern battlefields and support aviation missions. Our focus is on the world of avionics, radio and electronic warfare product applications to enable networked communications. As part of the corporation's business focus area on Communications, we are the equipment providers.Our team of communication systems experts is developing next-generation ground radios for land forces, and our Electronic Warfare subject matter experts are creating the next generation of Improvised Explosive Device (IED) countermeasures to keep our soldiers safe when in harm's way.A&TN focuses on providing advanced technologies, engineering development and production for our software-defined radio programs. A&TN programs include the communications, navigation and identification (CNI) production for F-22 and F-35 aircraft and production of advanced multi-function RF products such as JCREW.This position will support a 4th shift on the production floor.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Responsible for the direct supervision/management of the staff. Responsible for providing objective-oriented direction to subordinates utilizing management guidelines & general policies. Designs manufacturing processes, procedures and production layouts for assemblies, equipment installation, processing, machining and material handling. May incorporate inspection and test requirements into the production plan. Inspects performance of machinery, equipment, and tools to verify their efficiency, and investigates and initiates corrective action of problems and deficiencies to ensure product quality. Develops manufacturing processes that are applicable to statistical process control, and may develop those techniques. Additional Northrop Grumman Information:
Northrop Grumman has approximately 85,000 employees in all 50 states and in more than 25 countries, we strive to attract and retain the best employees by providing an inclusive work environment wherein employees are receptive to diverse ideas, perspectives and talents to help solve our toughest customer challenges: to develop and maintain some of the most technically sophisticated products, programs and services in the world.
Our Values. The women and men of Northrop Grumman Corporation are guided by Our Values. They describe our company as we want it to be. We want our decisions and actions to demonstrate these Values. We believe that putting Our Values into practice creates long-term benefits for shareholders, customers, employees, suppliers, and the communities we serve.
Our Responsibility. At Northrop Grumman, we are committed to maintaining the highest of ethical standards, embracing diversity and inclusion, protecting the environment, and striving to be an ideal corporate citizen in the community and in the world. MANUMS ERCOMMS You'll Bring These Qualifications: High School Diploma/GED. Experience working in a DoD manufacturing environment. First Line Manager experience managing assemblers and test technicians. Prior experience with Line Scheduling. Prior experience with Environmental Health and Safety (EHS). Prior experience with Lean Manufacturing. Prior experience utilizing Kaizen Techniques. Must be able to obtain a Secret Clearance with Special Access Permission which requires aU.S. Citizenship. Must be able to work 4th shift (Friday, Saturday, Sunday 6AM - 6PM) These Qualifications Would be Nice to Have:
Experience in electronics manufacturing environment. Experience with Monthly Preventative Maintenance on Production and Environmental Test equipment. To Include but not limited to, Stencil Cleaner, Vibration systems, Temp Chambers, Pad Cooling Systems and Fume Extractors. Experience with SAP and shop floor control systems. Experience with calibration of test equipment. Understanding development of overhead budgets for supplies and expenditures Proficient in ESD Training and Certifications. Proficient in electronics equipment programming and maintenance. Ability to track PO Funding and Period of Performance for all Production equipment requiring repair and update as required. Ability to ensure that all chemical supplies requiring shelf life are current and not expired. Experience with purchasing supplies, chemicals, spare parts and tools for production labs What We Can Offer You:
Northrop Grumman provides a comprehensive benefits package and a work environment that encourages your growth and supports the mutual success of our people and our company.
