Prepare and present engineering analysis, gaps, and recommendations to senior leadership. Additional Northrop Grumman Information: Northrop Grumman has approximately 85,000 employees in all 50 states and in more than 25 countries, we strive to attract and retain the best employees by providing an inclusive work environment wherein employees are receptive to diverse ideas, perspectives and talents to help solve our toughest customer challenges: to develop and maintain some of the most technically sophisticated products, programs and services in the world. Our Values. The women and men of Northrop Grumman Corporation are guided by Our Values. They describe our company as we want it to be. We want our decisions and actions to demonstrate these Values. We believe that putting Our Values into practice creates long-term benefits for shareholders, customers, employees, suppliers, and the communities we serve. Our Responsibility. At Northrop Grumman, we are committed to maintaining the highest of ethical standards, embracing diversity and inclusion, protecting the environment, and striving to be an ideal corporate citizen in the community and in the world. southbayjob This requisition may be filled at either a Systems Engineer (MBSE) Level or a Principal Systems Engineer (MBSE) Level. Basic Qualifications for a Systems Engineer (MBSE) are: Experience with Systems Modeling Language (SysML) and the Unified Profile for DoDAF and MoDAF (UPDM). Systems Engineering skills, including requirements definition/allocation, interface definition, verification & validation, and life-cycle management. Proficiency with commercially available architecting tools such as Enterprise Architect, Rhapsody, etc. Ability to provide a wide variety of technical analyses and program management support to a government customer. Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools. Current DoD Secret security clearance with an investigation within the past 6 years 2 years of System Engineering experience with a Bachelors of Science in a STEM discipline; 0 years of System Engineering experience with Masters Basic Qualifications for a Principal Systems Engineer (MBSE) are: Experience with Systems Modeling Language (SysML) and the Unified Profile for DoDAF and MoDAF (UPDM). Systems Engineering skills, including requirements definition/allocation, interface definition, verification & validation, and life-cycle management. Proficiency with commercially available architecting tools such as Enterprise Architect, Rhapsody, etc. Ability to provide a wide variety of technical analyses and program management support to a government customer. Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools. Current DoD Secret security clearance with an investigation within the past 6 years 5 years of System Engineering experience with a Bachelors of Science in a STEM discipline; 3 years of System Engineering experience with Masters; 0 with a PhD. These Qualifications Would be Nice to Have: Demonstrated ability to develop and present technical material to senior management and customers. Familiarity and experience working with DoD acquisition organizations. Experience designing and testing space systems and/or command & control systems. Previous experience in developing architectures for Information Support Plans (ISPs). Previous experience in supporting capability based assessments (CBAs) for Capability Development Documents (CDDs). Experience with the U.S. Air Force Experience with the Sparx Enterprise Architect tool. Current DoD Top Secret security clearance. Demonstrated leadership and interpersonal skills. Ability to work independently with multi-disciplined teams within the program. Demonstrate strong people, organizational, presentation and communication skills, written and verbal. What We Can Offer You: Northrop Grumman provides a comprehensive benefits package and a work environment that encourages your growth and supports the mutual success of our people and our company. Northrop Grumman benefits give you the flexibility and control to choose the benefits that make the most sense for you and your family. Your package will include the following: Health Plan Savings Plan Paid Time Off Additional benefits Education Assistance Training and Development https://benefits.northropgrumman.com/us/en2/BenefitsOverview/Pages/default.aspx

ad.title: Digital Media Planner / Sales Assistant - Bauer Xcel - New York, NY
ad.content: The ideal candidate will be an enthusiastic, organized, detail-oriented team player with a strong ability to multitask. This is a great entry-level position within a competitive industry and gives the candidate exposure to the many facets of sales and marketing. Digital Media Planner Responsibilities: Develop digital campaigns that align with advertiser's KPIs Work to optimize campaigns by analyzing plan performance and metrics Collect market data on a regular basis to maintain knowledge of audience trends and consumer behavior as well as competitive research to stay abreast of the marketing channels the competition is utilizing Develop audience segments and build personas based on advertisers target demographic Create wrap-up reports for advertisers using data collected to showcase campaign success Sales Assistant Responsibilities: Support Group Publisher, Integrated Sales Director and sales reps with day-to-day tasks & responsibilities Track competitive publication advertiser trends Complete RFPs under tight deadlines Prepare sales representatives for client meetings and lunches Compose sales presentations within Microsoft Office Suite Assist with events and other marketing projects Coordinate research & marketing requests Maintain filing system for back issues, sales/marketing materials and purchase orders Administrative duties include: coordinate office supplies, travel arrangements, client appointments, expense reports, and act as liaison for HR and Accounting Requirements Bachelor's degree Strong interest in print/digital advertising sales and marketing Must be proficient in Excel, PowerPoint and Microsoft Outlook Team player with a collaborative spirit Analytics tools (Google Analytics, comScore, GfK MRI, MOAT, Nielsen IMS) Social media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest)

ad.title: Public Relations Intern (Fall 2019) - Fleishman-Hillard - St. Louis, MO
ad.content: InternshipConsidering a career in integrated communications? If so, consider an internship at FleishmanHillard St. Louis, the global headquarters for one the largest, most prestigious communications agencies in the world. Three times a year, we hire a select group of highly qualified candidates for our internships to work with some of the very best professionals in the industry. We have positions available in a variety of practice groups and specialty areas including brand marketing, corporate reputation management, entertainment and sports, issues and crisis management, public affairs and internal communications. We are looking for individuals who have excellent writing skills, are passionate about communications and eager to learn. The FleishmanHillard experience provides the opportunity to grow personally and professionally through exposure to client service and the inner workings of a global, integrated communications firm. FleishmanHillard believes a diverse team brings a wider range of personal and professional experiences and perspectives. We recognize that diversity and inclusion benefit our agency, our clients, and the communities in which we work and live. To that end, we strongly encourage applications from women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ community, veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Qualifications Qualified candidates will have at least a 3.2 GPA, previous relevant internship experience(s) and completed their junior year of college, though recent graduates are preferred. Basic job requirements include excellent written and oral communications skills, an innate curiosity, strong time management, and a desire to learn in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment. Interns have the opportunity to be a part of the account staff teams and assist with campaign conception to execution, developing media materials, building relationships with journalists, conducting research, drafting online content calendars and other account-related activities. All candidates must also exhibit a desire and motivation to learn and the ability to work as part of a team. Interested candidates must attach the following items to their online application upon submission: Cover letter expressing interest in the internship program Resume Writing samples (three if possible): Examples would be something written for a classroom assignment or previous internship (press release, pitch letter, media kit, social media calendar), a campus newspaper or magazine article, or an essay, blog post, letter, or memo of some sort Letter of recommendation from a former teacher, employer, supervisor, or personal reference (teacher or employer are preferred) Transcript (can be unofficial) Deadlines for Fall submissions: July 1 The internship is a paid, full-time position requiring a commitment of at least five months (August 28, 2019 – January 17, 2020) About FleishmanHillard FleishmanHillard specializes in public relations, reputation management, public affairs, brand marketing, digital strategy, social engagement and content strategy. We have been named PRWeek’s Global Agency of the Year and Best Places to Work; a “Standout Agency” on Advertising Age’s A-List; NAFE’s “Top 50 Companies for Executive Women” for six years running; and among our firm’s award-winning work we’ve taken home 5 Lions in the past two years at the Cannes International Festival of Creativity. We’re also more motivated by what we can give than what we receive, and in our 70th year we’ve initiated a worldwide service commitment to support social inclusion in the communities in which we work and live. Visit us at www.fleishmanhillard.com. FleishmanHillard is committed to equal employment opportunity and affirmative action. FleishmanHillard does not discriminate in any aspect of employment on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, age, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where FleishmanHillard does business. Our policy is to employ, advance, and reasonably accommodate all qualified employees and applicants. Any person who feels that he or she has been subjected to discrimination should immediately report the matter to Talent Development or to a supervisor. Any reported incident will be investigated. Retaliation against an employee or applicant who makes a good-faith claim of discrimination is prohibited. Employees and applicants may bring good-faith complaints, ask questions, and raise concerns without fear of reprisal or retaliation.

ad.title: Creative Intern (Fall 2019) - Fleishman-Hillard - St. Louis, MO
ad.content: InternshipFleishmanHillard is looking for creative interns to join our award-winning ranks this summer. Whether you deal in images, words, pixels or aspect ratios, “The power of true” demands them all. Those selected will gain valuable experience working in a variety of mediums for brands across a range of industries. FleishmanHillard believes a diverse team brings a wider range of personal and professional experiences and perspectives. We recognize that diversity and inclusion benefit our agency, our clients, and the communities in which we work and live. To that end, we strongly encourage applications from women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ community, veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Qualifications ART DIRECTORS / DESIGNERS Our Art Direction/Design Interns work under the guidance of creative directors with their artistic prowess to fulfil the design needs of clients. Having an eye for aesthetic is vital for success on assigned projects. They show us how they create something from nothing, how they visually bring an idea to life, how their process unfolds, and the results. The ideal candidate will have the following experience: Completed or entering the final year of a 4-year graphic design or advertising degree or related program. A portfolio demonstrating a strong sense of design and typography. A willingness to learn and work within a team environment. Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite. COPYWRITERS Our clients are in need of all types of writing: short form, long form, whatever the kind, it will be written. The Copywriter Intern should capture the voice of the client and tell their story the best way possible. They show us how to change someone’s mind with only words. The ideal candidate will have the following experience: Completed or entering the final year of a 4-year advertising degree or related program. A portfolio filled with conceptual ideas and smart copy. Proficient in Microsoft Office. A willingness to learn and work within a team environment. VIDEO EDITORS Video Editor Interns work with directors and producers, being the tool that winds the story together, demonstrating the ability to jump from project to project, to find the shot that captures the moment, and to separate compelling content from filler. The ideal candidate will have the following experience: Completed final year of a 4-year film, video production, broadcast journalism or related degree program. A reel and/or work samples demonstrating strong technical proficiency as well as creative and storytelling ability. A willingness to learn and work within a team environment. Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro and related programs. Proficiency with videography and photography also a plus. DIGITAL DEVELOPERS Digital Development Interns get immersed into all aspects of development. They will see projects from front-end to back-end, the creation phase to the testing phase. They find what will work for a program and all its quirks. They are a problem-solver who loves finding that missing piece of the puzzle. The quicker, the better. The ideal candidate will have the following experience: Completed a 4-year computer science or engineering degree Ability to work in a fast-paced, demand driven environment. Basic experience with HTML5, XML, Ajax, jQuery and JavaScript. Strong communication skills, including proficiency in developing technical documentation A willingness to learn and work within a team environment. PROJECT MANAGERS Project Management Interns work directly with creative directors, account teams, and clients to see campaigns develop from start to finish. They demonstrate leadership qualities but operate best working with others. This position teaches the intern how to manage several tasks at once, oversee projects, and value the importance of being a collaborative leader. The ideal candidate will have the following experience: Completed a 4-year business, marketing, or related degree program. Ability to work under aggressive deadlines. Strong leadership, management, communication and analytical skills. A willingness to learn and work within a team environment. Proficient in Microsoft Office. Deadlines for Fall submissions: July 1 The internship is a paid, full-time position requiring a commitment of at least five months (August 28, 2019 – January 17, 2020). Team members communicate news in 140 characters, convey a point of view through blog posts, explain complex ideas through compelling videos, present dense content through accessible and easy-to-understand infographics, mobilize brands to engage friends and followers on Facebook and package information for use by all news channels. FleishmanHillard St. Louis is one of the largest public relations offices in the world. ad.title: Growth Project Manager - WeWork - New York, NY
ad.content: Reporting to the SVP Central Growth, the Project Manager will be responsible for working cross-functionally partnering with Sales, Marketing, Digital, Product, Analytics, Technology, Community and Creative to deliver programs designed to optimize experience, generate revenue and solve complex business challenges. This individual will be a key driver in bringing projects together across the Central Growth organization. This role will be critical in designing the foundation for cross-functional collaboration and effective process management between teams in order to deliver connected end-to-end experiences for WeWork prospects and members. Responsibilities: End-to-end project management of Central Growth initiatives Develop and own project plans and charters for multiple Central Growth business programs Design cross-functional stakeholder communication plans to deliver updates to key business owners at regular cadence Partner with the analytics team to design program reporting and distribution strategy Regularly review program progress to ensure that key milestones are being met Design stakeholder escalation plan for issue or blocker management Partner with Central Growth team members to uncover insights around opportunities for optimization Scope: Project management Stakeholder management Strategy development Qualifications: 5-7 years at a top consulting firm or experience within a Project Lead/Management role Track record of cross-functional program delivery Previous experience in implementation and program set-up/design Highly organized with high attention to detail Excellent communication skills Ability to work in a fast-paced, hyper-growth environment Tech-savvy and interested in the latest digital technology and tools available General understanding of Salesforce systems and tools including; SFDC, SFMC, SF DMP

ad.title: Creative Manager - NeoGenomics Laboratories - Aliso Viejo, CA
ad.content: Are you motivated to participate in a dynamic, multi-tasking environment? Do you want to become part of a company that invests in its employees? Are you seeking a position where you can use your skills while continuing to be challenged and learn? Then we encourage you to dive deeper into this opportunity. NeoGenomics is looking for a Creative Manager in our Aliso Viejo, CA location who wants to continue to learn in order to allow our company to grow. Now that you know what we're looking for in talent, let us tell you why you'd want to work at NeoGenomics: NeoGenomics Laboratories is comprised of a national team of experts in developing and delivering laboratory diagnostic and clinical trial services with a focus in cancer. It is the common purpose of all NeoGenomics employees to save lives by improving patient CARE through Communication, Accuracy, Reliability, and Efficiency. Our staff physicians, scientists, laboratory professionals, client services representatives, and sales people team up with our clients. Together, we work to solve the medical, scientific, and logistical challenges of making precise diagnoses, aiding in bringing new therapies to market and finding the unusual hallmarks of each patient’s disease that point the way to proper treatment. As an employer, we promise to provide you with a purpose driven mission in which you have the opportunity to save lives by improving patient care through the exceptional work you perform. Together, we will become the world's leading cancer reference laboratory. Position Summary: The Creative Manager will employ their deep understanding of strategic design, brand development and creative processes to convey complex or sophisticated topics into elegant concepts and world class visuals. This individual will not only be a creative content expert, but also a master of process who can juggle multiple projects from multiple masters get great work done. Your scope will range from print to digital and everything in between, yes some packaging as well. If you’ve wanted to employ these skills in an environment where you are making a difference, come see how you can make a difference in oncology at NeoGenomics. Position objectives are as follows: Implement a more regular use of creative briefs Transition the group from a mostly visual design group to a ‘creative’ group (visual and copy) Refresh the NeoGenomics brand style guide Become viewed as an indispensable ‘creative’ partner Implement a system to ensure rapid response and turnaround time Core Responsibilities: Creative Marketing Serves as an in house agency and collaborate with internal teams/departments to develop client creative strategy. Responsible for maintaining consistent brand image, look-and-feel, and vision across all marketing materials. Supports different departments on external and internal facing materials. Responsible to conceptualize, strategize, and design a wide range of marketing and communication materials in the areas of advertising and promotional programs, public relations/ trade shows, campaign/product launch, social media, packaging, web/mobile communications, and integration projects, etc. Manage all contractor logistics: For overflow work, secure / manage freelancers, ensuring they have the resources needed for their jobs. Facilitate smooth onboarding and invoice processing for our external partners. Implement process improvements: Proactively create processes and efficiencies for the rapidly growing marketing team, facilitating better cross-team collaboration and project outcomes. Project management system, Workamajig. Make sure project flows and meets deadline. Manage and organize design database on a daily basis. Seeking for innovate design strategies, tools, and up to date with latest design trends. Web Design / Social Media Deliver innovative UX/UI that optimize among user needs, business goals, and technological realities across web and mobile platforms. Also maintain/update corporate website contents and functions. Work with vendor, agencies, web developers directly on print and digital production projects. Contribute to marketing digital goal of generating leads. Responsible for corporate front end website design and strategy. Deliver and Supervise, prioritize, and manage projects among design team. Implemented Requirements: Education: Bachelor’s or BFA degree in Arts, Animation, Design, Digital Arts, Graphic Design, Photography Seven (7) + years working in the creative marketing space, supervisory experience, relevant experience could be as an inhouse resource, working for an advertising agency on the creative side with a mix of creative and copy, consulting experience; mix of experience in digital and non-digital Ability to work independently and in a team environment. Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Proficient in typing and working in MS Office programs. Excellent written grammar and punctuation. Travel Required: Travel All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

ad.title: Manager, Campaign Programming - Inspire Brands - Atlanta, GA
ad.content:
The purpose of this position is to build, execute and monitor 1:1 personalized communication and offers by leveraging first, second- and third-party data sources through Salesforce Marketing Cloud. The manager will work cross-functionally as a liaison between the CRM team and Brand Marketing, Digital Marketing, Loyalty Marketing, Consumer Insights, IT and App/Web Development teams. A blend of omni-channel marketing strategy, ability to explain technical processes to non-technical audiences and a strong understanding of database concepts and programming will be necessary for success in this role.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
CRM and Customer Profiling - Manage and leverage the CRM and personalization platforms to identify, segment and target the right people with offers and personalized communication across all marketing channels. Campaign Execution - Partner with cross functional stakeholders to develop and execute campaigns to optimize guest loyalty and lifetime value. Work with analytics team to build statistically sound control group designs which support optimization and insight generation. Campaign Tool Ownership - In partnership with IT, own and enhance the CRM execution tool. Assess and augment areas of weakness in effort to build a best-in-class CRM and Personalization platform. EDUCATION QUALIFICATION:
Required Minimum: Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Advertising, Computer Science, Analytics or Economics
Preferred: Master's degree
EXPERIENCE QUALIFICATION:
3+ years of experience with CRM / database marketing and customer analytics (loyalty and retention) 5+ years of CRM execution tool experience, using Salesforce, Unica, SAS, Marketo and/or other CRM execution tools 5+ years of data analysis experience, using SQL, R, python, and / or other data analysis tools Experience working with CRM and customer analytics in hospitality, travel, retail, or consulting environments Demonstrated experience in partnering with key stakeholders to deliver results REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS OR ABILITIES:
Ability to lead cross-functional teams and deliver results Conscientious about meeting project deadlines Excellent oral and written communication skills Personal integrity, humility, an appreciation for the power of true teamwork, and a sense of humor Passion for the restaurant industry and desire to train in our restaurants to learn operations A strong desire to help shape the future at Inspire Brands Self-starter personality who can operate with minimal supervision

ad.title: Web Analyst - Informa - New York, NY
ad.content: Got Marketing + Analytic Smarts? Join our Marketing Team as Web Analyst! Overview: Informa is an international business-to-business events, academic publishing and information services Group. We are listed on the London Stock Exchange and a member of the FTSE 100. Informa Tech inspires the technology community to design, build and run a better digital world via its portfolio of leading brands, which include Black Hat, Game Developers Conference (GDC), Service Management World, Interop, Dark Reading and InformationWeek. We are looking for an experienced Web Analyst to join our team. As our Web Analyst, you will examine and track web performance metrics and trends and provide actionable insights to key internal stakeholders. You will lead the development of standardized dashboards and reporting, as well as the group's tracking processes. As an integral member of our marketing team, you will ensure web data is relevant and accessible and help define metrics and KPIs. Experience with Omniture/Adobe Analytics web analytic platform or Google Analytics required. Responsibilities: Track, report, and analyze the performance of our event and media websites and social media networks. Develop insights and recommendations that lead to the formulation of effective online marketing and content strategies. Lead development of KPI's, dashboard / reporting and ad hoc analysis designed to monitor and improve digital marketing campaigns and website performance. Create dashboards by pulling data from different data sources for presentations to senior management. Ensure that all digital marketing channels and ad hoc promotions are tracked, identifying abandonment issues and developing options to improve conversion, and ensuring the accuracy of the analytics implementation by validating the data collected. Maintain and deliver weekly & monthly KPIs and ad hoc reports in set time frames. Assists in developing marketing initiatives to increase website traffic, improve conversion rate, and lift average order value. Create data driven recommendations for site improvements and website conversion optimization and reduced bounce rates. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Digital Marketing/ Digital Media or Marketing 2+ years of experience with Adobe analytics /Omniture Site Catalyst Practical experience with Adobe/Omniture and Google Analytics Knowledgeable in digital marketing analytics Knowledge of data visualization tools Demonstrated experience managing, manipulating and analyzing large data sets. Ability to synthesize information from a variety of sources to arrive at optimal solutions.

ad.title: Dental Assistant Externship - Willamette Dental Group - Spokane, WA
ad.content: Company Overview With more than 400,000 patients throughout our 50+ practice locations in Oregon, Washington, and Idaho, and a built-in specialty referral network to more than 30 specialists, Willamette Dental Group has been a leader in preventive and proactive dental care since 1970. What makes this multi-specialty group practice unique, and better, is a commitment to proactively facilitating the best possible health outcomes. Job Responsibilities Willamette Dental Group encourages Dental Assistant externships in Oregon, Washington, and Idaho. Our offices typically have multiple doctors which provides an excellent learning opportunity for students.Students prepare patients for examination and ensure our patients are prepared, relaxed and are as comfortable as possible. Working chair-side under the supervision of the dentist, you will perform a variety of tasks; selecting and handing instruments to the dentist during dental procedures and practices of standardized procedures, techniques and methods used in dental assistance. Our Dental Assistants also may remove sutures, apply topical anesthetics to gums or cavity-preventive agents to teeth - remove excess cement used in the filling process and place rubber dams on the teeth to isolate them for individual treatment. The dental assistant must have excellent patient communication skills and be able to instruct patients on postoperative and general oral health care and be skilled in cornal polishing and sealant placement.Must be enrolled in a bona fide Dental Assisting program and meet school criteria for externships. CODA accredited programs are preferred. Contact your school's extern placement coordinator for information on completing your externship with us.

ad.title: Production Monitoring Analyst - Bart & Associates, Inc. - Springfield, VA
ad.content: Bart & Associates (B&A) is recruiting for a Production Monitoring/ Incident Management Analyst to join our team on a Federal contract in Springfield, VA! We are seeking a candidate who will be a part of a dynamic and energetic team responsible for the continuous monitoring (24x7x365) of multiple DHS Customs and Border Protection (CBP) Passenger Systems Program Directorate (PSPD) applications and responding to alerts and potential issues. The person should be willing and able to work various shifts to accommodate 24-hour coverage if needed. The person must be able to multitask and manage multiple systems individually or as part of a team. This work includes leveraging various automated and manual performance reporting monitors to determine if an issue exists and its severity, timely reporting of events and performance statistics, contacting the group responsible for the application and providing a recommendation for a resolution of the incident. A detailed record of all incidents and their resolutions shall be tracked for future evaluation and trending purposes. This person may interact with project leads, project managers, department liaisons, and key government staff. The person may also collaborate with other analysts, infrastructure support personnel, and application support personnel. Consequently, this role requires excellent customer service, verbal and written communication skills and the ability to work closely with CBP to identify and resolve IT issues. RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: Monitor various CBP applications to proactively identify system disruptions and preempt enterprise outages Monitor applications and ensure that required Service Level Agreements (SLAs) are met Notify internal and external departments of performance issues and trends Support maintenance and monthly outages Review and update tickets with most current status information Incorporate monitoring of any new applications or systems Review and suggest monitoring tools as needed Monitor and support the Testing, Education, and Production environments Develop after action reports and provide inputs to hot washes pertaining to the following as needed. Performance issues Scheduled server maintenance Root Cause Analyst (RCA) and follow up both internal and external Provide updated reports for monthly PMR presentation and review Provide documentation and presentation support as needed REQUIRED SKILLS: US Citizen (required) Associate’s Degree A minimum of five (5) year of experience in IT system through troubleshooting application maintenance and network operations (required) Comply with minimum security clearance requirements (required) ITIL experience or certification (preferred) Experience with US Government systems (preferred) Must be proficient in the following MS Products: MS Office (Word and Excel) Visio PowerPoint Experience with automated monitoring and performance management tools (i.e. Auto Ops, App Dynamics, Splunk, etc.) (preferred) Demonstrate excellent written and verbal communications skills. CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS: An ACTIVE CBP Clearance or an ACTIVE Top Secret clearance will be required before consideration.

ad.title: Computer Technology Support Specialist I-Cheyenne - State of Wyoming - Cheyenne, WY
ad.content:
$18.54 - $23.18 an hourDescription and FunctionsOpen Until Filled GENERAL DESCRIPTION:This position provides technical support, and in some cases, initial contact for internal and external customers under minimal supervision with a degree of technical expertise, customer satisfaction, and timeliness to assigned state agencies. This position is also responsible for the input and follow-up of issues in the incident tracking system, which will allow for monitoring of incidents from identification to resolution. The Computer Technology Support Specialist I works in a team environment to provide troubleshooting and problem resolution for desktops, laptops, software, printers, wireless mobile devices, and work with higher level technicians to complete projects.Human Resource Contact: 307-214-5835ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: The listed functions are illustrative only and are not intended to describe every function which may be performed in the job level. Under minimum supervision, communicates with end users and performs computer troubleshooting to diagnose basic system and desktop problems; analyzes hardware and software functionality; identifies, locates, resolves, and repairs problems according to IT standards, guidelines, and procedures; and documents call records and results Provides high quality customer service for the Technology Support Center and State network Conducts password resets, user changes, moves, and additional functions that continue to evolve and grow in scope and complexity aimed toward state consolidation Performs preventive maintenance and upgrades for computer operating systems, standard software, and hardware Tests, troubleshoots, and repairs hardware components such as desktops, laptops, monitors, printers and scanners through communication in person, over the phone, and remotely. Troubleshoots network connectivity issues and escalates problems that cannot be appropriately resolved by the assigned technician Sets up, maintains, and removes user directory accounts where necessary Disposes, installs, upgrades, and maintains computer workstation hardware, peripherals, and associated software; manages and executes installation upgrades and system patches Works within a team to complete special projects such as State agency migrations, equipment replacement, agency moves, and mass operating system upgrades Qualifications PREFERENCES:Preference may be given to those with experience in customer service, relations, and interpersonal communications within the past 7 years.Preference may be given to those with experience in desktop and peripheral support (Hardware and Software) within the past 7 years.Preference may be given to those with experience in team collaboration and team building within the past 7 years.Preference may be given to those with experience in task and time management within the past 7 years.Preference may be given to those with experience in technical writing within the past 7 years. KNOWLEDGE: Knowledge of common PC platforms and operating systems, including multiple versions of Windows (such as XP, 7, and Windows 10 for desktops and notebooks at a minimum), and Linux (especially major distributions, including Red Hat, Debian, Ubuntu, and Mandrake), and Mac OS (recent OS X versions at a minimum). Knowledge of Active Directory. Knowledge of PC hardware, including motherboards, CPUs, RAM, interface cards, and hard disks. Knowledge of PC applications and common productivity applications such as email, graphics, Web browsers, and other everyday software components.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Education: Bachelor's Degree (typically in Computer Technology)
Experience: 0-1 year of progressive work experience (typically in Computer Technology) with acquired knowledge at the level of a Computer Technology Support Technician
OR
Education & Experience Substitution: 3-4 years of progressive work experience (typically in Computer Technology) with acquired knowledge at the level of a Computer Technology Support Technician
Certificates, Licenses, Registrations: None Necessary Special Requirements PHYSICAL WORKING CONDITIONS: May work evenings or weekends to meet deadlines or solve problems Ability to be on-call 24/7 one week per month Occasional travel to different locations within the State to assist other technicians NOTES: Successful candidate must pass a background check FLSA: Non-exempt Must be able to lift up to 50 lbs. All new hires or rehires starting in a non-exempt position on or after January 1, 2018 are required to be paid hourly. Supplemental Information 077-ETS - Information ServicesClick here to view the State of Wyoming Classification and Pay Structure.URL: http://agency.governmentjobs.com/wyoming/default.cfmThe State of Wyoming is an Equal Opportunity Employer and actively supports the ADA and reasonably accommodates qualified applicants with disabilities. Class Specifications are subject to change, please refer to the A & I HRD Website to ensure that you have the most recent version.

ad.title: Machinist I - bioMerieux - Utah
ad.content: World leader in the field of in vitro diagnostics for over 50 years, bioMérieux conceives, develops, produces and markets diagnostics solutions (systems, reagents, software and services) intended for clinical and industrial applications, which determine the origin of a disease or a contamination to improve the health of patients and insure consumer safety.bioMérieux is present in over 150 countries through 43 subsidiaries and a large network of distributors. More than 90% of our sales are done internationally. Its corporate headquarters are located in Marcy l’Etoile, near Lyon, in France.Joining bioMérieux, is choosing to join an innovative company with a long term vision, committed to the service of public health and carried out with a humanistic corporate culture.We look for candidates whose motivation is to invest in themselves, in the projects of the future, and to participate in a collective adventure led by a pioneering spirit.We have the commitment to offer our collaborators a working environment which encourages team spirit, with priority given to training and development with international career opportunities.Our Group offers numerous possibilities: so come and join the 10,000 bioMérieux employees who have already identified with these values!Qualifications This position is responsible for producing machined parts by programming setting up, and operating a computer numerical control machine; maintaining quality and safety standards, keeping records; maintaining equipment and suppliesMain Accountabilit ies: Plans machining by studying work orders, blueprints, engineering plans, materials, specifications, orthographic drawings, reference planes, locations of surfaces, and machining parameters; interpreting geometric dimensions and tolerances Plans stock inventory by checking stock to determine amount available; anticipating needed stock; placing and expediting orders for stock. Programs mills and lathes by entering instructions, including zero and reference points, setting toll registers, offsets, compensation, and conditional switches’ calculating requirements, including basic math, geometry, and trigonometry; proving part programs. Sets up mills and lathes by installing and adjusting three and four-jaw chucks, tools, attachments, collets, bushings, cams, gears, stops, and stock pushers, indicting vices, tramming heads. Loads feed mechanism by lifting stock into position. Verifies settings by measuring positions, first-run part, and sample workpieces; adhering to international standards. Maintains specifications by observing drilling, grooving, and cutting, including turning, facing, knurling and thread chasing operations, taking measurements, detecting malfunctions, troubleshooting processes, adjusting and reprogramming controls; sharpening and replacing worn tools; adhering to quality assurance procedures and processes. Maintains safe operations by adhering to safety procedures and regulations. Maintains equipment by completing preventive maintenance requirements; following manufacturer’s instructions, troubleshooting malfunctions; calling for repairs. Maintains continuity among work shifts by documenting and communicating actions, irregularities and continuing needs. Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading technical publications. Accomplishes organization goals by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.Studies-Experience:Requires a Bachelor or Associates degree in related field or equivalent years of experience.Additional 0-3 years experienceExperience with Haas ControlsDMG Mori Turning Center operationProficiency in Master CAM and SolidWorksMust be able to safely lift 50 lbs.Affirmative Action Employer. M/F/Vet/Disability/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer. M/F/Vet/Disability/Sexual Orientation/Gender IdentityPrimary Location : AMER-AMER-US-Utah Schedule : Full-time Job Posting : May 6, 2019, 8:11:31 PM Shift : Day Job Employee Status : Regular Travel : Yes, 10 % of the Time

ad.title: Doctor of Veterinary Medicine (DVM) - Banfield Pet Hospital - Charlotte, NC
ad.content:
Location 8150 Ikea Blvd, Charlotte, North Carolina Job Type Full-time regular Doctor of Veterinary Medicine
Banfield aspires to be a practice where as a team, we make a positive impact on pet health care in hospitals, communities, and the field of veterinary medicine.
We believe hiring doctors with diverse perspectives, ideas, and cultures, permits us to deliver to the highest quality of preventive care for each pet and client.
Banfield’s veterinarians apply their extraordinary passion, skills, and education, at every practice location. We support and depend on our veterinarians to use their expertise in a way that benefits pets, clients, hospital teams, and the communities we serve.Whether you are a recent graduate or an experienced veterinarian looking for a change, a new beginning at Banfield means an open door to explore the next best move in your professional veterinary career.Are you ready to dedicate yourself to helping us advance veterinary medicine across our practice and throughout the industry? Responsibilities:
Practice in accordance to state practice act and principles of veterinary medical ethics Leverage evidence-based medicine and continue pursuit of education to deliver quality patient care Devote yourself to the culture of preventive care and Optimum Wellness Plans Adopt and positively impact new veterinary standards and guidelines Deliver medical and surgical treatments with formulary approved pharmaceuticals, supplies, and equipment, in accordance with Banfield’s Medical Quality Standards Partner with clients as an advocate for the pet to plan follow-up visits, provide home-care instructions, and education to ensure the lifelong health of their pets Maintain relevant, comprehensive medical records with the support of practice systems, including Banfield’s database, PetWare, designed to obtain data for population research Foster an effective veterinary support team by communicating medical standards, ethical practices, and your veterinary knowledge and experience Exemplify the Mars Five Principles — Quality, Responsibility, Mutuality, Efficiency, and Freedom Requirements:
State Veterinary Board License and must be in good standing for the state in which they intend to be hired, prior to their start date. Additional Licensing: A State Controlled Substance (SCS) License may be required by the state in which you intend to work. If you do not already hold an SCS, Banfield encourages you to obtain this license after your start date as the practice may reimburse this cost. Once an associate has obtained their SCS, Banfield will apply and pay for your DEA License. New associates will be required to take their state USDA Accreditation class by the time they reach the 12-week mark from their hire date. Your well-being matters.
We know that your real passion for pet well-being is why you chose this profession. At Banfield, we believe it is just as important to support the well-being of those who devote their lives to this cause. Through our extensive network and support structure, Banfield offers a wide array of benefits and programs, empowering you to focus on yourself and your family, as you care for pets and clients.As a Banfield veterinarian, we want you to take full advantage of work and play through: Competitive salary with paid time off Medical, dental, vision and prescription drug benefits for you and eligible dependents Automatic enrollment 401(k) Savings Plan after 60 days of employment Health Savings Account with annual practice-paid funding of $750 to supplement health care expenses Automatic enrollment in 100% practice paid short- and long-term disability after 60 days of employment – includes maternity leave Liability and malpractice insurance Eligibility to enroll in the Veterinary Student Debt Relief Pilot Program Optimum Wellness Plans (OWPs) for up to three pets A variety of discounts including Mars, PetSmart, Royal Canin, fitness, cellular, and so much more Our dedication to your growth.
Your development is important to us which is why we'll provide you with the following:
Personal development plans designed to define and achieve your career goals Practice-paid continuing education opportunities VIN Membership discounts and other veterinary networking opportunities The chance to lend your skills to the communities you serve and live in Commitment to community wellness.
Through volunteering efforts, and our programs designed to benefit local shelters and rescues, we strengthen the pet-human connections in our communities. Discover how we support the wellness of our people and profession through the Mars Volunteer Program (MVP).
Support when you need it most.As the world’s largest veterinary practice, one of our biggest differentiators is our talented and equally passionate support teams that surround our skilled veterinarians.
This network of hospital, field, and headquarters leadership, allows us to offer you the support and resources needed to help you worry less and focus more on being your best self while practicing veterinary medicine.The time is now!Ready to start your career with Banfield? Apply now.
Banfield Pet Hospital® strongly supports and values the uniqueness of all individuals and promotes a work environment where diversity is embraced. Banfield Pet Hospital is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, genetic information, or protected veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. Banfield Pet Hospital follows all applicable federal, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every Banfield location.

ad.title: Managing Account Supervisor, Retail PR - Ketchum - Chicago, IL
ad.content: OverviewKetchum is looking to hire a Managing Account Supervisor in Minneapolis to join our newly designed retail industry to help lead the charge for a growing client's portfolio. We need a strong writer, a project manager guru, a good leader and someone who excels in a fast-paced work environment.We are more than just a public relations & communications agency. We change the game with every campaign we touch for our clients through innovative and out the box ideas we manifest. In a culture, which is fast moving, fun and collaborative; we are seeking only those who can inspire others, who are fearless and consider themselves one of the best in the business. Is that you? If so, stop reading and start applying! About the Job Perform a wide range of duties including development of client programs, strategic planning, staff development and financial management. Serve as key liaison among client, account team and agency management Manage day-to-day account needs Act as primary contact to clients, continually fostering client-agency relationship to build trust and become a valuable resource to clients Provide strategic guidance to clients on an ongoing basis; anticipate and address clients’ needs Troubleshoot client’s problems as they arise; seek senior management input whenever appropriate Motivate team members by promptly reviewing work and providing constructive feedback; encourage team to take advantage of training and development opportunities Assist account team(s) in working effectively and in the best interest of client(s) Demonstrate proficiency in writing and editing materials including client press releases, byline articles, correspondence and reports Strive to develop the best communication and presentation skills possible to effectively articulate ideas to clients, colleagues and others Manage account financials including budget allocation and control, time sheets, client billing, supplier invoicing and purchase orders; ensure team billability and account profitability Access agency’s network of resources to deliver greatest value to clients Work with account team(s) to build incremental business Communicate account status to agency management regularly Participate in new business programming and presentations Demonstrate and develop presentation, negotiation and problem-solving skills; demonstrate ability to effectively develop full range of materials, including media materials, byline articles, speeches, client correspondences and reports. Stay on top of trends in the industry; bring them to the attention of clients and associates, as appropriate Qualifications Any combination of education and experience providing the required skills and knowledge for successful performance would qualify. Typical qualifications would be equivalent to: Bachelor’s degree in Communications, Public Relations, Journalism, English, Marketing or a related field preferred. Master’s degree in a communications field desirable 7+ years of experience of agency and/or corporate public relations experience, three years basic supervisory experience IND13 About Ketchum As a global communications consultancy with 90 plus years of experience, Ketchum is a trusted partner who is equal parts creative and analytical. Ketchum is a place where all perspectives and points of view are welcome and encouraged. We are a collection of communications specialists, content creators, creatives, researchers, data analysts, media pros, digital strategists, issues and crisis counselors, and tech nerds. And we love when those worlds collide to create the very best teams and solutions for our clients. We work with the world’s leading brands, emerging start-ups, and everything in between. We are beyond proud to have created some of the most celebrated and award-winning campaigns in our industry. We’re just crazy enough to think we can impact the world – and how it responds to ideas – through communication.We encourage our employees to be curious, brave, inspiring, and a force for good. Let’s talk. Come belong at Ketchum! IND13 What we offer Robust benefits program Generous time off policies Retirement program with company match Workplace flexibility Business casual dress code Workplace and off-site social gatherings Yoga @ work Professional learning and development opportunities Tuition reimbursement Paid maternity/paternity leave Transit benefits Interested? We’ve got an opportunity for you.

ad.title: Data Platform Engineering Manager - Prosper Funding - San Francisco, CA
ad.content:
What we need
The DPE Manager will be leading a team of DBA professionals responsible for managing multiple complex 24*7 High Available Databases systems for “Prosper” production and other environments. The other responsibilities would include, but not limited to creating/evaluating/implementing tools and processes to ensure the database team’s effectiveness from workload management perspective and projects execution. The DPE Manager will working closely with Engineering and Infrastructure teams to carry out the execution of database changes through Agile processes. This position demands technical hands-on skills as well as responsibilities of managing performance of the team members, mentoring and guiding team, as well as representing in cross-functional activities with Engineering and Business groups.
What you will do
Ensure 24X7 high availability for all the production databases at Prosper Database Design: tailor database instances to the processing requirements of the business systems (e.g. OLTP design considerations versus ODS and DSS, warehouse or “Big Data” implementations) they serve; understanding of logical data design integration and maintenance as well as the trade-offs required to meet business processing requirements Take the responsibility to troubleshoot issues with hands-on approach of databases and servers during critical incidents. Must have prior experience with problem solving techniques using SQL and Server Monitoring Tools in high available and business critical systems Secure database by developing policies, procedures, and controls working closely with InfoSec team Responsible for performance of the databases, continuous improvement of stored procedures Maintain database results by setting and enforcing standards and controls Collaborates with the Security and Audit teams to protect our data across all databases and to ensure compliance to all applicable regulations Keep senior technical management informed by preparing reports on system performance and problems Provide a working model of our transaction processing environment for capacity assessment and planning Prepare for database expansion by studying plans and requirements; coordinating with Engineering and Infrastructure teams Upgrade hardware and software by assessing transaction processing and database options Provide leadership during the development and enhancement of the enterprise production applications including working with applications, technical support, compliance and operations during the design, development and implementation of applications Update your technical knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations Show a positive attitude to adapt to new technologies as and when needed
What you will need to have
8+ years of experience in database administration in large-scale, high-available production database environments. (MS SQL Server Database) 5+ years of experience in planning/installing/managing replication and clustered database servers using MS SQL Server, T-SQL query optimization and tuning Demonstrated leadership skills including building the team like hiring, training and providing technical direction to the team Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to communicate technical information to non-technical audience. Organized and detail-oriented, able to work well under deadlines in a changing environment and perform multiple tasks effectively and concurrently. Strong work ethic - ability to work well with team members from many different disciplines with varying degrees of technical experience Minimum 2 years of experience in PostgreSQL, MySQL databases and No-SQL databases like MongoDB, Cassandra Exposure to scripting languages like Python, JavaScript and PowerShell Strong hands-on skills with a proven ability to manage high available complex production databases on a 24*7 basis Experience in designing and building data models to improve accessibility, efficiency, and quality of data Experience in data architecture, process improvement Understanding of IT Security and Compliance audit processes Bachelors/ Master’s degree in IT or related field is preferred. Equivalent combination of education and experience may be substituted in lieu of degree.
A Few Things to Know About Us
We offer an excellent compensation and benefits plan, including incentive bonuses, stock options, company-paid health, dental, and vision insurance, paid vacation time, 401(k) with employer-match, fitness reimbursement, commuting reimbursement, and more!
Prosper is committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Prosper will consider for employment qualified applicants who are non-US citizens and will provide green card sponsorship.

ad.title: Sales Director - TrueMotion - Boston, MA
ad.content:
There are 1.2B drivers in the world. TrueMotion combines the power of mobile technology, machine learning and SaaS to reduce auto crashes, identify the safest drivers, and help them save money. Our clients include leading insurers, transportation network companies, auto manufacturers, telcos, etc. These clients embed and integrate our software into theirs and offer new products & services to their customers. The Sales Director is a critical and high profile, individual contributor, quota-carrying role. You will source, develop and close business with leading companies across the US. You will lead the entire sales process for prospects and existing customers. Responsibilities: Cultivate deep relationships with executives at all levels. Elicit prospects' and customers' business, functional and technical requirements Develop solutions to help customers achieve their business strategies and goals. Understand and address prospect and customer questions and objections Show the value of our market-leading mobile telematics and big data analytics solutions Qualify and advance opportunities while being a wise steward of company resources Negotiate and close contracts that result in predictable, committed revenue Develop, communicate and execute account and opportunity plans Create and deliver accurate forecasts Be the "voice of the market" and contribute to marketing and product strategy Be an authority on usage based insurance, claims, telematics, mobile marketing, driver behavior Ensure customers succeed post-sale and grow our business with them
Required Qualifications: 5+ years as a consultative, enterprise application sales executive doing large, complex deals with line-of-business buyers (not IT) Track record of exceeding sales targets and performance at top 10% of peers BA or BS degree Technical expertise in auto insurance and/or telematics is a plus MBA or Strategy Consulting experience is a plus
TrueMotion offers: The best products and technology in our industry A base of satisfied, reference-able customers in the US and Europe Financial stability and great investors like General Catalyst, Bain, and Lakestar Killer exec team (Liberty Mutual, Tesla, Lyft, Zipcar, Harvard, MIT) Great culture with 4.9 rating on Glassdoor
Why TrueMotion? At TrueMotion we build solutions that make driving safer, lower cost, and more fun. We use the smartphone as a sensor and machine learning to turn phone data into driving data. We believe distracted driving is a solvable problem and partner with insurance companies and other relevant organizations to drive change (pun intended). We are a band of entrepreneurs dedicated to our mission and having fun at our office on Fort Point Channel! TrueMotion is backed by General Catalyst, Bain Capital Ventures and Lakestar. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

ad.title: Director, Digital Inventory and Yield - AT&T - New York, NY
ad.content: Description What part will you play?As Director, Digital Inventory and Yield you will play a key role in maximizing value and utilization of digital inventory across Xandr. You will leverage data to evaluate performance, analyze strategies to optimize yield and implement best-practices to support growth. You will be a leader on the highly motivated Xandr Operations team where relationship building, and customer satisfaction are keys to a successful candidate.The right person for this role is a dynamic problem-solver who is comfortable interpreting large data sets and communicating results throughout a sales organization. You will also have a track record of hiring, training and retaining dedicated talent - being a coach and advocate for your team. If you are someone who thrives in a fast-paced, hands-on and collaborative environment, then this is a great role for you.What will you be doing?Lead and build a team of inventory analysts and yield optimization experts while also being a key contributorWork closely with cross functional teams to be able to understand complex inventory, reporting and workflow needsIdentify and implement inventory management related workflow and technology enhancements to support scaling the business.Be a key stakeholder and contributor in the implementation and adoption of Yieldex, driving automation for inventory forecasting and accuracy of total inventory capacity and availability.Model trends for digital ad inventory and yield, including programmatic, by using ad server, viewership, financial and industry data.Create reporting with inventory utilization, sell-through, and revenue pacing using systems to drive automation. Use reporting to develop actionable, data driven insights and make recommendations to maximize revenue to upper management, sales and media planning teams.Work closely with Product Marketing and Sales Planning to create packaging guidelines and rationalize profitability and pricing of new media products including pricing thresholds and margin attainment.Drive development of quantitative models necessary for evaluation and implementation of new strategies, and product rolloutDevelop, research and analyze pricing strategies - testing and evaluating current and proposed scenariosBe a key partner to ad sales management and operations team to drive sales performance leading with data Qualifications What do we require from you?8-10 years of experience leading Digital Inventory & Yield for Ad Agency, Publisher, Network, or Ad Tech Vendor.Proven ability to lead without authority and communicate both up and downHighly proficient (expert level preferred) within Microsoft Excel (for example vLookup, Indexmatch, Pivot Tables, Macros)Strong analytical, communication and organizational skills requiredEnergy, enthusiasm, and ability to propose solutions to problems with a positive and client-centric attitudeExperience with digital ad serving systems, such as DFP and FreeWheel / front-end sales systems, such as DMD, Salesforce, Operative.One etc. / publisher tools, such as Yieldex / Aggregators, such as Staq or Ad-Juster / SQL and/or data visualization tools like Looker/Tableau a plusDeep knowledge of the digital advertising industry including, yield optimization, pricing & inventory, ad tech, and programmatic buying/sellingComfort with ambiguity and a strong self-learner who can navigate through situations with minimal guidanceMust be able to multi-task and prioritize in a fast-paced environmentMust possess a passion to drive the business forwardBachelor's degree required

ad.title: Sales Executive 1 Fiber - AT&T - Chicago, IL
ad.content: CommissionLooking for a career in Business to Business Sales – look no furtherYou already know the name AT&T. Did you also know AT&T Mobility has the largest voice and data network in the country with the strongest spectrum position and 36 coverage in over 165 major metropolitan areas. We also have the best international coverage in wireless - voice in 190+ countries and data in 120+ countries. Plus, AT&T Mobility recently completed a $250 million investment to implement end-to-end business systems built for enterprise clientsBut we couldn’t be all those grand things if it wasn’t for our world-class employees. Would you like the chance to get on board with this exciting, high-tech growth-oriented company that offers you top uncapped earning potential? Sure you would. Here’s your shot.As a Sales Executive 1 Fiber you’ll be proactively selling AT&T's pre-deployed Fiber Based Broadband network assets. You’ll focus on generating new sales revenue within a module or territory making daily sales calls, networking, building relationships and identifying sales opportunities. You’ll partner with clients to understand their needs and deliver customized value-added solutions to solve customers’ strategic business priorities. We’re looking for tech-savvy, self-driven individuals that are passionate about business sales and transforming the speed of business.Are you ready for the challenge?Key Responsibilities: Understand the communication and technology needs of small and mid-sized business customers and to partner with your resources to design customized solutions to meet their unique business needs. Develop new accounts and maintain and grow existing accounts while establishing and maintaining productive long-term networks and relationships with customers. Utilize consultative selling skills to identify key trends, uncover customer needs and leverage industry knowledge and applications to find and close sales opportunities. Develop responses for Request for Proposals as well as observe and participate in presenting products and services that can benefit customer’s needs. Design strategic initiatives to grow and retain the revenue stream of assigned complex accounts while ensuring customer satisfaction. Required Qualifications: Valid driver's license with satisfactory driving record Current auto insurance Reliable vehicle per transportation needs of market Demonstrated ability to meet and/or exceed assigned sales targets Strong networking and negotiation skills Ability to learn quickly Experience: 2-5 Years Outside Sales and/or Account Management experience preferred. Experience with Telecommunications or Technical sales is desired Education: Bachelor’s Degree, technical discipline preferred. Compensation: Once you’re a part of the team, you’ll gain some amazing perks and benefits like: a competitive base salary + commission, medical/dental coverage, 401(k) plan, tuition reimbursement, paid training and paid time off. We also provide 50% employee discount on: AT&T internet & fiber AT&T phone (formerly U-verse Voice) DIRECTV (including Free HBO & NFL Sunday Ticket), DIRECTV NOW or U-verse TV AT&T is leading the way to the future – for customers, businesses and the industry. We're developing new technologies to make it easier for our customers to stay connected to their world. Together, we’ve built a premier integrated communications and entertainment company and an amazing place to work and grow.Team up with industry innovators every time you walk into work, creating the world you always imagined. So, what do you say? Let’s do great things together.

ad.title: Solutions Architect -Automation (Government) - AT&T - Columbia, MD
ad.content: AT&T is seeking a Leader who will be instrumental in establishing and formalizing a DevOps methodology in the delivery and automation of solutions for a large DoD customer. You must be a professional systems architect able to work across multiple technology verticals with a vision of integrated wholistic solutions. This role is aimed to identify and develop automation to improve product delivery, process and solution quality. You will be required to articulate in detail, technical solutions to complex problems and gain support and endorsement across a variety of organizations and stake holders.Scope and responsibilities include:Knowledge: Expert level technical professional. Trusted advisor on technical knowledge of the Customer and AT&T technologies and commercial best practices. Applies extensive technical expertise, and experience to real-world scenarios.Problem Solving: Develops technical solutions to complex problems which require the regular use of ingenuity and creativity.Discretion: Work is performed without appreciable direction. Exercises considerable latitude in determining technical objectives and approaches to assignment. Completed work is reviewed from a relatively long-term perspective, for desired results.Impact: Guides the successful completion of projects impacting multiple programs and may function in a project leadership role. Erroneous decisions or recommendations would typically result in failure to achieve major organizational objectives.Liaison: Represents the organization as a technical subject matter expert on projects. Interacts in a customer-facing capacity with senior leadership on significant technical matters often requiring coordination between organizations.• Asses and identify opportunities to automate tasks, processes and workflows. • Engage/collaborate with operations stakeholders to develop and validate functional requirements; control project schedules and deadlines.Responsible for discovering and identifying any bottlenecks or solution gaps such as manual process flows that can hinder services or impact cycle time or cost and resolve them early during the solution development, design, and construction phase. Consider the clients non-functional requirements such as security, scalability, resiliency, and performance in all solutions.Provide functional and behavioral requirements to software developers to produce high quality custom applications, reports and data dashboards for multiple communities of interest in an operations environment.develops integrated solutions between legacy and target state solutionsdefine and design functional, technical, performance, and reliability solutions in line with client inferred requirements.Collaborate with external organizations to develop enhancements in a DevOps organizational structure. Participate in all phases of the solution to include design, implementation, Operations and Improvement cycles.Mentor and share expertise with Intermediate and associate personnel.Provide technical engineering support to all phases of network development, operation and management. Skills and qualifications:A passion to automate EVERYTHING!Ability to learn new technologies quickly and apply breadth of experience and maturity to any given solution or scenario.Must have organizational skills with ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and responsibilities.commitment to quality work, customer service and high productivity.Able to handle confidential/sensitive proprietary information and personal identifiable information (PII).Hand-On experience with various scripting and/or coding automation techniques and languages, such as Python, BASH or YAML.Fluency in software development (but not a developer)Experience working in a DevOps environment delivering minimal viable product.Expert level hands-on experience with Common DevOps tools such as (Puppet, Chef, Ansible), provisioning, infrastructure as code, and other DevOps concepts and tools (Vagrant, Docker, Jenkins etc.)Experience with database query, data manipulation and other forms of data analytics preferred.Experience and ability to lead projects; work individually on projects, as well as, a team player.Knowledge of various Software Defined Networking controllers and Orchestration tools such as Open Daylight, Cisco NSO. Experience, Education, and Certifications:Compliant with DoD 8570 IAT Level I baseline certification or higherMaster’s degree from an accredited college with 5 years of professional experience, or bachelor’s degree (Engineering, Math, Computer Science, Physics, Telecommunications, or Information Systems) from an accredited college with 7+ years of professional experience or prior military service or 10+ years related experience in public sector Work location: Ft. George Meade Md. Or St. Louis Metro (Scott AFB IL.)Required Clearance: Active SECRET

ad.title: Principal-Technology Security - AT&T - Durham, NC
ad.content: AT&T is currently seeking candidates for Sr. Cybersecurity Threat Hunter - Tier III SOC Analyst to be a part of a top-notch team of cybersecurity professionals. The role will involve working with our mid-large global business customers protecting their enterprises by leveraging AT&T Cybersecurity’s cutting-edge unified security technology and platforms. We are seeking an individual that can bring security analysis and incident response experience to support daily operations and to help scale this growing area of our business.As a Cybersecurity Threat Hunter, you will be responsible for participating in threat actor-based investigations, creating new detection methodologies, and provided expert support to incident response and monitoring functions. The focus of the Threat Hunter is to detect, disrupt and eradicate threat actors from impacting enterprise networks. To execute this mission, the Threat Hunter will use data analysis, threat intelligence, and cutting-edge security technologies. This role will also directly support the Security Operations Center by applying analytic and technical skills to investigate intrusions, identify malicious activity and potential insider threats, and perform incident response. Responsibilities:General SIEM monitoring, analysis, content development, and maintenanceResearch, analysis, and response for alerts; including log retrieval and documentationConduct analysis of network traffic and host activity across a wide array of technologies and platformsAssist in incident response activities such as host triage and retrieval, malware analysis, remote system analysis,
