ad.title: Software Engineering Manager - CentralReach - New Jersey
ad.content:
CentralReach is a leading provider of EHR and practice management solutions that enable applied behavioral analysis (ABA) clinicians and educators to produce superior outcomes for people with autism and related disorders. Powered by its acquisition of Chartlytics, the company is revolutionizing the ABA space with cutting-edge solutions including precision teaching, clinical data collection, scheduling, billing, and learning management. Trusted by more than 52,000 clinicians and educators, CentralReach is committed to ongoing product improvement, market-leading industry expertise, world-class client satisfaction and support of the ABA community to propel industry practitioners into a new era of excellence. We are looking for experienced Engineering Manager to join our team! Reporting to our Chief Technology Officer, you will be a trusted partner, managing and developing back-office and front-end software, systems, and API's in an agile environment to integrate with a growing set of practice management software solutions. As a key member of the Engineering team, you will take ownership of bringing new and improved features and functionality to our entire stack, working within a group of developers to drive product development, communicate and coordinate effectively with other independent techies and non-techies alike, to ensure optimal progress towards our goals. If you have a passion for full stack development and technology in general, enjoy and thrive in an agile, fast-moving, ever-changing startup environment, welcome and take on technical challenges of all shapes and sizes, have excellent interpersonal skill and sense of humor and enjoy rolling up your sleeves and jumping in, then read on! This role is based out of our Holmdel, New Jersey Office. Local candidates only please. Key Accountabilities: We primarily utilize the following technologies: Web technologies (JavaScript, TypeScript, React, CSS, etc.) Microsoft development stack (C#, SQL Server) with Service Stack, on AWS (using Redis, ElasticSearch, Redshift, DynamoDB, Kinesis, etc.). Responsible for collaboration and communication with various teams as needed Provide guidance and insight to upper management and procure buy-in Report progress, including any changes made to plans and production Contribute to product design, technical design and establishment of requirements Deliver products consistently, on time and on budget Work closely with scrum master during all phases of development lifecycle Review all work produced by development team Ensure code produced meets company standards Conduct regular status meetings with all necessary stakeholders Participate regularly in development assignments as duties allow for. A strong people manager. Your weekly one-on-ones are sacred and growing your management / leadership skills are just as important as your tech skills to you. Maintains staff by recruiting, selecting, orienting, and training employees; maintaining a safe and secure work environment; developing personal growth opportunities. Accomplishes staff results by communicating job expectations; planning, monitoring, and appraising job results; coaching, and counseling employees; developing, coordinating, and enforcing systems, policies, procedures, and productivity standards. Passionate about building an inclusive engineering culture, with teams that are both eager to learn and deeply curious. Desired Skills and Experience: Demonstrate solid working knowledge of any mainstream object-oriented programming language, ideally C#. Have a deep understanding of back end/server/api development, including application and database/data development and architectures Demonstrate solid working knowledge of any mainstream front end technologies ideally Javascript, TypeScript, React, Mobx, & CSS. Have a deep understanding of front end development and architectures Possess broad applicable knowledge of data/database technologies including traditional RDBMS's (SQL Server), NoSql (DynamoDb), Search (ElasticSearch), Analytics/Warehousing (Redshift, EMR), Streaming (Kinesis), etc. Display working knowledge of the SQL language and/or SQL-based relational database system(s) (i.e. MySql, SQL Server, Oracle, etc.) Minimum 5 years’ experience in Information Technology field Minimum 2 years’ experience in management Exceptional communication and reporting skills Outstanding leaderships skills and ability to delegate responsibilities effectively CentralReach was developed for Clinicians by Clinicians. The story of CentralReach begins at an ABA clinic based out of Pompano Beach, Florida. The company’s founder, a practicing Board Certified Behavioral Analyst, was drowning in manual management of her clinic from scheduling staff and filing claims to reporting on clinical data. She decided that there had to be a better way to manage her operations so she could spend more time on what mattered most — working with her clients and patients. To help ABA practices focus on what they do best, CentralReach launched the first iteration of its EHR and practice management platform in 2012. Today, under the leadership of Chris Sullens, an award-winning CEO in the technology space, CentralReach is committed to their mission of providing cutting-edge technology and services to help clinicians and educators produce superior client and patient outcomes. Already a market leader, CentralReach is expected to grow exponentially through its four core tenets: hire and develop great people; build industry-leading products; provide exceptional service to customers and continuously invest in systems, processes and infrastructure.
We value our employees and offer a robust benefits package including health and dental, paid time off, life insurance, disability coverage and a 401(k) matching. We also provide comprehensive onboarding, ongoing training, mentoring and career pathing to help you develop your career. We pride ourselves on our fun and energetic environment that also provides our employees with a meaningful way to make a difference by helping clinicians produce superior outcomes for children and adults with disabilities.

ad.title: ETL Developer - Symphony Health Solutions - United States
ad.content: Overview Symphony Health Solutions, a wholly owned subsidiary of PRA Health Sciences, is a leading provider of high-value data, analytics, technology solutions and actionable insights for healthcare and life sciences manufacturers, payers and providers. The company helps clients drive revenue growth and commercial effectiveness, while adapting to the transformation of the healthcare ecosystem, by integrating a broad set of patient, prescriber, payer and clinical data together with primary and secondary health research, analytics and consulting. Symphony delivers a comprehensive perspective on the real dynamics that drive business in the healthcare and life sciences markets. At Symphony Health Solutions, we pride ourselves on being Collaborative and customer centric. We do this by focusing on five key values: Love the Customer by consistently exceeding expectations Focus on Brilliant Execution by being detailed and accountable Leapfrog the Competition by Differentiating ourselves and providing innovative solutions Build a High-Performance Culture that does not accept mediocrity Make it Fun by Connecting as one passionate high-energy team. Connect with Symphony! Collaborate with Customers! Differentiate Yourself! Symphony is hiring a Technical Services Engineer to work closely with Production, Development, and Operational areas to resolve technical issues, perform root cause analysis, develop continuous engineering improvements and foster stakeholder relationships. The successful candidate will be a multi-tasking self-starter with a keen ability to prioritize and lead efforts to solve issues effectively. Must have experience with ETL, Linux, Oracle, Informatica, SQL and the flexibility to work outside standard business hours. Pharma data knowledge is a plus. Responsibilities Adhere to and enforce company service level agreements, specifically those customer facing. Available for escalation as a technical subject matter expert. Troubleshooting, resolving and tracking application issues on a daily basis for issues such as, but not restricted to: alert activity, available disk space, available memory, server logs, number of processes running, who is logged in, queues. Diagnose internal or customer reported issues to determine the validity of the reported issue and undertake analysis and actions for resolution. Support the change control process making judgments as to when a push-forward or rollback decision should be made as necessary. Communicates effectively to both business and technical stakeholders within the project team. Foster relationships with key stakeholders, understanding their requirements and recommend / implement technical solutions and provide guidance as needed. Proactive analysis and troubleshooting of production servers and applications. Define procedures and processes for ongoing continuous improvement and implement tools for automation.Qualifications 4-year degree in information technology, computer science or a related field. Equivalent work experience or technical certifications will be considered. Solid problem solving ability Must have sound understanding of ETL (Informatica), Linux and database basics such as SQL, MySQL, Oracle, etc... Some experience with the Hadoop ecosystem Sound written and oral communication skills AutoSys knowledge is a plus Pharma Data knowledge is a plus Needs to have flexible work schedule because we do 24 x 7 support Exposure to Hadoop is a big plus

ad.title: Senior Database Engineer - Redfin - Seattle, WA
ad.content: Redfin's mission is to change the real estate game in the consumer's favor. We are looking for amazing Software Engineers in Test to guarantee that we have the best home buying and selling experience in the world. As a Senior Database Engineer, you will lead the development and evolution of our data platform. Partnering with systems and application developers, you will play a key role as we evolve our architecture to meet the demands of Redfin’s growth. In addition to defining our next-generation architecture for persistent storage, you will continue to support our existing data layer, working to increase performance, scale with demand, and define org-wide best practices for data storage and access. Your responsibilities include: Ensure effective performance and 24X7 availability of the production database systems Lead efforts to re-architect our existing data platform and design new standard data platforms for new services Lead efforts on performance tuning, scaling and bench-marking the data services infrastructure Design, automate and document operational processes, tasks and configuration management Work closely with performance engineers and core product engineers on a myriad of topics Contribute to automation such as configuration automation using puppet, provisioning as well as automating any other repetitive tasks. Track resource usage trends and take preventative actions to restore full health Monitor security and database operation related alerts, take preventive or corrective action to resolve issues Participate in on-call rotation and occasional off-hour activities Desired Skills & Qualifications History of leading large multi-team efforts to design database solutions for enterprise-scale applications. 10 years of experience engineering, administering and managing relational databases (Oracle, MySQL, SQLServer, PostgreSQL) Expert-level coding skills in the procedural language for at least one database engine a must (PL/SQL, T-SQL etc.) Able to automate tasks using at least one scripting language (shell, Python, Perl). Experience building and maintaining complex mission-critical production database systems Experience sharding large shared data sets, enabling data isolation at the application level. Broad awareness of customer workloads and use cases, including performance, availability and scalability Experience working directly with application engineers, resolving database, systems and infrastructure-related issues and also providing systems architecture leadership. Expertise of relational database internals (locking, consistency, serialization, recovery paths) Systems engineering experience, including Linux performance, memory management, I/O tuning, configuration, security, networking, clusters and troubleshooting. Storage engineering experience, including NAS, SAN, SSD, multi-pathing and caching. Proven track record of automating tasks Excellent communication skills What We Offer A mission that matters. Homes bought and sold with Redfin as of 2017: 120,000+ Management that is interested in helping you grow as an engineer and motivated to making our work environment as productive as possible. Competitive compensation packages with a salary, bonuses, and restricted stock grants. Generous benefits, including three weeks of paid vacation, medical, dental, and vision insurance, and fully paid family leave Strong company culture with catered lunches, casual dress code, happy hours, and more. Redfin is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce.

ad.title: NOW Foods R&D Packaging Engineer - NOW Foods - Bloomingdale, IL
ad.content: Founded by Elwood Richard in 1968, NOW Foods has grown from a small, family operation to a highly-respected manufacturer of natural health products. Today, NOW Foods manufactures and distributes over 1,400 dietary supplements, natural foods, sports nutrition, and personal care products. NOW’s state of the art manufacturing facilities are GMP-certified, and our quality testing labs are among the best in the industry. The company has over 1,500 employees and its products are sold in more than 60 countries. The company remains family-owned and committed to its original mission: to provide value in products and services that empower people to lead healthier lives. NOW offers a competitive compensation structure and a comprehensive benefit package which includes medical, dental and vision plans from tier one companies, Paid Time Off, 401k match up to $6,500 per year, educational assistance and company-paid disability and life insurance. NOW employees also enjoy a wide array of unique benefits such as company-paid profit sharing, quarterly bonuses, employee discount, wellness program, company-paid Teladoc and Rx’nGo, and much more! Many of our benefits are 100% paid by NOW – this is why NOW Foods has been awarded as one of the “101 Best & Brightest Companies to Work for” in Chicago ELEVEN years in a row, and on the National Level SIX years in a row! To learn more about NOW Foods, visit nowfoods.com, like us on Facebook at facebook.com/nowfoodsofficial, or follow us on Twitter at twitter.com/NOWFoods or on Instagram at instagram.com/nowfoodsofficial. POSITION SUMMARY The R & D Packaging Engineer is responsible for developing, implementing, and improving procedures for managing and coordinating packaging engineering activities. The packaging procedures and activities must produce results in terms of improved quality, methods, and cost. This position will lead cross functional teams, provide technical support, develop new packaging, and optimize existing packaging systems. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Perform all packaging engineering activities associated with package design, testing, process development, specifications, and ensure proper configuration and packaging attainment goals are met or exceeded. Manage the design and selection of primary, secondary, and tertiary components, label substrates/adhesives and suppliers Drive continuous improvement efforts focused on quality and operational efficiency. Identify and implement cost savings initiatives related to packaging materials, efficiency, transportation, and storage. Develops test methods based on accepted industry standards to verify packaging material integrity, product compatibility, stability, sustainability, and meets regulatory requirements. Project future packaging needs and formulate strategies consistent to meeting established business objectives. Establish strong working relationships with key suppliers. Understands the upstream and downstream implications of his/her work. Creates and/or maintains technical packaging specifications. Creates and/or maintains master batch records to include materials and packaging process requirements to ensure consistency from batch to batch. Leads sustainability efforts associated with packaging to include improving existing and seeking new technology for new packaging components. Design packaging used for distribution to minimize breakage, leaking, or other quality related issues. Works directly with Supply Chain, Quality Assurance, Quality Control, and Operations evaluating new packaging materials, materials out of specification, and alternate vendors to ensure materials are compatible with packaging equipment used in-house and at contract manufacturers. Organizes resources in completing projects based on the priorities of meeting profitability objectives, company deadlines, operating budget responsibilities, and R & D departmental and company goals. Obtains information related to research and development including raw material characteristics, processing techniques, environmental conditions, packaging requirements and production efficiencies to be used for master batch records. Enters information into Oracle in the form of bill of materials, specifications, and manufacturing instructions. Identifies and documents critical parameters pertaining to approved packaging in order reproduce results on a full-scale production basis. Completes URS documentation, attends FAT, and works closely with QA/QC to complete DQ/IQ/OQ/PQ protocols for new and existing packaging materials and equipment. Actively participates in root-cause analysis as packaging related issues arise. Recommends and implements corrective actions. Complies with safety and GMP requirements. SAFETY RESPONSIBILITY STATEMENT Supports a culture of safe production and operations; follows all safety rules and procedures. Actively participates in the safety program by: engaging in training activities to learn what constitutes a safety hazard; reporting safety concerns to the supervisor, submitting safety suggestions; and correcting or reporting to the appropriate people when an employee sees a workplace health or safety hazard, until it is resolved. Assists with communicating safety information to new employees. Fulfills responsibilities as outlined in the company safety management plan. QUALIFICATIONS To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Requires strong project management skills and ability to work individually and part of a team. Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE Master’s degree in Chemical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or related field. PhD in Packaging Engineering preferred. 10 years packaging experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of training and experience. LANGUAGE SKILLS Ability to read and interpret documents such as packaging specifications, test methods, CAD drawings, equipment and procedural manuals, SOPs, and safety data sheets (SDS). Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of the organization. Proactive in communicating project updates and conducting postmortem review of completed projects. MATHEMATICAL SKILLS Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations. Apply analytical engineering tools including critical path thinking, fault tree analysis and root cause failure analysis for purpose of determining design feasibility and identifying sources of variation from designed performance specifications. REASONING ABILITY Excellent problem solving skills and statistical analysis required. Knowledge of Design of Experiment applications a plus. OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES Proficient in Microsoft Office, Share Point, Smartsheet, ETQ, and other databases. Oracle experience is preferred. Work independently with limited supervision in a fast paced environment with aggressive project deadlines. Excellent organizational skills a must to effectively manage multiple projects concurrently with attention to detail. Proactive in communicating project updates to large groups and maintaining project lists. Practical knowledge of package testing including ASTM, ISO, DIN, and other accepted industry standards. PHYSICAL DEMANDS The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to enter information into a computer, handle testing equipment, raw materials and finished product, tools, or controls and communicate in person and on the telephone. The employee frequently is required to taste or smell and ascend and/or descend stairs. The employee is occasionally required to move from place to place within the facility, to reach, ascend and/or descend, balance, or stoop. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, ability to adjust focus and color vision. The employee must regularly lift, move (in some cases drag items), slide, raise and/or place: 5 lbs. from ground level and place at 61 high inch level; return to original position. Up to 30 lb. force for up to 25 feet and then pull to original position. Up to 33 lbs. from 5 inches off ground and raise to 47 inches and then return 33 lbs. to original position. Up to 50 lbs. for 3 feet at waist level; lift bag/box onto side and return to original position. Pallets weighing up to 55 lbs. from floor onto one side, move it up to 10 ft. and return to original position. WORK ENVIRONMENT The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions. The employee is frequently exposed to vapors and/or herbal aromas. The employee may be exposed to potentially hazardous chemical and biological materials. This position works in all areas of NOW’s manufacturing facilities with direct exposure to ingredients (powders and liquids), mixes (powders and liquids), equipment, and packaging..It is the policy of NOW Foods to prohibit discrimination of any type, and to afford equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and prospective employees, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by law.

ad.title: Technical Lead - Warner Music Group - New York, NY
ad.content: With its broad roster of new stars and legendary artists, Warner Music Group is home to a collection of the best-known record labels in the music industry including Asylum, Atlantic, Big Beat, Canvasback, East West, Elektra, Erato, FFRR, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Reprise, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Warner Bros., Warner Classics, and Warner Music Nashville; Warner/Chappell Music, one of the world's leading music publishers, with a catalog of more than one million copyrights worldwide. For more than four decades, WMG has been an industry-leading force in providing a world-class array of services designed to help artists and labels grow their careers and their businesses. Artist & Label Services is the umbrella for WEA (Warner-Elektra-Atlantic) – the pioneering WEA distribution and marketing network – and Alternative Distribution Alliance (ADA) – the groundbreaking global distribution company for independent artists and labels.Job Title: Technical Lead A little bit about our team: Technical Lead is responsible for the estimation, feasibility analysis, technical leadership and oversight in end-to-end delivery of software solutions for business. The role is expected to promote and implement good engineering practices, improve overall architecture and participate in cross-team initiatives. The role is roughly 30-50% hands on and will manage a remote staff of roughly 3-10, depending on the project(s) assigned. Here you’ll get to: Makes project commitments and delivers well designed solutions to solve business problems Actively contributes to the global standards and technology architecture Works well with a variety of leaders across technical functions and in the music business To fulfill the above: Provides feasibility analysis, rough order of magnitude (ROM), and/or detailed project estimates based on deliverables from the product management team Works with product management and related stakeholders to set an appropriate level of detail on user stories and other requirements for the development team to be successful Facilitates and enables IT commitments on project delivery Develops technical designs or prototypes/spikes as needed to fulfill project commitments Manages project risk to successfully meet project commitments Leads with a continuous improvement mindset Hands-on technical depth enables direct oversight, problem-solving leadership and participation for complex software development, and troubleshooting where needed It would be music to our ears if you had: Leadership Skills: 5 years total experience with at least one year of project leadership responsibility and exposure to a large or complex software development project Proven ability to estimate and understand project risk, especially technical risks (performance, stability, etc) Holds accountability and is able to hold others accountable for their commitments Communicates effectively and builds relationships with both internal and external stakeholders Techology Skills: Familiarity with several major programming languages – Java, Python, Javascript, C#, etc. Strong understanding of CS fundamentals – data structures, algorithms, software design patterns, database systems, messaging Experience with designing robust modern full-stack web solutions – front-end, restful APIs, persistent storage, caching, etc. Experience with proven/popular web frameworks in several language stacks Experience with proven/popular ORM frameworks in several language stacks Experience with CI/CD and devops Experience with cloud technologies (preferably AWS) Understanding of reactive architecture patterns Optional, but would be a plus - working experience with big data technologies (Hive, Presto, Redshift, etc) Oracle RDBMS or any large COTS platform (SAP, etc) Why join us? Warner Music Group is all about our people. We are one global company made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. It is the mission of every member of the WMG team around the world to create a nurturing environment for artists, songwriters, and the people behind the music, every stage of their career. We strive to set WMG apart from the rest of the industry by embracing a philosophy of innovation that is part of our company's DNA. Consider a career at WMG and be a part of one of the biggest forces in music today. Love this job and want to apply? Click the “Apply” link at the top of the page, or apply directly with your LinkedIn. Applying with LinkedIn will import all of the information you put in your profile, but will still allow you to upload a resume and cover letter. Don’t be discouraged if you don’t hear from us right away. We’re taking our time to review all resumes, and to find the best people for WMG. Thanks for your interest in working for Warner Music Group. We love it here, and think you will too. Warner Music Group is an equal opportunity employer. We enthusiastically accept our responsibility to make employment decisions without regard to race, religious creed, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, marital status, medical condition as defined by state law (genetic characteristics or cancer), physical or mental disability, military service or veteran status, pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, genetic information or any other classification protected by applicable federal, state or local laws or ordinances.

ad.title: ETL Developer - PRA Health Sciences - United States
ad.content: ETL Developer Job Locations US | US-PA-Blue Bell | US-AZ-Phoenix Posted Date 3 hours ago(5/6/2019 3:30 PM) ID 2019-53841 Overview Symphony Health Solutions, a wholly owned subsidiary of PRA Health Sciences, is a leading provider of high-value data, analytics, technology solutions and actionable insights for healthcare and life sciences manufacturers, payers and providers. The company helps clients drive revenue growth and commercial effectiveness, while adapting to the transformation of the healthcare ecosystem, by integrating a broad set of patient, prescriber, payer and clinical data together with primary and secondary health research, analytics and consulting. Symphony delivers a comprehensive perspective on the real dynamics that drive business in the healthcare and life sciences markets. At Symphony Health Solutions, we pride ourselves on being Collaborative and customer centric. We do this by focusing on five key values: Love the Customer by consistently exceeding expectations Focus on Brilliant Execution by being detailed and accountable Leapfrog the Competition by Differentiating ourselves and providing innovative solutions Build a High-Performance Culture that does not accept mediocrity Make it Fun by Connecting as one passionate high-energy team. Connect with Symphony! Collaborate with Customers! Differentiate Yourself! Symphony is hiring a Technical Services Engineer to work closely with Production, Development, and Operational areas to resolve technical issues, perform root cause analysis, develop continuous engineering improvements and foster stakeholder relationships. The successful candidate will be a multi-tasking self-starter with a keen ability to prioritize and lead efforts to solve issues effectively. Must have experience with ETL, Linux, Oracle, Informatica, SQL and the flexibility to work outside standard business hours. Pharma data knowledge is a plus. Responsibilities Adhere to and enforce company service level agreements, specifically those customer facing. Available for escalation as a technical subject matter expert. Troubleshooting, resolving and tracking application issues on a daily basis for issues such as, but not restricted to: alert activity, available disk space, available memory, server logs, number of processes running, who is logged in, queues. Diagnose internal or customer reported issues to determine the validity of the reported issue and undertake analysis and actions for resolution. Support the change control process making judgments as to when a push-forward or rollback decision should be made as necessary. Communicates effectively to both business and technical stakeholders within the project team. Foster relationships with key stakeholders, understanding their requirements and recommend / implement technical solutions and provide guidance as needed. Proactive analysis and troubleshooting of production servers and applications. Define procedures and processes for ongoing continuous improvement and implement tools for automation.Qualifications 4-year degree in information technology, computer science or a related field. Equivalent work experience or technical certifications will be considered. Solid problem solving ability Must have sound understanding of ETL (Informatica), Linux and database basics such as SQL, MySQL, Oracle, etc... Some experience with the Hadoop ecosystem Sound written and oral communication skills AutoSys knowledge is a plus Pharma Data knowledge is a plus Needs to have flexible work schedule because we do 24 x 7 support Exposure to Hadoop is a big plus Options Apply for this job onlineApply Share Sorry the Share function is not working properly at this moment. Please refresh the page and try again later. Share on your newsfeed Connect With Us!

ad.title: Senior Software Developer-Java - ASRC Federal Holding Company - St. Louis, MO
ad.content:
Position: Software Developer, Sr.
Location: St Louis, Missouri
Requirements:
The successful candidate must be knowledgeable of and experienced with web and desktop application software design and development environments. Principal responsibilities include:
Provide guidance and structure for creating and maintaining software infrastructure. Develop, test and deploy code (primarily using Java) with an emphasis on both front-end methodologies and server-side programing. Design and develop web services components for cross-application solutions. Interact with system designers and provide feedback on design modules. Perform testing on developed code (initial and regression). Coordinate and prioritize application modifications and bug fixes. Participate and contribute to a team approach to software development and problem solving using Agile/Scrum practices. Work well as part of a development team including across System and Business Analyst teams as well as other development teams. AFHCM Requirements:
Experience as a development lead or significant development team member. Strong problem solving skills and ability to generate high quality code. Experience with service-oriented architecture and web application/services development. Java, Microsoft .NET, C# and ASP.NET software development experience. Experience with web services technologies such as SOAP, HTTP, WSDL, XSD and REST. Experience with object-oriented JavaScript programming. Experience with cross-browser DHTML and HTML5 web design. Frontend web developer experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript (jQuery). Experience with SQL, Oracle, RDBMS, and database principles. Experience with source code management tools. Comfortable in Agile Development Methodology, especially Scrum Object Oriented design and implementation experience. Knowledge of configuration management practices. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Subject to a background investigation by the government and must be able to meet the requirements to hold a position of public trust. Desired Skills:
Experience with Middleware Development, designing, & implementing data interchange solutions is a plus Knowledge of MuleSoft and Salesforce. Experience designing for virtual configurations. Experience in full software development life cycle development (requirements gathering through development and test to maintenance). Experience designing for virtual configurations. Knowledge/experience working with access control systems. Education and Experience: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, I.T., or similar degree. 10+years of overall I.T. experience. 7+years hands-on experience writing, debugging, testing, and documenting Web Applications. Candidates without a college degree must at least have 10 years of relevant development experience. ASRC Federal and its Subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, gender, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identification, national origin, religion, marital status, ancestry, citizenship, disability, protected veteran status, or any other factor prohibited by applicable law.

ad.title: Infrastructure System Architect Manager - Colas - Denver, CO
ad.content: Investing in your tomorrow starts right here Are you interested in an opportunity working for a company that puts the safety of their employees first, then you have stopped at the right careers site. Colas USA companies are part of the Colas Group, the worldwide leader in transportation infrastructure construction and maintenance. The Colas Group is active in the construction and maintenance of road, air, rail and maritime transport infrastructure, urban development projects and recreational facilities. With 70,000 employees throughout 1,400 business units in 40 countries on 5 continents, the Colas Group carries out over 100,000 projects each year.Colas IS Support offers competitive salary and benefits packages, along with in-house training, an incredible work environment, and career advancement opportunities.Must be able to meet all safety requirements including pre-employment fit and drug/alcohol testing. POSITION SUMMARY: This is a leadership position responsible for architecture and designing of large scale, complex system integration projects. Needs experience across multiple platforms, business processes and architectures; broad knowledge of new technologies; strong ability to lead a team and technical activities with the customer; and accurately evaluate risks. Colas infrastructure is very Microsoft centric and will require a person with extensive experience with Microsoft infrastructure technologies. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Lead an infrastructure team composed of Colas ISS Architect and Engineers and also manage global projects (multiple continents) focused on Microsoft technologies as needed Projects coordination with Colas IT France Participate in design activities, record engineering decisions made during the design sessions, validate that infrastructure development is within the budget constraints of program plan Design infrastructure to increase the sufficiency of instrumentation, active monitoring, and alerting Constantly evaluate new solutions to help in infrastructure cost containment or reduction Identify, analyze, and provide recommendations and solutions for high-priority engineering initiatives, and organize and conduct working groups with the right participants (North America or International) to address any given initiative Review engineering Bills of Material and coordinate with procurement and asset management functions on hardware/software acquisition Perform necessary quality analysis, conflict resolution, consistency analysis, impact analysis, and verification of technical requirements Implement infrastructure projects and transition rollout to an infrastructure support team Work in a matrixed environment in a worldwide organization where ultimate decision making is not under Colas ISS responsibilities Lead our effort to build an elastic infrastructure (cloud based, flexible based on infrastructure usage) Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: Proven ability to manageme a team Knowledge of best practices and new technologies in infrastructure architecture design. Knowledge of High Availability technologies, Disaster Recovery (AlwaysOn, Mirroring, Log Shipping, Database Partitioning, Replication, Clustering) System Engineering IT Governance High Performance Computing Infrastructure Consolidation Great organizational skills Ability to work independently most of the time Bilingual French and English required Experience and Training: 10+ years of management experience leading infrastructure teams dispersed geographically 10+ years of experience with most technologies listed below: Microsoft Windows Server Technologies Microsoft Windows 7 and 10 Microsoft SCCM McAfee EPO Microsoft Azure Technologies Oracle Server Technologies Linux – Preferred but not required 2+ years of experience working in a matrixed environment in a large organization 5+ years of experience with vendor management and vendor selection activities Education: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience in Information Technology field Licensure / Certification: ITIL Colas IS Support is an Equal Opportunity /Affirmative Action Employer dedicated to promoting diversity and maintaining a drug-free workplace. It is our policy to ensure that applicants are considered for employment based on their qualifications without regard to their race, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), creed, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expressions, sexual orientation, color, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, pregnancy (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding or related medical conditions), immigration status, citizenship, genetic information, medical conditions, protected veteran status, uniform service member status, familial status, marital status, registered domestic partner status or any other classification protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Applicants are treated on the basis of their job-related qualifications, ability and performance. We are committed to equal employment opportunity for all employees and applicants and provide a workplace free of harassment and discrimination. This Policy applies to aspects of employment including recruitment, hiring, training and development, promotion, termination, compensation, benefits, and all other terms and conditions of employment in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. For more information about your EEO rights as an applicant, please click here and here. For notification on E-Verify click here and for information on Right to Work, click here. We are a VEVRAA Federal Contractor. If you need accommodation to access the information provided on this website, please contact Colas IS Support at 973-290-9082 or send an e-mail to:Colasrecruiter@colasinc.com Colas IS Supprot will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants. For more information, please click here.

ad.title: NTK Anderson Plant - NTN Bearing Corporation of America - Anderson, IN
ad.content:
NTK Anderson Plant - Tool Crib Attendant 1st Shift - AND10R
Description
NTK PRECISION AXLE CORPORATION Tool Crib Technician 1st Shift Join Our Start Up Team! NTK is a joint partnership between NTN Bearing, Takao Kogyo, and Koshuha Neturen. NTK Precision Axle Corporation is a leading manufacturer of constant velocity joints and hub bearings for the automotive industry. We are looking for dynamic individuals to add to our team. We are currently in search of candidates to fill the Tool Crib Technician opening. Position Summary: Responsible for maintaining the tool crib inventory of tools, dies, materials and equipment (physical inventory and computer records) and communicating potential supply problems and cost savings opportunities to the supervisor and Purchasing Department. Also, responsible for data entry of preventive maintenance, corrective maintenance and repair activities with direction from the Maintenance Planning group. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Receives, stores and issues hand tools, machine tools, dies, materials, and equipment. Maintains records of tools and equipment issued and returned, manually or using computer (Oracle JDE or MP2). Locates lost or misplaced tools and equipment. Prepares periodic inventory or maintains perpetual inventory of tools and equipment, manually or using computer. Receives, unpacks and stores incoming tools and equipment, and requisitions stock to replenish inventory. Delivers tools or equipment to workers, manually or using hand truck. Marks and identifies tools and equipment, using identification tag, stamp, or electric marking tool. Sends parts for repair and follows up on status. Communicates potential supply problems to maintenance supervisor and purchasing. Maintains log books for issuing of certain production components. Inputs data for maintenance/repair activities (plans/results) into computerized maintenance management system (Oracle JDE or MP2). Other duties as assigned. Skills and Experience: Relevant experience with tool crib preferred. Knowledge of inventory control. Strong computer skills and experience with Microsoft Office. Ability to learn Oracle JDE system for tracking tool crib inventory. Strong organization skills and attention to detail. Excellent communication skills. Ability to work under strict timelines to meet deadlines. Ability to multi-task and prioritize duties. Self-starter. Basic math skills for verification of receipt quantities. Forklift/material handling skills a plus. Knowledge of Oracle JDE a plus. Knowledge of basic accounting a plus. Previous experience in automotive manufacturing a plus. NTK offers competitive compensation and world-class benefits to include Blue Cross Blue Shield health & dental, EyeMed vision, CVS/Caremark prescription, short term and long term disability, life insurance, 401(k) plan with 50% company matching up to 8%, and paid vacation (1 week after 6 months ) plus holidays. If you enjoy working in a team environment and like a challenging opportunity then NTK is the place for you. Equal Opportunity Employer
Job: Maintenance Technician
Primary Location: Indiana-Anderson, NTK Precision Axle
Organization: Operations
:
Job Posting: May 6, 2019, 8:09:59 PM

ad.title: IT Internships - Mary Kay Inc - Dallas, TX
ad.content:
eBusiness Intern Job Description: Perform the services of a Business Analyst on DBS/eBusiness product teams. The candidate will be responsible for working across business and IT teams to gather and document requirements. The candidate will also perform initial triage of incoming bugs for supported applications. Triage includes validation of the bug, providing additional business or technical information for the developers, and answering questions the developers may have when they estimate and start work. Candidates will write test cases for bugs/requirements and then run those test cases in various environments. Qualifications: Degree: Analytics, MIS Preferred Classification: Senior or Graduate Student REQUIRED: Professional verbal/written communication collaboration with other roles and teams basic understanding of business requirements gathering process, business analysis, analysis/problem solving detail oriented
DESIRED: Analytics, Business process flow diagrams, business process modeling, web experience, ability to analyze and suggest UI improvements to websites, eCommerce/online shopping experience, software quality assurance testing PMO Job Description: Support PMO CA PPM system: be able to talk to users to understand their problems and provide some basic tool training Create user guides for CA PPM features Process documentation for PMO processes Qualifications: Degree: Management or Business Preferred Classification: Junior, Senior or Graduate StudentREQUIRED: BA skills Customer service skills Enterprise System Service Job Description: Areas they will be working on are IT Governance, IT Service Management and Enterprise Monitoring. The intern will help with documentation of process, policies, writing scripts, talking to customers to gather requirements Qualifications: Degree: Business Administration Preferred Classification: Junior, Senior, Graduate StudentREQUIRED: Technical programming and scripting skills Business Analyst skills Customer service skills IT Risk & Compliance Job Description: The intern will be responsible for assisting the Risk and Compliance Specialists in developing risk program and managing compliance process to strengthen the IT control environment. Projects and day-to-day tasks may include assisting upgrade and enhancement of GRC solution, with performing vendor risk assessments, evaluating third party control environments through review of SOC reports, assessing internal controls to ensure compliance with company policies, and creating/updating IT department risk registries. Qualifications: Degree: IT, Computer Science, Business Administration Preferred Classification: Senior or Graduate StudentREQUIRED: Have a basic understanding of information technology; risk and compliance standards and frameworks; and the principle of auditing. GPA at least 3.25 DESIRED: Working towards CPA or CISA certificates. Familiar with industry framework and standard (such as COBIT, ISO, NIST and etc.) Knowledge of GRC solutions IST Asset Management Job Description: The intern will be responsible for assisting the IT Asset Management team in implementing and ensuring compliance with IT hardware and software policies, procedures and processes. Projects and day-to-day task may include assisting with implementation of new Software Asset Management solution, performing IT asset hardware inventory audits, maintaining hardware and software inventory databases, creating/updating reports to relay compliance, cost and other metrics related to IT asset management. Qualifications: Degree: IT, Computer Science, Business Administration Preferred Classification: Senior or Graduate Student REQUIRED: Have a basic understanding of information technology and asset management standards and frameworks. GPA at least 3.25 DESIRED: Knowledge of IT Asset Management processes and procedures. Knowledge of IT Asset Management solutions/tools. SCS PMO Admin Job Description: Weekly tasks across all SCS projects will include generating reports to track and analyze performance (e.g. Tenrox time entry actuals versus forecasted hours,) maintaining project properties across multiple applications (Tenrox, CA PPM, and Aha!,) and consolidating status for management reporting. Additional work will include supporting project PM’s for various requests (e.g. research, data entry, document prep) as well as participation in ongoing efforts to document PMO processes, build SOP’s, create deliverable templates, and organize SharePoint documentation. Qualifications: Degree: IT Preferred Classification: Junior or SeniorREQUIRED: Proficiency in Microsoft suite of applications (Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Project, etc.,) Excellent verbal/written communication and presentation skills Ability to successfully work in a team environment but also be self-driven to accomplish tasks. DESIRED: SharePoint experience .
